Excerpt:
(Sophie doesn’t relax until they’re back at her place. Until they showered away the tension and curled up on the couch with Sophie wrapped around Ryan and a cheesy action movie playing on the TV.

Sophie holds on a little too tight. Sits a little too stiff. And she sniffles during a chase scene, which is really the final straw.

Ryan has to tuck her head under Sophie’s chin to look up at her girlfriend. “It’s her loss, you know? I’m pretty damn amazing, and you? You’re Sophie freaking Moore, and anyone who chooses not to love you is making the worst mistake of their life.”

Sophie sniffles again. “What if she never comes around?”

“Then you still have me, and Jordan, and Mary and Luke. You can even have Alice if you’re that desperate for a high head count. But you don’t need her to be happy.” Ryan wiggles out of the hold to sit up on her own. “And whenever you start worrying about what your mom thinks, just remember what the great poets once said.”

Sophie’s eyes narrow, and Ryan does her best to keep a serious look on her face.

“‘All I need in this life of sin—’” Sophie shoves Ryan away from her, and Ryan uses all of her strength to pull Sophie into her arms and sing right into her face, “‘is me and my girlfriend.’ Come on, baby, you know it.”

Sophie sings back, “‘It’s me and my girlfriend.’”

“See.” Ryan pecks Sophie on the lips. “That simple. Trust me.”

Sophie says, “I always do.”)

Sophie’s eyes narrow, and Ryan does her best to keep a serious look on her face.

“‘All I need in this life of sin—’” Sophie shoves Ryan away from her, and Ryan uses all of her strength to pull Sophie into her arms and sing right into her face, “‘is me and my girlfriend.’ Come on, baby, you know it.”

“See.” Ryan pecks Sophie on the lips. “That simple. Trust me.”

Sophie says, “I always do.”)

Excerpt:
“That’s your question?”

“What?”

“Seriously?”

“We’re 11 questions deep into our fourth round of 20 questions. And your last one was what age I learnt to swim. Let’s not pretend we haven’t been dragging the bottom of the barrel for a while now.”

Sophie huffed, not responding to Ryan for a moment. The sound of the drizzle on the roof of the van was the only thing piercing the silence.  Twenty questions had seemed like a good idea two hours ago when their coffee had long been nothing more than dregs at the bottom of their cups and there was still no sign of movement in the building they were staking out.

“It was ‘I’m Yours'.” Sophie said, her voice dropping, as though hoping Ryan wouldn’t hear.

But of course, she could never be so lucky. Ryan snorted in her nose, her head dropping onto the steering wheel, her shoulders shaking with laughter.

“Okay,” Sophie’s defenses went all the way up, “You don’t get to judge me for that.”

“You didn’t,” Ryan said.

“It was a popular song!”

“Girl, you did not have the white guy with an acoustic guitar song as your first dance.”

“Tyler choose it,” Sophie’s voice dropped, resignation seeping in. 

“Of course he did,” Ryan’s amusement was bright in her eyes and voice. “And you just went along with it.”

“Shockingly, for some reason, I wasn’t into planning my own wedding.”

“Yeah, I bet.” Ryan leaned back, tucking one foot under her on the seat so she could face Sophie.

Sophie chose to ignore Ryan's bright smile. She definitely chose to ignore the fact she didn't hate seeing it.

Excerpt:
“Um I don’t know actually now that you mention it. I mean you were there when I told Ryan I don’t want to be included in her little sexcapades so maybe that’s why we haven’t heard from the two of them as of late.” Mary offered. Sophie was quiet. So Mary kept talking to fill the silence. “But Imani is cool, you’d like her.”

“I know Imani is cool Mary, she saved us from jail with her fancy lawyer knowledge. Besides, Ryan wouldn’t date somebody uncool. I mean except for Angelique.” Sophie said as an after thought.

“Ohhh you didn’t like her either!?” Mary exclaimed and put her hand on Sophie’s shoulder.” Mary laughed joyously. “Whew I thought I was the only one! Girl maybe we do need to get out the hard stuff from the cupboard!” She gave Sophie a look letting her know that she was down to turn up whenever she said the word.

“It’s not that I didn’t like her. She just wasn’t good enough for Ryan.” Sophie said matter-of-factly. Mary sat there in stunned silence at Sophie’s admission. But before she could say anything, Sophie tried to clarify.

“I-I just meant like she’s Ryan Wilder, bad ass extraordinaire, Batwoman by night and day, bartending babe on the side. Angelique was just bringing Ryan down. I never saw it until I got to know Ryan and realized she was always covering for Angelique, and Angelique was taking advantage of Ryan’s kindness and the emotional attachment that was there from when they were kids. Ryan felt like she owed Angelique, when really it was the other way around. Ryan’s a good person. She deserves someone who knows that but doesn’t use it against her, someone like-”

“Someone like you?” Mary offered up slowly, testing the waters.

“Are we singing Adele now?” Sophie went for a joke hoping that she was coming off as aloof. Mary just kept staring back at Sophie with a grin on her face.

“Stop smiling Mary. Ok what? If you’re thinking I want to date Ryan, I don’t.” Sophie inwardly cringed as this sounded like such a lie even to her own ears.

“Well it doesn’t sound like you want anyone else to have her.” Mary was feeling emboldened. Sophie didn’t seem mad, she just seemed either unaware or in denial. Mary continued, “you didn’t like Angelique, which I am with you on that one. And you sound jealous of Ryan spending time with Imani. So if all these girls that Ryan gets with upset you, then why don’t you just ask Ryan out? You just said she deserves better. You could be better.”

Excerpt:
Who said I love you first?

Ryan said it first. Ryan was in the batsuit and she thought she was about to die after getting bested in a big fight. She turned on her comms and told Mary and Luke to get Sophie on the line.

Soph?

Yeah I’m here babe, what is it?

Sophie, I love you. Ryan said this with zero hesitation in her voice. She turned off the batsuit voice manipulator so that Sophie could hear Ryan’s real voice when she told her.

You wha-

I love you. I’m in love with you. And I have been for a while now. I wanted to tell you but I didn’t know the right time. I thought maybe I would take you to dinner at our favorite spot, but it doesn’t look like I’m gonna make it. Ryan’s breath was coming out in short bursts and she was struggling. Sophie heard the distress.

BABE, Ryan talk to me! What’s happening?

I’m ok, I just needed to tell you this incase I didn’t get the chance. I love you with my whole heart Sophie. You’re the most important thing in my life and I’m so glad I didn’t die before I met you.

Are you quoting a Bright Eyes song to me right now? Sophie let out a raspy laugh.

Damnit Soph, I’m trying to be serious here. I didn’t know you know that song.

Ryan, I hear you sing it to yourself literally every morning when you’re getting dressed.

Oh.

Ryan?

Yeah? Ryan’s voice comes out strained but she’s holding on.

I love you too. And you’re not dying today. Hang tight shorty. I’m on my way.
HTMLExcerpt:
Who said I love you first?

Ryan said it first. Ryan was in the batsuit and she thought she was about to die after getting bested in a big fight. She turned on her comms and told Mary and Luke to get Sophie on the line.

Soph?

Yeah I’m here babe, what is it?

Sophie, I love you. Ryan said this with zero hesitation in her voice. She turned off the batsuit voice manipulator so that Sophie could hear Ryan’s real voice when she told her.

You wha-

I love you. I’m in love with you. And I have been for a while now. I wanted to tell you but I didn’t know the right time. I thought maybe I would take you to dinner at our favorite spot, but it doesn’t look like I’m gonna make it. Ryan’s breath was coming out in short bursts and she was struggling. Sophie heard the distress.

BABE, Ryan talk to me! What’s happening?

I’m ok, I just needed to tell you this incase I didn’t get the chance. I love you with my whole heart Sophie. You’re the most important thing in my life and I’m so glad I didn’t die before I met you.

Are you quoting a Bright Eyes song to me right now? Sophie let out a raspy laugh.

Damnit Soph, I’m trying to be serious here. I didn’t know you know that song.

Ryan, I hear you sing it to yourself literally every morning when you’re getting dressed.

Oh.

Ryan?

Yeah? Ryan’s voice comes out strained but she’s holding on.

I love you too. And you’re not dying today. Hang tight shorty. I’m on my way.

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

I made a Wildmoore playlist and I’ve been trying to figure out how to incorporate all the songs into Wildmoore fics. This is my first attempt at it. I might change it up with other songs or do one shots based off the songs as well. The possibilities are endless,

Here is the link to the playlist: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/7twzlXv7n2K7NFN1imtEEJ?si=076ac575fa474704

I suggest playing the songs when they come up in the fic to get the full affect

...

The scene is a bedroom with the sun rising but it hasn’t quite lit the room up yet so there is a soft darkness. We can make out the forms of two sleeping people. One is lying on their side with the covers pulled up around their shoulders. The other is lying on their stomach. The clock in the room reads 5:17am. A light breeze flits through the curtains.

Devotion by Tone Stith plays as the camera slowly pans the room and the people sleeping.

You said that you're tryna find

Someone who will love you more than just on the side

I said I'll give you my devotion

Give you my devotion, baby, uh, oh-oh

You scared of livin' a lie,

So baby let me give you somethin' money can't buy

Give you my devotion, yeah

Give you my devotion, baby,

I'll adore you even if you left me broken

If you take a step, baby I'll take two...

_____________________________________

Music slowly fades out:

Sophie Moore wakes up on her stomach. She notices that her face feels like she didn’t take off her make up. She pats her head and feels her braids so her wig must have come off or she took it off before crashing. Her head is definitely pounding a little bit. She feels comfortable besides the impending hangover but she knows this bed isn’t hers and this room smells like... Ryan? Sophie then notices the extra weight in the bed. She turns onto her side and comes face to face with a sleeping Ryan Wilder.

Sophie breathed out a sigh too at the sudden change in topics and the loss of closeness that Ryan was providing. Had Ryan almost kissed her? Would Sophie have let her? Sophie got up and grabbed her dress pants and slipped them on. Then she turned her back and took off Ryan’s sleep shirt and put on her own top from the previous night that she found tossed over a chair. She could feel Ryan’s eyes on her and her face got hot. She turned towards Ryan once she had her own clothes on she saw Ryan quickly avert her gaze and then get up too. Ryan was wearing extremely short boy shorts and a top that barely fit; it was showing off her belly button ring. She also wasn’t wearing a bra and her nipples were poking hard against the fabric of the shirt. Fuck the only time this girl is covered is when she’s wearing the Batsuit. Sophie thought. She had to get out of this room. It was suddenly too hot, too cramped, and too Ryan.

“Ok well I’ll see you out there.” Sophie quickly went to open the door and hurried out.

The door shuts, and Ryan is alone with her thoughts.

Shame by Summer Walker starts playing:

In a perfect world

You're understanding, I'm not a perfect girl

I would drop my fears at the door

I would only bring myself and nothing more

And you let me be, a woman

And you let me be, a flawed woman

You would yearn to hear all about my past

What I've done, what I've did and why

Hear all my sick thoughts

And if I needed to, I could cry

And you would catch my tears

You don't wanna be nobody else's pain no, aye, no

You don't wanna be nobody else's place, to hide from themselves

[Chorus]

Shame

And I'm the one to blame

[Bridge]

You see right through me

You see through the smile

You see straight through me

You push past the lies, oh

You got it baby

Oh, oh, oh

________________

Story: I know you (even if you don't want me to)
Excerpt:
“All that’s left is the slideshow.” Jordan’s face splits into a wide grin. “Now, everybody else sent their pictures — thank you for this, by the way.” Jordan pulls up the slideshow in another tab, and a picture of Ryan and Angelique in their prom dresses smiles back up at them. “But my sister couldn’t be bothered, so we get to pick for her.” A mischievous wiggle of the eyebrows, and Jordan logs into Facebook.

She scrolls through Sophie’s Facebook, which Ryan admittedly leans a little closer to the screen to see. Sophie’s profile picture is still her Crows swearing in photo. “It’s been this way for years. She changed it for, like, two months when she and Tyler got married, but then she changed it right to back this.”

Ryan frowns. “Not a selfie in sight.”

Jordan shakes her head. “It’s awful. I’m working on it. But you need to see this.” Jordan excitedly goes to the videos section and finds her favorite one. “Behold: the greatest video ever taken.”

She hits play, and Ryan can’t help but smile as a twelve-year-old Sophie and seven-year-old Jordan walk onto screen in their childhood living room. They’re wearing Halloween army uniforms. Sophie’s serious as ever, and Jordan giggles as she comes to stand back-to-back with her big sister. The opening notes of the song ‘One Girl Revolution’ begin, and Ryan cackles.

“You’re not,” Ryan says, but then it happens: the young Moore sisters perfectly reenact the final drill team performance from Cadet Kelly. “Not the dance from that gay ass Disney movie!” Ryan laughs. Much like the leads of the movie, little Sophie is precise and alive, glowing as she throws a baton and later twirls the ribbons. She’s freer than Ryan has ever seen her.

Jordan smiles. “I’m pretty sure this is what made her do ROTC.”

Jordan smiles. “I’m pretty sure this is what made her do ROTC.”

Writer’s End Notes:

This also references the Disney Channel Original Movie, Cadet Kelly … which involves a pairs drill team performance between Hilary Duff and Christy Carlson Romano that you could watch on YouTube, if you’re curious for a visual reference.

Story: I know you (even if you don't want me to)
Excerpt:
Ryan hops from one foot to the other. She keeps the pressure mostly on the pads of her feet. Light and nimble. Finally back at full form with only one day left in her two week recovery period. She’d do a flip if it wouldn’t make Mary’s head explode. Or disrupt the perfect tuck of her Center Volunteer shirt. Then again, Mary does anxiously hover in the doorway of Ryan’s bathroom. Maybe she’ll explode on her own.

“Mary, seriously?” Ryan reaches for her favorite purple lipstick. “I’m making mocktails and guarding the punch bowl. I’m not even dancing. Doctor’s orders.”

The doctor in question stabs a finger out at Ryan. Mary manages to look menacing even in her little scrubs. “If you so much as think about doing the Wobble—” She stomps into the bathroom.

It’s truly one of the greatest dances of all mankind. Ryan crosses her lipstick tube across her heart.
HTMLExcerpt:
Ryan hops from one foot to the other. She keeps the pressure mostly on the pads of her feet. Light and nimble. Finally back at full form with only one day left in her two week recovery period. She’d do a flip if it wouldn’t make Mary’s head explode. Or disrupt the perfect tuck of her Center Volunteer shirt. Then again, Mary does anxiously hover in the doorway of Ryan’s bathroom. Maybe she’ll explode on her own.

 

“Mary, seriously?” Ryan reaches for her favorite purple lipstick. “I’m making mocktails and guarding the punch bowl. I’m not even dancing. Doctor’s orders.”

 

The doctor in question stabs a finger out at Ryan. Mary manages to look menacing even in her little scrubs. “If you so much as think about doing the Wobble—” She stomps into the bathroom.

 

It’s truly one of the greatest dances of all mankind. Ryan crosses her lipstick tube across her heart.

Story: I know you (even if you don't want me to)
Excerpt:
Mary continues, “I’m leaving you to climb up the stairs on your own. No ice pack, or pain meds, or anything.” Mary takes a deep breath. “Fortunately for you….” She walks over to Ryan to adjust the hair on Ryan’s shoulder. “I know someone who might help you out. Depending on how well your side mission is going.”

If they can call Ryan talking to Sophie a side mission. Ryan applies her lipstick and rubs her lips together. 

Mary bats expectant eyes towards the mirror. “You’ve been getting along. Can I draft up the offer letter?”

Ryan smacks her lips. “She’s still a Crow, Mary.”

“A Crow you spent, like, all of yesterday on the phone with.”

Ryan didn’t spend all of yesterday on the phone with Sophie. In the morning, they texted about how awful the playlist for the dance might be. Then they swapped bad songs in the afternoon. Ryan’s personal favorite was a religious remix of ‘The Thong Song’ that truly had to be a parody. (“That God, Go-God, God, God.”) Then they told their personal dance horror stories after Sophie was off work. There were breaks.

Before Ryan can defend herself, her phone lights up from beside the sink. Sophie’s name flashes, and Ryan’s got her phone in her hands in seconds. Mary snorts.

Story: I know you (even if you don't want me to)
Excerpt:
Microphone feedback cuts off the rest of Sophie’s sentence. Jordan cheers from beside the DJ with a huge smile. “Next up, we’ve got a special song to celebrate Ryan’s return. This was requested anonymously.” Jordan dramatically and heavily turns to face where Ryan and Sophie are working. She sing-songs, “I wonder who it was.”
The opening notes of T-Pain’s ‘Bartender’ start playing. Most of the teens seem confused, but the chaperones all cheer and laugh. Sophie busies herself with glaring at Jordan. 
Ryan laughs. “You actually requested it?”
Sophie shrugs. “I mean, it is your song.” Not only is it appropriate for the night, but Ryan loves songs she can sing along to. She loves putting on a show, and Sophie can’t think of a better way to spend the night than watching Ryan actually have fun.
Ryan beams. Celeste fake vomits onto the bar. Ryan fake glares at Celeste.
“Just for that. You’re dancing with me.” Ryan walks around the bar to body-roll her way towards Celeste. The preteen groans and scrambles towards the other kids. “Wait up. It’s my song, didn’t you hear?”
Celeste rushes into the crowd, so Ryan turns her attention back towards Sophie. “Mission accomplished. She’s actually talking to people.”
Sure, the other kids might only be gossiping about the relationships of their instructors, but Celeste is talking to other kids instead of standing on the sidelines with the chaperones. When Sophie turns her eyes back to Ryan, Ryan has this gentle smile on her face. She blinks down some emotion in her eyes. Maybe it’s pride, or just empathy for the kids who don’t know where to be themselves.
“She’s doing better than me at her age,” Sophie admits. She leans her elbows into the bar, and the role reversal catches her off guard for a moment. Ryan glances over her shoulder at Sophie. How does she keep her curls like that? How does she look at Sophie like it’s the easiest thing in the world?
Ryan has to pitch up on her toes for a moment. She’s too close to Sophie over the bar counter as she snaps her fingers in a dramatic pout. “But here we are with no one to dance with.” She points to the ceiling as the bridge starts. “You ready? ‘Cause I can’t do this alone.” She sings, “‘She made us drinks, to drink. We drunk ‘em—’” She holds her clasped hand out to Sophie like a mic.

Sophie plays along and sings, “‘Got drunk.’”

Ryan pulls her mic back. “‘Man, I think she thinks I’m—’”

“‘Cooool.’”  

“‘She gave me a wink—’” And Ryan keeps singing, twirling on her toes with the ridiculous lights of the dance behind her. Her teasing voice over the autotune has never felt more true than this moment. She drops her fake mic to dance her way around the corner of their makeshift bar. By the time the chorus hits, she’s right in front of Sophie. Smile bright and so full of joy that Sophie can’t think of anything else.

Their eyes catch, as Ryan sings, “‘I like the baaaartender. Oooh, if you’re looking for meee.’” Her fingers graze Sophie’s, and sparks tingle all the way up Sophie’s arm. “‘I’m at the baaar with her.’” Sophie’s fingers tighten around Ryan’s automatically.

“‘I like the baaaartender. Oooh, if you’re looking for meee…’” Ryan’s voice trails, as Sophie gulps. As Sophie’s eyes widen and her pulse thrums in her ears, and she drops Ryan’s hand and steps back.
“I-I’ll be back.” And Sophie takes off out of there.

Sophie plays along and sings, “‘Got drunk.’”

“‘I like the baaaartender. Oooh, if you’re looking for meee…’” Ryan’s voice trails, as Sophie gulps. As Sophie’s eyes widen and her pulse thrums in her ears, and she drops Ryan’s hand and steps back.

Excerpt:
They both work so hard and rarely take a day off that date night usually ends up being time to sleep and cuddle together in bed, which is fine with them because they sleep better knowing the other is safe in bed with them but they could definitely use a night out to just have fun and be together.

It was Ryan’s idea for them to go out to a club and go dancing. She’s never seen Sophie dance, other than the occasional hip sway when Ryan watches her do her Saturday morning cleaning listening to Chaka Khan, Patti Labelle, and Luther Vandross. Ryan almost got Sophie to dance with her to some Anita Baker because Angel is one of Ryan’s favorite songs and she couldn’t help wanting to sing and dance around Sophie’s kitchen but they were rudely interrupted by Sophie being called in for a work emergency.

“Let's go out tonight,” Ryan suggests as they lay on Sophie’s couch cuddling and watching Living Single.

Excerpt:
When they are about to sit back down, Janelle Monae's "Make Me Feel" comes on and Ryan starts jumping up and down.

“I love this song! Come dance with me!” Ryan tries to pull Sophie onto the dance floor but she stands her ground and tries to resist.

“Oh no. I don’t dance. You go dance and I’ll sit here and watch and grab us a round of drinks.” Sophie tries to go sit back down but Ryan pulls her along.

“Nope. You came in here dressed like that so you’re my date for the night and you have to dance with me.” The smile Ryan gives Sophie is the exact reason why Sophie can never tell Ryan "no" so of course she agrees.

“Fine. One dance.” Sophie playfully rolls her eyes as Ryan pulls her onto the dance floor.

“Like I said, you can’t say no to me.” Ryan’s smile gets wider.

This night is turning out better than Sophie thought when she decided to buy the Mr. Incredible’s suit. She has to remember to text Mary and thank her for the insight into Ryan’s costume. Mary happened to see Ryan’s costume a couple of weeks ago when she came home and text Sophie to let her know. Sophie recently told Mary that she has feelings for Ryan and Mary has been over the moon ever since. She's dubbed herself captain of the #Wildmoore ship and is determined to get them together now.

Sophie lets Ryan drag her into the middle of the dance floor and pull her in so their bodies are connected. The way Ryan moves her body has Sophie captivated. Then Ryan puts her hands on Sophie’s waist and her brain short circuits. …..yeah, Sophie is gonna have a lot to tell Mary next time they talk.

Excerpt:
“We all want to belong, Ryan.” A year ago, Sophie belonged with the Crows and with her husband, Tyler. Now, she has Ryan, Luke, and Mary. She has this team that she’s quickly coming to rely on. “Like you said, we’ve got this family. Maybe we can all belong to each other.”

Ryan smiles another small smile. It’s one of her more emotional ones, and Sophie’s not sure when she started cataloguing Ryan’s smiles in her mind.

Sophie goes for the joke. “Don’t start singing Taylor Swift just yet.”

Ryan shakes her head. “Nope, that’s not me.”

“You weren’t a Taylor Swift fan?” Sophie asks. Ryan levels her with a look that’s three seconds away from teasing Sophie about ‘those white girls’ again. “Don’t do it.”

That makes Ryan laugh. Her teeth shine, and she shakes her head. “I didn’t say it.” Sophie narrows her eyes. Ryan laughs again. “Listen. We like who we like.”

Sophie teases, “Here you go again, talking about my love life.”

Ryan tilts her head in a question. “I can stop.”

Sophie waves that off. “No, please. That’s what friends do, right?”

Ryan nods. “Right.”

Ryan smiles another small smile. It’s one of her more emotional ones, and Sophie’s not sure when she started cataloguing Ryan’s smiles in her mind.

Sophie teases, “Here you go again, talking about my love life.”

Ryan tilts her head in a question. “I can stop.”

Sophie waves that off. “No, please. That’s what friends do, right?”

Ryan nods. “Right.”

belonging by youngerdrgrey

Excerpt:
“You can’t do that,” Sophie says. “You can’t push me away, then….” Her hand bumps into the hand that was just inside of her. Sophie takes a step back on still shaky knees. “Shit, Ry. Do you…. Do you have any idea how hard it’s been for me?”

“For you,” Ryan repeats. Sophie’s spent the last few weeks living it up. Best of fucking both worlds. Full Hannah Montana bullshit with the Rogues and the Bat Team both in her back pockets.

“Yes, for me.” She huffs. “You’re impossible, you know that? You’re amazing, and beautiful, and brilliant, and so fucking hard to need.” Sophie’s leg bounces where she stands. Her eyes dart around the elevator. Ryan wonders if she’s somehow dreamed the last thirty minutes. Did Sophie just say that she needs her?

Story: So a Bat and a Crow Waltz into Each Other's Hearts
Excerpt:
“Ohhhh my god. And here i was all worried and panicky about losing you.” Ryan playfully rolls her eyes and goes to stand but Sophie grabs the hoodie and pulls her toward her, stopping just shy…

She whispers “i really like you in my clothes”.

Ryan closes the distance, finally kissing her girl. She hears Tamia’s “Last First Kiss” playing in her head instantly. She only comes up to say “you really should let me feed you”. Sophie hums in agreement and pulls her back in to resume the kissing. The dam’s broken and she just knows she needs this more than sustenance.

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes: 

Song used: 'Have Mercy' by Chloe Bailey (https://youtu.be/HW_pgXZIlN8)

...

  “Why don’t you get it set up? I’m going to text Ryan to see if she needs any help getting the food.”




Sophie nodded and headed towards her dvd shelf. She thanked her over-organized ass for making finding anything a breeze. And as if the universe heard Mary; the doorbell rang. 




        “It’s me,” the trio hear Ryan say through the door.




        “Nevermind. I’ll get it.” Mary put her phone down, hopped off the couch and pranced over to the door. 




So maybe Sophie looked in the mirror on the wall and ran her hand through her hair to make sure it was in place. So maybe she adjusted her sweater. And maybe she checked her makeup. It had nothing to do with Ryan finally making it to the party. Nothing at all. 




𝆕𝆕Murda on the beat so it’s not nice𝆕𝆕




Mary opened the door to a smiling Ryan holding four boxes of pizza and a bag of what looked like wings just as the song started to play from the speakers.




𝆕𝆕Booty so big lord have mercy𝆕𝆕




        “Oh damn. That’s my shit.” Ryan yelled as she walked into the apartment and started dancing to the music. Realizing the timing of the song with Ryan entrance, Sophie snapped her head around so fast and glared at Jordan.




        ‘Seriously?’ she mouthed. Jordan just shrugged and stepped away from the speakers.




        “I just hit shuffle. It was a coincidence. Scout’s honor.”




        “You were never a fucking girl scout.” Sophie whispered through gritted teeth. “I know what you’re doing. Stop it.”

Jordan ignored her and went back scrolling through the playlist on her phone. Sophie tried to focus on locating the movies on her shelf and not on Ryan, who had set the food down on the coffee table, throwing it back with her sister right behind her. Tried being the word because of course there was a mirror on the wall in front of her. So she was absolutely not looking at the way Ryan wound her hips while she sang the verses with a carefree sensuality that only Ryan could possess. 




She most certainly was not watching Ryan’s ass bounce in the black jeans she was wearing for the night. 




Wait.




What movies was she looking for again?




Oh right. Mean Girls. Eventually Sophie found the dvds, grabbed them and returned to the couch just in time to see the finale of what had become a mini grinding line of the other three. Ryan in front with Mary dancing behind her and Jordan maintaining the rear.  




As she watched, Sophie could admit to herself that she was attracted to Ryan. She wasn't blind. Ryan was fine as hell. With that thousand watt smile, those beautiful brown eyes, that amazing body. But she could never let Jordan in on it because she would never let her live it down. She already got enough teasing about them being “the perfect material for an enemies to lovers story”. 




       “Come on Soph. Dance with us.” Mary said, pointing in front of Ryan who was too busy feeling the music to notice the exchange. 




Sophie swallowed at the thought. And all of a sudden the room felt ten degrees hotter.




        “Um, nah. Imma pass. Grind lines aren’t really my thing. And especially not with my baby sister involved.” Sophie answered, taking a big swig of her beer to take her eyes off of Ryan dancing.




        “Fine.” Jordan stepped away, reached around Mary, grabbed Ryan’s hand and just as the intro to the next song started; pushed Ryan towards Sophie on the couch. “You dance with Ryan alone then. I got Mary.”





Sophie quickly hopped up in time to prevent Ryan from falling onto her on the couch but did so by awkwardly catching her around the waist.

As she watched, Sophie could admit to herself that she was attracted to Ryan. She wasn't blind. Ryan was fine as hell. With that thousand watt smile, those beautiful brown eyes, that amazing body. But she could never let Jordan in on it because she would never let her live it down. She already got enough teasing about them being “the perfect material for an enemies to lovers story”. 

 

       “Come on Soph. Dance with us.” Mary said, pointing in front of Ryan who was too busy feeling the music to notice the exchange. 

 

Sophie swallowed at the thought. And all of a sudden the room felt ten degrees hotter.

 

        “Um, nah. Imma pass. Grind lines aren’t really my thing. And especially not with my baby sister involved.” Sophie answered, taking a big swig of her beer to take her eyes off of Ryan dancing.

 

        “Fine.” Jordan stepped away, reached around Mary, grabbed Ryan’s hand and just as the intro to the next song started; pushed Ryan towards Sophie on the couch. “You dance with Ryan alone then. I got Mary.”



Sophie quickly hopped up in time to prevent Ryan from falling onto her on the couch but did so by awkwardly catching her around the waist.

Have Mercy by Chlöe

The woman looks at Ryan, confused, “What do you mean?”

Ryan nods her head over towards the table where Sophie is sitting with Renee. The woman looked over towards the table and then back at Ryan, “Oh.”

She looks back at Ryan with a sexy smirk. “I get it. But maybe I can help you forget about her.”

Ryan smirks back at the woman, “Maybe you can.”

As if almost on cue, Touch Me by Victoria Monet and Kehlani starts to play. The woman pulls Ryan close once more and begins to move her body against Ryan’s. Story: I know you (even if you don't want me to)
Excerpt:
Ryan could call Sophie, but avoidance feels a hell of a lot better than getting rejected by the same woman on a different day. But Luke was probably right. Sophie’s not the type to just do things without a reason. Maybe she’s coming around.

Ryan also doesn’t have to put herself out there. Not when she has Batwoman. So Ryan takes her break in her manager’s office and pulls out the Bat Burner.

 

Unknown to SM
Surprised I haven’t heard from you yet. Had to hear on the radio that you’ve got a thing for me….

SM to Unknown
You could’ve heard it from me if you stuck around

Ryan feels that blow for more than just Batwoman. 

 

Unknown to SM
I’m a busy Bat
Some night though huh?

SM to Unknown
Most people just give me flowers.

Unknown to SM
Didn’t take you for the basic type. This is how trust works, right? I give, you give? We come to expect it?

SM to Unknown
so this is what trust looks like?

Is Ryan imagining it, or is there attitude in that text message? Is Sophie upset with her?

 

SM to Unknown
When I give, you give

Unknown to SM
Just like that

SM to Unknown
Would you see a Ludacris gif if I send it? Does the burner have those capabilities?

Okay, cool, Sophie isn’t upset. She’s cracking Ludacris jokes. They’re still good. Ryan can push a little then.

 

Unknown to SM
Idk. Maybe try a different type of picture first.

A knock on the office door. Someone needs Ryan, so she calls out, “One second!” Glances back down with nerves she absolutely shouldn’t have. “Come on, Soph. Say something.”

Song: All I Want for Christmas Is You
Story: All I Want for Christmas Is You
Excerpt:
Story Title: All I Want for Christmas Is You

...

“If I hear that ‘All I Want for Christmas is You’ shit play one more gotdamn time!”

“ANISSA!” Iris lunges forward, “TOUCH MY PHONE AND SEE WHAT HAPPENS.”

Ryan watches as Anissa uses her long arms to her advantage, grabbing the phone out of its AUX chord and playing a game of keep away that would be mean if it wasn’t so funny. Sophie, forever trying to ignore them, continues hanging stretched cotton balls that look like snow to the beams of the Hold Up. Alex and Kelly are supposed to be helping, but have used the now fifth Iris-Anissa Music Battle Royale as an excuse to reach behind the bar and pour drinks.

They started this tradition five years ago now, closing down the Hold Up for a night in December that’s just the crew. It started when Ryan and Alex first got to know each other teamed up on a mission. It doesn’t take long for gays to clock gays and before Ryan knew it, Alex already had her number in her phone and a promise for a double date in their future. Kelly and Sophie became best friends right away, sharing weekly Saturday morning FaceTimes. Anissa’s been the homie ever since Ryan met her the first time years ago at a Ladies Night in Freeland back when she first got of Blackgate. Of course with Anissa, came Grace. And Iris? Iris first got introduced to Anissa via her dad? Maybe? Ryan’s not too clear, but she knows that nothing makes Anissa happier than pissing Iris off on purpose, and that’s how they ended up back at the AUX chord battles.

Just in time, Grace reappears with Christmas lights wrapped around her arms. Ryan smiles to herself as Sophie sighs, relieved that at least someone is staying on task. Ryan gets up from her seat and goes to help her girlfriend, grabbing some extra cotton. She’s not sure what Grace whispers in Anissa’s ear, but it’s enough for her to relent the phone back to its rightful owner. 

“You play too much,” Iris hisses, but she’s smiling triumphantly. “And Just! For! That!”

Iris taps her screen and everyone groans as the familiar opening chimes start echoing through the speakers, followed by Mariah’s warm hum of the first notes.

“You know you love it.” Iris damn near skips (oooh she’d hate that description) over to Alex to take a glass of Bailey’s.

Story: All I Want for Christmas Is You
Excerpt:
Ryan’s never felt luckier. And it’s not just because Sophie finished hanging the cotton and now has wrapped her arms around her waist. Growing up in the system, except for Angie, Ryan was always alone. She grew to hate Christmas, hate the idea of loved ones coming together when all she had was a twin bed with a thin mattress crowded together in a foster home. It was different the years with Mama Cora, but then before she knew it — she was alone again, singing “I’ll be Home For Christmas” to her plants and warming hot chocolate on the hot plate in her van.

But now she has Sophie. She has Mary and Luke. They’ve made their own family of adult orphans and every year when they unwrap presents together on Christmas morning and Mary makes her famous spicy tofu scramble for breakfast, the one that always leaves Sophie choking and reaching for a glass of cold milk. Ryan can’t believe how much she’s come to love these new traditions of their own.

It was different the years with Mama Cora, but then before she knew it — she was alone again, singing “I’ll be Home For Christmas” to her plants and warming hot chocolate on the hot plate in her van.

But now she has Sophie. She has Mary and Luke. They’ve made their own family of adult orphans and every year when they unwrap presents together on Christmas morning and Mary makes her famous spicy tofu scramble for breakfast, the one that always leaves Sophie choking and reaching for a glass of cold milk. Ryan can’t believe how much she’s come to love these new traditions of their own.

Excerpt:
They all started to gather their things and head out. Sophie assured Ryan she would be able to find something to sleep in, so they didn’t have to waste a trip back to the loft. With their previous conversations with Mary and Luke earlier that day, Sophie and Ryan’s drive back to her apartment almost felt awkward in a way. They were both overthinking so much that a space that would normally be filled with endless chatter was now painfully quiet. Thankfully the ride back to her place was a short one. Once they were upstairs and settled, Sophie scooped baby Amauri out of her carseat. She had awakened by this time, so she was going to feed her and then try and get her back to sleep.

“Everything okay?”

Sophie asked as she sat on the couch. Ryan sat with her, her body slightly facing her, with her legs folded into her.

“Yeah.”

Right now wasn’t time for her to start acting like Usher and confessing while she was feeding the baby, so she put it on pause.

“You really are great with her, you’re going to make a great mom someday.”

Once they were upstairs and settled, Sophie scooped baby Amauri out of her carseat. She had awakened by this time, so she was going to feed her and then try and get her back to sleep.

“Everything okay?”

Sophie asked as she sat on the couch. Ryan sat with her, her body slightly facing her, with her legs folded into her.

“Yeah.”

Right now wasn’t time for her to start acting like Usher and confessing while she was feeding the baby, so she put it on pause.

“You really are great with her, you’re going to make a great mom someday.”

Excerpt:
A local group of children put on a dance performance, so the group camps out on the blanket Ryan brought while they watch the show. Ryan sits between Sophie's legs with Sophie’s arms wrapped around her waist pulling her in close.

Jordan takes a moment to look at her surroundings. You rarely see this many black people in one place in Gotham. You wouldn’t even know that Gotham had this many black people if it wasn’t for events like this. The Black joy and ease she sees warms her heart and is all she wants out of life. There are all types of Black people around but what really catches Jordan’s eye is all of the queer couples around. If it was up to her mom Jordan would have never been exposed to queer people and every day she is thankful for getting out of her mom’s house and getting to meet new people and explore the world.

The performances continue with a couple of drag performers and other queer and trans artists promoting their music and performing dance routines. A queen comes out a performs “Rhythm Nation” and that gets Sophie up and so excited that she’s pulling Ryan along with her to get closer to the stage. Jordan knew that Sophie was obsessed with Janet Jackson growing up. She used to sneak and buy her CDs and hide them from their mother because she knew Diane would not approve of her daughter listening to Janet Jackson’s music. Now that she’s older, Jordan isn’t so sure if it was just Janet Jackson’s music that Sophie loved. Jordan would not be surprised if Janet Jackson was her sister’s first girl crush.

It is so satisfying getting to see her sister live her truth and be with other Black queer people. She doesn’t have the most rhythm, but Ryan does the best she can to keep Sophie on beat as she excitedly dances around with the other people by the stage.

They dance for what feels like forever, eventually grabbing Jordan and Alex to join them in the sea of people moving to the music now that the performances are over and the DJ is keeping the party going. All it took was the DJ playing “Before I Let Go” and they were Electric Sliding and everything else all night.

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: Where the Love Light Gleams

...

They were so wrapped up, in the blankets and one another, that they didn’t even notice how cold out it was anymore. But they did notice when Christmas music started playing faintly in the background. As Leslie Odom Jr.’s “I’ll Be Home for Christmas” began playing, a lull in the conversation made it extra noticeable.

I’ll be home for Christmas

“God, where is that music coming from?” Sophie asked abruptly.

Ryan shot up and looked at her. “Okay, so you hear it too, right? It’s not just me?”

Sophie laughed and got up to look out over her balcony. “Ahh.” She motioned for Ryan to join her.

Below them was a couple making use of the condo’s outdoor area to have a series of slow dances.

Please have snow and mistletoe

“We should totally steal their flow, right?” Ryan proposed.

“We should what?” Sophie felt herself being pulled into Ryan’s arms.

Ryan beamed as she took Sophie’s arms and placed them around her neck. Naturally, they leaned their foreheads together.

Christmas Eve will find me

“By the way, you can stop pretending to hate all of my activities now. I know how much you love them,” she joked.

Sophie was quick with her rebuttal. “Do I? Or is that just what you’re telling yourself so that you can get me into another onesie?”

“Now, how did you know I had another one?” Ryan said in a way that left Sophie wondering if she was joking or not.

If only in my dreams

They eased back into silence and swayed in each other’s arms.

Some time through the trumpet solo, Ryan spoke softly to her partner, “You know, I know you said you were fine and I’m going to take your word for it.”

“But?”

“But I’m also just going to say that if your parents want to cut you out of the family because of their own bigoted beliefs, that’s their problem; not yours. If you being gay is an issue for them and they don't want to get to know you— the truest, most authentic, and beautiful version of you, it's their loss.”

Sophie found her mouth etching itself into a sad smile hearing her words from months ago parroted back to her.

“My time as Batwoman has taught me a lot about family. If someone is all the family you have, they're all the family you need. You have Jordan, Luke, Mary, and you have me. We’re going to do everything that the rest of them couldn’t; accept you and support you and love you. You know why?”

Smirking, Sophie knew what she was going to say next. “Why?”

“Because you still deserve it. I’m going to make every Christmas for you as magical as this one. And the magic I can't bring will find you. I know it will.”

Then, Sophie kissed her, in part because she loved her and in part to shut her up before she started blubbering like a baby on Ryan’s shoulders.

Christmas Eve will find me

As the song approached its end, Sophie felt something cold on her cheek. Actually, a few somethings in quick succession. She opened her eyes to see snow cascading swiftly onto their faces and all around them. “Did you know it was supposed to snow tonight?”

Ryan looked up and cheesed again. She laid her head on Sophie’s chest. “I told you, it finds the people who deserve it.”

“What finds its way?”

“Christmas magic.”

If only in my dreams
HTMLExcerpt:
Chapter Title: Where the Love Light Gleams

...

They were so wrapped up, in the blankets and one another, that they didn’t even notice how cold out it was anymore. But they did notice when Christmas music started playing faintly in the background. As Leslie Odom Jr.’s “I’ll Be Home for Christmas” began playing, a lull in the conversation made it extra noticeable.

I’ll be home for Christmas

“God, where is that music coming from?” Sophie asked abruptly.

Ryan shot up and looked at her. “Okay, so you hear it too, right? It’s not just me?”

Sophie laughed and got up to look out over her balcony. “Ahh.” She motioned for Ryan to join her.

Below them was a couple making use of the condo’s outdoor area to have a series of slow dances.

Please have snow and mistletoe

“We should totally steal their flow, right?” Ryan proposed.

“We should what?” Sophie felt herself being pulled into Ryan’s arms.

Ryan beamed as she took Sophie’s arms and placed them around her neck. Naturally, they leaned their foreheads together.

Christmas Eve will find me

“By the way, you can stop pretending to hate all of my activities now. I know how much you love them,” she joked.

Sophie was quick with her rebuttal. “Do I? Or is that just what you’re telling yourself so that you can get me into another onesie?”

“Now, how did you know I had another one?” Ryan said in a way that left Sophie wondering if she was joking or not.

If only in my dreams

They eased back into silence and swayed in each other’s arms.

Some time through the trumpet solo, Ryan spoke softly to her partner, “You know, I know you said you were fine and I’m going to take your word for it.”

“But?”

“But I’m also just going to say that if your parents want to cut you out of the family because of their own bigoted beliefs, that’s their problem; not yours. If you being gay is an issue for them and they don't want to get to know you— the truest, most authentic, and beautiful version of you, it's their loss.”

Sophie found her mouth etching itself into a sad smile hearing her words from months ago parroted back to her.

“My time as Batwoman has taught me a lot about family. If someone is all the family you have, they're all the family you need. You have Jordan, Luke, Mary, and you have me. We’re going to do everything that the rest of them couldn’t; accept you and support you and love you. You know why?”

Smirking, Sophie knew what she was going to say next. “Why?”

“Because you still deserve it. I’m going to make every Christmas for you as magical as this one. And the magic I can't bring will find you. I know it will.”

Then, Sophie kissed her, in part because she loved her and in part to shut her up before she started blubbering like a baby on Ryan’s shoulders.

Christmas Eve will find me

As the song approached its end, Sophie felt something cold on her cheek. Actually, a few somethings in quick succession. She opened her eyes to see snow cascading swiftly onto their faces and all around them. “Did you know it was supposed to snow tonight?”

Ryan looked up and cheesed again. She laid her head on Sophie’s chest. “I told you, it finds the people who deserve it.”

“What finds its way?”

“Christmas magic.”

If only in my dreams

Excerpt:
The next morning finds Sophie feeling idyllic and borderline whimsical. She queues up a throwback from her childhood and dances her way to the shower, reciting the lyrics in that almost corny way she does as the water heats…




🎶 I was layin' in the coup with my hat turned back


We caught eyes for a moment and that was that

So I skated off as you strolled off

Looking at them legs, god damn they looked so soft

I gotta take ya from your woman that's my mission

If her love is real she gotta handle competition 🎶




When the song gets to the part with her favorite old school R&B group crooning on the hook, she’s wide open, riding that high.




🎶 Hey lover, hey lover, this is more than a crush 🎶





Was she acting like a lovesick teenager at 31? Perhaps. But if you can’t enjoy the high of new love, then what even is the point of anything?

She steps out of the shower smiling ear to ear, thinking about last night and the joy it brings her heart. She towels off still humming, pops a french vanilla in the keurig, and throws on a sundress because yeah she’s feeling sundressy!

That is…until she opens the doors to the balcony and remembers it’s fall, nearing winter, in Gotham. She promptly changes into a cute sweater, warm pants, and a sensible boot, chuckling to herself as she sips her cappuccino.




...

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt:
As the announcer echoed through the ballroom, “Dancing the Cha-Cha-Cha to Butter by BTS, Ocean and Lana”, inspiration struck Ryan.

She knew that next week they’d be doing this dance and she could use that to distract Sophie. To get Sophie’s attention she gently placed her hand on Sophie’s arm and leaned in, saying “Tell me your critique of this. I can use tonight to learn.”
HTMLExcerpt:
A hush fell over the crowd as Vesper Fairchild, the show’s host stepped out onto the stage. The recording indicator lights strategically placed out of camera lines but easy for the crowd to see flashed bright red. Then, Vesper said in her well known news anchor voice, “Welcome to this season of Dancing With The Stars!”

For the first time Ryan got a look at the judges in person as Vesper welcomed them all back for yet another season. Renee Montoya was the hardest of the three to impress, so any compliments from her would be hard earned, Joe West was known to be the most softhearted and encouraging of the judges, Ryan wasn’t so worried about him and Gideon was exceedingly fair and real stickler for the rules. She’d seen Sophie consulting rule manuals a lot, and as a new pro she also suspected Sophie would be extra risk averse. So she wasn’t worried about getting docked points from Gideon due to rule transgressions.

While the package for the night’s first couple, a famous model named Ocean and his pro whose name Ryan hadn’t caught yet, aired Ryan noticed Sophie was being all jittery again. As the announcer echoed through the ballroom, “Dancing the Cha-Cha-Cha to Butter by BTS, Ocean and Lana”, inspiration struck Ryan.

She knew that next week they’d be doing this dance and she could use that to distract Sophie. To get Sophie’s attention she gently placed her hand on Sophie’s arm and leaned in, saying “Tell me your critique of this. I can use tonight to learn.”

Sophie leaned back, a slow smile spreading on her face. Ryan knew she had struck gold when Sophie moved her chair around, so instead of sitting a foot or so from Ryan they were right next to each other. Then she proceeded lean in close so she could narrate the entire dance to Ryan without being drowned out by the music. Having a job to do, something to focus on other than her nerves, had definitely calmed Sophie down.

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt: ... both of them saying how much dancing in a same sex couple meant to them played on screens throughout the ballroom. Then, the announcer’s voice rang out, “Dancing the Quickstep to Woman by Doja Cat, Ryan and Sophie”
HTMLExcerpt:
Ryan shook her head. “You might be the pro at dancing, but that doesn’t mean you can’t be a bit worried about the cameras and being on TV.” Ryan said, knowing she was deliberately downplaying the reason Sophie was nervous. She wasn’t sure Sophie would want to burden Ryan’s learning experience with her career worries.

“Thanks Ryan”, was all Sophie was able to reply before they heard the cue. Ryan dropped Sophie’s hand and they walked out onto the stage. The replay of their comments, about Ryan’s career, both of them saying how much dancing in a same sex couple meant to them played on screens throughout the ballroom. Then, the announcer’s voice rang out, “Dancing the Quickstep to Woman by Doja Cat, Ryan and Sophie”

The beat of the song dropped in a few seconds later. Sophie had prepared her well, before she could think her body started to move of it’s own accord to the beat. She felt, rather than saw Sophie completing the side by side steps that started the routine. Then, as the chorus ended and the rap verse started, she joined Sophie in ballroom hold. The dance was frantic, although their upper bodies stayed still their feet were moving at warp speed across the floor dancing in double time to the beat of the song. The routine ended as planned, they faced each other with their arms outstretched. Sophie looked radiant, and Ryan could feel herself beaming back at her. Whatever else happened now, they’d danced together in front of America, normalizing two women being together.

…

Excerpt:
There’s a lot they don’t tell you when you first put on the suit, but the fact that you will spend almost every night in a bath of epsom salt nursing bruises has got to be at the top of the list.
Sophie tries to brave her face when Ryan finally makes her way back to the cave, but Ryan sees herself in the reflection of the worried crinkles at the corner of her eyes. That’s the thing about having a girlfriend — there’s no place to hide. Maybe Ryan was willing to convince herself that it wasn’t as bad as it looked, that a few scrapes and bruises are a price well paid to protect the city’s most vulnerable. But there was no convincing Sophie.
After debriefing with Luke and having Mary clean up dried blood and check for any broken bones or concussion (none, thank God), Ryan lets Sophie help her back to their apartment. This has become their tradition. When the night is done and the city is finally quiet, Ryan is never alone. She has her girl. She has this one place where she can be vulnerable, where she doesn’t have to take care of everyone else before she takes care of herself.
 Ryan protects Gotham. Sophie protects Ryan. That is their way.
Sophie eases Ryan onto the couch and helps her out of her Vans, rubbing her feet slightly as she goes.
“I cannot believe you never told me about “Touch Me”! You know I love Kehlani! AND VICTORIA MONET! And yet, here I am having to learn about this two year old song from Anissa in the group chat!! The group chat, Ryan? What’s the point of this relationship if you aren’t going to help in my lesbian education?”
Ryan chuckles, slightly kicking Sophie off of her with her left foot. She knows Sophie is doing this on purpose, trying to keep it light. But after a night like tonight, her energy is fading. Her skin is tender, turning purple in places as bruises form. And a faint laugh? That’s all she got. 
“How about I run you a bath?”

Sophie tries to brave her face when Ryan finally makes her way back to the cave, but Ryan sees herself in the reflection of the worried crinkles at the corner of her eyes. That’s the thing about having a girlfriend — there’s no place to hide. Maybe Ryan was willing to convince herself that it wasn’t as bad as it looked, that a few scrapes and bruises are a price well paid to protect the city’s most vulnerable. But there was no convincing Sophie.

After debriefing with Luke and having Mary clean up dried blood and check for any broken bones or concussion (none, thank God), Ryan lets Sophie help her back to their apartment. This has become their tradition. When the night is done and the city is finally quiet, Ryan is never alone. She has her girl. She has this one place where she can be vulnerable, where she doesn’t have to take care of everyone else before she takes care of herself.

 Ryan protects Gotham. Sophie protects Ryan. That is their way.

Sophie eases Ryan onto the couch and helps her out of her Vans, rubbing her feet slightly as she goes.

The group chat, Ryan? What’s the point of this relationship if you aren’t going to help in my lesbian education?”

Ryan chuckles, slightly kicking Sophie off of her with her left foot. She knows Sophie is doing this on purpose, trying to keep it light. But after a night like tonight, her energy is fading. Her skin is tender, turning purple in places as bruises form. And a faint laugh? That’s all she got.

Excerpt:
Story Title: let me be your woman

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

just a bunch of Ryan and Sophie being very attracted to each other because “Woman” by Doja Cat is a great song with some absurd lyrics. Press play and just vibe.

Let's all say that Ryan and Sophie are new girlfriends, okay?

...

There’s something about the beat of this damn song. Something sensual and inviting that builds as Doja sings, “let me be your woman.” Good music always makes the shifts go by faster. Makes a quick pop over to the booths for glasses feel like the start of a music video.

Ryan dances along, her hips swaying, eyes slightly hooded as her tongue pokes out between her teeth. She spins to play into her little video girl fantasy. But on the spin, she spots Sophie on the edge of the section. Sophie’s eyes snap up to meet Ryan’s. Ryan laughs. Leave it to Sophie to be dead serious at the bar.

Ryan turns back to the table to get the glasses. Short legs and arms means she bends over it to get some of the farther ones. She could’ve walked around, but she knows Sophie’s still watching.

A hand lands on Ryan’s swaying hip for just a moment. Ryan freezes at the touch, but relaxes once she glances over her shoulder to see that it's Sophie. They’re still new to this — the touches that don’t have to be innocent, the heated glances that get to burn forever.

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt:
Across the dance floor, in her spotlight Ryan smiled at her as the announcer’s voice rung out, “Dancing the Cha-Cha to Don’t Cha by the Pussycat Dolls with her partner Sophie, it’s Ryan Wilder.”

The music came on and Sophie gladly moved from her mark towards Ryan. The start of the routine progressed exactly as plan, Ryan keeping her timing in sync with Sophie’s even as they danced in parallel. They progressed to a sequence where they were dancing in hold and Sophie could see Ryan’s thinking face as they neared the most tricky part of the routine, the split dip. As choreographed, Sophie spun Ryan back into her, so that her back was flush with Sophie’s front. Taking advantage of being so close that Ryan would be able to hear her Sophie instructed, “Ryan, relax”, in the split second they had before she lowered Ryan between her own legs and into the splits. As she pulled Ryan up and got back into hold for the next few bars she could hear the crowd applauding and saw the tension leave Ryan. 

The transition back to side by side movement was marked by a high kick, Sophie smiling genuinely as she saw Ryan successfully complete the kick in her periphery. The dance was all hip action and longing glances as the energy of the song overtook them. Sophie knew the chemistry would be palpable onscreen. The finale of the dance ended with them in hold, their bodies pressed close as the camera panned out.

Sophie pulled Ryan into a hug before the moved towards the judges, saying, “See I knew you would show that cha-cha.”

Ryan laughed and led Sophie over to the mark on the floor, holding her hand the whole way.
HTMLExcerpt:
Across the dance floor, in her spotlight Ryan smiled at her as the announcer’s voice rung out, “Dancing the Cha-Cha to Don’t Cha by the Pussycat Dolls with her partner Sophie, it’s Ryan Wilder.”

 

The music came on and Sophie gladly moved from her mark towards Ryan. The start of the routine progressed exactly as plan, Ryan keeping her timing in sync with Sophie’s even as they danced in parallel. They progressed to a sequence where they were dancing in hold and Sophie could see Ryan’s thinking face as they neared the most tricky part of the routine, the split dip. As choreographed, Sophie spun Ryan back into her, so that her back was flush with Sophie’s front. Taking advantage of being so close that Ryan would be able to hear her Sophie instructed, “Ryan, relax”, in the split second they had before she lowered Ryan between her own legs and into the splits. As she pulled Ryan up and got back into hold for the next few bars she could hear the crowd applauding and saw the tension leave Ryan.

 

The transition back to side by side movement was marked by a high kick, Sophie smiling genuinely as she saw Ryan successfully complete the kick in her periphery. The dance was all hip action and longing glances as the energy of the song overtook them. Sophie knew the chemistry would be palpable onscreen. The finale of the dance ended with them in hold, their bodies pressed close as the camera panned out.

 

Sophie pulled Ryan into a hug before the moved towards the judges, saying, “See I knew you would show that cha-cha.”

 

Ryan laughed and led Sophie over to the mark on the floor, holding her hand the whole way.
SongArtist: Don't Cha by The Pussycat Dolls, Busta Rhymes
StoryWriter: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees) by jump_the_gunn
SASW:
Don't Cha by The Pussycat Dolls, Busta Rhymes

Excerpt:
Story Title: Late Night Drive

...

Sophie would never tell Ryan this but she found it incredibly hot whenever Ryan was in the Batmobile. The sheer power and control that Ryan possessed when she was in that thing, the rev of the engine, the sexy sleek red and black of the car that matched Ryan's suit and the wig she wore. All of the lights and buttons in the car that seemed to know what Ryan needed and when she needed it. Sophie loved the few times that she got to be in the Batmobile riding shot gun with Ryan. The Batmobile was already a super fast car but Ryan definitely had a lead foot. She'd speed through the streets and swerve in between cars like she was on a longboard and Sophie loved every minute of it. She never felt scared because she trusted Ryan. 

"So, you gonna stare at me all night?" Ryan said out of nowhere. She turned her head towards Sophie and gave her one of those thousand watt smiles of hers. 

"Oh please, don't be so full of yourself. I was just staring out in that direction and you just happen to be in my line of sight." Sophie offered dumbly. Ryan chuckled. 

"Uh huh." Ryan flipped on her playlist.

They should've treated you better
Girl they should've treated you better
They didn't show you enough love
Now you just want more
Now you just want more




They didn't show you enough love, love
They didn't show you enough love
They should've treated you better, yeah

I know what you want, girl
You ain't even gotta tell, you know I got it

You feel like you deserve to be loved
Your exes did you wrong
That's why you stayed alone
But your lonely days are gone
I came out here to save you...

Sophie looked at one of the screens in the car to see what song was playing. "Late night drive" by someone named Yo Trane. Sophie got butterflies in her stomach. She tried to calm them and breathed in. She suddenly felt this overwhelming urge to grab Ryan's hand and lace their fingers.

Excerpt:
Story Title: Beautiful Surprise

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

I'm back! I've been enjoying reading the other Wildmoore fics (y'all doing the damn thing!!) so I got inspired. This is something I whipped up while passing the time in between episodes.

Title taken from India. Arie's song. Give it a listen to catch my vibe for this fic and because it's an amazing song.

Beautiful Surprise: https://youtu.be/w5DpuEHhCuc

Enjoy!

...

They settle back into a quiet calm between them. Returning to their respective searches on their phones in preparation for their upcoming wedding.

               

“You know, we kinda remind me of an India. Arie song,” Ryan says out of nowhere. 

               

“Oh yeah? Which one?” Sophie asks, saving the tab about black owned wedding cake bakeries.

               

“Beautiful Surprise. ‘Cause let’s be real, neither one of us saw this,” Ryan points between the two of them, “coming.” Sophie laughs loudly, Ryan quickly joining in.

               

“Oh not at all. But Jordan did call it early in our friendship.”




Ryan laughs even louder.

               

“Oh yeah. Shipper at first sight.”

               

“Yup. I think she loves you more than I do.”

               

Ryan puts her hand over her heart and fakes being hurt. “Rude.”

               

“Relax. It's a complete lie.” Sophie gets up, steps around the table, and slowly sits down on Ryan’s lap. Ryan immediately puts her arms around her fiancee’s waist while Sophie puts hers around Ryan’s neck. “No one loves you as much I do.” 




“Yeah?”




Sophie smiles and nods. “Uh huh. I love you so much, future Mrs. Moore.”

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt:
They were standing posed under the intense spotlight, forehead to forehead, Ryan’s arms around the back of Sophie’s neck. Sophie’s arms holding Ryan’s waist, her fingers grazing Ryan’s skin since she’d been given a tiny backless dress this week.  They’d of course practiced the pose as the starting point of their dance. They never had to hold it so long though, as they waited for the recorded package to end. It felt kind of like a meditation to Ryan, especially when she felt Sophie’s thumb moving in small reassuring strokes.

Finally, the announcement sounded, “Dancing the Argentine tango to When Doves Cry by the Prince with her partner Sophie, it’s Ryan Wilder.” 

With the shriek of the electric guitar playing the opening riff of the song they were off. This dance was smooth and fluid, bodies passing between bodies. Legs always seemingly impossibly tangled to a viewer but actually playing a carefully choreographed back and forth. Things started to get real when they got to the first lift, Sophie grasped the back of Ryan’s neck and Ryan held onto her arms. Using Sophie for both momentum and leverage Ryan leaped up as high as she could, doing a scissor kick as she moved from one side of Sophie to the other. She landed smoothly and without any pause they continued on with the choreography, twisting back into hold for a few steps before Sophie split one of her legs through Ryan’s.

Ryan hadn’t forgotten what Sophie had said about being able to fake chemistry. And all week while they’d been practicing Ryan had felt a spark of chemistry. But the way Sophie was looking up at her now from between her legs, that girl deserved an Oscar. Even knowing it was fake Ryan, was overwhelmed by the intensity of it. This was easy to work with, it felt real for her. So when Ryan hooked her leg up around Sophie and moved in close, running her hand down Sophie’s neck and into the deep V of her costume, the passion was there. She felt it, she saw it and she knew this performance would be off the charts.

They were standing posed under the intense spotlight, forehead to forehead, Ryan’s arms around the back of Sophie’s neck. Sophie’s arms holding Ryan’s waist, her fingers grazing Ryan’s skin since she’d been given a tiny backless dress this week.  They’d of course practiced the pose as the starting point of their dance. They never had to hold it so long though, as they waited for the recorded package to end. It felt kind of like a meditation to Ryan, especially when she felt Sophie’s thumb moving in small reassuring strokes.

 

Finally, the announcement sounded, “Dancing the Argentine tango to When Doves Cry by the Prince with her partner Sophie, it’s Ryan Wilder.”

 

With the shriek of the electric guitar playing the opening riff of the song they were off. This dance was smooth and fluid, bodies passing between bodies. Legs always seemingly impossibly tangled to a viewer but actually playing a carefully choreographed back and forth. Things started to get real when they got to the first lift, Sophie grasped the back of Ryan’s neck and Ryan held onto her arms. Using Sophie for both momentum and leverage Ryan leaped up as high as she could, doing a scissor kick as she moved from one side of Sophie to the other. She landed smoothly and without any pause they continued on with the choreography, twisting back into hold for a few steps before Sophie split one of her legs through Ryan’s.

 

Ryan hadn’t forgotten what Sophie had said about being able to fake chemistry. And all week while they’d been practicing Ryan had felt a spark of chemistry. But the way Sophie was looking up at her now from between her legs, that girl deserved an Oscar. Even knowing it was fake Ryan, was overwhelmed by the intensity of it. This was easy to work with, it felt real for her. So when Ryan hooked her leg up around Sophie and moved in close, running her hand down Sophie’s neck and into the deep V of her costume, the passion was there. She felt it, she saw it and she knew this performance would be off the charts.

Song: hell is where i dreamt of u and woke up alone
Story: hell is where i dreamt of you and woke up alone
Excerpt:
Story Title: hell is where i dreamt of you and woke up alone

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Hi y’all, this is my first fanfic so please be nice. I really love Wildmoore and wish there was more content so I decided to try my hand. Also, this fic is kind of inspired by hell is where i dreamt of you and woke up alone by blackbear and also just Sophie’s conversation with Jordan about her dream. Hope you like it!

Oh also I’m on Twitter with the same handle slimthickmani, so follow me if you want to :)

...

Sophie looked up now, gazing into Ryan’s eyes before opening her mouth to speak. She cleared her throat so as to not choke on the words. Then quickly: “Ihadadreamaboutyou.” Ryan could barely decipher the sentence.

“You... had a dream about me?” Ryan repeated back to her, confused. Sophie drew in a long breath and looked down to her fingers again.

“Yeah, I- I had a dream about you. I was sick and you brought me soup and flowers,” Sophie looked up to gauge Ryan’s reaction. All she saw was a neutral, but intrigued face. She marched on. “And it was honestly a really good dream, having you there when I was sick. But then I woke up and you weren’t there, and it sucked. It felt like a special kind of Hell, to have dreamt of you and woke up alone.” Another exhale escaped Sophie’s lips as she geared up for her big finale. “Ryan, I really like you. And I think you like me, too. And I think you should let me take you on a date.”

At this, Ryan broke into a smile. And a giggle left her mouth. Sophie looked at her in bewilderment. She had just poured out her feelings and the girl was laughing? She felt like she could combust. “I thought you’d never ask,” Ryan said after she collected herself. She scooted a little bit closer to Sophie to place a soft, chaste kiss on the corner of her mouth. “I’d love to go out with you, Sophie. I’ve liked you for a while now.” Sophie smiled that shy smile reserved for Ryan and brought her in for the warmest hug.

“You dreamed about me, huh?” Ryan teased. “And not waking up next to me felt like Hell? Damn, I got it like that?”

Sophie groaned. “Shut up, Wilder. Don’t make me regret telling you that.”

“Too late,” the brunette quipped. “I’ll always hold that over your head.” She shifted in Sophie’s grasp, moving her head so she could look her in the eyes. “You can sleep next to me tonight. Maybe it’ll be like heaven instead when you wake up,” she added with a giggle. Sophie rolled her eyes super hard but couldn’t suppress the smile on her face knowing that Ryan was probably right.
