Excerpt:
Story Title: I Am Woman

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

I am currently a bit in love with the Emmy Meli song 'I Am Woman' and it makes me think of Javicia Leslie every time I listen to it so Happy Batwoman Day =)

...

Ryan doesn’t hear her feet pounding the pavement or her blood rushing to keep up the pace, nor does she feel the burn of a few minutes ago. As she rounds the corner onto their street and their building comes into view she’s almost tempted to run straight past, add on another kilometre or so. She’s absolutely buzzed, dopamine and endorphins bubbling away under her skin, encouraged by the rare Gotham sun and the music in her headphones. She feels like she could go for hours, maybe run the city perimeter, but Soph should be finishing work soon and they have dinner plans before tonights patrol. She takes the stairs up to their apartment two at a time, determined to actually be ready – showered and spectacular – for when Sophie gets home. Maybe hoping a little that she’ll look too good to share, that dinner will be skipped and her incredible dress stripped. She finally stops running when she reaches the door but she’s nowhere near ready to stop moving, to cut this song, now louder without all the street noise and making her feel euphoric.

I am woman, I am fearless

I am sexy, I am divine

 

Slamming the front door behind her, she squeezes her eyes closed, mouthing the lyrics enthusiastically before bouncing towards the kitchen and dropping her key onto the counter.




I am unbeatable, I am creative

Honey, you can get in line




The blender jug is upside down on the drainer and a huge delivery of oxytocin swells up to join the other feel goods – Sophie always remembers to wash it for her after her morning HIIT sessions and having someone think and do these little things just for her will never get old. Her singing lifts with her mood as she dances around the kitchen collecting the ingredients for her protein smoothie.




I am feminine, I am masculine

I am anything I want

I can teach you, I can love you

If you got it going on

 

She genuinely can’t think of a time she’s ever felt this happy, this alive. And she’s not even fazed by the level of cheese right now – she feels cute, might delete the thought from memory later. As a rule, Ryan tries really hard not to dwell on the unbalanced amount of shit life and its inhabitants have thrown at her because what’s the fucking point?

 

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

 

She’s always kind of lived by the adage that you should throw out into the world what you hope to get back, so maybe that’s what this is. Maybe it’s finally happening.

 

Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

Got it on going on, ya

 

Not karma exactly…more like a manifestation of what she’d always hoped her life could be.

 

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on)

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on, yeah)




She has a home and a job and a cause and a girl, all her own.

 

 

I'm classy, I'm modern, I live by my own design

I'm cherry, I'm lemon, I'm the sweetest key lime pie

 

A meaning beyond what anyone or anything external had ever wanted to attribute to her.

 

I'm electric, I'm bass, I'm the beat of my own drum

I could make your goosebumps raise

With the tracing of my thumb

 

 

She has friends and a family, she has a city and she’s loved, truly, finally equal to the love her Mama gave and got in return. She’s not alone or ever scared that she’s going to be. Not anymore.

 

Only love can get inside me

I move in my own timing

Voice of the future speak to me kindly

I feel what I want and somehow it finds me

 

She did this. Now they all do this with her and for her and she feels…invincible.

 

 

Somehow it finds me

Somehow it finds me

Somehow it finds me

Yeah! Hey hey!

 

The sweat is drying on her skin but throwing herself around the kitchen and singing loudly (badly but so damn what?) is keeping the fire stoked inside. She kicks off her trainers, takes off skidding across the tiled floor like a kid to return the almond milk to the fridge. She cleans the remaining hempseed butter from her teaspoon with her mouth and then uses it as a microphone, belting out the words so even her own ears hear them through her headphones.

 

 

I am woman, I am fearless

I am sexy, I am divine

I am unbeatable, I am creative

Honey, you can get in line

I am feminine, I am masculine

I am anything I want

I can teach you, I can love you

If you got it going on

 

She presses the lid onto the blender and pulses her drink, hips tick-tocking staccato in perfect time, voice getting louder and louder to rise above the blades.

 

 

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

Got it on going on, ya

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on)

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on, yeah)

 

She pours the smoothie over ice and drops the jug into the sink, encouraged to turn the sound up even more when she hears it clang against the metal.

 

 

Hear no evil, speak no evil

I am not the one to curse

They can talk that shit about you

Long as you know that it's false

 

She’s so hyped right now she might burst. Full to the very brim with pure unadulterated goodness, energy vibrating in every atom of her being; she actually can’t still any part of herself long enough to function. Her smoothie can wait. The shower can wait. Her dress can wait. Right now she has no choice but to move. To sing, shriek, scream at the top of her voice as she throws herself further into their apartment. Hands above her head, ass going every which way, belly bar reflecting light across the walls as she passes through towards the bathroom.

 

I am earthly, I am heaven

I am what I like to be

When I ask for what I want

 

Somehow it finds me

Somehow it finds me

Yeah! Hey hey!

 

‘HEYYYY! Ohhhh crap.’




Sophie is twisted around in her seat at the dining table, one set of multiple pairs of eyes staring at her as she quickly drags the headphones down around her neck. Her heart beats in her throat – partly from almost jumping out of her skin at the unexpected company, but mostly from sheer embarrassment at the show she’d inadvertently just put on for what looked like the Mayor’s office, GCPD, Jordan’s outreach investors and a couple of B list celebs. And her extremely tense looking girlfriend.




‘Ryan,’ Soph grinds out, cheeks flushed and eyes imploringly wide. ‘Can you give us a few minutes to wrap this up please?’




‘Yep. Of course. Not a problem.’ She rushes back into the kitchen, necks the smoothie like it’s a half pint of Tequila just to stop herself from squirming or screaming or both.




‘Oh my God, Ryan,’ Sophie hurries into the kitchen, shaking her head. ‘What the hell was that?’




‘You said you were in a meeting until 5! I didn’t think anyone was here.’




‘I WAS in a meeting until 5! On Zoom, like the rest of the frikkin world!’




‘Well why didn’t you stop me?’




‘I tried!’ Sophie visibly softens, the ridiculousness of the situation dawning, and steps closer to Ryan to jostle the headphones. ‘You obviously couldn’t hear over these. And I couldn’t exactly get out of my chair and come in here because…’ She gestures down at herself and the half business suit half jami attire she’s rocking.




‘Ohhh, my bad.’ Ryan winces but with the hint of a grin. ‘Did I wreck the proposal?’




‘Not as much as you wrecked that song.’




‘Rude.’




Sophie steps fully into her pouting girlfriend, arms encircling to clasp together in her lower back.




‘Honestly, it was dragging on a bit – I think they were grateful for the show. It was quite the performance.’




‘I was in the zone.’ Ryan gazes up at her, scrunching her face all cute and playful. ‘Play your cards right and maybe you’ll get a private show later.’




‘Well it’s a widely known fact that everyone sounds better in the shower, and you my love are very much in need of one, so why don’t we do an undressed rehearsal right now?’




‘Hmm…’ Ryan hums against her lips, guiding her gently backwards in the general direction of the bathroom. ‘I’m gonna let that insult slide for now but better believe you’ll be paying for it later.’




‘Oh I’d say I’ve prepaid for that one given the way you just forced me to mix business with pleasure.’




‘Call it even?’

 

 

I am woman, I am fearless

I am sexy, I am divine

I am unbeatable, I am creative

Honey, you can get in line

I am feminine, I am masculine

I am anything I want

I can teach you, I can love you

If you got it going on

 

If you got it, got it, got it, got it

Got it, got it, got it going on

Got it going on, got it going on, got it going on

I am anything I want

I can teach you, I can love you

If you got it going on

 

She genuinely can’t think of a time she’s ever felt this happy, this alive. And she’s not even fazed by the level of cheese right now – she feels cute, might delete the thought from memory later. As a rule, Ryan tries really hard not to dwell on the unbalanced amount of shit life and its inhabitants have thrown at her because what’s the fucking point?

 

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

 

She’s always kind of lived by the adage that you should throw out into the world what you hope to get back, so maybe that’s what this is. Maybe it’s finally happening.

 

Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

Got it on going on, ya

 

Not karma exactly…more like a manifestation of what she’d always hoped her life could be.

 

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on)

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on, yeah)

 

She has a home and a job and a cause and a girl, all her own.

 

 

I'm classy, I'm modern, I live by my own design

I'm cherry, I'm lemon, I'm the sweetest key lime pie

 

A meaning beyond what anyone or anything external had ever wanted to attribute to her.

 

I'm electric, I'm bass, I'm the beat of my own drum

I could make your goosebumps raise

With the tracing of my thumb

 

 

She has friends and a family, she has a city and she’s loved, truly, finally equal to the love her Mama gave and got in return. She’s not alone or ever scared that she’s going to be. Not anymore.

 

Only love can get inside me

I move in my own timing

Voice of the future speak to me kindly

I feel what I want and somehow it finds me

 

She did this. Now they all do this with her and for her and she feels…invincible.

 

 

Somehow it finds me

Somehow it finds me

Somehow it finds me

Yeah! Hey hey!

 

The sweat is drying on her skin but throwing herself around the kitchen and singing loudly (badly but so damn what?) is keeping the fire stoked inside. She kicks off her trainers, takes off skidding across the tiled floor like a kid to return the almond milk to the fridge. She cleans the remaining hempseed butter from her teaspoon with her mouth and then uses it as a microphone, belting out the words so even her own ears hear them through her headphones.

 

 

I am woman, I am fearless

I am sexy, I am divine

I am unbeatable, I am creative

Honey, you can get in line

I am feminine, I am masculine

I am anything I want

I can teach you, I can love you

If you got it going on

 

She presses the lid onto the blender and pulses her drink, hips tick-tocking staccato in perfect time, voice getting louder and louder to rise above the blades.

 

 

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it, got it

If you got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on

Got it on going on, ya

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on)

(Got it, got it, got it, got it, got it going on, yeah)

 

She pours the smoothie over ice and drops the jug into the sink, encouraged to turn the sound up even more when she hears it clang against the metal.

 

 

Hear no evil, speak no evil

I am not the one to curse

They can talk that shit about you

Long as you know that it's false

 

She’s so hyped right now she might burst. Full to the very brim with pure unadulterated goodness, energy vibrating in every atom of her being; she actually can’t still any part of herself long enough to function. Her smoothie can wait. The shower can wait. Her dress can wait. Right now she has no choice but to move. To sing, shriek, scream at the top of her voice as she throws herself further into their apartment. Hands above her head, ass going every which way, belly bar reflecting light across the walls as she passes through towards the bathroom.

 

I am earthly, I am heaven

I am what I like to be

When I ask for what I want

 

Somehow it finds me

Somehow it finds me

Yeah! Hey hey!

 

‘HEYYYY! Ohhhh crap.’

 

Sophie is twisted around in her seat at the dining table, one set of multiple pairs of eyes staring at her as she quickly drags the headphones down around her neck. Her heart beats in her throat – partly from almost jumping out of her skin at the unexpected company, but mostly from sheer embarrassment at the show she’d inadvertently just put on for what looked like the Mayor’s office, GCPD, Jordan’s outreach investors and a couple of B list celebs. And her extremely tense looking girlfriend.

 

‘Ryan,’ Soph grinds out, cheeks flushed and eyes imploringly wide. ‘Can you give us a few minutes to wrap this up please?’

 

‘Yep. Of course. Not a problem.’ She rushes back into the kitchen, necks the smoothie like it’s a half pint of Tequila just to stop herself from squirming or screaming or both.

 

‘Oh my God, Ryan,’ Sophie hurries into the kitchen, shaking her head. ‘What the hell was that?’

 

‘You said you were in a meeting until 5! I didn’t think anyone was here.’

 

‘I WAS in a meeting until 5! On Zoom, like the rest of the frikkin world!’

 

‘Well why didn’t you stop me?’

 

‘I tried!’ Sophie visibly softens, the ridiculousness of the situation dawning, and steps closer to Ryan to jostle the headphones. ‘You obviously couldn’t hear over these. And I couldn’t exactly get out of my chair and come in here because…’ She gestures down at herself and the half business suit half jami attire she’s rocking.

 

‘Ohhh, my bad.’ Ryan winces but with the hint of a grin. ‘Did I wreck the proposal?’

 

‘Not as much as you wrecked that song.’

 

‘Rude.’

 

Sophie steps fully into her pouting girlfriend, arms encircling to clasp together in her lower back.

 

‘Honestly, it was dragging on a bit – I think they were grateful for the show. It was quite the performance.’

 

‘I was in the zone.’ Ryan gazes up at her, scrunching her face all cute and playful. ‘Play your cards right and maybe you’ll get a private show later.’

 

‘Well it’s a widely known fact that everyone sounds better in the shower, and you my love are very much in need of one, so why don’t we do an undressed rehearsal right now?’

 

‘Hmm…’ Ryan hums against her lips, guiding her gently backwards in the general direction of the bathroom. ‘I’m gonna let that insult slide for now but better believe you’ll be paying for it later.’

 

‘Oh I’d say I’ve prepaid for that one given the way you just forced me to mix business with pleasure.’

 

‘Call it even?’

 

 

I am woman, I am fearless

I am sexy, I am divine

I am unbeatable, I am creative

Honey, you can get in line

I am feminine, I am masculine

I am anything I want

I can teach you, I can love you

If you got it going on

 

If you got it, got it, got it, got it

Got it, got it, got it going on

Got it going on, got it going on, got it going on

Song: The Most Beautiful Girl In the World
Excerpt:
The drive to Philadelphia was a quick, thanks to Sophie’s bomb playlist. She finally gave Ryan an idea of what she had in mind, there wasn’t anything time restrictive so it would allow them to just go with the flow of the day and see how they felt. Ryan was excited about the idea of the Vegan food fest, but most of all, just getting to spend a few carefree days with her girl. When they reached their location, Sophie parked and they got out to start their exploration.

“I’m surprised some of this food doesn’t smell too bad. Let me find out you’ve been purposely torturing me with what you’ve been bringing to my place.” Sophie teased her.

Ryan rolled her eyes, nudging Sophie with her shoulder before she intertwined her fingers with Sophies. They held hands as they moved through the crowd. There were also vendors who were selling art here and there between the food vendors. Occasionally Ryan would steal glances at Sophie, secretly admiring her beautiful girlfriend. Prince’s Most Beautiful Girl in The World playing on a loop in her mind every time she did do.

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt:
“Dancing the Viennese waltz to I Was Here by Beyoncé, with her partner Sophie it’s Ryan Wilder”, rung out across the area and when the beat dropped in a second later Ryan spun towards Sophie.  The dance Sophie had choreographed was perfect, the rise and fall of the song and their dancing matching perfectly. She had captured softness of two women making space for each other. Supporting each other, as Ryan and Sophie alternated taking lead throughout the dance, mirroring the relationship that Ryan and her mom had experienced. With Ryan being the one to take care of her mom in the end.

For the maximum emotional impact the dance finished with Sophie leaving the hold and walking away, as Ryan watched on forlornly.The moment the camera panned away and the audience started clapping Sophie ran back to Ryan. The audience sounds faded away as Sophie pulled Ryan in close, wiping away tears Ryan hadn’t even realized she was shedding. Sophie was murmuring something soothing to Ryan that she couldn’t quite make out. Thankfully there was a commercial break between their dance and judging so they were able to just be together quietly for a moment without being rushed to a new mark.

Excerpt:
She really had to thank god for Mary’s ridiculously expensive coffee machine. She got it started and while it did its thing she pulled out what she needed for breakfast. Tofu (extra firm), eggs, some milk of the almond variety, the various seasonings and spices she needed.

Setting two pans on the stove, she threw the tofu in one pan and cracked a couple of eggs into the other. When the scent of coffee started to make its way through the loft was around the same time Ryan heard footsteps behind her. The radio turned on and a line and half later (enough for Ryan to recognize the middle bars of Sun Goes Down) arms slipped around her waist.

“You’re cooking eggs?” Sophie asked, the surprise evident in her voice. She tucked her face against Ryan’s neck, trailing kisses across her skin.

Ryan tilted her head back to rest on Sophie’s shoulder.
HTMLExcerpt:
She really had to thank god for Mary’s ridiculously expensive coffee machine. She got it started and while it did its thing she pulled out what she needed for breakfast. Tofu (extra firm), eggs, some milk of the almond variety, the various seasonings and spices she needed.

Setting two pans on the stove, she threw the tofu in one pan and cracked a couple of eggs into the other. When the scent of coffee started to make its way through the loft was around the same time Ryan heard footsteps behind her. The radio turned on and a line and half later (enough for Ryan to recognize the middle bars of Sun Goes Down) arms slipped around her waist.

“You’re cooking eggs?” Sophie asked, the surprise evident in her voice. She tucked her face against Ryan’s neck, trailing kisses across her skin.

Ryan tilted her head back to rest on Sophie’s shoulder.

Excerpt:
"Alright you guys I think that's enough fun for today. Check out The Crows newest single Torn. And watch the exclusive performance later tonight at the 2020 Video Music Awards. Then, don't forget to get your tickets to their world tour!" The interviewer thanked the band members then excused herself.


...



Sophie grabbed her red fender stratocaster and watched as her fellow bandmates did the same with their own instruments.

"The Crows are on in five, four, three, two, one." The stagehand counted down with a hand to their ear piece. As soon as they hit one the platform started to slowly raise from their place under the stage.

Sophie can hear the audience cheer before she could see them. Their set was supposed to be dark so she assumed she wouldn't really see anything at all for the duration of the song.

There was a lone spotlight shining on her and the rest of the group as a red to white ombre background shown from behind them.

Kate counted off with her drumsticks and Sophie begins to sing.

I thought I saw a girl brought to life
She was warm, she came around
And she was dignified
She showed me what it was to cry

I couldn't be the one to adore
You don't seem to know
Or seem to care what my heart is for
But I don't know you anymore

The crowd begins to scream louder. Other celebrities stand up and attempt to sing along. Which in and of itself would be entertaining if she could see it more clearly, because the song had just released the day prior.

Excerpt:
“Jordan said you were worried about your vows,” Ryan prompted, sifting her fingers through Sophie’s to hold her hand.

“It was a mess. She said it sounded more like an essay than vows and she was right. God, I don’t know why I thought I could do it,” Sophie explained, kicking herself in the process. Ryan squeezed her hand tighter.

“It’s alright, darling,” Ryan assured her. She shifted so she could see Sophie’s face. “How about we write them together? We do everything better together anyway.” 26 minutes. “I can start: I’ll give you all I have.”

Sophie considered the words, and a warm feeling entered her chest. She smiled for practically the first time that day. “And nothing less, I promise.” She paused, considering her wants, and her fears, and her desires. “Love me and don’t look back.” The words sounded almost desperate to her ears, but she couldn’t help it. She needed to say exactly how she was feeling if this was going to work.

“I want you with me,” Ryan squeezed her hands again, drawing their foreheads together, both of them closing their eyes on contact. “On this road to the sky.” Ryan felt in her core that her and Sophie would last forever. Even past the grave.

Sophie’s next line came out almost like a question. “We’ll be shining every night.” It was her way of saying that they’d never go to sleep mad at one another. Their love should cast over them as they lay their heads down to rest.

Ryan understood the request because she knew Sophie better than anyone else. “I promise you. Just me and you?” She agreed and came back with a question of her own.

“I promise you,” Sophie finished, their vows complete. She opened her eyes to see mahogany orbs already staring into hers.

“God, I love you so much, it’s almost scary,” they both laughed at Ryan’s confession, breaking apart. They sat in a silent embrace for a few more moments before Sophie moved to stand, pulling her wife-to-be with her. 18 minutes. “Ah,” Ryan said, looking down at her phone with a satisfied grin. “We’re gonna make it back with time to spare.”

...

As they approached the altar, Luke let them go, their signal to open their eyes for their first look. Instantly, they took in the other woman’s ensemble and gasped. Ryan was in an intricate, lacy dress with a long train, while Sophie opted for a long-sleeved silk dress with beaded detail along the waist. The pictures that would be sent to them after the ceremony of this moment, showed faces full of love and adoration and longing.

The women were giddy with delight as Jada started officiating. They could barely hear her because they were so focused on each other. She had to prompt them twice to get them out of their stupor for their vows. Like the first change in their ceremony, they decided to say their vows simultaneously. “I’ll give you all I have, and nothing less, I promise,” they started. “Love me and don’t look back. I want you with me on this road to the sky. We’ll be shining every night. I promise you, just me and you, I promise you.”

When they finished, there wasn’t a dry eye in the place. Tearfully, Jada announced, “I now pronounce you wives. You may kiss the bride.” As their lips entangled passionately, the bar erupted in applause. They could barely hold the kiss because they were so happy that they were laughing.

“Thank you for meeting me at the altar, my love,” Ryan said, still in her wife’s embrace.

“Just me and you, Ryan Wilder-Moore.”

...

Writer's End Notes:

Thank you Beth and Randall for the vows inspo, y'all are my fictional parents. Also, if you liked the vows themselves, thank Ariana Grande and Victoria Monet because they were very bigbrained for that.

She smiled for practically the first time that day. “And nothing less, I promise.” She paused, considering her wants, and her fears, and her desires. “Love me and don’t look back.” The words sounded almost desperate to her ears, but she couldn’t help it. She needed to say exactly how she was feeling if this was going to work.

“I want you with me,” Ryan squeezed her hands again, drawing their foreheads together, both of them closing their eyes on contact. “On this road to the sky.” Ryan felt in her core that her and Sophie would last forever. Even past the grave.

Sophie’s next line came out almost like a question. “We’ll be shining every night.” It was her way of saying that they’d never go to sleep mad at one another. Their love should cast over them as they lay their heads down to rest.

Ryan understood the request because she knew Sophie better than anyone else. “I promise you. Just me and you?” She agreed and came back with a question of her own.

“I promise you,” Sophie finished, their vows complete. She opened her eyes to see mahogany orbs already staring into hers.

“God, I love you so much, it’s almost scary,” they both laughed at Ryan’s confession, breaking apart. They sat in a silent embrace for a few more moments before Sophie moved to stand, pulling her wife-to-be with her. 18 minutes. “Ah,” Ryan said, looking down at her phone with a satisfied grin. “We’re gonna make it back with time to spare.”

...

As they approached the altar, Luke let them go, their signal to open their eyes for their first look. Instantly, they took in the other woman’s ensemble and gasped. Ryan was in an intricate, lacy dress with a long train, while Sophie opted for a long-sleeved silk dress with beaded detail along the waist. The pictures that would be sent to them after the ceremony of this moment, showed faces full of love and adoration and longing.

The women were giddy with delight as Jada started officiating. They could barely hear her because they were so focused on each other. She had to prompt them twice to get them out of their stupor for their vows. Like the first change in their ceremony, they decided to say their vows simultaneously. “I’ll give you all I have, and nothing less, I promise,” they started. “Love me and don’t look back. I want you with me on this road to the sky. We’ll be shining every night. I promise you, just me and you, I promise you.”

When they finished, there wasn’t a dry eye in the place. Tearfully, Jada announced, “I now pronounce you wives. You may kiss the bride.” As their lips entangled passionately, the bar erupted in applause. They could barely hold the kiss because they were so happy that they were laughing.

“Thank you for meeting me at the altar, my love,” Ryan said, still in her wife’s embrace.

“Just me and you, Ryan Wilder-Moore.”

...

Writer's End Notes:

Thank you Beth and Randall for the vows inspo, y'all are my fictional parents. Also, if you liked the vows themselves, thank Ariana Grande and Victoria Monet because they were very bigbrained for that.

Excerpt:
With that, they all scampered around the building trying to get the women prepped and ready in time. At the ten-minute mark, Luke made his rounds to check alert the women of the time. Both parties shooed him away, assuring him that they’d be ready. He did get a quick peck from Mary though, so that was worth it. With three minutes left to spare and all the guests seated for the main attraction, Jada took her place at the altar.

“Ladies and gentlemen, we will begin momentarily. Thank you,” Jada announced, a rush of excitement rolling over the crowd. Promptly at five o’clock, the music started. The couple had let Mary and Jordan choose the song they would walk out to, and they chose the only song that made sense: Bartender by T. Pain. The guests laughed as the duo made their way dancing down the aisle, a spectacle to behold.

Excerpt:
Story Title: whispers would deafen me now

...

Ooh, I'm breaking down. Whispers would deafen me now. You don't make a sound. Heartbreak was never so loud.

One day, months beforehand, Mary asked her if she believed in soulmates.

Her answer was 'no'. Nothing more, nothing less.

Not for a lack of trying, or even just wanting to. Because, believe her, she desperately wanted to and boy, had she tried. But odds had a nack for not being in her favor routinely.

She wasn't born a cynic. She had been raised that way.

Maybe if Angelique had stayed any of the 3567 times they had started something, she would have believed in soulmates.

Maybe if her biological mother hadn't abandoned her, and then her real mom hadn't been ripped from her cold, bloody fingers, she would have believed in soulmates.

Maybe if the first time she met her, handcuffs and two-way mirrors hadn't been involved, she would have believed in soulmates.

And maybe, just maybe, if she had sucked it up. Been a goddamn big girl for once and finally went for something, someone, she wanted, Ryan Wilder would have believed in soulmates.

Story Title: whispers would deafen me now

...

Ooh, I'm breaking down. Whispers would deafen me now. You don't make a sound. Heartbreak was never so loud.

One day, months beforehand, Mary asked her if she believed in soulmates.

Her answer was 'no'. Nothing more, nothing less.

Not for a lack of trying, or even just wanting to. Because, believe her, she desperately wanted to and boy, had she tried. But odds had a nack for not being in her favor routinely.

She wasn't born a cynic. She had been raised that way.

Maybe if Angelique had stayed any of the 3567 times they had started something, she would have believed in soulmates.

Maybe if her biological mother hadn't abandoned her, and then her real mom hadn't been ripped from her cold, bloody fingers, she would have believed in soulmates.

Maybe if the first time she met her, handcuffs and two-way mirrors hadn't been involved, she would have believed in soulmates.

And maybe, just maybe, if she had sucked it up. Been a goddamn big girl for once and finally went for something, someone, she wanted, Ryan Wilder would have believed in soulmates.

Excerpt:
Sophie pulled up to the Hold Up in the same work wife outfit (including myself) that she’d been wearing earlier that day. Since she was on a mission to read Ryan for filth, she didn’t bother with putting together a head turning outfit like she normally would. Consequently, this gave her more time to come up with talking points. With “Bitter” by Me'Shell Ndegeocello blasting on repeat, she practiced her talking points the whole drive over. And, you know what, they were pretty good. Too bad Sophie barely spit two of them out, before Ryan defused her whole ‘tude with some overdue lesbian processing at the bar counter. For a second, Sophie thought Ryan was letting her down easy and resigned herself to the friend zone.

But Ryan closed the distance between them and, with a kiss, the S.S. Wildmoore set sail. And best believe, It’s maiden voyage was a sight to behold and I had a front row seat.

Story: I want to let you in
Excerpt:
When they got into the building Sophie noticed how inviting and warm the place was, nicely decorated, with words of affirmation hanging on the walls.

‘You matter’. ‘You’re perfect the way you are’. ‘Don’t dim your light so that others can shine’. ‘I know the real you and I still choose you’. ‘There’s only one you, why would you want to change that’.

Sophie was suddenly overcome by emotions as she was reading through all the posters as they walked through the hallway into a smaller room that appeared to be a booth. Ryan closed the door behind them, motioned Sophie to the couch and pressed some button on the monitor in front of them.

The monitor came on and suddenly, pictures of Sophie from as early as her childhood began to flash across the monitor, with Sia’s Unstoppable playing in the background. Sophie looked happy picture after picture. One by one, the flashing pictures were accompanied by the taglines ‘You are brave’. ‘You are beautiful’. ‘You are loved’. ‘I accept you’. ‘I wouldn’t change anything about you’.

Sophie didn't even notice the tears run down her cheeks as she was taken down memory lane, one picture after the other. She looked at Ryan in an attempt to ask where she got these pictures but suddenly heard audio come out of the speakers in the room.

‘The Coming Out Do Over Haven is privileged to welcome Miss Sophie Moore, the one and only true, authentic version of Miss Sophie Moore.’
HTMLExcerpt:
When they got into the building Sophie noticed how inviting and warm the place was, nicely decorated, with words of affirmation hanging on the walls.

‘You matter’. ‘You’re perfect the way you are’. ‘Don’t dim your light so that others can shine’. ‘I know the real you and I still choose you’. ‘There’s only one you, why would you want to change that’.

Sophie was suddenly overcome by emotions as she was reading through all the posters as they walked through the hallway into a smaller room that appeared to be a booth. Ryan closed the door behind them, motioned Sophie to the couch and pressed some button on the monitor in front of them.

The monitor came on and suddenly, pictures of Sophie from as early as her childhood began to flash across the monitor, with Sia’s Unstoppable playing in the background. Sophie looked happy picture after picture. One by one, the flashing pictures were accompanied by the taglines ‘You are brave’. ‘You are beautiful’. ‘You are loved’. ‘I accept you’. ‘I wouldn’t change anything about you’.

Sophie didn't even notice the tears run down her cheeks as she was taken down memory lane, one picture after the other. She looked at Ryan in an attempt to ask where she got these pictures but suddenly heard audio come out of the speakers in the room.

‘The Coming Out Do Over Haven is privileged to welcome Miss Sophie Moore, the one and only true, authentic version of Miss Sophie Moore.’

Excerpt:
But then the DJ made an announcement. It started innocuous enough, “Heyyyy this is DJ BeeRay (Bre) welcoming all you lovely women-loving women to the The Hold Up’s 5th annual Valentine’s Day Sapphic Prom. We’d like to thank the gracious owners, Mary Hamilton and Ryan Wilder, for keeping this space a safe place for us in Gotham.” Ryan heard some applause and whistles. Then it took a turn… “Yeah, y’all give it up for Ryan in that gorgeous dress, looking like somebody’s wife.” More people clap and make noise in appreciation. “Hell, I’m tryna get chose if Miss America can’t seal the deal.”

And there it was, the complete descent into date hell.

Whereas Ryan jerks her head in her direction “Breesha…don’t fumble the bag being inappropriate”, Sophie slowly turns her head landing with a look so cold that Ryan closes the little distance between them speaking softly “Soph, she doesn’t matter.”

Sophie doesn’t react, still staring unflinchingly at the source of her ire.

“Heyyy, I’m just kidding y’all. It’s all in fun! Loosen up and have a good time!”

Ryan tries being a bit more stern. “Sophie Moore.”

“Ole wannabe Angie Martinez, DJ Raggedy Anne ass…”

Nobody hears her but Ryan and she is dying laughing at this quiet roasting session. “Soph!”

DJ Begging For An Ass-Whooping throws on “Love’s Dance” by EWF, which is a bonafide groove. Ryan starts swaying in front of Sophie.

“Dance with me, Soph.”

“I know what you’re doing, Ryan.”

“Mmmhm. And you could let me or you could choose to let some rando ruin the night before it gets started. So…this ass, she jiggles it right on her for emphasis, or that ass.”

Sophie looks down, exhales and shakes her head, “You are trouble, Ryan Wilder…But your logic is impeccable.”

Ryan giggles, “Thought so”.

They fall into a dance of stutter steps and turns that looks fun and simple enough that others begin to join them on the makeshift dance floor on some Electric Slide at a Black function type shit.

But then the DJ made an announcement. It started innocuous enough, “Heyyyy this is DJ BeeRay (Bre) welcoming all you lovely women-loving women to the The Hold Up’s 5th annual Valentine’s Day Sapphic Prom. We’d like to thank the gracious owners, Mary Hamilton and Ryan Wilder, for keeping this space a safe place for us in Gotham.” Ryan heard some applause and whistles. Then it took a turn… “Yeah, y’all give it up for Ryan in that gorgeous dress, looking like somebody’s wife.” More people clap and make noise in appreciation. “Hell, I’m tryna get chose if Miss America can’t seal the deal.”

And there it was, the complete descent into date hell.

Whereas Ryan jerks her head in her direction “Breesha…don’t fumble the bag being inappropriate”, Sophie slowly turns her head landing with a look so cold that Ryan closes the little distance between them speaking softly “Soph, she doesn’t matter.”

Sophie doesn’t react, still staring unflinchingly at the source of her ire.

“Heyyy, I’m just kidding y’all. It’s all in fun! Loosen up and have a good time!”

Ryan tries being a bit more stern. “Sophie Moore.”

“Ole wannabe Angie Martinez, DJ Raggedy Anne ass…”

Nobody hears her but Ryan and she is dying laughing at this quiet roasting session. “Soph!”

DJ Begging For An Ass-Whooping throws on “Love’s Dance” by EWF, which is a bonafide groove. Ryan starts swaying in front of Sophie.

“Dance with me, Soph.”

“I know what you’re doing, Ryan.”

“Mmmhm. And you could let me or you could choose to let some rando ruin the night before it gets started. So…this ass, she jiggles it right on her for emphasis, or that ass.”

Sophie looks down, exhales and shakes her head, “You are trouble, Ryan Wilder…But your logic is impeccable.”

Ryan giggles, “Thought so”.

They fall into a dance of stutter steps and turns that looks fun and simple enough that others begin to join them on the makeshift dance floor on some Electric Slide at a Black function type shit.

Excerpt:
Story Title: Turn the World Off

...

Sophie tried to hide her blush with a slight shake of her head against the doorframe. She lifted her head and studied Ryan for a long moment which made Ryan a little uneasy. It almost felt like Sophie was looking through her, seeing all of her, and she thought that maybe Sophie had developed the gift of reading her just as well as she had with Sophie. Before she could ask what that look was for, Sophie pushed herself off the doorframe and walked over to the couch in 3 long strides and sat down taking Ryan’s hands in her own. “You need to rest too, Ryan. I know that you have so much going on right now and that you have all of that weighing down on your shoulders, but you’re also human. You need to sleep and rest.” Ryan was looking down at their hands until Sophie hooked her index finger under her chin and gently pulled up so that she would meet her eyes. Sophie’s eyes scanned between both of Ryan’s like she was gauging how to convince Ryan to try to go back to sleep. “Let’s just turn the world off for a little while.” Sophie’s voice was low and raspier than normal from sleep. How could Ryan deny her anything with that voice paired with those eyes. 




Ryan’s heart squeezed in her chest. Sophie was always there when she needed her. She was always willing to help. She always had Ryan’s back and she always knew what to say to get Ryan out of her head. Except that damn kiss in the woods, not that Ryan was complaining. She also knew that Sophie wouldn’t rest if she didn’t, but Ryan really couldn’t sleep right now. She was just waiting for the moment when Marquis decided to unleash his plan. But she had to take advantage of these moments of peace. Of this moment. With Sophie, here in the loft, wearing her clothes, holding her hand, and looking at her like THAT. A look so soft and caring, it made the backs of Ryan's eyes burn. She doesn't think that anyone has every looked at her the way Sophie looks at her. At that moment, an idea popped into her head. She wasn't going to be able to sleep but they both deserved a little escape from all of the chaos. She carefully pulled her hands out of Sophie’s and reached for her phone on the table. Sophie tiled her head again. Wordlessly, she waited patiently as Ryan clicked and scrolled and clicked again.




Ryan place her phone back down on the coffee table and looked up into Sophie’s beautifully, confused eyes as music started playing from her phone. Sophie glanced at Ryan’s phone and then back at Ryan, raising an eyebrow in silent question. Ryan smiled and stood up just as the lyrics started.




We can turn the world off

Forget about what’s goin’ on outside




Ryan held her hand out to Sophie who looked at her hand and then up at her, her face scrunched further in confusion.




We can make it all stop

Freeze a little time tonight




"Come here, Soph." Ryan smiled down at her and bent slightly to grab both of Sophie’s hands to pull her up from the couch as Sophie narrowed her eyes at her.




Don’t need a DJ, a disco ball
No cover charge, no last call




Ryan pulled Sophie a little closer, giggling at Sophie’s slight, surprised gasp.




Just pull me close
And let’s see where this goes




She wrapped her left arm around Sophie’s waist, letting her left hand rest on the small of Sophie’s back. She had to tilt her head up to meet Sophie's eyes, which no longer held any confusion. Instead, there was a twinkle of surprise, followed by a moment of realization. And Ryan was thankful that she had developed this skill of knowing each and every one of Sophie's feelings just by looking into her eyes.




Turn the lights down low
Let’s take it slow




With her right hand, Ryan laced her fingers with Sophie’s left without breaking eye contact, unable to keep a smile from her face.




Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room




She felt Sophie’s other arm wrap around her waist with her hand resting her back. Ryan winked playfully at Sophie who chuckled as she turned her head slightly and cast her eyes down in an attempt to hide her blush. 




It’s just you and me in our bare feet
Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room




"Eyes on me, Agent Moore." Ryan teased as she started swaying to the rhythm of the music, gently, leading Sophie side to side. 




We can put a record on
Spin me like the vinyl, ’round and ’round




Ryan took a small step back from Sophie with a bright smile and a sparkle in her eyes as she raised their linked hands so she could spin herself underneath their arms. There was no way she could reach up that high and spin Sophie especially in her bare feet. 


Pour the drinks and make ’em strong
Burn up every candle in this house




As she was finishing her turn, Sophie grabbed her by the waist with her free hand and pulled her back in close which made Ryan tilt her head back, giggling.




Turn the lights down low
Let’s take it slow




Ryan’s hand returned to its place on the small of Sophie’s back, as Sophie leaned in resting her forehead against hers.


Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room




Both of their eyes closed as they swayed in time with the slow beat.




It’s just you and me in our bare feet
Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

Don’t need a DJ, a disco ball
If I got you, I got it all
Just pull me close




Sophie lifted her head tightened her grip on Ryan’s waist, pulling her impossibly close. 


And let’s see where this goes




This time, Sophie too the opportunity to quickly stepped back with a smirk and raised their linked hands and rotated her wrist to spin Ryan under their arms. Ryan's shock must have been evident on her face, because as she spun around to face Sophie again, she was met with a cocky, smug smile which Ryan returned with a light shake of her head and an eye roll for good measure. 




The lights down low
Let’s take it slow




Sophie pulled Ryan back in close, still swaying, as they got lost in each others’ brown eyes and soft smiles as the chorus plays again.


Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room




Sophie takes her hand and steps back slightly before pulling her hand up and twirling Ryan around once again before stepping back in close, grabbing her waist with one hand and dipping her backwards all in one smooth motion. Ryan gasps at the sudden movement. She lifts her head slightly and meets Sophie's light eyes, sparkling with amusement. Ryan bites down on her bottom lip in a feeble attempt not to smile. But it obviously didn't work. 




It’s just you and me in our bare feet
Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

Sophie gently pulls Ryan up from the dip and continues swaying them as the song comes to an end. 

Dancing in the living room

Slow dancing in the living room

Slow dancing in the living room




The music fades but neither of them register the silence. Ryan unlaces their fingers to wrap both of her arms around Sophie's middle and leans in to rest her head against Sophie’s chest as she burrows her face into the space between her chin and shoulder. She feels one of Sophie's arms wrap around her back and the other hand cups the nape of her neck, as her cheek rests on the top of her head. Ryan lets out a deep sigh, like she's just released a breath that she's been holding for too long.  She listens to Sophie’s heartbeat, tuning out every other thought and sound, just breathing in and out, inhaling Sophie's scent.

She finally got out of her head, even if it was only for five minutes. No thoughts, no stress. Just her and Sophie. Sophie holding her impossibly close, as if she's trying to meld them together as one, as if she is trying to absorb all of Ryan's stress and worry if only for a few minutes. 




After a minute, Sophie seems to finally register that the music has stopped and she moves her head back slightly starting to pull away, until Ryan’s arms tighten around her waist.




Ryan isn't ready to let go yet. She just wants to hold Sophie a little while longer, to stay in this moment as long as she possibly can. “Wait, Soph. Can we just leave the world turned off for a little while longer?” Ryan's voice is so soft, as she mimics Sophie's words, almost desperate to stay in this little bubble of peace. Sophie smiles and kisses Ryan's hairline before returning her cheek to the top of her head and wrapping her arms tighter around Ryan's back. She releases a contented sigh and as Ryan closes her eyes, she swears she can feel Sophie smile against her hair. Surprisingly, her mind had abandoned all the worry and stress over Marquis, for now. Ryan's mind was finally quiet. Except for one loud thought: I am already in love with this woman. 

...

Writer's End Notes:

Song is by Mickey Guyton: Dancing in the Living Room

She wasn't going to be able to sleep but they both deserved a little escape from all of the chaos. She carefully pulled her hands out of Sophie’s and reached for her phone on the table. Sophie tiled her head again. Wordlessly, she waited patiently as Ryan clicked and scrolled and clicked again.

 

Ryan place her phone back down on the coffee table and looked up into Sophie’s beautifully, confused eyes as music started playing from her phone. Sophie glanced at Ryan’s phone and then back at Ryan, raising an eyebrow in silent question. Ryan smiled and stood up just as the lyrics started.

 

We can turn the world off

Forget about what’s goin’ on outside

 

Ryan held her hand out to Sophie who looked at her hand and then up at her, her face scrunched further in confusion.

 

We can make it all stop

Freeze a little time tonight

 

"Come here, Soph." Ryan smiled down at her and bent slightly to grab both of Sophie’s hands to pull her up from the couch as Sophie narrowed her eyes at her.

 

Don’t need a DJ, a disco ball
No cover charge, no last call

 

Ryan pulled Sophie a little closer, giggling at Sophie’s slight, surprised gasp.

 

Just pull me close
And let’s see where this goes

 

She wrapped her left arm around Sophie’s waist, letting her left hand rest on the small of Sophie’s back. She had to tilt her head up to meet Sophie's eyes, which no longer held any confusion. Instead, there was a twinkle of surprise, followed by a moment of realization. And Ryan was thankful that she had developed this skill of knowing each and every one of Sophie's feelings just by looking into her eyes.

 

Turn the lights down low
Let’s take it slow

 

With her right hand, Ryan laced her fingers with Sophie’s left without breaking eye contact, unable to keep a smile from her face.

 

Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

 

She felt Sophie’s other arm wrap around her waist with her hand resting her back. Ryan winked playfully at Sophie who chuckled as she turned her head slightly and cast her eyes down in an attempt to hide her blush. 

 

It’s just you and me in our bare feet
Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

 

"Eyes on me, Agent Moore." Ryan teased as she started swaying to the rhythm of the music, gently, leading Sophie side to side. 

 

We can put a record on
Spin me like the vinyl, ’round and ’round

 

Ryan took a small step back from Sophie with a bright smile and a sparkle in her eyes as she raised their linked hands so she could spin herself underneath their arms. There was no way she could reach up that high and spin Sophie especially in her bare feet. 


Pour the drinks and make ’em strong
Burn up every candle in this house

 

As she was finishing her turn, Sophie grabbed her by the waist with her free hand and pulled her back in close which made Ryan tilt her head back, giggling.

 

Turn the lights down low
Let’s take it slow

 

Ryan’s hand returned to its place on the small of Sophie’s back, as Sophie leaned in resting her forehead against hers.


Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

 

Both of their eyes closed as they swayed in time with the slow beat.

 

It’s just you and me in our bare feet
Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

Don’t need a DJ, a disco ball
If I got you, I got it all
Just pull me close

 

Sophie lifted her head tightened her grip on Ryan’s waist, pulling her impossibly close. 


And let’s see where this goes

 

This time, Sophie too the opportunity to quickly stepped back with a smirk and raised their linked hands and rotated her wrist to spin Ryan under their arms. Ryan's shock must have been evident on her face, because as she spun around to face Sophie again, she was met with a cocky, smug smile which Ryan returned with a light shake of her head and an eye roll for good measure. 

 

The lights down low
Let’s take it slow

 

Sophie pulled Ryan back in close, still swaying, as they got lost in each others’ brown eyes and soft smiles as the chorus plays again.


Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

 

Sophie takes her hand and steps back slightly before pulling her hand up and twirling Ryan around once again before stepping back in close, grabbing her waist with one hand and dipping her backwards all in one smooth motion. Ryan gasps at the sudden movement. She lifts her head slightly and meets Sophie's light eyes, sparkling with amusement. Ryan bites down on her bottom lip in a feeble attempt not to smile. But it obviously didn't work. 

 

It’s just you and me in our bare feet
Dancing in the living room
Slow dancing in the living room

Sophie gently pulls Ryan up from the dip and continues swaying them as the song comes to an end. 

Dancing in the living room

Slow dancing in the living room

Slow dancing in the living room

 

The music fades but neither of them register the silence. Ryan unlaces their fingers to wrap both of her arms around Sophie's middle and leans in to rest her head against Sophie’s chest as she burrows her face into the space between her chin and shoulder. She feels one of Sophie's arms wrap around her back and the other hand cups the nape of her neck, as her cheek rests on the top of her head. Ryan lets out a deep sigh, like she's just released a breath that she's been holding for too long.  She listens to Sophie’s heartbeat, tuning out every other thought and sound, just breathing in and out, inhaling Sophie's scent.

She finally got out of her head, even if it was only for five minutes. No thoughts, no stress. Just her and Sophie. Sophie holding her impossibly close, as if she's trying to meld them together as one, as if she is trying to absorb all of Ryan's stress and worry if only for a few minutes. 

 

After a minute, Sophie seems to finally register that the music has stopped and she moves her head back slightly starting to pull away, until Ryan’s arms tighten around her waist.

 

Ryan isn't ready to let go yet. She just wants to hold Sophie a little while longer, to stay in this moment as long as she possibly can. “Wait, Soph. Can we just leave the world turned off for a little while longer?” Ryan's voice is so soft, as she mimics Sophie's words, almost desperate to stay in this little bubble of peace. Sophie smiles and kisses Ryan's hairline before returning her cheek to the top of her head and wrapping her arms tighter around Ryan's back. She releases a contented sigh and as Ryan closes her eyes, she swears she can feel Sophie smile against her hair. Surprisingly, her mind had abandoned all the worry and stress over Marquis, for now. Ryan's mind was finally quiet. Except for one loud thought: I am already in love with this woman. 

...

HTMLExcerpt:
Story Title: Blue Light

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Morning after 3x11 with Sophie and Ryan. They deserve some much-needed rest. #LetRyanSleep2k22
*Yes, the title is inspired by the Mitski song*

...

Sophie opens her eyes to the dark blue light of the early morning coming in through the windows of the loft. A quick glance at the clock on Ryan’s nightstand tells her she’s only slept for a couple of hours. 

...

Sophie moves her hand to tangle in the curls at the nape of Ryan’s neck. The other drifts to her waist to make small comforting circles with her finger. The steady sound of Sophie’s heartbeat in Ryan’s ear already has sleep threatening to overtake her. She doesn’t fight it. Her fingers that make imaginary letters across Sophie’s chest suddenly stop short. The slow measured breaths that tickle Sophie’s skin signal what was inevitable. Ryan’s asleep. 

Sophie continues her movements enjoying the quiet of the loft and the city. The window of peace in Gotham is small. There are only a couple of hours where everything is completely silent and unmoving before the world starts again and the city’s underbelly wakes with a new taste for violence. Soon, Sophie begins to feel sleep touch her too. With Ryan’s weight on top of her and her own exhaustion spreading through her body, it’s not long before she joins Ryan and the rest of the city in stillness as the blue morning light melts into orange.

Story: Shortest Distance Between Two Points Is A Line: But Geometry Is Boring
Excerpt: He’d hoped Jordan would join him on the rooftop this evening to enjoy an exhilarating cocktail of addictive power and life-affirming retribution as someone else who’d been harmed by his hypocritical nag  of a mother and betrayed by their letdown of an only sister. He’d thought she’d be a fun addition to the festivities, but… alas, a dud – a pathetic waste of vitality. Like so much of this fucking city of walking dead, shackled by their own lack of imagination and driven to suppress all free thinking. A tyranny against excitability. A dreary city for drab ass people so scared of social death they avoided living. But not him though. How’d that song go? Death can take me if I can’t be free. I am not like you; I’m a dying breed.

Song: It's Not Right But It's Okay
Story: Shortest Distance Between Two Points Is A Line: But Geometry Is Boring
Excerpt:
Jordan looks at them thoughtfully, nods then gets up. “Aaaanyway. I’ll give you two some privacy. They probably already know you’re awake and will come up for a more thorough check-in than normal soon. And you still have a lot of healing to do, Fefe, so maybe don’t get too frisky.”

Sophie scoffs, “why, I never”.

“You just were.”

“I mean yeah babe. She literally saw us.”

“Mm. Mm. Mm. Back a few hours and you’re ganging up on me already. Mm. It’s not right, but it’s okay.”

“You’re gonna make it anyway? Ok Whitney. Ryan…” — currently in a giggle fit at the Moore sister antics—“welcome to the family.” And with that she closes the door behind her.
HTMLExcerpt:
Jordan looks at them thoughtfully, nods then gets up. “Aaaanyway. I’ll give you two some privacy. They probably already know you’re awake and will come up for a more thorough check-in than normal soon. And you still have a lot of healing to do, Fefe, so maybe don’t get too frisky.”

Sophie scoffs, “why, I never”.

“You just were.”

“I mean yeah babe. She literally saw us.”

“Mm. Mm. Mm. Back a few hours and you’re ganging up on me already. Mm. It’s not right, but it’s okay.”

“You’re gonna make it anyway? Ok Whitney. Ryan…” — currently in a giggle fit at the Moore sister antics—“welcome to the family.” And with that she closes the door behind her.

Story: Home Is Where The Heart Is
Excerpt:
“It went as best as could be expected with my mom. I can tell she’s still uncomfortable with the idea but whatever Jordan said to her…she’s trying and I’m going to try and meet her halfway. She wants us to come to dinner, forreal this time” That comment was in response to a previously planned dinner that her mom ended up canceling at the last minute.

“I’m wherever you want me to be.” Ryan wrapped her arms around Sophie’s shoulders.

Almost as if there wasn’t anyone else in the room. They got lost in each other, slowly swaying to Share My World by Mary that was playing in the background. The collective eyes that watched them, with endearing smiles in the room didn’t bother them at all. Even Diane could see the happiness that beamed within her daughter's face. She might not have understood it, but there was no denying that she’d never seen this look on her before.

Almost as if there wasn’t anyone else in the room. They got lost in each other, slowly swaying to Share My World by Mary that was playing in the background. Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

Hello, I am back for a quick chapter two!

One thing my brother has been telling me over and over is that he’s been exhausted dealing with his newborn. She always seems to cry the moment he’s about to fall asleep.

I reminded him that our mother used to sing to us alllllll the time. When she bathed us, when she was helping us clean up our toys(she sang the clean up song from Barney lol) and especially when it was bedtime. He’s trying it, and so far it’s been working. I wanted to do a fussy baby chapter, and figured maybe a little singing might help soothe the Wildmoore baby too. So here’s that, with a side of worried mother Sophie :)

Btw, the song Ryan sings is Crazy by Javier. Thanks for reading!

One thing my brother has been telling me over and over is that he’s been exhausted dealing with his newborn. She always seems to cry the moment he’s about to fall asleep.

I reminded him that our mother used to sing to us alllllll the time. When she bathed us, when she was helping us clean up our toys(she sang the clean up song from Barney lol) and especially when it was bedtime. He’s trying it, and so far it’s been working. I wanted to do a fussy baby chapter, and figured maybe a little singing might help soothe the Wildmoore baby too. So here’s that, with a side of worried mother Sophie :)

Btw, the song Ryan sings is Crazy by Javier. Thanks for reading!

...

“I don’t know what you need, honey,” Sophie sighed. Worry began to creep into her mind when she suddenly heard the front door open. “Ryan!”

Ryan walked into the living room, tugging her coat off and tossing it on the couch and placing the cloth grocery bag she held down next to it. She smiled at the sight of her exhausted wife and the tiny ball of fury she held in her arms. “There’s my babies.” She walked right up to Sophie and gently pulled Miles from her arms. “My sweet baby boy, what’s wrong?”

Sophie slumped onto the couch and let out a heavy sigh. “I don’t know. I fed him, changed him-”

“Did you burp him after you fed him?”

“Of course.”

“Aw Miles, why are you crying?” Ryan asked the boy, who was still screaming bloody murder. Ryan held the child against her chest and kissed the side of his head, nuzzling against his dark curly hair. “I get a little bit crazy, baby, every time you call my name.. My heart beats a little bit faster, after, you are in my arms again.”

Sophie sat up slightly, watching as her wife sang to their cranky son, who immediately calmed at the sound of his mother’s soothing voice.

“You try to fight it, don't even try to hide it, emotions falling down like the rain.. I can't find the words to explain it, ain't it, crazy how I fall, every time you call my name,” Ryan sang quietly, rocking the infant in her arms.

“I got you, sweetheart. Mama’s got you, go back to sleep,” Ryan cooed. “My little angry baby. You were in here stressing your mommy out while I was at the store?”

“Yes,” Sophie groaned.

Ryan chuckled. “Okay honey, let’s get you back in your crib.” Sophie followed Ryan as she headed to the nursery. She leaned against the doorframe and watched Ryan put their son down in his crib, the baby already fast asleep.

“So, sing to him when he’s cranky. Got it,” Sophie yawned. “Why didn’t I think of that.” Ryan shuffled over to her wife, smiling.

Song: You've Got a Friend in Me
Excerpt:
“Have you made a decision?” She asked once Cora got into the car. Luna, ever the drama queen, turned to Cora and nodded. “Okay, let me hear it.”

“Can we have burritos tonight?”

“Deal.”

As soon as they got home, Luna ran to the bathroom. A minute later, Ryan heard the shower running, coupled with a very loud and pitchy rendition of ‘You’ve got a friend in me.’

Ryan had fully intended to get everything they’d need for dinner ready, but Cora shooed her away, mumbling something about Ryan burning down the kitchen as she took over.

“Mama, I burnt noodles one time.”

“You damn near burnt the house down too,” Cora laughed. “You can sit over there and keep me company.”

Excerpt:
Messenger 
(Julia Pennyworth)

Ryan 09:55 pm: was the song this week your choice? 

Julia, 09:55pm: i mean, i did suggest it?
Julia, 09:56pm: and production went with it
Julia, 09:56pm: you don’t like it?? it’s a lesbian anthem


Ryan, 09:56pm:  yeah…. an anthem for lesbian longing 😔


Julia, 09:57pm: are you um…
Julia, 09:57pm: asking me out or something?

Ryan, 09:57pm:  NOOOOOOOO!!!
Ryan, 09:58pm:  are you moving in on my fake girlfriend?

Julia, 09:58pm: firstly. ouch.
Julia, 09:58pm: could’ve been a little less all caps and maybe only one exclamation point
Julia, 09:59pm: and more like oops no sorry 🥲
Julia, 09:59pm: secondly. what on earth are you on about?

Ryan, 10:01pm:  you’ve been hanging around so much more since the after party.
Ryan, 10:02pm:  where you and sophie looked pretty close...
Ryan, 10:02pm:  i don’t want my first public ‘relationship’ to turn into a love triangle scandal

Julia, 10:04pm: ok. i get why you might think that
Julia, 10:04pm: but i think you probably need to talk directly to sophie mate ❤️







Ryan had not had enough drinks to message Sophie about this. She wasn’t sure she even could drink enough to make her ready to message Sophie without the alcohol literally killing her. She was still perplexed that Julia felt like them doing a jazz routine to Untouched was a good idea. All it did for Ryan was make her feel more frustrated this was all a ruse and that Sophie was shutting her out. It felt like Julia was playing a cruel joke on them. Especially after that kiss a few days earlier at the after party. It had felt so real to Ryan, and Sophie had initiated it! Had been the one to take it further first! And it had been for no particular reason, then she had just pulled away right after.

Story: Don't threaten me with a good time
Excerpt:
Mary tapped on the microphone harder than she needed to, "Okay, girls, gays, and theys! It's time for sing along fun time. The sacred St. Patrick's day tradition. First up, we have Ryan Wilder, manager extraordinaire, singing Megan Monday Freestyle by Megan Thee Stallion.....? Really, Ryan? Didn't want to spring for something softer like Halo or Unwritten?" Mary huffed into the microphone before clambering off the stage, Ryan taking her place.

Sophie stared blankly at the spot inbetween Kate's and Tyler's heads. Luckily, Julia and Renee seemed to get the hint that she was not in the mood to talk to any of them.

She had been mentally begging someone to come save her from this 10th ring of Hell. Ryan even made eye contact with her once, but ultimately stayed where she was. Sophie groaned loudly. She knew Ryan was probably more put off by her own drunkenness than she was mad at her, but that didn't really serve to make her feel any better.

"Your girlfriend cannot rap." Renee said off-handedly as she watched Ryan bounce around the make shift stage in time with the beat of the song.

"Girlfriend? Ryan's your girlfriend?" Kate asked with surprise. Like the thought had never crossed her mind. Like Sophie wasn't almost wrist deep inside of Ryan when Kate interrupted them earlier in the night.

"Surprise." She said sarcastically. She had meant to do this much more softly one day, but she's been worn down all night and she just cannot bring herself to care.

"Why didn't you tell me?"

"You didn't give me the chance."

Sophie could always tell when Ryan was looking at her. She turned toward the stage to admire the way Ryan really couldn't rap. If there was ever a need for evidence of the statement that black people really weren't a monolith, it would be this very performance.

Ryan was staring directly at her, or maybe glaring as she "rapped".

"It was the knees for him, hmm, the way that it squeeze for him, ayy

He done fucked a whole lotta bitches, but it was the ME for him, ayy"

Sophie, and everyone else around her got the message loud and clear.

Excerpt:
She wasn’t sure if Ryan had to work that morning, but regardless when she woke up, she wanted her to wake up to breakfast. She’d already taken the liberty of looking up a recipe before dinner just in case the night went the way they intended. Sophie eased out of bed and retrieved a t-shirt from her night stand and slipped it on. She laid out her favorite Moore Security t-shirt next to Ryan in case she woke up and looked for something to wear before she got back in the room.

"Sweet lady…would you be my…sweet love for…a lifetime"

Sophie had to pause as she moved to retrieve the ingredients for the vegan pancakes and tofu scramble that she was going to prepare.

“Are you singing?!” She voiced out loud for only her ears. “Wow Moore..” When she realized she was still talking to herself, all she could do was laugh. “She got you going crazy already..” She shook her head at herself.

“I don’t know if I should be taking credit for that. You might have already been a little bit off.” Ryan surprised her.

She smiled before she even turned back to look over her shoulder.

“How long have you been standing there?”

“Long enough to know that you should probably let Tyrese sing that song.” She teased her with a goofy grin

Sophie scoffed.

“I’m joking. “ She grinned. “ Good morning..” The lack of sleep in her tone, got a bit softer with her greeting.

“Good Morning Ms. Wilder..” Sophie turned on her heels to face her.

The sight of Ryan in her t-shirt, put an instant smile on her face and an ache between her thighs. She looked so beautiful in the morning, so soft…so sexy. How was that even possible?

She wasn’t sure if Ryan had to work that morning, but regardless when she woke up, she wanted her to wake up to breakfast. She’d already taken the liberty of looking up a recipe before dinner just in case the night went the way they intended. Sophie eased out of bed and retrieved a t-shirt from her night stand and slipped it on. She laid out her favorite Moore Security t-shirt next to Ryan in case she woke up and looked for something to wear before she got back in the room.

"Sweet lady…would you be my…sweet love for…a lifetime"

Sophie had to pause as she moved to retrieve the ingredients for the vegan pancakes and tofu scramble that she was going to prepare.

“Are you singing?!” She voiced out loud for only her ears. “Wow Moore..” When she realized she was still talking to herself, all she could do was laugh. “She got you going crazy already..” She shook her head at herself.

“I don’t know if I should be taking credit for that. You might have already been a little bit off.” Ryan surprised her.

She smiled before she even turned back to look over her shoulder.

“How long have you been standing there?”

“Long enough to know that you should probably let Tyrese sing that song.” She teased her with a goofy grin

Sophie scoffed.

“I’m joking. “ She grinned. “ Good morning..” The lack of sleep in her tone, got a bit softer with her greeting.

“Good Morning Ms. Wilder..” Sophie turned on her heels to face her.

The sight of Ryan in her t-shirt, put an instant smile on her face and an ache between her thighs. She looked so beautiful in the morning, so soft…so sexy. How was that even possible?

Excerpt:
Story Title: Underneath the Stars

...

Additional Tags: 

Romance, Tenderness, Feelings, Wildmoore Week March 2022, Wildmoore Week, References to Mariah Carey's Music

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

*waves* Hello, my lovelies! I decided to try my hand at a Wildmoore fic and what better way to do so than with Wildmoore week. I was nervous about posting, but thanks to the encouraging people on Twitter I decided to drop this little number.

Anyway, I hope you enjoy this story.

Mariah Carey inspires everything for me :)

Oh, and for my fellow Gleeks if there are any, there is a nod to Mr. Shue's failed wedding in this chapter.

...

will you dance with me underneath the stars?” Ryan suggested. She was not quite ready to go inside yet. There were times when she would climb on top of her van and look at the moon and the stars. They twinkled in the sky reminding her of little diamonds.

Sophie would deny Ryan anything she wanted, “I think we can do that. I never pegged you for a Hallmark-style romantic,” She teased.

“There is a lot you don’t know about me, Soph, but I’m sure we have all the time in the world for us to learn about each other,” She climbed off Sophie’s lap and held her hand out, “I owe the lady a dance.”

Sophie looked from Ryan’s eyes to her hand and placed her hand in Ryan’s. Sophie loved Ryan’s hands they  were always so soft, “Yes, you do.” She stood up as the song changed to Mariah Carey’s Underneath the Stars. It was very on-brand for their night.

They swayed to the music content to be in each other’s arms. This was the first time that Sophie had ever slow danced with a woman, and she loved it, “I’ve never slow danced with a woman before. I like it,” She gave Ryan a beatific smile.

“This will not be the last time, I will have you in my arms. I like dancing with you too,” There was nowhere else Ryan would rather be right now.

The song had changed and Sophie did not know how long they were dancing on the balcony, but she didn’t want to break the moment. Everything felt so right there were a couple of times she had dreamt of moments like this with Kate, but she knew that would never happen. Ryan was a much better fit even though they started out as enemies before anything, but they eventually became lovers. And Sophie wouldn’t change that for the world.

And just like that, she and Ryan would be dancing underneath the stars for years to come.

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

*waves* Hello, my lovelies! I decided to try my hand at a Wildmoore fic and what better way to do so than with Wildmoore week. I was nervous about posting, but thanks to the encouraging people on Twitter I decided to drop this little number.

Anyway, I hope you enjoy this story.

Mariah Carey inspires everything for me :)

Oh, and for my fellow Gleeks if there are any, there is a nod to Mr. Shue's failed wedding in this chapter.

...

will you dance with me underneath the stars?” Ryan suggested. She was not quite ready to go inside yet. There were times when she would climb on top of her van and look at the moon and the stars. They twinkled in the sky reminding her of little diamonds.

Sophie would deny Ryan anything she wanted, “I think we can do that. I never pegged you for a Hallmark-style romantic,” She teased.

“There is a lot you don’t know about me, Soph, but I’m sure we have all the time in the world for us to learn about each other,” She climbed off Sophie’s lap and held her hand out, “I owe the lady a dance.”

Sophie looked from Ryan’s eyes to her hand and placed her hand in Ryan’s. Sophie loved Ryan’s hands they  were always so soft, “Yes, you do.” She stood up as the song changed to Mariah Carey’s Underneath the Stars. It was very on-brand for their night.

They swayed to the music content to be in each other’s arms. This was the first time that Sophie had ever slow danced with a woman, and she loved it, “I’ve never slow danced with a woman before. I like it,” She gave Ryan a beatific smile.

“This will not be the last time, I will have you in my arms. I like dancing with you too,” There was nowhere else Ryan would rather be right now.

The song had changed and Sophie did not know how long they were dancing on the balcony, but she didn’t want to break the moment. Everything felt so right there were a couple of times she had dreamt of moments like this with Kate, but she knew that would never happen. Ryan was a much better fit even though they started out as enemies before anything, but they eventually became lovers. And Sophie wouldn’t change that for the world.

And just like that, she and Ryan would be dancing underneath the stars for years to come.
SongArtist: Underneath the Stars by Mariah Carey
SASW:
Underneath the Stars by Mariah Carey
Underneath the Stars by Nayanna_Rivergron

Story: Did you ever really love me?
Excerpt:
Story Title: Did you ever really love me?

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Wildmoore Week day 3: When you started shipping them
This one was HARD for me! Not because I couldn't pinpoint the when but because every time I tried to write about it, I had far too many thoughts and it turned into an essay on everything that was wrong with the Kate and Ange relationships. I didn't entirely get away from that but I wanted to submit something so here it is.

Now I know a lot of people started shipping Wildmoore from day 1 (and yes, their interaction in the interrogation room was intense and they're both hot as hell) but I have an issue with it being an assumption that just because two characters are gay they'll automatically be attracted to each other. "As a lesbian," (yes, I say this like Sophie, hand raised and all, every time) I can't stress enough how much I do not want to jump the bones of every other lesbian I encounter. So, my stubborn ass held out until the emotions got involved and then I was a goner.

Also, the title is taken from the song Blink Twice by Joy Oladokun, which plays over the scene where Ange confronts Ryan and Sophie listens in. Doesn't matter how many times I watch/listen - it's just stunning.

Happy Wildmoore Week!

Excerpt: “Okay, baby girl, how about a song?” Sophie exhaled lightly before she started singing to her daughter. “Now it's time to say good night, good night, sleep tight,” Sophie started softly. “Now the sun turns out his light, good night, sleep tight. Dream sweet dreams for me. Dream sweet dreams for you,” Sophie continued to rock lightly as she sang, a tear rolling down her cheek. “Close your eyes and I'll close mine, good night, sleep tight,” Sophie stopped singing as she cleared her throat. “My mom used to sing that to me when I was little,” Sophie pursed her lips as she felt another tear wanting to fall from her eyes. “I don’t really talk to my mom anymore, but you’ve got to take the good, huh?” Sophie questioned. “I do miss her, though,” Sophie admitted. “So much,” Sophie paused, taking a moment to keep herself composed, but she knew the tears would fall soon. “Mama says it’s her loss and I know she’s right but it’s not too much to ask for is it?” Sophie questioned, still rocking lightly in the chair. “To be loved and accepted for who are by your own mama?” Sophie couldn’t hold them in any longer, more tears rolling down her cheeks. “Even after all my mom said to me, what she’s said about me and Mama being together, the things she’s said to your mama, I…” Sophie pursed her lips and closed her eyes, desperate for the tears to stop. “Oh, baby girl, I’m sorry,” Sophie took a deep breath. “Maybe I’ll just go back to singing to you, huh? That’s nicer, right?” Sophie questioned. She stayed silent for a few moments, composing herself. “I know I don’t have the best singing voice, but Caleb likes it when I sing this song to him, so I hope you do too,” Sophie said, feeling a swell in her heart as she gazed at her newborn daughter who was fast asleep in her arms. “Now the moon begins to shine, good night, sleep tight,” Sophie started singing again. “Dream sweet dreams for me. Dream sweet dreams for you. Close your eyes and I'll close mine, good night, sleep tight.” Sophie closed her eyes and rested her head back on the chair as she continued to sing to Cora.
