Excerpt:
Story Title: Bad Girl

...

Sophie is dancing around the living room in a tank top and the smallest pair of shorts Ryan has ever seen Sophie wear. They might actually be Ryan’s based on how short they are on Sophie. Ryan isn’t complaining though, because that gives her the chance to see those long legs of Sophie’s that she loves so much.




What yall know about a supermodel?




Usher’s Bad Girl is playing through the speaker. 




Fresh out of Elle magazine

Buy her own bottles




This is one of Ryan’s favorite songs, and it is perfect for this moment because Sophie embodies everything about this song; she truly is a supermodel. Ryan would put Sophie in any magazine and would buy every single copy.




Bad than a mother.




Usher sings. Sophie is definitely bad than a mother.




Ryan watches as Sophie dances around the room while sweeping the floor; she can’t help the smile that shines across her face as she watches Sophie be so light and carefree. Ryan can't believe she really gets to call this woman hers.




Ohhh, work me, baby

Shaking it the way I like

I’m ready to be bad

I need a bad girl (say yeah)




Sophie uses the broom in her hand as a microphone as she sings the words to the song, unintentionally giving Ryan a full performance. She’s dancing and moving her hips to the music; her back is to Ryan, so Sophie can’t see the look that Ryan is giving her. She can’t see the way Ryan’s eyes are roaming her body, taking in her endlessly long legs in Ryan’s shorts that also accentuate her ass. Ryan bites her lip, thinking about how she wants to be between those legs right now.




It is so rare that Ryan gets to see Sophie like this that she doesn’t want to interrupt her moment, but she also wants to join in because it really looks like Sophie is having fun. She hasn’t noticed Ryan because she is in her own world having a great time.




What sexy lady’s 

Coming home with me tonight?

I’m ready to be bad

I need a bad girl (super bad, baby)

Get at me, bad girl.




Ryan pushes off the wall and slides across the room until she is right behind Sophie. She puts her hands on Sophie’s waist to press herself against Sophie’s back, causing her to jump in surprise. 




Sophie turns around, shocked, not expecting Ryan to be behind her.




“Jesus, Ryan. You scared me.” Sophie says, covering her chest with her hand to catch her breath.




“I’m sorry, babe, but you just looked so cute and like you were having so much fun, and I wanted to join in.” Ryan does look apologetic for scaring Sophie, but her pout is so cute that Sophie can’t be mad at her. 




Ohh, work me, baby

Shaking it the way I like

I’m ready to be bad

I need a bad girl (say, yeah).




With her hands still on Sophie’s waist, Ryan turns her around and starts singing the words to the song while moving Sophie’s hips from side to side. It doesn’t take long for Sophie to join in, singing and dancing along to the music with Ryan. The energy between them is light and cheerful just like the song, and they become consumed with the music and each other. If there was anyone else in the room, it wouldn't matter because all they see right now is each other. 




They both sing the bridge of the song at the top of their lungs (a little out of tune) since it is their favorite part of the song. 




If you wanna party

I got what you're looking for

Come see me in the VIP 

It’s very necessary 

To be that kind of girl for me

If you are, then, baby girl, let’s leave.




Ryan grabs the broom from Sophie’s hand and balances it against the counter. She takes both of Sophie’s hands in hers and starts walking back towards the bedroom with a mischievous smirk on her face. Sophie knows exactly where Ryan is going with this and plays hard to get, resisting Ryan’s pull to the bedroom. 




“Get at me, bad girl,” Ryan winks, and Sophie can’t help but laugh and let Ryan pull her until they are flush together. 




Sophie rests her arms around Ryan’s neck and they move together to the music as Ryan walks backward, trying to get to her original destination.




“Imma get me one of them,” Sophie sings to Ryan.




By the end of the outro, they are back in the bedroom, and Ryan is showing Sophie just how much she appreciates her “bad girl”. 




Get at me, bad girl.

...

Writer's End Notes:

It took me a while to narrow down the one song to use but Bad Girl is one of my favorite songs and Confessions is one of my favorite albums so I had to do it!

Excerpt:
Story Title: Comfortable

...

Summary:

Wildmoore Week Day 4: Quotes and Songs

Continuing to use their words and getting comfortable at Sophie's place for the first time.

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Title, lyrics and inspiration from Comfortable by H.E.R (the song just does things to me)

I am fairly certain that Sophie has never taken a woman back to her bed and if I've missed something in the show I want to remain oblivious!

Happy Wildmoore Week!

...

‘You don’t have to explain…’ But the croak in her voice contradicts what she’s saying. And they promised they wouldn’t hide from each other anymore. Ryan grips tighter to her hand, not wanting to risk her pulling away even though she’s the one battling the urge to bolt whilst Sophie remains ever solid. ‘I don’t know why this is bothering me, it’s not like we don’t both have pasts; this isn’t a first for either of us.’

‘It is for me.’ Sophie bends her knees to pull her legs up onto the seat, closing the circuit of their limbs, creating an insulated space for them to have this discussion. ‘I told you, this is my first time being in an out relationship with a woman. Before this - before you - being out, becoming comfortable with who I am and in my own skin, it didn’t really extend beyond myself and my body. I shared my home with someone before and it almost destroyed me. Him too. And as confident as I was that being gay was my truth, I wasn’t prepared to rush into that again. Or at all really. I didn’t want it to be for nothing, I didn’t want it cheapened by bringing just any woman back. I needed it to be right this time. I needed to be right this time. And it wasn’t until I admitted my feelings for you that I finally understood what that meant. I’m not just comfortable within myself now, I’m comfortable opening myself and my life up to something worthy. Someone. I’m comfortable, because of you. For you…With you.’

'Cause I feel so comfortable with you
You make me comfortable with you
I feel so comfortable with you
You make me comfortable with you
You make me…

Ryan hasn’t moved, hasn’t blinked, maybe hasn’t breathed. Every thought in her head slow crawls through syrup, decidedly sweet but sticking, unable to make its way out. Her toes tingle, noises that she logically knows she can’t hear are loud against the silence – her blood rushing to pool in the parts of her body that need it most, Sophie’s heartbeat. She inhales, hitched and shuddering, willing herself to stay present and not go hurtling a hundred miles an hour into what has been or what could be. She simultaneously has so many regrets and none at all; so many concerns and the sensation of total calm. Sophie Moore continues to make her ask all the questions she’s spent a lifetime avoiding, and to be all the answers she’s ever needed.

‘Take me to bed.’ Ryan’s voice is thick, eyes so glazed with emotion, her body so pliable, she’s not sure she’d make it there alone. ‘Please.’

Wanna get (Wanna get), wanna go deep
Intimate (Intimate), let you in me
Inside (Inside), you're deserving
Of my mind, my mind, yeah, yeah…

Excerpt:
Summary: Sophie and Ryan are laying in bed and Sophie asked Ryan can she play a song for her. The song is by H.E.R. “Rather Be”
Later on Ryan returns the favor and plays a song for Sophie.

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Day 4 of Wildmoore Week and it has been great participating. I had two storylines that I put together in one story (don't judge me). Here are songs that I think encompass the vibe of Wildmoore. If you haven't heard it and want to follow along with the lyrics, the songs are below for you to play it.
H.E.R. "Rather Be"
Queen Naija "Butterflies"

...

Sophie's Song

Ryan and Sophie are laying in bed as their gazing into each other eyes after a long day of Batwoman saving the day. Sophie reached for her phone on the side of the bed and went to her Tidal playlist “Love Songs.”

“I want to play a song for you Ryan. Is that okay?” Sophie asked.

Ryan smiled “Of course.”

Sophie found the song “Rather Be” by H.E.R. and it flowed through her wireless speaker in the room. Sophie and Ryan shifted in bed to lay on their backs as they both got lost in the lyrics in the song.

Thoughts of you running through my head
As I lie awake in my bed, ooh
Know you want this, don't be afraid, baby
And now we're standing face to face
Baby, tell it to me now
Everything you dreamed about
Don't make sense to run around and ooh, it's now or never

Remember this night
Show me how you feel
Let me know it's real tonight, oh

There's nowhere I'd rather be than here with you, ooh ooh, you, you
There's nowhere I'd rather be than here with you, ooh ooh, you, you
There's no place I'd rather be

Ryan reached over and pressed pause on Sophie’s phone.

Sophie got a little scared that she may have involuntarily given to much of her feelings away in the song she chose. “Are you okay? Did you not like the song?” Sophie asked Ryan.

Ryan smiled “I loved the song” Ryan caressed Sophie face while looking into her light brown eyes. “I feel the same way, Sophie. There is no other place I rather be than here with you too.”

Sophie felt all her emotions coming in at once and she gave a little smile as Ryan leaned in to kiss her softly. It was supposed to be a little kiss for comforting to let Sophie know that she will always be there then it got heated so quickly as their emotions took over them. Ryan straddled Sophie and pushed her caramel brown hair away from her face and pulled away from their kiss to look down at Sophie lovingly. They may have not said the words yet but they both felt it and they showed each other what they meant to each other with their kiss.

There's no place I'd rather be

Ryan reached over and pressed pause on Sophie’s phone.

Sophie got a little scared that she may have involuntarily given to much of her feelings away in the song she chose. “Are you okay? Did you not like the song?” Sophie asked Ryan.

Ryan smiled “I loved the song” Ryan caressed Sophie face while looking into her light brown eyes. “I feel the same way, Sophie. There is no other place I rather be than here with you too.”

Sophie felt all her emotions coming in at once and she gave a little smile as Ryan leaned in to kiss her softly. It was supposed to be a little kiss for comforting to let Sophie know that she will always be there then it got heated so quickly as their emotions took over them. Ryan straddled Sophie and pushed her caramel brown hair away from her face and pulled away from their kiss to look down at Sophie lovingly. They may have not said the words yet but they both felt it and they showed each other what they meant to each other with their kiss.
SongArtist: Rather Be by H.E.R.
SASW:
Rather Be by H.E.R.
Wildmoore Songs by RyanWilderSuit

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Day 4 of Wildmoore Week and it has been great participating. I had two storylines that I put together in one story (don't judge me). Here are songs that I think encompass the vibe of Wildmoore. If you haven't heard it and want to follow along with the lyrics, the songs are below for you to play it.
H.E.R. "Rather Be"
Queen Naija "Butterflies"

...

Ryan's Song

It was another long shift for the Bat Team as Batwoman and Batwing were out patrolling, Mary was tending to patients and Sophie was manning the fort.

“Sophie can you mute Luke’s comms” Ryan (Batwoman) asked.

“Uh why?” Sophie asked perplexed.

“Yea…why? And that’s rude.” Luke said sounded offended.

“Please do it Sophie” Ryan begged.

“Okay.” Sophie muted Luke’s comms “What’s wrong Ryan?” She asked concerned.

“Nothing is wrong…I just didn’t want Luke to hear what I’m about to say to you.” Ryan stated. “He has a big mouth and would tell Mary.”

Sophie shook her head in agreement “Yes. He will. What do you have to tell me?” Sophie asked.

Ryan started “The other night…when we were...uh...listening to music” Sophie face grew concerned.

“Yes? What about it?” Sophie asked.

“Sophie, I want to tell you how I feel but I don’t’ know how but I found a song that says it for me.”

Sophie smiled because she knew that was hard for Ryan to admit. “Okay, what’s the song I’ll look it up.”

“About that…so I added it to the playlist you had open when you played the song for me. You were sleep and I didn’t want to disturb you.”

Sophie smiled. “Okay I found it. It’s called “Butterflies”?

“Yes.” Ryan smiled.

“Okay…I’ll listen to it right now” Sophie said.

“Uh can you take Luke off mute first.” Ryan said.

“Yep…he’s unmuted. Hey, Luke, you’re back on.” Sophie stated.

There was no answer. “Luke. Luke are you there?” Sophie grew worried. “Ryan I can’t re-“

“I’m here.” Luke answered

“Why didn’t you say anything?” Ryan asked.

“Because Sophie didn’t put me on mute…I heard the whole conversation, so I put myself on mute.”

Ryan and Sophie groaned.

As Ryan and Luke were going back and forth. Sophie decided to listen to the song Ryan suggested.




Butterlies by Queen Naija

I don't wanna fall so fast
But I'm open
They always say that good things never last
And I know 'cause I've been broken
I'm tryin' to protect my heart
But you're making it so hard
And I guess it's safe to say
You take my pain away

And I just wanna hold you all night long
Whenever I'm around you, nothing's wrong
I'm hoping that you'll always be around
You got me on a high, I don't wanna come down
And I love it, I love it (these butterflies)
Yeah I love it, I love it (I'm on a high)
Yeah, I love it, I love it
And I just wanna love on you (ooh)

Ever since you crossed my path
Everything is different
You always know just how to make me laugh
You got me all up in my feelings
And as much as I love the feeling
I hate it, it gets me frustrated
Wanna say just how I feel
But don't know how you would take it
Why do you do what you do to me?
Got me doing things that I don't do usually
I promised myself I wouldn't fall
But every time I see you, I just wanna risk it all
And baby, yeah, I know it ain't right
But the chemistry we have is so hard to fight

And I just wanna hold you all night long
Whenever I'm around you, nothing's wrong
I'm hoping that you'll always be around
You got me on a high, I don't wanna come down
And I love it, I love it (these butterflies)
Said I love it, I love it (I'm on a high)
Love (And I just wanna love on)
And I just wanna love on you

Just wanna love, just wanna love on ya (uh, uh)
Just wanna love, just wanna love on ya (uh, uh)
Ay, ay (uh, uh)

Sophie stopped the song as she heard Luke say that they were on their way back to the Batcave.

Sophie stood up from the chair when she saw Ryan and grabbed her face and kissed her. She heard Luke say “Not in the Batcave guys” but all she cared about in the moment was Ryan.

Ryan was taken aback “Whoa…I was only gone for two hours.” She said playfully.

Sophie smiled. “I listened to your song.”

“Oh yeah” Ryan said shyly “What did you think?”

Sophie pulled her closer “I think that was the perfect song to describe us.”

Ryan leaned back in the embrace to peer up at Sophie “How so?”

Sophie took a deep breath “Ryan, I am falling too so don’t think it’s one-sided and when I’m close to you…you give me butterflies too.”

Ryan smiled and leaned in to kiss Sophie. “I’m so lucky” Ryan stated.

Sophie smiled. “Yes, you are.”

Excerpt:
Jordan raised her shot glass in front of her and said “cheers to girls night!” Everyone clinked their glasses together before taking their shots.




The DJ switched the song then to a remixed version of Ain’t Nobody by Chaka Khan. Ryan practically squealed and jumped up off her stool. “I love this song! Let’s dance!”




She didn’t wait for anyone to acknowledge or agree to join her. She was already making her way to the dance floor swaying her hips and singing along. Imani looked at Jordan who looked at Sophie.




“Are ya’ll coming or what?” Jordan asked as she hopped off her stool and started toward Ryan who was now in the middle of the dance floor.




Imani threw back another shot that she ordered and reluctantly climbed off her stool and made her way through the crowd. Sophie watched for a few minutes. Her sister and Imani dancing and Ryan... The woman could move. Sophie wasn’t the best dancer. Her dancing was more slow and sexy. She could watch Ryan dance for hours. As her gaze came up, she met Ryan’s eyes with hers while she swayed and bopped and rolled her body in ways that made Sophie’s mouth dry. She considered just going out there and shooting her shot. Liquor coursing through her body, she felt a little more confidence,

Jordan raised her shot glass in front of her and said “cheers to girls night!” Everyone clinked their glasses together before taking their shots.

 

The DJ switched the song then to a remixed version of Ain’t Nobody by Chaka Khan. Ryan practically squealed and jumped up off her stool. “I love this song! Let’s dance!”

 

She didn’t wait for anyone to acknowledge or agree to join her. She was already making her way to the dance floor swaying her hips and singing along. Imani looked at Jordan who looked at Sophie.

 

“Are ya’ll coming or what?” Jordan asked as she hopped off her stool and started toward Ryan who was now in the middle of the dance floor.

 

Imani threw back another shot that she ordered and reluctantly climbed off her stool and made her way through the crowd. Sophie watched for a few minutes. Her sister and Imani dancing and Ryan... The woman could move. Sophie wasn’t the best dancer. Her dancing was more slow and sexy. She could watch Ryan dance for hours. As her gaze came up, she met Ryan’s eyes with hers while she swayed and bopped and rolled her body in ways that made Sophie’s mouth dry. She considered just going out there and shooting her shot. Liquor coursing through her body, she felt a little more confidence,

Kiss From A Rose by almag

Story: It Could All Be So Simple
Excerpt:
Ryan looked up at her and leaned in to lightly brush her lips against Sophie softly. She did it one time to gauge Sophie’s reaction, Sophie didn’t resist so she lightly touched her face with her hand and kissed her slowly two more times. The kiss was slow, intimate, light just soft touches against their lips as to familiarize themselves with each other. The waiter came back with their food and Ryan and Sophie broke apart. The waiter asked if they wanted anything else and Ryan told him she needed something stronger than wine, so she ordered a Whiskey Sour and Sophie ordered a Martini.

Ryan and Sophie ate their food and sat in comfortable silence as the band played “Best Part” by H.E.R and Daniel Caesar. After finishing their meal and their first round of drinks they ordered more while the music in the background became their soundtrack. It played every song of how they were feeling in the moment from “At Your Best (You Are Love)” by Aaliyah to “Get You” by Daniel Caesar and Kali Uchis. As the music was playing Ryan leaned her head back in the booth to look up at Sophie who was looking down at her.
“God, I love your eyes.” Ryan said feeling relaxed after a couple of drinks.

Sophie was feeling relaxed too. “I love your lips.” She said while her hand caressed Ryan’s face and her thumb grazed Ryan’s lips.

Ryan took the opportunity to stick her tongue out while Sophie’s thumb was on her lips and lick it slowly. Sophie’s eyes grew wide and heated as that one touch sent a vibration through her body. Ryan slowly grabbed the back of Sophie’s neck to pull her in to kiss her. This kiss was still unhurried, but it was faster than before with open mouthed kisses, Ryan tugged on Sophie’s outer lip softly, their tongues intertwining slowly as they found a groove that became theirs.

Excerpt:
“Ryan Wilder. I love you more than I thought I could ever love another person who isn’t my sister. From the moment you came into my life, you have turned my world upside down, not always in a good way at first,” Ryan laughs, holding back tears. “But even after our rocky start, you encouraged me to be the best version of myself. You had faith in me in a way that no one else ever had, and you’ve always wanted the best for me, even when you hated me. Then when we became friends, you became my fiercest supporter and so encouraging, and after we finished dancing around this thing between us and made it officially official, you became the fiercest lover I’ve ever had. You’ve shown me a love that I never thought I could have; you love all of me not despite my flaws but because of them. I love you, Ryan Wilder, and I want to spend the rest of my life trying to make you feel as loved by me and I feel loved by you. I know I don’t need anyone’s permission to marry you, and you are your own woman, but I wanted to make sure that the most important woman in your life thought I was good enough for you. So your mom and I had a conversation, and I think she approves, so now I’m asking you. You said you've always wanted to belong to someone and for someone to belong to. I want to be that someone, so Ryan Wilder, will you marry me?”

They are both crying by the time Sophie finishes her speech, but Ryan somehow finds her voice to answer.

“Of course, I’ll marry you, Sophie. There’s nothing in this world that I want more than to spend the rest of our lives together.” Sophie takes the ring out of the box with shaky hands and places it on Ryan’s finger.

...

Sophie stands and reaches out her hands to help Ryan to her feet. She pulls Ryan to her body, and Ryan raises onto her tiptoes to give Sophie another kiss. 

“Let's go home, wifey.” Ryan jokes, Sophie throws her head back in laughter.

“What? You don’t like wifey?” Ryan laughs.

“I do. I like it. I just wasn’t expecting it.” Sophie takes Ryan’s hand and heads back to her car.

They get in the car and both laugh at the song that just so happens to be playing.

Will you be my wifey? Next-Wifey plays through the car.

They both look at each other and laugh but respond at the same time.

“Yes, I’ll be your wifey.”

Excerpt:
“Theo, you want to play a song?”

Sophie’s voice finally pulls Ryan’s attention. Ryan watches her as gets off the couch and moves across the room to the record player and speakers Luke set up as their house warming gift. Theo is up and following her. He puts his small hand on her shoulder when she kneels to look for the perfect song to play, and leans in deeper than necessary to get a better view. Sophie holds the record up so only he can see it but speaks loudly enough for Ryan to hear. 

“Should we play this one?”

“Yes!” 

Theo bounces with excitement and watches his mother uncover the vinyl and place it carefully on the turntable. After she closes the glass top Theo presses the button for the needle to settle in the grooves of the plastic. The record crackles and comes alive as Corinne Bailey Rae begins to sing “Just like a star across my sky, just like an angel off the page”. Behind them, Ryan smiles at the choice of song, their wedding song. Sophie stands again bringing Theo up into her arms. She positions him on her hip with one arm, the other on his back as she begins to dance around the room as Corinne croons, “You have appeared to my life, feel like I’ll never be the same.”

Sophie moves to the slow and steady rhythm as she spins and dips herself and the other love of her life. Theo is a fit of giggles by the third dip as Sophie sings along to the music,

“You’ve got this look I can’t describe. You make me feel I’m alive.” Ryan watches them from the couch. The coffee in her hand isn’t as warm as it was as if the temperature had moved directly to her chest instead. Sophie turns again, this time facing Ryan, and outstretches her hand. “Are you going to join us?”

Theo mimics her holding out his own small hand. Ryan can’t, won’t, resist the tug they both make at her heart strings and follows the feeling to where they are in the room. Ryan positions herself against her wife, resting her head on her shoulder, and wraps her arms around Sophie and their son. The three of them sway around the room to the music as the rain outside falls harder, and with each lyric so do Sophie and Ryan.

The needle clicks too soon signaling the end of the song and Ryan looks at the peaceful face next to her. The smile that spreads across her own is one of contentment and relief. 

“Soph, you did it. He’s out.”

Finally, finally, the rambunctious toddler sleeps. His face is pressed against Sophie in a way that makes his cheeks look fatter, his small pajama-covered arms and legs dangle limply as he rests. Sophie gently runs a hand over his plush jet-black curls. 

“Let’s hurry before he wakes up again.” 

Ryan leads the way to the other end of their home to Theo’s bedroom and watches Sophie as she lays him down in his own bed and draws the blankets over him before tucking his favorite Batarang-shaped plushie in with him. 

Before long they are back on the couch wrapped around each other, alone and child-free. 

“How’d you like the singing? I think I did pretty well.” Sophie asks as she lays down back against the pillows pulling Ryan into her. She follows with no hesitation and kisses Sophie. 

“It was interesting.”

“Interesting? Now, who’s the one that’s hard to please?”

Ryan doesn’t answer and instead captures Sophie’s lips with her own once again. She understands now why the rainy days of Gotham are Sophie’s favorite. The lull of the city doesn’t come often, and when it did moments like these feel the most special. The dreary greyness of the sky doesn’t seem so bad when the light of your life kisses you senseless. 

The Gotham rain doesn’t let up, and neither do Sophie and Ryan as they recreate the torrent outside whispering, sputtering, stopping to begin again washing away all other sounds in the city until the clouds break.
HTMLExcerpt:
“Theo, you want to play a song?”

Sophie’s voice finally pulls Ryan’s attention. Ryan watches her as gets off the couch and moves across the room to the record player and speakers Luke set up as their house warming gift. Theo is up and following her. He puts his small hand on her shoulder when she kneels to look for the perfect song to play, and leans in deeper than necessary to get a better view. Sophie holds the record up so only he can see it but speaks loudly enough for Ryan to hear. 

“Should we play this one?”

“Yes!” 

Theo bounces with excitement and watches his mother uncover the vinyl and place it carefully on the turntable. After she closes the glass top Theo presses the button for the needle to settle in the grooves of the plastic. The record crackles and comes alive as Corinne Bailey Rae begins to sing “Just like a star across my sky, just like an angel off the page”. Behind them, Ryan smiles at the choice of song, their wedding song. Sophie stands again bringing Theo up into her arms. She positions him on her hip with one arm, the other on his back as she begins to dance around the room as Corinne croons, “You have appeared to my life, feel like I’ll never be the same.”

Sophie moves to the slow and steady rhythm as she spins and dips herself and the other love of her life. Theo is a fit of giggles by the third dip as Sophie sings along to the music,

The three of them sway around the room to the music as the rain outside falls harder, and with each lyric so do Sophie and Ryan.

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: You Show Me How Deep Love Can Be

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Song: Cherish the Day by Sade was recommended by @ The Vaporz on Twitter.

...

The song changed and one of their favorites started playing as Ryan turned to Sophie with an excited smile. It wasn't exactly on the itinerary but Sophie put her glass down and gently took Ryan's and placed in on the table as well. She held out her hand and Ryan took it immediately allowing Sophie to pull her up from the table and wrap her other arm around her waist just as the vocals began. 

'You're ruling the way that I move
And I breathe your air
You only can rescue me
This is my prayer

Sophie smiled at Ryan singing along in a whispered tone. 

I cherish the day
I won't go astray
I won't be afraid
You won't catch me running
You're ruling the way that I move'

Ryan rested her head on Sophie's chest as they danced under the stars. Sophie pulled Ryan in even closer wrapping her arms tighter around her waist. 

'You take my air

You show me how deep love can be

Ryan pulls back so that she can look into Sophie's eyes. "Who knew you were so romantic?" She teased, with that twinkle in her eyes and a smile so bright, Sophie would have been so weak in the knees she'd fall if Ryan wasn't holding onto her so tightly. 

You're ruling the way that I move
And I breathe your air
You only can rescue me
This is my prayer

With an idea and sparkle in her own eyes, Sophie grabbed one of Ryan's hands. "You haven't seen anything yet." And she raised their joined hands up and used her wrist to spin Ryan around underneath them, throwing Ryan completely off-guard and off balance with gasp, before Sophie grabbed her waist and pulled her right back in close against her. Ryan's eye darkened and her eyebrows raised in disbelief for what felt like maybe the third time that night. "Impressed?" 

I cherish the day
I won't go astray
I won't be afraid
You won't catch me running'

"When did Mama teach you how to dance?" Ryan tilted her head and Sophie rolled her eyes at Ryan's ability to just know everything all the time, well almost everything. Sophie shrugged feigning ignorance as they swayed in each other's arms quietly getting lost in the other's eyes. 

You show me how deep love can be
You show me how deep love can be
This is my prayer

I cherish the day
I won't go astray
I won't be afraid
Won't run away
Won't shy

As the song faded out, they still stood close with Ryan's head back on Sophie's chest listening to her racing heartbeat and Sophie's arms wrapped behind Ryan's back. Sophie almost didn't want to interrupt the moment but she sticking to her schedule settled her nerves. "Ry?" She whispered not wanted to break the peaceful quiet of their embrace. Ryan hummed. "I love you, you know that?" 

That made Ryan look up smiling. "I do."

Excerpt:
Ryan didn’t answer, and her eyes eventually drifted shut. The rain had eased to a steady drizzle when she woke up alone, not knowing how much time had passed. The icy chill that had threatened to bring her body to a standstill was replaced by a spark so tiny that all it would take was a careless breath to extinguish it. She murmured her thanks to her mother and was about to leave when she heard the first lines of Amazing Grace being sung by a choir just ahead.

Ryan moved closer without ever realizing she’d made the decision to, the haunted sound pulling her in. She was surprised by the large number of people there, surprised she hadn’t heard them sooner, surprised to see Sophie and Jada sitting together on the seats usually reserved for family, the two women clinging to each other as though they were the only thing keeping each other sane. Marquis sat beside Jada; his face distraught as he stared straight ahead. Jordan, Mary, and Luke sat on Sophie’s other side, tears streaming down their eyes as the choir sang to the audience. Ryan’s eyes drifted to a large, framed picture of her that stood next to a mahogany coffin.

When the song finally ended, Mary stood. “May the road rise to meet you, may the wind be always at your back. May the sunshine upon your face, and the rains fall softly on your tracks. May God grant you safe passage. Until we meet again.”

Ryan moved closer without ever realizing she’d made the decision to, the haunted sound pulling her in. When the song finally ended, Mary stood. “May the road rise to meet you, may the wind be always at your back. May the sunshine upon your face, and the rains fall softly on your tracks. May God grant you safe passage. Until we meet again.”

Excerpt:
Ryan decided to drop by GC Jitters to get her lady some coffee and scones before she headed home. When she arrived, she called out to Sophie with no response. She heard the shower running and then turn off. Sophie came out of the shower with a towel wrapped around her waist. Ryan smiled as she watched Sophie go about her routine of moisturizing her body and spraying her favorite fragrance onto her body. Sophie was so busy singing “Girls Like Girls” by Drake that she didn’t see Ryan standing by the door watching her.

“Now I know my wife isn’t a Crow anymore but I’mma need you to be more observant.” Ryan stated.

“Aaaarrggh.” Sophie screamed. “You scared me.” Sophie said breathing heavily. “What are you doing home?”

Ryan walked closer to Sophie and wrapped her arms around her waist. “I missed you and wanted to see you.”

After her heart stopped racing, Sophie smiled down at Ryan. “Aww babe.
HTMLExcerpt:
Ryan decided to drop by GC Jitters to get her lady some coffee and scones before she headed home. When she arrived, she called out to Sophie with no response. She heard the shower running and then turn off. Sophie came out of the shower with a towel wrapped around her waist. Ryan smiled as she watched Sophie go about her routine of moisturizing her body and spraying her favorite fragrance onto her body. Sophie was so busy singing “Girls Like Girls” by Drake that she didn’t see Ryan standing by the door watching her.

“Now I know my wife isn’t a Crow anymore but I’mma need you to be more observant.” Ryan stated.

“Aaaarrggh.” Sophie screamed. “You scared me.” Sophie said breathing heavily. “What are you doing home?”

Ryan walked closer to Sophie and wrapped her arms around her waist. “I missed you and wanted to see you.”

After her heart stopped racing, Sophie smiled down at Ryan. “Aww babe.

Excerpt:
Story Title: Let Me In (Rest)

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

If I had to choose just one artist's music to be the score for scenes of Wildmoore, I'd choose H.E.R. She's who I hear in my head whenever they're together. This was written after 309 as a personal wish fulfillment, and was originally titled "Rest." More at the end.

...

R: Where are you going?
S: To the couch...but I can stay?

Ryan responds with a small smile. Sophie turns slightly, but doesn't leave.

S: Get in.

When the shuffling ends, Sophie sits on the floor next to the tub and a fully submerged Ryan whose knees are to her chest.

R: Thank you. I honestly can't remember the last time I've done this.
S: I figured as much.

Ryan closes her eyes, looking tired but content. They both sit quietly, listening to "Let Me In" by H.E.R. playing in the background. Ryan grins.

S: What?
R: I like this song.
S: Do you?

Sophie looks skeptical this time. Ryan only responds by widening her smile, knowingly, still not opening her eyes.

...

Writer's End Notes:

So, I actually went to a spa, and had a really uncomfortable scrub, and this idea went through my head as a distraction. Later, though, I had a really great massage (and was able to listen to music during it). The idea continued growing as I listened to "Let Me In." I thought I would be done when they went to bed, but I couldn't shake the feeling that the show would probably never circle back to Sophie saying she didn't know if Ryan hated her. And here we are.

Story: Let the Brat Have her Say
Excerpt:
“Told you not to drink with Jordy,” she reminded again, kneeling in front of her five-four troublemaker, mouth twisted in empathy.

Ryan, Mary and Jordan had converged on a night of what they lauded as the first unofficial meeting of the, “Involuntary Younger Sibling Society,” or the IYSS for short. According to the trio, after the trauma they’d all unfortunately endured due to the cause and effect of their familial relationships, they needed liquor and music with barely comprehensible lyrics to assist in their healing. Sophie called bullshit. Luke called bullshit. The girls called a driver and stuck them with bat duties for the night.

The result? Ryan sprawling face first at Sophie’s feet upon being dropped off at Wayne Enterprises after a series of confusing texts that made Sophie simply put her head down upon the batcave monitor desk and tap in a gentle rhythm.

When Ryan had finally drug into the loft, hair tousled, mascara smudged and her mouth wide open around the lyrics to, “Thot Shit,” Sophie braced herself for whatever may follow.
HTMLExcerpt:
“Told you not to drink with Jordy,” she reminded again, kneeling in front of her five-four troublemaker, mouth twisted in empathy.

Ryan, Mary and Jordan had converged on a night of what they lauded as the first unofficial meeting of the, “Involuntary Younger Sibling Society,” or the IYSS for short. According to the trio, after the trauma they’d all unfortunately endured due to the cause and effect of their familial relationships, they needed liquor and music with barely comprehensible lyrics to assist in their healing. Sophie called bullshit. Luke called bullshit. The girls called a driver and stuck them with bat duties for the night.

The result? Ryan sprawling face first at Sophie’s feet upon being dropped off at Wayne Enterprises after a series of confusing texts that made Sophie simply put her head down upon the batcave monitor desk and tap in a gentle rhythm.

When Ryan had finally drug into the loft, hair tousled, mascara smudged and her mouth wide open around the lyrics to, “Thot Shit,” Sophie braced herself for whatever may follow.

Excerpt:
“Take a look at that. I thought twisting it would work best because you can leave it down like that or put it in a ponytail or a bun, then when you get sick of the twists, you can take them out, and you’ll have a bomb ass twist out.”

Sophie gets off the floor and stretches her back and legs out before going into the bathroom to look at her hair.

Looking in the mirror, Sophie thinks the twist looks so cute. From the way Ryan described it, it sounded like she might look a little childish with this hairstyle, but Ryan absolutely came through with this style. Sophie shakes her head, letting her twist shake around a bit.

“Shake the dreads,” Sophie chuckles to herself, rapping the words to “Tell Me When To Go” softly to herself. This must be what people with locs feel like when this part of the song comes on because Sophie is so giddy and pleased with herself for shaking her head and making her twist bounce.

“How do you like it?” Ryan asks as she comes into the bathroom.

“I love it. Thank you, babe.” Sophie wraps her arms around Ryan's when she stands back up from putting away the hair stuff under the cabinet. She kisses the other woman on the cheek and sits her head on Ryan’s should as they take a moment to look at each other in the mirror. Sophie’s hands that are settled around Ryan’s waist start tracing circles on the skin not covered by Ryan’s crop top. Sophie feels Ryan’s body settle back into hers as she watches Ryan’s eyes drift closed.

...

Writer's End Notes:

We see Sophie taking care of Ryan and doing things for Ryan a lot so I wanted to switch it up for a change and have Ryan taking care of Sophie. We love girlfriends who take care of and help each other ❤️

Also getting to shake my locs while listening to "Tell Me When To Go" is one of my favorite things 😂

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

This is the third installment of the Five + First series. We’re at a pivotal halfway point where some things may start to shift between Sophie and Ryan. The title is unintentionally a Placebo song, but I ain’t mad.

HTMLExcerpt:
Story Title: Running Up That Hill

Writer's Beginning Notes:

This is the third installment of the Five + First series. We’re at a pivotal halfway point where some things may start to shift between Sophie and Ryan. The title is unintentionally a Placebo song, but I ain’t mad.

Indirectly mentions an unspecified pandemic, so please allow this to serve as a trigger warning.

I didn't get the chance to edit this too heavily, so it's flying by the seat of its pants typo-wise. Happy reading!

Excerpt:
Story Title: On My Mind

...

Sophie stands off to the side of the stage, waiting for the last act of the night to finish, trying desperately to pay attention to his lyrics instead of the narrative running around her own head, threatening to talk her out of this. She’d insisted that Jordan return to the bar, her enthusiastic pep talk beginning to feel like a rollercoaster climbing to its highest peak; she didn’t want to risk hitting that drop prematurely. She ducks down next to the guy on keys whilst the crowd are still cheering what they think is the end of the show, talking directly into his ear to be heard and hoping he understands. He takes out his phone and quickly pulls up a Youtube video that shows that he does. Sophie nods, smiling her thanks as the previous performer leaves the makeshift stage and the rest of the band begin to look to them for explanation.

‘You lot clock off,’ the guy says, placing his hand briefly, knowingly, on Sophie’s arm. ‘I got this one.’

He indicates the stool set up in front of the microphone and Sophie sits down, closing her eyes and drawing a calming breath as the unexpected notes from the keyboard once again quiet the crowd.




You’ve been on my mind

I grow fonder every day

Lose myself in time

Just thinking of your face




God only knows

Why it’s taken me so long

To let my doubts go

You’re the only one that I want

 

It’s been a long time and it’s not how she remembered it. Terrifying, yes, still that, but also freeing, weightless, like she’s stepped out, not of herself but of everything she carries unwillingly. She squeezes her eyes tighter against the fear, allows the total silence beyond the keyboard and her voice to embrace her and hold her steady.




I don’t know why I’m scared

I’ve been here before

Every feeling, every word

I’ve imagined it all

You’ll never know if you never try

To forgive the past and simply be mine

 

The usual rasp of Sophie’s voice lends itself flawlessly to the stripped-back version of the song, curling around each syllable like it’s a language written exclusively for her tongue. Her hand shakes a little where it grips around the mic, but her mouth doesn’t falter at all.




I dare you to let me be your one and only

I promise I’m worthy, to hold in your arms

So come on and give me the chance

To prove I am the one who can

Walk that mile

Until the end starts




‘What the…?’ Mary’s whisper barely registers as sound as she comes up beside a stock-still Ryan behind the bar.

‘Oh yeah, sis can sing,’ Jordan fills in for them, looking between her sister’s pitch perfect soul-bearing and Ryan’s slack jaw with unbridled joy – damn, she loves being right. ‘She needs a reason though. Something important enough to make her willingly give up that control-freak nature she hones on the daily and expose the stuff she struggles to talk about. Something real.’




Have I been on your mind?

Do you hang on every word I say?

Lose yourself in time

At the mention of my name

 

Her eyes lock onto Ryan’s as soon as they open, every ounce of pent-up frustration hitching a ride on the words in the pearled gravel of her tone. No room for ambiguity, not anymore.




Will I ever know

How it feels to hold you close

And have you tell me

Whichever road I choose, you’ll go

 

And Ryan’s insides implode.




I don’t know why I’m scared

Cause I’ve been here before

Every feeling, every word

I’ve imagined it all

You’ll never know if you never try

To forgive my past and simply be mine




The fight or flight is lost, given in entirely to freezing though she burns from the inside out. She’s trapped here, in her own body and in Sophie’s gaze, her outsides numb to everything but her whilst her insides feel absolutely everything there is at once.




So, I dare you to let me be your one and only

I promise I’m worthy, to hold in your arms

So come on and give me the chance

To prove I am the one who can

Walk that mile

Until the end starts




The stunned silence that permeates the room as her voice builds raw beauty and grit on every note is enough to allow them both to step out of it. Whilst Sophie sings, they’re not in a packed bar, they’re not in the middle of fighting each other, their history, the future, the next Gotham villain, every unjust system and situation they encounter. Whilst Sophie sings, their fears are suspended, time not stopping but becoming irrelevant.




I know it aint easy, giving up your heart

I know it aint easy, giving up your heart

I know…




Whilst Sophie sings, Ryan doesn’t have to fear or fight or flee. Whilst Sophie sings, to her, she can be still.




Until the end starts.

 

The whole bar erupts and Ryan freefalls, every single thing she’d been avoiding flooding in like her very own Gotham Dam has ruptured, the applause like an additional tidal wave about to crash down on her when she’s already drowning. Sophie reaches out a hand to gently squeeze her thanks into the arm of the keyboardist, feels him return it with an uttered ‘wow’ but can’t tear her eyes from the path Ryan takes as she bolts from behind the bar. One way or another, for both of their sakes, this has to end now.

...

Writer's End Notes:

This turned out way longer than intended! Got the idea a few weeks ago when waiting on a delayed airport pick up and a live, stripped back version of Adele: One and Only came on an old playlist. The raw, gritty frustration she sings the song with just made me think of Sophie, and in this particular performance Adele changes the line ''forgive the past" each time, using "my", "your", and "our", and that was me sold on writing this fic. Plus, the rest of the lyrics are pretty spot on for these two and their lingering lovestruck gazes.

And if Sophie could actually sing like that, I would be an actual puddle. I actually can't think too much about it because I'd never get anything done.

Hope you enjoy!

Excerpt:
“Okay, but don’t you wanna go back and brag about how badass you turned out?” She gives Sophie a once over wiggling her eyebrows, garnering an infectious giggle.




“I wouldn’t call a careerless 31 year old woman a Point Rock success story.” Ryan lays her hands over her heart  to seem shocked.




“Excuse me, you don’t have a job? Are you telling me I’m dating a scrub?” She starts humming the TLC song before standing up and proceeding to sing loudly and then begins to dance pulling Sophie up with her. Sophie’s head falls back, she’s laughing so hard and she knows Ryan won’t stop til she joins in. Oh, and join in she does. Sophie can’t think of anyone else in her life that she feels so carefree with. No one, except maybe Jordan, has ever gotten her to act so ridiculously uninhibited the way her girlfriend does. Her own singing voice fades a bit as she gets caught up watching Ryan sing and dance around, looking sexy and like a complete dork all at the same time. Sophie thinks that bragging about herself is asinine but going to show off Ryan? 

...

Writer's End Notes:

Maybe I'll add a second part at the actual reunion? Idk depends if my brain throws any ideas out.

Also they grew up in the 90s so in my head TLC and other 90s R&B etc gets sung a lot because that's what Ryan does to get Sophie to relax.

Excerpt: “I’ll tell you what, girl, I’ve a different song to try,” Ryan said. “Come stop your crying, it will be alright. Just take my hand, hold it tight. I will protect you from all around you. I will be here, don’t you cry,” Ryan started softly singing to her daughter. “For one so small, you seem so strong. My arms will hold you, keep you safe and warm,” Ryan felt herself smiling as Cora’s cries started to lessen. “This bond between us, can’t be broken. I will be here, don’t you cry. Cause you’ll be in my heart, yes, you’ll be in my heart, from this day on, now and forever more. You’ll be in my heart. No matter what they say. You’ll be here in my heart, always.” Ryan stopped singing as Cora’s cries stopped. “You like that one, too?” Ryan questioned. “I guess Mommy can have her special song and I’ll have my one,” Ryan said. “And I mean those lyrics,” Ryan said, feeling her heart swell. “Mama is always going to protect you. I’ll always keep you safe. You’ll always be in my heart,” Ryan felt emotional as she spoke. “You and your brother are amazing and I’m so, so lucky that I get to be your Mama, I am,” Ryan cooed as Cora gave a little whimper. “I love you so much, Cora. My sweet, darling girl.” Ryan said, lightly rubbing Cora’s back as she rested her head back on the couch, enjoying this special moment of bonding with her daughter.

Excerpt:
Sophie has it all mapped out. She’d collected everything she could find and is ready to present to Ryan a folder full of her records – birth, class pictures with her as the sole Black person in the room, an arrest when she was in middle school for stealing a TI-83 she needed for Algebra that her mom couldn’t afford, high school, Point Rock, her service records, and everything the Crows have about her. She’d practiced what she is going to say in the mirror a few times over the last couple of weeks, but it didn’t do much to abate her nerves. Still, she thinks, it’s the right thing to do. She’s sure of it.

The right time, however, hasn’t presented itself neatly. Sophie isn’t quite sure there’s a natural segue into this. What would that even look like? So she plans a relaxing dinner at her place full of Crispy Joe’s vegan options, Dirty Computer wafting from the speakers, and that wine Ryan likes. What happens instead is as Ryan’s looking for some earrings she’s lost, she stumbles across the package in the drawer. 

“Soph?”
“I checked the couch and don’t see them.”
“Yeah, no. I was looking in the top drawers and came across-“
Shit.
“-this ziplock labeled ‘For Ryan’ with what looks like, but I assume is not, a fidget spinner? Are you ready for me to see that or…?”

She’d practiced what she is going to say in the mirror a few times over the last couple of weeks, but it didn’t do much to abate her nerves. Still, she thinks, it’s the right thing to do. She’s sure of it.

The right time, however, hasn’t presented itself neatly. Sophie isn’t quite sure there’s a natural segue into this. What would that even look like? So she plans a relaxing dinner at her place full of Crispy Joe’s vegan options, Dirty Computer wafting from the speakers, and that wine Ryan likes. What happens instead is as Ryan’s looking for some earrings she’s lost, she stumbles across the package in the drawer. 

“Soph?”
“I checked the couch and don’t see them.”
“Yeah, no. I was looking in the top drawers and came across-“
Shit.
“-this ziplock labeled ‘For Ryan’ with what looks like, but I assume is not, a fidget spinner? Are you ready for me to see that or…?”

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: I hate to think about you with somebody else


...


Writer's Beginning Notes:


The song is Somebody Else by The 1975 but it's more a mix between the original and the cover by VÉRITÉ


...



"I'm looking through you, while you're looking through your phone, and leaving with somebody else."

...

Kate frowned as she waited for her que. Sophie had only shown her what seemed to be the bare bones of a chorus. So therefore, she was currently listening to Sophie pull lyrics out of her ass.

I don't want your body
But, I hate to think about you with somebody else
A love gone cold
You're intertwining your soul with somebody else
I'm looking through you while you're looking through your phone
And leaving with somebody else
No, I don't want your body

But, I hate to think about you with somebody else

Though, maybe pulling lyrics out of her ass wasn't the best description. These seemed to be coming from deep within her chest.

I don't want your body with somebody else
No, I don't want your body
I don't want your body with somebody else

Kate stopped drumming with a sharp intake of breath. She tended to go a little overboard on her poor drumheads.

"So...are we going to talk about what that was just then?" She asked slightly out of breath.

Sophie yanked her guitar strap over her head, "No."

And leaving with somebody else
No, I don't want your body

But, I hate to think about you with somebody else

Though, maybe pulling lyrics out of her ass wasn't the best description. These seemed to be coming from deep within her chest.

I don't want your body with somebody else
No, I don't want your body
I don't want your body with somebody else

Kate stopped drumming with a sharp intake of breath. She tended to go a little overboard on her poor drumheads.

"So...are we going to talk about what that was just then?" She asked slightly out of breath.

Sophie yanked her guitar strap over her head, "No."

HTMLExcerpt:
“You think 2 shots is enough to get you to dance?”

Lucky for blondie, her inquiry came just as the DJ mixed the song into Good in Bed, one of Sophie’s favorites. She smiled and nodded her agreement.

“I’m Devan, by the way.” A name to face alas, as she took Sophie’s hand and guided her deeper into the crowd.

Once they got to an open spot, Devan spun Sophie around and moved her hands to Sophie’s hips.

“Sophie.” They were already all up in each other’s space so raising her arms to Devan’s shoulders felt somewhat natural. Their bodies moved mostly in sync though Sophie’s mind may or may not have been wandering to the bite-sized bartender across the room.

Excerpt:
“You ready to get back out there?” Devan’s smile was hopeful and sweet. Sophie returned the gesture because, well what else was there do to..watch Ryan and whats her names’ flirty antics at the bar all night? She stuttered to a stop when her eyes found Ryan and the aforementioned patron dancing just a few feet away. Ryan was moving her hips against the customer’s pelvic in a hypnotic motion that made Sophie feel almost queasy. She noted the other woman’s left hand comfortably sitting on Ryan’s hip, as her right laced with one of Ryan’s own.

Feels was playing and she watched Ryan use their laced fingers to spin herself around so that she and her dance partner were face to face, mirroring the position she was in with Devan. Oh shit, Devan. Sophie hurriedly turned her attention back to Devan as they danced, not quite as close as they had been before. She felt Devan’s hands roam up her arms and settle in a loose grip around her neck. She forced her gaze to stay focused on Devan and their own dancing, but her mind and eyes were like magnets to Ryan and her every moment. Sophie tried earnestly to look elsewhere but kept finding her eyes trail over to the woman who was sexily dancing with someone else– so close yet so far.

Knew right from the start there was no limit to ya And I'm catching feelings, baby
You give me feels and I
Know that it, know that it, know that it's real You give me, you give me feels
You give me feels and I
Know that it, know that it, know that it's real

In that particular moment, Ryan looked up and met Sophie’s eyes. She grinned and wagged her eyebrows suggestively. In those brief seconds, Ryan’s little dancing partner interrupted their moment with roaming hands moving up Ryan’s full hips and over her slightly exposed stomach. The sensual display set something off in Sophie that she couldn’t ignore or placate in a crowd of people so the taller Moore abruptly stopped dancing and mumbled something quickly to Devan about going to the restroom. There was no wait for a response as she zipped across the dance floor and towards the bathroom without looking back.

Excerpt:
Story Title: Go There With You

...

Ryan looked at Sophie, shrugged and laughed. Sophie noticed the way Ryan tilted her head back slightly when she laughed, her bright smile and smooth skin juxtaposed beauitfully with The Hold Up strobe lights moving around them. She realized their hands were still together and without thinking she lifted their joined hands and spun Ryan around. Ryan must have been caught off guard because she stumbled slightly before Sophie steadied her by guiding her hips. For a second they just stood there, embracing and staring at each other. Ryan’s evocative eyes once again held so much feeling, confusion, questions–lust?

The intro to Go There With You started playing from the speakers and Sophie raised her eyebrows and leaned in barely a whisper from Ryan’s waiting ear. “I know this is your song Wilder, let’s see what you’ve got.” She stepped back a little and motioned for Ryan to start dancing.

'Cause I don't really wanna go there with you

W e picking fights like it's Fortnite
I don't wanna go there with you
Let's end the night on a good time

Ryan’s sudden uneasiness was still there for a moment before quickly being replaced by her incessant need to prove a point to Sophie. She met Sophie’s eyes confidently with a smirk of her own, “Ms. Moore, be careful what you wish for..”

Ryan started moving her body rhythmically, grabbing Sophie’s hands to pull her in closer. The taller woman let out a barely audible gasp of surprise at the warmness of Ryan’s body so close to her own–standing still while Ryan seamlessly in front of her.

I can find a better way to be all in your face

A better way to scream your name, baby
I would rather go there with you
Go there with you

Ryan chuckled, “I’m not going to put on a show for you in front of all these people, so you’re going to have to dance with me.” The flirtatious grin on Ryan’s face practically melted any of Sophie’s apprehension away.

She found her Sophie Freakin Moore confidence and spun Ryan around, pulling her completely into her so that there was little space separating the two.

I can find a better way to be all in your face

A better way to scream your name, baby
I would rather go there with you
Go there with you

When Ryan looked up to meet Sophie’s eyes she was taken aback by the way the room light hit her magical amber colored eyes. They sparkled differently tonight, carrying messages of desire and want. And Ryan felt a flutter in her stomach as those pools bore into her.

Sophie looked down at her own hands on Ryan’s hips, somewhat in awe of finally being in this proximity to the object of her desires– possessively pulling her closer even closer so as not to have even a breath of space between them while they moved to the beat of the night.

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: TiO

...

I just wanna watch you when you take it off. Take off all your clothes and watch you take them off.

...

As if on cue, a song that the athlete barely recognized started up out of nowhere. Like this was all some perfectly timed act. And in a way, Sophie supposed, it was.

I can taste it on your mouth
And I can't leave it
You're a freak like me
(Can't you see?)

Royalty obviously pulled no punches. She's a professional and she has a job to do. So, she does it. And she does it so well, Sophie might just spontaneously combust depsite all of her efforts not to.

Royalty rid herself of the crushed velvet dress via a zipper running conspicuously down her side, revealing the matching set of lingerie underneath.

Her movements never strayed far from the rhythm of the song. And it mustn't be that hard because Sophie's heartbeat has sinced up with it too.

Sophie isn't sure how the next part happened. All she's really aware of is the endless black holes that are Royalty's eyes and the heat of Royalty's body sinking into Sophie's skin like she's being baked at a pleasant 350 degrees.

Excerpt:
“You’re right. They’ve got this.” They take a step forward in line as a kid runs away with a Spongebob popsicle that looks like someone assembled it in the dark. The placement of the blue gumballs as eyes is–nightmarish, to say the least and, on top of that, the teeth . And yet it’s still less offensive than the Minions popsicle that’s dripping down a little girl’s hand a few feet away. 

Ew. 

“Are you sure you don’t want to go to the vegan ice cream truck Mary got?” Sophie asks because she’s kind of getting tired of listening to the tinny jingle of Do Your Ears Hang Low. “It’s right there. And they have the good vegan ice cream.” 

“Soph, we can get that whenever we want. This is way more fun. And no one is too grown up for a popsicle.”

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt:
Chapter Title: Week 6 - Beyond


...



“So what song are you doing this week?” Iris asked them casually. Sophie noticed that Mary was paying close attention to them, her eyes flitting between her and Ryan. As Sophie watched Mary, Ryan replied, “Beyond by Leon Bridges”

“Oh wow! That’s so romantic, Barry and I had that as our first dance at our wedding!” Iris gushed.

Sophie  saw a sheepish look pass across Mary’s face. She knew that Ryan and Mary had grown even closer since Ryan confided in her earlier in the week. And assumed Mary knew all about their feelings discussion. Realizing she had been quiet too long Sophie replied, “We’re doing a foxtrot to it. It’s going to be really beautiful.”

“Wow, it’ll be a preview for the first dance at your wedding!” Iris joked. Ryan mumbled something about checking if the boba was ready and walked off.

“They’ve only been dating a month, c’mon Iris at least give them two months before you’re offering to choreograph their wedding dance!” Cisco, Iris’ celebrity dance partner joked.

“They are lesbians don’t they move extra fast?” Mary said as she joined Sophie’s roast.

Excerpt:
She forced a timid smile as she listened to Luna describe everything she and Luke still needed to do to finish their model of the Opportunity rover, wishing she could take Luna somewhere far away, where nothing could get to them.

“Thanks Ryan, can we go now? I wanna get back so Luke and me can finish the rover. We gotta get it to move.”

“Okay go and put your shoes on. Do you want anything specific for dinner, Mary and Luke are staying today and you get to pick?” 

Ryan already knew what the answer would be, and when Luna asked for a taco night, she laughed, forgetting for a moment where they were about to go. In the car, she let Luna choose the music.

You’re just too good to be true
Can’t take my eyes off of you
You’d be like heaven to touch

Ryan stopped singing after a few lines and she alternated between watching the road and occasionally glancing at Luna who was giving a full-on performance with her eyes shut and one hand on her chest in the rearview mirror. A smile tugged on her lips

Excerpt:
“Get your freezing toes off my friggin’ calves, Wilder.”

 Lips, cheeks and chin nuzzled. Fingers scratched her side. And there was a bemoaned, “But you’re so warm. Please.”

“Put’em elsewhere or get yeeted.”

The toes moved. “Mary shouldn’t have taught you that word,” Ryan grumbled.

“Uh—“

 “ I like my girls just like I like my honey…”

 Sophie grimaced, slapping at her nightstand for her phone to shut off the alarm as the younger woman’s head popped up.
 
“Sorry,” she whispered. “Damn gym alert. It’s leg day.”

 “Unh-hunh,” Ryan murmured back. “Are we going to discuss the very homosexual use of Kehlani so flagrantly?”

“Not on your life.”

“Okie-dokie.” There was a peck to Sophie’s nape. “ Lesbian .”

Mere minutes later the troublemaker was all gentle sighs and pitchy snorts. There may have been a trickle of drool. Stupid smile shamelessly affixed, she didn’t feel room for complaint.

 Because what no one else seemed to know about Ryan Wilder was how soft she could be when tired.

 And Sophie hated to admit it, but she found it irrationally adorable.
…

HTMLExcerpt:
“Get your freezing toes off my friggin’ calves, Wilder.”

 

 Lips, cheeks and chin nuzzled. Fingers scratched her side. And there was a bemoaned, “But you’re so warm. Please.”

 

“Put’em elsewhere or get yeeted.”

 

The toes moved. “Mary shouldn’t have taught you that word,” Ryan grumbled.

 

“Uh—“

 

 “ I like my girls just like I like my honey…”

 

 Sophie grimaced, slapping at her nightstand for her phone to shut off the alarm as the younger woman’s head popped up.

 

“Sorry,” she whispered. “Damn gym alert. It’s leg day.”

 

 “Unh-hunh,” Ryan murmured back. “Are we going to discuss the very homosexual use of Kehlani so flagrantly?”

 

“Not on your life.”

 

“Okie-dokie.” There was a peck to Sophie’s nape. “ Lesbian .”

 

Mere minutes later the troublemaker was all gentle sighs and pitchy snorts. There may have been a trickle of drool. Stupid smile shamelessly affixed, she didn’t feel room for complaint.

 

 Because what no one else seemed to know about Ryan Wilder was how soft she could be when tired.

 

 And Sophie hated to admit it, but she found it irrationally adorable.

Excerpt:
“You know what, I would have a cute moment at my house with you in my arms cuddled up for a while before we left, but now you got me all heated up to take you down at the lane. So, let’s head out, Ryan. I’m curious to see you prove me wrong.” While getting off the chair to head to the door in the excitement of this incredible match to come, Sophie says. “You’re coming, Ryan?” Sophie said with a smirk.




Ryan didn’t need to be told twice; she got up and exited the house with Sophie. Both women got into Sophie’s car and traveled to Uncle Larry’s Bowling Emporium in South Gotham. Sophie played Screwed by Janelle Monáe, and Ryan started to sing out of nowhere which caught Sophie off guard. She began to laugh and ended up joining in. As the singing continued, Sophie parked the car, and both women entered the bowling emporium.

Excerpt:
Both women hug after the kiss, and everyone else thanks them for an epic match. They tell them that they make a beautiful couple.




“Congratulations to the professional bowler of my dreams, I am in awe, and this was super fun.” Sophie says, giving Ryan another kiss.




“Thanks, Sophie, you held in there, and I am proud of you; maybe I can make a professional bowler out of you.” Ryan says with a cute smile on her face.




“You did not just reference Mulan in bowling.” Sophie says, laughing at Ryan’s goofiness.
“She’s one of my favorite Disney characters, sue me.” Ryan says, still in Sophie’s arms.
“She’s mine too, and I am shocked by our scores. You got 260, and I got 195. Jordan and I need to perfect our skills because I need to see you play Jordan. Luke, Mary, and Alice need to witness this.” Sophie says in excitement.

“Thanks, Sophie, you held in there, and I am proud of you; maybe I can make a professional bowler out of you.” Ryan says with a cute smile on her face.

 

“You did not just reference Mulan in bowling.” Sophie says, laughing at Ryan’s goofiness.
“She’s one of my favorite Disney characters, sue me.” Ryan says, still in Sophie’s arms.
“She’s mine too, and I am shocked by our scores. You got 260, and I got 195. Jordan and I need to perfect our skills because I need to see you play Jordan. Luke, Mary, and Alice need to witness this.” Sophie says in excitement.

Excerpt:
As she continues to make her way through the mountain of case files, an unassuming man working as a janitor, fitted with heart shaped retro headphones exits the elevator on the same floor as Sophie. Confident that he is alone, the janitor begins to sing Sam Cooke , “Cupid, draw back your bow. And let your arrow go. Straight to my lover's heart for me, for me. Cupid please hear my cry…”




BOOM!




The mountain of case files from Sophie’s desk falls to the ground causing the janitor to look up in shock. He slides his headphones off and races over towards the noise.




“I’m so-sorry ma’am. I didn’t know anyone was still here.”




Sophie finally looks up at the janitor and he is gobsmacked, enamored by her beauty as she says “Oh no, sir. That is completely my bad. I’m not supposed to be here. My ah, Ms. Jett asked me for a last minute favor. Please don’t let me disrupt your flow”




With that, the janitor and Sophie share a laugh and he begins helping Sophie pick up the files that have fallen on the ground. The janitor begins humming the Sam Cooke and Sophies offers the lyrics this time “there’s danger of me losing my happiness. For I love a girl who doesn’t know I exist..”




The janitor is blushing now as Sophie continues to sing. Once all the files are put back on her desk, she goes back to working and the janitor awkwardly walks away, but quickly changes his mind and goes back over to Sophie’s desk. “H-h-how d-d-do you know that s-s-s-song?”




Sophie smiles as she thinks back to a childhood memory “My father used to sing it to my Mother, when I was younger”




“N-n-nice” the janitor struggles to say. There is a pregnant pause as he searches for something more to say in a desperate attempt to keep Sophie’s attention. She offers him an out as she smiles and continues to look through the case files on her desk.
HTMLExcerpt:
As she continues to make her way through the mountain of case files, an unassuming man working as a janitor, fitted with heart shaped retro headphones exits the elevator on the same floor as Sophie. Confident that he is alone, the janitor begins to sing Sam Cooke , “Cupid, draw back your bow. And let your arrow go. Straight to my lover's heart for me, for me. Cupid please hear my cry…”

 

BOOM!

 

The mountain of case files from Sophie’s desk falls to the ground causing the janitor to look up in shock. He slides his headphones off and races over towards the noise.

 

“I’m so-sorry ma’am. I didn’t know anyone was still here.”

 

Sophie finally looks up at the janitor and he is gobsmacked, enamored by her beauty as she says “Oh no, sir. That is completely my bad. I’m not supposed to be here. My ah, Ms. Jett asked me for a last minute favor. Please don’t let me disrupt your flow”

 

With that, the janitor and Sophie share a laugh and he begins helping Sophie pick up the files that have fallen on the ground. The janitor begins humming the Sam Cooke and Sophies offers the lyrics this time “there’s danger of me losing my happiness. For I love a girl who doesn’t know I exist..”

 

The janitor is blushing now as Sophie continues to sing. Once all the files are put back on her desk, she goes back to working and the janitor awkwardly walks away, but quickly changes his mind and goes back over to Sophie’s desk. “H-h-how d-d-do you know that s-s-s-song?”

 

Sophie smiles as she thinks back to a childhood memory “My father used to sing it to my Mother, when I was younger”

 

“N-n-nice” the janitor struggles to say. There is a pregnant pause as he searches for something more to say in a desperate attempt to keep Sophie’s attention. She offers him an out as she smiles and continues to look through the case files on her desk.

Excerpt:
“Jada, please. This will be my first valentines day with Sophie and I want to surprise her with a special night on Valentines Eve.”




Jada : Fine, but you better explain to her that I am acting under your direction!




Ryan laughs “Thank you. This means a lot to me.”




Jada : What is that music that I hear?




Ryan proudly proclaims, “Pretty Ricky, Bluestar extended edition”




Jada : Honey, no. Get dressed and find a better playlist. 




CLICK!




Ryan laughs to herself and goes through her music and starts a new playlist “90s r&b”. Satisfied with her new selection she goes into the bedroom and starts getting ready.




40 minutes later   




Ryan Wilder emerges from the bedroom looking like a sexual goddess! Lush and loose curls fall down the nape of her neck as the candle light gives her hair a halo effect. A light beat on her face, with curled lashes, and a red lip that she keeps slightly parted makes her look like a flawless sensual painting. Her attire is a two piece black lace lingerie set that she dawns with a tiny red satin robe. I don’t know if her beauty is the result of the devil or an angel, but one thing is certain, Ryan Wilder is out of this world sexy and beautiful!




She gives herself a once over and looks around the loft, she is ready! Anticipating Sophie’s arrival, Ryan unlocks the front door and turns up the music. Silk, “If you” begins playing and that is clearly her song as she lets out an enthusiastic yell of “Baby! I am so ready for you!” And begins singing along.




“ If you (feelin' like lovin' me). If you(feelin' like kissin' me). If you (feelin' like lovin' me, holdin' me). If you (feelin' like lovin' me) .”




She heads over to the kitchen and with her back turned away from the front door as she begins to pour red wine into two wine glasses straight out of Shondaland. 




KNOCK! KNOCK!




Ryan lets out an excited breath and yells out “Come in”

Story: A Bump in the Right Direction
Excerpt:
Sophie wiped an errant tear from her eye. “I want to say the words back to you.”

“You will. It doesn’t have to be today. I’m just happy you’re here. We have plenty of time to say I love you.” Ryan interrupted.

Sophie smiled as she put her arms around Ryan’s neck and Ryan’s arms moved to her waist to pulled her closer. Ryan started to sing softly to Sophie while looking into her eyes. “I just wanna see how beautiful you are, You know that I see it, I know you're a star, Where you go I follow, No matter how far, If life is a movie, Oh you're the best part” as they swayed to the music in the background.

Sophie smiled at Ryan and leaned down to kiss her. “You’re the best part too.”
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie wiped an errant tear from her eye. “I want to say the words back to you.”

“You will. It doesn’t have to be today. I’m just happy you’re here. We have plenty of time to say I love you.” Ryan interrupted.

Sophie smiled as she put her arms around Ryan’s neck and Ryan’s arms moved to her waist to pulled her closer. Ryan started to sing softly to Sophie while looking into her eyes. “I just wanna see how beautiful you are, You know that I see it, I know you're a star, Where you go I follow, No matter how far, If life is a movie, Oh you're the best part” as they swayed to the music in the background.

Sophie smiled at Ryan and leaned down to kiss her. “You’re the best part too.”
SongArtist: Best Part by Daniel Caesar, H.E.R.
StoryWriter: A Bump in the Right Direction by RyanWilderSuit

Best Part by Daniel Caesar, H.E.R.
A Bump in the Right Direction by RyanWilderSuit

Excerpt:
Sophie watched as Ryan picked her phone and shuffled through a list on her phone.

“Now at my prom, they were playing all the old 90s throwbacks because they refused to play anything that was actually in at the time.…” Ryan said as SWV’s I’m So Into You, started to play from her Homepod.

Sophie narrowed her eyes on her. “What are you doing?”

“Dance with me?” She held her hand out to Sophie.

“Ryan if you don’t go ahead…” She chuckled and playfully swatted her hand away.

“I’m serious, come on, indulge me. Dance with me Sophie….please.” The softness behind her please and the cute way she swayed her hips to the beat made it almost impossible for Sophie to decline her request.

Sophie reached up and allowed Ryan to pull her up off the couch. A part of her felt silly but she liked it. Ryan had such a light and carefree energy that was magnetic. You wanted to be silly with her and just be in the moment.

I’m so into youuuuu

Ryan mouthed the words as she playfully pointed at Sophie. She danced around her, just wanting Sophie to have fun and get out of her head for a while. Sophie watched her closely, eyeing the silhouette of her body and the alluring smile she held on her face. Ryan took Sophie by the hands to lift them up and force her to dance with her but Sophie went a step further and ended up pulling Ryan into her. The move closed all the space that was between them and forced Ryan to look up and match Sophie’s gaze.

There were no words other than the lyrics of the song that had now been drowned out in the background. Sophie thought about how terrible she felt when she first got to Ryan’s place and how good she felt at that moment. For anyone that knew her, getting her out of her feelings was no small thing and somehow in a short amount of time Ryan had managed to do this on multiple occasions. In ways she had yet to discover, she could already feel Ryan was special.

Excerpt:
“Jada went to check on the serves , I need to go check on her and make sure she’s not stressing them out…you good?” Jordan nodded.

“Yeah I’m going to go and greet people…” She said looking toward the door …”Ryan just walked in…”

Sophie looked back and saw Ryan. Jordan watch her sister draw in a breath while her lips curled up into an almost giddy grin. She watched as they connected eyes and for a slither of a second she was sure everyone else in the room had disappeared as far as they were concerned.

“You’re sprrunnnggg…dawwg she got youuu!” Jordan joked singing in her best T-Pain impression.

"Ryyaaan!!" Cora sang out as she opened her door. "Rise and shine Birthday girl!" She always made a big deal out of Ryan's birthday. When she first adopted her, she wanted her to feel how special and important this day was because she was a blessing to the world.

Excerpt:
As the thought left Sophie’s brain the intro track to Jazmine Sullivan’s new album starts and Sophie glances at Ryan.

“What do you now about that? I’ve had that album on repeat since it dropped.” Sophie nodded.

“Oh yeah? She’s my favorite artist. I’m such a huge fan girl. Her music has really gotten me through some things.” Ryan said as she looked up at Sophie.

There was a sad look in Ryan’s eyes that Sophie didn’t miss after Ryan spoke. Her eyes fell deep like she was still hurting over something very recent.

Sophie immediately changed the direction of the convo. “Same girl. Look at you having taste in music. Looks like you passed the Bluetooth vibe check.” Sophie smiled.

Ryan smiled picking up on Sophie’s attempt to change the topic and appreciating the older woman for it. Ryan knew Sophie was at least 6 years older than her but damn she did not look it at all. She was tall and fit like she worked out often. Ryan caught herself watching the way the sweatpants hugged her ass but darting her eyes back up to her light brown eyes before Sophie could notice her ogling.
