Excerpt:
The sound of Tevin Campbell singing Can We Talk drew Sophie to the kitchen after finishing up her work. When Sophie arrived downstairs, Phillipe and Jordan were in the kitchen, the two were cooking and dancing together. Sophie had never seen Jordan so happy to be in a man’s company that she wasn’t just trying to take home and kick out before morning. So it was so refreshing to see. How was she missing all of this? If she was really honest with herself. Her relationship with Kate had consumed all of her time and what little time she had was poured into her work and spending time with Jordan. Mary was out of the country for work and she got away with Facetime and phone calls with Luke when they could. She really was missing so much and it immediately made her sad.

Sophie decided she was taking the week off to really start putting things in motion. She would catch up on the messages and voicemails on her business phone and would call Mary and Luke to catch them up. One of the reasons Sophie loved Luke so much was because he always waited until Sophie was ready to talk. For as long as she could remember he was always a soft place for her to land.

Phillipe spotted Sophie, shuffled over and grabbed her and started dancing with her. He spun and twirled her in Jordan’s direction as she did the same to her sister in tune with the music. It was almost 7 in the evening, Sophie didn’t notice how long she was held up in Ryan’s study working. Jordan and Phillipe were half way through a bottle of wine and as Jordan and Sophie danced, Phillipe poured Sophie a glass which she took with glee.

Story: how it started vs how it's going
Excerpt:
“I can’t believe you drove a whole ass hour and a half just to get your ass kicked at Mario Kart 8 when you could’ve done that on your own couch,” Ryan gloated gleefully. “What’s all that shit you were talking earlier?”

“Shut up,” Sophie grumbled. She wasn’t mad for real though.

“You was talking shit in the beginning,” Ryan sang. “I know it piss you off to see me winning.”

Sophie looked scandalized. “Oh hell no. Did you seriously just Post Malone me?”

“Yup!” God, her laugh was so infectious. Sophie’s scandalized look softened into a small grin to mimic Ryan’s joy. “I Wow’d you to be more specific.”

Excerpt:
Sophie drives them back to the city, this time Ryan controlling the aux. Ryan takes them on a throwback journey with her playlist. She plays Paramore, Mariah Carey, and Destiny's Child (Ryan did that purely to see Sophie get excited and belt out all the words to Lose My Breath). They ended with the Usher Confessions album; they just finished singing the words to "Bad Girl" as they pulled up at Ryan's apartment building.

They climb out of the car, and Sophie grabs Ryan's bag from the trunk. Ryan tries to grab it from her, but Sophie offers to walk Ryan to her door and take the bag upstairs for her. Ryan doesn't argue and grabs Sophie's hand and takes her with her upstairs. They hold hands and talk the whole way to the elevator and to Ryan's apartment.

Excerpt:
Story Title: Kiss From A Rose

...

"You stole my moment you know? I was supposed to kiss you." Sophie did just that, pressing a light, quick kiss to her lips. 

"Are you really complaining?" She raised a skeptical eyebrow. 

Sophie chuckled and kissed her lips again. "No, but only because that move was so smooth." 

"The old close your eyes and smell the rose." Ryan bit her lip but it couldn't hide her soft, shy smile. 

"Yeah well maybe because you're so short but it was more on my lips that at my nose." She couldn't help but tease a little. 

Ryan swatted her playfully laughing. "Whatever, you got a kiss from a rose and from me."

"Isn't that a song?" Sophie tried to think of the lyrics. 

"Mhm." She felt her nod against her chest.  

"Babyyyyyy I compare you to a kiss from a rose on the grayyyyy..." Sophie sang loudly and completely off key.

Ryan shook with laughter. "Maybe we should leave the singing to Seal."

...

Ryan leaned back down to kiss Sophie's lips. 

She pulled back just looking into her eyes and Sophie had never felt this happy. Before she could stop the giddiness from bubbling up, she sang again. "Better than a kiss from a roseeeeee!" If she was embarrassed at her own goofiness, it quickly passed as soon as Ryan tossed her head back in full laughter.

Story Title: Kiss From A Rose

...

"You stole my moment you know? I was supposed to kiss you." Sophie did just that, pressing a light, quick kiss to her lips. 

"Are you really complaining?" She raised a skeptical eyebrow. 

Sophie chuckled and kissed her lips again. "No, but only because that move was so smooth." 

"The old close your eyes and smell the rose." Ryan bit her lip but it couldn't hide her soft, shy smile. 

"Yeah well maybe because you're so short but it was more on my lips that at my nose." She couldn't help but tease a little. 

Ryan swatted her playfully laughing. "Whatever, you got a kiss from a rose and from me."

"Isn't that a song?" Sophie tried to think of the lyrics. 

"Mhm." She felt her nod against her chest.  

"Babyyyyyy I compare you to a kiss from a rose on the grayyyyy..." Sophie sang loudly and completely off key.

Ryan shook with laughter. "Maybe we should leave the singing to Seal."

...

Ryan leaned back down to kiss Sophie's lips. 

She pulled back just looking into her eyes and Sophie had never felt this happy. Before she could stop the giddiness from bubbling up, she sang again. "Better than a kiss from a roseeeeee!" If she was embarrassed at her own goofiness, it quickly passed as soon as Ryan tossed her head back in full laughter.

Excerpt:
She left the bathroom and returned with her phone. She connected to the waterproof Bluetooth speaker suctioned to the wall and turned on the water. She scrolled through her apple music and found the sappiest love playlist she could find. She hit play as stood up in the mirror one more time and took a deep breath. “Feel your feelings but don’t stay there.”

Sophie stepped into the shower and the tears keep running as her face hit the water. She turned up the music from the Bluetooth speaker and restarted the song.

“I've tried
And I've lied to myself

To stop the tears

But it's been too many years

And you keep doing the same thing

Making the same old promises

Before you play with my heart again

I'ma keep it one hundred

It's been on my mind

And before you get to lying..”

Sophie’s cried as the chorus to Monica’s song Breathe followed and echoed in the bathroom. She eventually slid down and sat in the shower as the hot water hit her skin and snot ran from her nose.

Excerpt:
Luke sits on the couch as he watches his friend leave. Once she goes, he grabs the remote and starts flipping through all of Ryan's streaming services to find something to watch. He should have brought his switch so they could play Mario Kart; that always cheers Ryan up even though she always loses to him. 

Just as he decides on Encanto because he knows how much Ryan loves "We Don't Talk About Bruno," there is a knock on the door. He's curious about who it could be since Ryan would just use her key unless she ordered too much food and needed help opening the door. However, she hasn't been gone long enough to walk down the street and back, though. So he gets up from the couch and cautiously opens the door to see who is on the other side. To his surprise, he sees Sophie standing at the door with a plant in hand

Excerpt:
"Stay and watch a movie with us; we're about to watch," Ryan looks over at the television to see what Luke had picked. "Encanto, it's my favorite. You said Jordan was at a sleepover tonight, so it isn't like you have to pick her up. I bought plenty of food. I always go overboard when I'm sad. Please stay."

Sophie relents and nods her head, "Fine, but only if you're sure."

"I am, and you have to stay too, Luke. I bought you food, so you at least have to stay and eat."

Luke shrugs, not having to be told twice, and grabs the food off the table and brings it into the living room. 

The three of them settle on the couch, watching Encanto. All three of them loved the movie, Ryan made Luke watch it all the time, and Sophie has been in love with it since Jordan made her watch it when it came out. She identifies with Luisa more than she would like to admit, and "Pressure" definitely hits different for her. But she still loves singing along and watching Ryan dramatically perform "We Don't Talk About Bruno."

Excerpt:
“You got this, sis,” Jordan encourages as she watches Sophie stand in the middle of the room fidgeting. Sophie doesn’t say anything for fear of accidentally throwing up from nerves.

Jordan’s classmate, Nathan,
Jordan’s classmate, Nathan, rushes back into the room just in time for the student to cue up Brandy’s “Sitting Up In My Room” over the speakers. The two of them love Brandy and were obsessed with Brandy as teenagers, watching Moesha, so it seemed appropriate. The students start to dance just as Ryan walks in and stops in the doorway, clearly shocked and surprised about what is going on in her class. She’s even more confused about why Sophie is standing in the middle of the room, looking nervous. Jordan is standing beside Sophie with the biggest smile and sign that Ryan has ever seen, and she knows exactly what’s going on.

“Soph, what’s this?” Ryan asks.

“I told you that you would know when I was asking you to be my girlfriend. I never got to ask a girl I like to a school dance, so I’m asking you, will you be my girlfriend and be my date to chaperone a bunch of children dancing badly and awkwardly.”

Ryan gives Sophie a lighthearted smile that takes over her whole face. She can’t hide the excitement and wonder in her eye as she looks around and takes in the scene. Brandy is playing in the speakers, her kids dancing and barely staying on beat, and the girl she really likes is finally asking her to be her girlfriend and asking her to a corny middle school dance.

“You have to answer her, Miss Ryan,” one of the students, Erica, yells from the other side of the room.

“Of course, I’ll be your girlfriend. It took you long enough to ask, I thought you were going to chicken out, and I would have to ask you.” Ryan steps into Sophie’s personal space, putting on hand on her waist.

“I just wanted it to be perfect,” Sophie speaks low enough that none of the kids can hear her.

Ryan lifts herself onto her tiptoes and kisses Sophie. It’s short and sweet, nothing too much, because she didn’t want to go overboard in front of the kids.

“It was absolutely perfect. The Brandy was a nice touch too,” Ryan speaks against Sophie’s lips.

Excerpt: They spend the rest of the night watching the students run around, talk to other volunteers, and having a good time. Excerpt:
“Sophie you turned a woman down because she had red nail polish on.” Mary countered.

“It clashed with her outfit.” Sophie countered.

“You can change it easily.” Mary said in disbelief.

“Her conversation topics were dry too. All she wanted to talk about was her cat. It’s like I get it you own a cat.” Sophie said animatedly.

“Okay what about Taja? The nurse I set you up with. You went on a date with her and never called her back.” Mary stated.

“She was to touchy-feely and she ended every sentence with Period. Like what are you a City Girl?”

“It’s your birthday” Ryan says




“This goes out to my favorite Lesbian moms” Alani winks





Make Me Feel by Janelle Monáe starts playing




“I think I’m going to enjoy this parent role with you Soph.” Ryan whispers to Sophie




“I think I will too. But you agree, no more kids for a while”




“Oh definitely. Plus I gotta marry you first” Ryan winks

Excerpt:
I sighed, it was cold as hell. I forgot my jacket in her car this morning. I checked my phone once again. It was 4:25. She was suppose d  to be here at 3:30. She hasn't replied to any of my  messages  or answered my calls.

To say I was pissed was  an  understatement. I shook my head, before feeling a cold hand touch my shoulder, I tensed, flinching back. I turned to my side, seeing a familiar  woman's  face. She was fair -skinned ,  with  curly hair,  and  blue eyes. She was attractive but not my type. "You sure you don't want a ride?" She asked, my brows rose, she always offered this and I always had the same answer.

"No, I'm good," I denied.

She raised a brow. "You sure?" She asked, eyes scanning around for Sophie but like always she wasn't here.

"Yeah, I'm sure, she's probably around the corner," I say, she  was  always here when Sophie wasn't.  The woman  was slowly starting to get creep y .

"Okay but a pretty lady like you shouldn't be-," She started, before getting cut off, by a car driving in blasting Tupac  Hit 'Em Up.  I sighed, of course ,  she had to come late and drive -in  being ghetto. She drove in front of her, rolling down her window. Then she looked at me, always having this beautiful glist in her eyes. As if I'm  the  most important person in her life and all above.  She  smiled.

As if I'm  the  most important person in her life and all above.  She  smiled.

Excerpt:
“I would love to sit and watch you paint sometimes.” Ryan looks over her shoulder and shakes her head at her girlfriend. It seems like she is finally starting to loosen up; the wine must finally be kicking in to make her relax.

Just as Ryan was about to respond, the DJ starts playing “International Player’s Anthem.” Ryan watches Sophie’s face light up when the beat drops. It is obvious that Sophie loves this song.

Ryan is pleasantly surprised when Sophie starts rapping the words of the song along with the other people in the room who love the song. This is one of Ryan’s favorite songs but watching Sophie get into it is so much better than rapping the song herself. The whole room is hype, and Sophie feeds into the energy radiating through the room. It seems to Ryan that they’ve gotten to the part of the night where everyone’s alcohol is starting to kick in, and people will be doing more singing and dancing than actual painting.

“I choooooose you, baby,” Sophie sings as she points at Ryan.
The laugh Ryan lets out is bold and loud as she watches her girlfriend rap. She knew Sophie had a goofy side that she didn’t always let out but seeing her act like this is amazing, and now Ryan is determined to do anything possible to bring this side of Sophie out all the time.
HTMLExcerpt:
“I would love to sit and watch you paint sometimes.” Ryan looks over her shoulder and shakes her head at her girlfriend. It seems like she is finally starting to loosen up; the wine must finally be kicking in to make her relax.

Just as Ryan was about to respond, the DJ starts playing “International Player’s Anthem.” Ryan watches Sophie’s face light up when the beat drops. It is obvious that Sophie loves this song.

Ryan is pleasantly surprised when Sophie starts rapping the words of the song along with the other people in the room who love the song. This is one of Ryan’s favorite songs but watching Sophie get into it is so much better than rapping the song herself. The whole room is hype, and Sophie feeds into the energy radiating through the room. It seems to Ryan that they’ve gotten to the part of the night where everyone’s alcohol is starting to kick in, and people will be doing more singing and dancing than actual painting.

“I choooooose you, baby,” Sophie sings as she points at Ryan.
The laugh Ryan lets out is bold and loud as she watches her girlfriend rap. She knew Sophie had a goofy side that she didn’t always let out but seeing her act like this is amazing, and now Ryan is determined to do anything possible to bring this side of Sophie out all the time.
SongArtist: International Players Anthem by Swishahouse, Michael Watts

International Players Anthem by Swishahouse, Michael Watts

Excerpt: The party (because clearly it isn’t a paint and sip anymore) ends with them doing the electric slide to “Before I Let Go” because what is a function without the Electric Slide.
HTMLExcerpt:
Soon enough, everyone has abandoned their painting to sing and dance. It’s hard to focus on painting when you’re trying to “take over for the 99s and 2000s” or sing Fantasia at the top of your lungs. The alcohol has everyone feeling good, and Ryan and Sophie are not excluded from that feeling. They dance together and sing; they make friends with the couple beside them and discover that Sophie lowkey loves hip-hop. She flawlessly spits lyrics to UGK, Megan thee Stallion, DMX, and Lil Kim without missing a beat or a lyric.

The party (because clearly it isn’t a paint and sip anymore) ends with them doing the electric slide to “Before I Let Go” because what is a function without the Electric Slide. Then, everyone cleans up, and Sophie grabs her and Ryan’s unfinished paintings as Ryan throws away their trash.
SongArtist: Before I Let Go by Maze, Frankie Beverly
SASW:
Before I Let Go by Maze, Frankie Beverly

Excerpt:
Ryan rips open the box to show an enlarged picture of the two of them on what looks like the outside of a vinyl. She unwraps the plastic around it to find that it is a vinyl; Ryan opens the flap and slides the record out of the cover. The vinyl is yellow and has a different picture of the two of them on the center with the #Wildmoore written across it.

"Jordan came up with #Wildmoore. That's what she calls us."

"What is this, Soph?" Ryan asks.

"You're old enough to know what a record is, so I'm assuming that isn't what you mean. It has all the songs that make me think of you and how much I love you on it. I know it's kind of corny I basically made a playlist like we're in high school again, but I thought it would be a nice first record for the record player you bought but have absolutely no records for and insisted on leaving here.

Ryan leans over and kisses Sophie, "I love it, Soph. I'm gonna play it now." 

She hops out of bed with the record and puts her new record on the turntable. Ryan turns it on and places the needle on the record. 
The first song starts playing, and "Girl" by the Internet begins playing.

Ryan takes off her underwear, climbs back in bed with Sophie, who must have gotten cold, and climbed under the covers. Sophie is completely naked now; she must have taken her bra off while Ryan set up the record.

The two cuddle together and let their hands roam over smooth skin. Neither of them tries to initiate anything; they soothe each other until they both feel the pull of sleep taking over them.

Sophie kisses Ryan's forehead as Ryan tucks herself under Sophie's chin and cuddles in close.

"Happy Birthday, baby," Sophie says as they get wrapped in each other arms, able to feel safe and loved enough to drift off together.

Excerpt:
After Sophie packed her car with Ryan’s things they got in the car to go forward with their journey. The lake house was two hours away so they had enough time to stop to for coffee and bagels. After their stop they headed on to their destination. The car ride was silent except the music playing low in the background. Ryan noticed that Sophie was gripping the steering wheel tightly. Ryan knew that this would be a big week for Sophie so she could tell she was nervous and overthinking things.

“Do you mind
“Do you mind if I play something?” Ryan said.

Sophie glanced over at Ryan. “Sure play whatever you want.”

Ryan took Sophie’s
Ryan took Sophie’s aux cord and plugged it into her phone. She found the playlist she wanted to hear and pressed play. A familiar song played through the speakers. Ryan started singing along with the radio and dancing in her seat. She noticed Sophie’s hands loosened up on the steering wheel as she bobbed her head along with the music. Ryan lightly pushed Sophie which caused her to sing softly along with Ryan to the song.

“Oh girl
One more chance
With you again
I will not let it go
Oh, girl
Give me just one more chance
For love, love, love, love”

Ryan and Sophie sung along to Tevin Campbell’s “Can We Talk” to the top of their lungs. They sung every ad-lib, every note, every lyric and they laughed and smiled with each other while doing so. Ryan saw that Sophie had relaxed more after their duet together and kept playing songs that would have them screaming at the top of their lungs the whole journey to the lake house.

Excerpt:
There were a lot of mumblings and groaning but everyone got up to go outside where the DJ had started playing music. Everyone was standing around in a spot not moving.

“Ugh I have to do everything myself.” Aunt Tish said as she pulled people onto the makeshift dance floor. “Come on everyone loosen up. My daughter is getting married and she wants us all to have a good time.”

Aunt Tish made it over to Sophie and Ryan and pulled them both on the floor. “I know you guys had a seductive tango this morning by the lake but keep it PG out here okay.” She said with a wink and laugh.

Sophie groaned while Ryan chuckled. The DJ decided to mix up the song and played “Boo’d Up” by Ella Mai.

“I love this song.” Sophie said as she swayed side to side.

“Me too.” Ryan said as she looked up at Sophie.

Sophie looked everywhere but at Ryan until Ryan pulled her closer to her as they swayed together.

Excerpt:
Once Ryan buckled Alaia into her car seat and buckled her own seatbelt she reached for her phone scrolling through her playlists. “Any requests?” She held her phone so the little girl could see her music app from her seat.

 

“Ummmm” she tapped her tiny finger on her chin while she thought. She’s really the cutest kid. “Can we play the lighting bottle song?”

 

Ryan smiled to herself and typed the actual title into the search bar. She and Alaia sang along for the twelve-minute drive home dancing and laughing.

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

“And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.”

Thank you very much for reading.
Shout out to Ciara and Normani!

...

Sophie puts on Normani's Motivation and Ryan laughed nervously as she watched the monitor screen intently trying to get a few moves in. She made the mistake of turning around to watch Sophie. Sophie was currently in her sexy mode and killing Normani's choreography. She was so in her element and didn't even notice that Ryan was staring. Ryan was just swaying left and right at this point, just watching Sophie and drooling.

Omg her athleticism is insane and wait was that a full effortless split. My goodness who the hell is this person and what have they done with Sophie.

Ryan tried her best to put a few moves in but her knees were painfully weak from watching Sophie but her heart was full.

This song somehow seemed longer than the previous one. Was it because Ryan wasn't doing much dancing? The song ended and Sophie high fives Ryan and went for her water bottle, leaving Ryan as tongue tied as ever.

'Omg Normani gets me in the zone, gosh I love her choreography so much, it challenges me', says Sophie out of breath.

'Oh no ma'am, are we gonna talk about what just happened? What the hell was that?'

'Oh, come on Ryan, that was nothing'

'I can't believe that a highly skilled and tactical operative such as yourself can move so gently. The was so much sexiness on display, I need to take a minute '

'Oh'

'Yes, oh'

'Can you please do that again, except this time I'm just gonna intentionally sit here and watch you, if that's okay with you?', Ryan is not sure where that came from.

'Hang on, is thee Batwoman asking me to put on a show for her?'

'No, I'm asking as Ryan. I’m gonna need to see you do that again, please', Ryan spoke softly and sounded like she was pleading.

Sophie grabs a chair and places it in the middle of the small room and gestures for Ryan to take a seat, which she does hurriedly.

'Well since you've asked so nicely', Sophie says as she presses replay on Normani’s Motivation.

Unlike the first time where Sophie was giving a ‘So You Think You Can Dance’ worthy performance, this time she was intentionally performing for Ryan. She made sure to take every opportunity to make eye contact and dance as close to Ryan as possible. Her brain didn't process her body's actions as quickly as they played out. Sophie was lost in Ryan's eyes and Ryan was looking at Sophie like she was the only person in the world. So many thoughts were going through Ryan's head. They both don't know when it happened but before they knew it, Sophie was currently giving Ryan a lap dance and things were escalating. The song ended too quickly for Ryan's liking and Sophie was about to get off Ryan's lap when Ryan spun her around and kissed her hungrily, yet passionately.

They broke off the kiss with Sophie still sitting on Ryan's lap, face to face, never breaking eye contact.

'Sophie I'm-

'Shhh, no need to say anything. Let's just be in the moment and allow ourselves to feel what we're feeling right now for a little while longer, is that okay with you?'

Ryan could only nod before she pulled Sophie in for another passionate, slightly longer and more explorative make out session.

Ryan learnt that Sophie is tough yet gentle, she's passionate and commits to the things she loves. Most importantly Ryan learnt that she liked Sophie and that Sophie liked her back.

Sophie was lost in Ryan's eyes and Ryan was looking at Sophie like she was the only person in the world. So many thoughts were going through Ryan's head. They both don't know when it happened but before they knew it, Sophie was currently giving Ryan a lap dance and things were escalating. The song ended too quickly for Ryan's liking and Sophie was about to get off Ryan's lap when Ryan spun her around and kissed her hungrily, yet passionately.

They broke off the kiss with Sophie still sitting on Ryan's lap, face to face, never breaking eye contact.

'Sophie I'm-

'Shhh, no need to say anything. Let's just be in the moment and allow ourselves to feel what we're feeling right now for a little while longer, is that okay with you?'

Ryan could only nod before she pulled Sophie in for another passionate, slightly longer and more explorative make out session.

Ryan learnt that Sophie is tough yet gentle, she's passionate and commits to the things she loves. Most importantly Ryan learnt that she liked Sophie and that Sophie liked her back.
SongArtist: Motivation by Normani
StoryWriter: What I learnt about Sophie by OneWordADay
SASW:
Motivation by Normani
What I learnt about Sophie by OneWordADay

Excerpt:
Sophie was the only one out of the loop but she couldn’t tell as Aunt Tish was keeping her busy talking to her. Soon the DJ played “Body Party” by Ciara which Ryan requested and she proceeded to walk slowly to Sophie. Sophie was engaged in conversation that she didn’t notice Ryan until she stood over her. Sophie looked Ryan up and down slowly, Ryan grabbed her hands and moved them from Sophie’s lap to her waist. Ryan slowly straddled Sophie then proceeded to sway her hips back and forth to the music. Sophie was in awe as Ryan was on top of her, she couldn’t take her eyes off of her. Ryan stared down at Sophie as she continued to wine her hips slowly that had Sophie holding on for dear life. In the background the party was hollering and cheering on Ryan but Sophie didn’t hear as she was focused on Ryan and Ryan only. Sophie rubbed her hand down Ryan’s back as she swayed back and forth to the beat of the music. Sophie felt her heart was beating so fast as strong feelings surged through her body, as she wanted to feel every part of Ryan’s body. Her hand brushed across Ryan’s cheek as her body was acting on its own as she had no control on what she was doing. Sophie looked into Ryan’s eyes and realized that this was another moment where she has a chance to kiss Ryan. Last night she couldn’t bring herself to do it but right now she could because everyone already thought they were a couple so she would have a valid reason to kiss Ryan. She was not going to miss this opportunity like she did before. She leaned forward and kissed Ryan quickly…just a peck to see if Ryan would return the gesture. Ryan smirked and then leaned forward and briefly touched her lips with Sophie’s. She did it again just softly touching to make sure she didn’t scare Sophie with the intense motion she was feeling. As Ryan lightly pulled back, Sophie pulled forward connecting their lips for longer moments. She cupped Ryan’s face and leaned her head to the side to deepen the kiss. Ryan moved her hands from Sophie’s waist to lightly grab Sophie’s neck and pulled back to look into the honey brown eyes. She smiled. “Was that for show or was that real?” Ryan asked.

Sophie smiled. “What do you want to be?”

Ryan looked up at her eyes and then back to her lips. “Real.” She whispered.

Sophie smiled. “Then real it is.”

I’ll always remember us this way.

...

Sophie takes out her phone and presses play on Lady Gaga's Always Remember Us This Way and reaches out for Ryan’s hand to ask for a dance, who then accepts the invite and so their bodies fall into a natural rhythm as they slow danced. Emotions running high as they have both been waiting for this moment for a painfully long time, over 10 years. They’re holding on to each other, never wanting to let go as they each sob in each other’s shoulders, as their bodies move in unison to the music.

That Arizona sky burnin' in your eyes
You look at me and, babe, I wanna catch on fire
It's buried in my soul like California gold
You found the light in me that I couldn't find

So when I'm all choked up
But I can't find the words
Every time we say goodbye
Baby, it hurts
When the sun goes down
And the band won't play
I'll always remember us this way

Lovers in the night
Poets tryin' to write
We don't know how to rhyme
But, damn, we try
But all I really know
You're where I wanna go
The part of me that's you will never die

So when I'm all choked up
And I can't find the words
Every time we say goodbye
Baby, it hurts
When the sun goes down
And the band won't play
I'll always remember us this way

Hoo, hoo, hoo, hoo
Hoo, hoo, hoo, hoo
Hoo, hoo, hoo, hoo, hoo

So when I'm all choked up
And I can't find the words
Every time we say goodbye
Baby, it hurts
When the sun goes down
And the band won't play
I'll always remember us this way, way, yeah
When you look at me
And the whole world fades
I'll always remember us this way

As the song finishes, Sophie pulls Ryan in for a long, passionate kiss, as if she’ll never get another chance to kiss her again.

Excerpt:
Sophie and Alani jumps, that hadn’t realized that Iris had got up. Iris laughs at the reaction. She joins them on the balcony 




“I can’t believe you made that disgusting ass tea.” Iris says with a stank face




“Same thing I said.” Alani says




“It reminds me of Ryan.” Sophie laughs




“You couldn’t make her red velvet cupcakes she love?” Alani asked




“Or her sweet and sour cauliflower? There are better things to make to remind you of Ryan.” Iris smiles




“True…” Sophie chuckles




“Wait…can we make the cauliflower? I am hungry and as a meta mutant experiment, I need to eat…a lot.” Alani emphasizes




“Only if we do it her way.” Sophie smiles




“I’ll call Kelly!”  Iris says excitedly 




“I’ll put on Chaka Khan!” Alani sings




Sophie smiles as they head into the condo. Her faith is restored. Ryan will be back before she knows it and she will marry her as soon as she can. 




*Ain’t Nobody by Chaka Khan starts to play as Kelly uses one of the alien transports to appear in Sophie’s condo*




“I brought broccoli…” Kelly says with an embarrassed smile




They all laugh.

Excerpt:
Vegan wings aside (she loves her girl but she'll forever choose chicken over the alternative until the day she dies), she can't think of a better way to spend the first free weekend they've had in ages cuddled up with Ryan and binging Moesha on Netflix. A few months ago they'd been scrolling through the list of nostalgic Black shows on the streaming platform before stopping on Moesha.

"God, I had such a crush on Brandy back in the day. My mom bought Rodger & Hammerstein's Cinderella and I must have worn that VHS out I played it so many times. Knowing my mom, she probably thought I had a crush on the prince not knowing I was crushing on Brandy. And Whitney," Sophie smiled.

"Girl, you?! Whenever I could get my hair braided, you couldn't tell me I wasn't Brandy. Called myself sittin' up in my group home room," Ryan laughed. "I didn't know if I wanted to be her or be with her. Turns out it was the latter," she said before taking the remote from Sophie and seeing that they had all six seasons of the show.

"Wanna watch?" she asks, thumb hovering over the button, ready to start the series. Sophie nods and leans back on the couch letting and Ryan get comfortable on top of her before starting the series.

"Mo to tha, E to tha," they both sing as the intro song begins playing.

"Mo to tha, E to tha," they both sing as the intro song begins playing.

Excerpt:
Story Title: (Let Me Call You) Sweetheart

...

After making it back to Sophie's condo and indulging in a shared epsom salt bath, a massage with Sophie's favorite oils, a good night's sleep, and now bellies full of wings of the vegan and non-vegan variety, Ryan lay in her favorite position - on top of Sophie - as they watched the episode I Love Moesha.

Kim and Hakeem as their I Love Moesha counterparts are preparing to perform for their audition when Ryan gets up and pulls Sophie up with her from the couch. The piano begins to play on the TV and Ryan takes hold of Sophie's right hand before wrapping her left around her waist and and begins dancing as Kim sings.

Let me call you sweetheart
I'm in love with you

Ryan is leading their waltz around the living room as best she can given their height difference and Sophie's laughter. Ryan sings along with Kim as she moves them around the couch and near the balcony where the open curtains display Gotham's skyline against the setting sun.

Let me hear you whisper
That you love me too

Sophie twirls Ryan so Ryan's back is against her chest. She leans down so her lips brush against Ryan's ear as she whispers Hakeem's line in time, "I love you, too." Ryan takes in a breath before turning around again. They haven't said that they loved each other yet and though she knows it's part of the scene, hearing Sophie say the words makes her heart skip a beat. And it isn't that she hadn't meant the lyrics when she sang them herself - she definitely had. But Sophie probably thought it was all part of the scene so she continued on and sang her next verse.

Keep the love light glowing
In your eyes so true

She separates from Sophie to break it down like Kim causing Sophie to laugh again. Sophie pulls Ryan into her and Ryan wraps her arms around Sophie's neck before finishing the song, feeling Sophie wrap her arms back around Ryan's waist.

Let me call you sweetheart
I'm in love with you

Sophie leans down and places a tender kiss on the shorter woman's lips. Ryan cups the back of Sophie's head with one hand while she runs her nails softly against the nape of Sophie's neck with the other. Her hand wanders down Sophie's back before finding itself under the older woman's tank top. She feels Sophie smile against her lip as her fingertips graze her side. She discovered that Sophie was ticklish their first night together and doesn't hesitate to exploit her discovery every chance she gets. Sophie grabs her hand before she can complete her tickle assault and brings it in front of her before grabbing Ryan's other hand and doing the same. She kisses her knuckles on each hand before lowering their hands to sway between them. Sophie looks into Ryan's eyes,

"You know I meant it, right?"

Ryan thinks, hopes she knows what Sophie meant, but she needs to hear Sophie say it. She needs verbal confirmation of what she feels in her heart. That her feelings are reciprocated.

"Meant what?"

Sophie steps impossibly closer, the backdrop of Gotham behind them, Moesha still playing in the background. Ryan's brow is furrowed in confusion and Sophie can see the fear in her eyes. The fear that Sophie won't reciprocate her feelings. The fear of feeling something real and blowing it. She'd roll her eyes if she was sure that it wouldn't ruin the moment.

"That I love you. That I'm in love with you, Ryan."

And there it is.

Sophie can see and feel the tension leave Ryan's body. She brings a hand up to cup Ryan's cheek and Ryan leans into the hold, eyes closed, before looking back up at her love.

"I love you, too, Soph. So damn much."

The smile reserved solely for Ryan, soft, gentle, loving, graces Sophie's face once more as she brings their lips together again. There's more to say, of course, but later. Sophie walks them towards her bed before lying Ryan down gently. They'll have to rewatch the episodes that continue to play in the background as they spend the rest of the night professing their love for one another verbally and physically, but that's alright.

Ryan is in love with her and they've got the rest of the weekend to themselves. Moesha can wait.

“All my memories, all gathered 'round her

My lady swingin' through the water (water)

Dark and dusty painted on the sky

Misty taste of moonshine”

Excerpt:
Ryan and Sophie were transfixed, listening and looking at Mama Cora.



There's a chance that you care

Won't you answer this fervent prayer?

Of a stranger in paradise

Don't send me in dark despair

From all that I hunger for

But open your angel's arms

To this stranger in paradise

And tell him that he need be

A stranger no more

 

As the last words trailed from Diana Ross and Mama Cora’s lips, Ryan and Sophie looked over at each other. Mama Cora holding steady in her stance. Sophie began moving towards her but Ryan signaled her to wait. Cora slowly opened her eyes.

 

She took a long, deep, inhale and smiled as she released it. She called Ryan and Sophie into a hug. Each is taken in one of Mama Cora’s arms. “Thank you,” she released Sophie and Ryan from her grip, she looked at Ryan and then Sophie, “Charlie is in this room with us. Set him a plate and let’s eat.”

Chapter Summary:

This chapter was heavily influenced by the song 'Pass It' by MK Xyz.

...

A new song starts and the crowd goes absolutely wild. Ryan and Jess recognise it, MK's been teasing this song for some weeks and so many people were waiting for the release

Pass it
I can pass it
Can you pass it?

The doors open and Ryan sees MK and her dance crew emerge. Much to her surprise, Sophie is a part of the crew "gosh, I learn something new about this woman every day"

Talk to me nice, talk to me dirty
Can you pass it?
I can pass it

As the performance goes on, Jess and Ryan watch in awe. Jordan's screaming and following the dance moves. Ryan shouts over the music

I'm in the 488, yeah, I'm floating
Tryna put that shit in motion, yeah

Ryan: YOU DANCE TOO?!!

Jordan just nods to the beat of the music and smiles whilst copying the arm movements of the routine

They finish their routine and welcome everybody to the dance floor whilst the song keeps playing. The energy in the room almost feels like the night's just started

Sophie appears from behind, still in her dance outfit. Holding her hand out to Ryan, "A dance?", Ryan nods, turns her clutch into an across the body bag and steps unto the dance floor with Sophie, Jordan and Jess joining them shortly after.

...

Talk to me nice, talk to me dirty
Can you pass it?
I can pass it

Ryan and Sophie dance the night away with each other and everyone else. This is definitely gonna hurt in the morning.

Sophie doesn’t say anything. She had already connected to the radio via Bluetooth. 

The opening bars of Mariah Carey’s Fantasy came pumping out of the speakers. 

Ryan immediately reacted, “woooo!,” she started rolling her hips in her chair, smiling and rapping along with ODB. She is getting completely caught up in the lyrics as Sophie is mesmerized by watching Ryan let loose and enjoy her song choice.

Yo, New York in the house (come on)

Is Brooklyn in the house? (That's right)

Uptown in the house (let's go)

Shaolin, are you in the house? (Don't stop)

Boogie Down, are you in the house? (Yeah)

Sacramento in the house (I like that)

Atlanta, Georgia, are you in the house? (Come on)

West Coast, are you in the house?

Japan, are you in the house?

Everybody, are you in the house?

Ryan started rapping to Sophie and dancing in her direction. 

Baby, baby, come on

Baby, come on, baby, come on (Bad Boy)

Ryan was about to release the emergency brake when Sophie began to sing. 

Oh, when you walk by every night

Talkin' sweet and lookin' fine

Excerpt:
“You’re about to dance with me.” Sophie blushed, took Ryan’s hands, and stood up.

“You’re surprisingly declarative Ryan Wilder.”

The opening note chords of the song come billowing out of the speakers and Sophie’s skin is instantly electrified. Syd’s Body is the song that came over the speakers. 

Drink in your glass

You drinking it fast

Sophie could feel her heart beating in her chest. Ryan held Sophie around her waist, pulling her in to dance with her. She felt Sophie take a quick sharp breath and then she turned around, swiftly but sensually pressing her ass back into Sophie while pulling the taller woman’s arms around her waist. Ryan was grinding back onto Sophie. It brought desire and confusion to the surface for her. It was a sudden and completely different, Ryan. But different from who? She hadn’t known Ryan that long. What was she assuming about the woman that immediately captivated her?

Give it to me don't hold back babe

If your friends could see you right now

No lying girl I bet they'd wanna be you right now

Your body's taking over you

Excerpt:
S: "Some rich people choose that lifestyle, and that's also part of what makes you the beautiful, compassionate, protector I love. If anyone deserves a night feeling like royalty, it's you, Ryan."

Ryan melts at that, and rubs her thumb over the hand she's holding. They reach the automatic doors, where a doorman is still waiting and greets them.

They enter a mood-lit lobby that's dark enough to feel like they're in for a good time but bright in places that accentuate the vibrant decor. There are turquoise and magenta rope lights woven through wall plants and patterns painted onto slate grey walls. With the low tones of "On It" by Jazmine Sullivan surrounding them through the speakers, it feels more like a nightclub than a hotel.

Excerpt:
He checks them in and gives them their keys, and they're off to the elevators, which are separated by which side of the tower and floors they ascend to. On each side, one elevator goes from floors 2 to 24. The other, which includes theirs, only stops at floors 25 to 30.

They step into the private box, where "Say It Again" by H.E.R. is playing, and begin the wait for the gradual climb to their floor. Ryan loses her cool. She drops the toy store bag, causing a small thud, and goes straight to Sophie, pressing her into the wall. She grabs Sophie's face, and pulls her into a deep kiss, as though they were in the middle of kissing and not just starting.

Excerpt:
Sophie kneeled in front of Ryan and took her hands into her own, placing them both in Ryan’s lap. She tried to make eye contact with Ryan. She didn’t want to push but she knew she needed to pull Ryan away from the dark place she was lost in. 

She walked to watch you with her head down low

She wondered if there's a way out of the blue

Who's gonna take her home this time

She knew that this time wouldn't be the last time

 

Sophie’s voice began low. She doesn’t know why she started singing or why Laura Mvula’s words came to mind. She could feel an overwhelming sadness in the space between, a sense of urgency to reach Ryan.

There she waits looking for a savior,

Someone to save her from her dying self

Always taking ten steps back and one step forward,

She's tired, but she doesn't stop

Ryan lowered her head meeting Sophie’s. She continued to sink deeper into Sophie’s body. Sophie reached her arms up, embracing Ryan as she fell into her. 

She don't stop, she don't stop, she don't stop

She don't stop, she don't stop, she don't stop

“Soph-”

“Yea.., baby.”

Excerpt:
“Sorry.” Alani said, “listen Mom would love anything you say. She already married you, you are just having a wedding. You can legit look at her and quote Yung Miami… ‘We go together, real bad’ and she will be weak in the knees.” Alani smirked




“I am not quoting Yung Miami to your mom. But I know you’re right but I want to go all out for her. She deserves it. Especially being with someone as difficult as me.” Ryan said sincerely 




“I understand. You will get it.” Alani said




They sat in silence as Ryan stared down at the blank paper. Alani got a text message, Ryan assumed from David and she gets up to leave.”




“Before I got, I got something for you. Grab your pen.” Alani says




Ryan grabs it and looks at her daughter 




“I got you babe, ‘Cause you got me, and baby, I got you” Alani laughed 




Ryan playfully pushed her




“I am not going to say Sonny and Cher lyrics to Sophie.” Ryan laughed, “You play entirely too much. Get outta here.”




“I’m leaving. I love you.” Alani said as she kissed the top of Ryan’s head




“I love you too.” Ryan smiled as Alani exited.

“I am not quoting Yung Miami to your mom. But I know you’re right but I want to go all out for her. She deserves it. Especially being with someone as difficult as me.” Ryan said sincerely

Excerpt:
“Are you nervous about tomorrow?”

“No,” a smile crept onto Ryan’s face as she remembered convincing Sophie to go camping with her for a weekend so they could watch the stars. It rained the entire time, and they toughed it out for one night until they gave up and made the drive back to Gotham. “I’m not nervous about marrying you.”

“You know most people might say that you running around Gotham in the batsuit the night before our wedding suggests otherwise.”

Ryan laughed, “But you’re not some people are you?”

“Luckily for you, I’m not.” They fell silent for a moment before Sophie finally spoke again. “So if you’re not nervous or getting cold feet, what are you doing on this side of town?”

“Why do birds, suddenly appear, every time you are near,” Ryan began singing, a smile tugging on her lips when Sophie burst into laughter. She heard movement on the other side, and she managed to get to her feet just in time for Sophie to open the door.

“Come here nerd,” Sophie pulled her into the room by the straps that held the cape. 

Before she could bring their lips together, Ryan leaned back, “Wait, is it cheating if you sleep with Batwoman the night before your wedding?”

“Who said anything about sleep?”
HTMLExcerpt:
“Are you nervous about tomorrow?”

“No,” a smile crept onto Ryan’s face as she remembered convincing Sophie to go camping with her for a weekend so they could watch the stars. It rained the entire time, and they toughed it out for one night until they gave up and made the drive back to Gotham. “I’m not nervous about marrying you.”

“You know most people might say that you running around Gotham in the batsuit the night before our wedding suggests otherwise.”

Ryan laughed, “But you’re not some people are you?”

“Luckily for you, I’m not.” They fell silent for a moment before Sophie finally spoke again. “So if you’re not nervous or getting cold feet, what are you doing on this side of town?”

“Why do birds, suddenly appear, every time you are near,” Ryan began singing, a smile tugging on her lips when Sophie burst into laughter. She heard movement on the other side, and she managed to get to her feet just in time for Sophie to open the door.

“Come here nerd,” Sophie pulled her into the room by the straps that held the cape. 

Before she could bring their lips together, Ryan leaned back, “Wait, is it cheating if you sleep with Batwoman the night before your wedding?”

“Who said anything about sleep?”
SongArtist: (They Long To Be) Close To You by Carpenters
SASW:
(They Long To Be) Close To You by Carpenters
Aftermath (Wildmoore) by WilderxMoore

Excerpt:
They slid out and made their way inside, and all Sophie could do was laugh.

"Welcome to the gayest prom to ever hit Gotham," Ryan announced, proudly.

"I can't believe you actually got other people to come, and got a DJ!" Sophie said, as Ryan led her to the table with the drinks and snacks.

"You had to get the full experience!"

"This is amazing, baby…" She took notice of all the detail that she had put into everything. With everything happening around her, Ryan never missed an opportunity to make time to show Sophie just how much she meant to her, and that meant the world to her. She pulled Ryan into her. "Now I want to dance with the prettiest girl at the prom."

"Sure Thing" by Miguel was blasting throughout the center. Sophie pulled Ryan to the floor with the small group that was there.

If you be the cash
I'll be the rubber band
You be the match
I will be a fuse

Sophie sang.

BOOM

Ryan completed the lyric holding her fingers in the air. She slid her arms around Sophie's neck, while Sophie held her around her waist.

Even when the sky comes falling
Even when the sun don't shine
I got faith in you and I
So put your pretty little hand in mine
Even when we're down to the wire baby
Even when it's do or die
We could do it baby, simple and plain
'Cause this love is a sure thing

Ryan and Sophie sang to each other. They held each other dancing so close, getting lost in their own little world during the song. The DJ switched the tempo playing Cuff It by Beyonce and they all ended up doing the tik tok dance that had been circulating. When Jordan got there, she took the liberty of spiking the punch which really turned up the vibes.

"This next song is a little sad but we still think you should find a dance partner and make some space anyway." Julia spoke into her own mic as she moved further to the front of the stage with her violin.

Sophie watched as that director offered her hand to Ryan for a dance. She suddenly had the overwhelming urge to change the song but unlike usual, Julia was leading and there wasn't really anything she could do about it.

Thought I found a way
Thought I found a way out (found)
But you never go away (never go away)
So I guess I gotta stay now

Was there anything to be jealous of? Knowing the conversation, or lack thereof, they had in the restroom. Probably not. And yet.

Isn't it lovely, all alone
Heart made of glass, my mind of stone
Tear me to pieces, skin to bone
Hello, welcome home

And yet, Sophie couldn't shake the feeling. Watching her hands slink around Ryan's waist. Her face do the same thing Sophie's does when she's near Ryan. The same thing Sophie's face is probably doing right now.

There was no way Ryan didn't know. There was no way Ryan didn't know what she did to the both of them.

We Shall Not Be Moved is the protest song based on I Shall Not Be Moved that was popularised during the Civil Rights Movement.

Excerpt:
A note on Mama Cora, Jada, and Sophie singing 'We Shall Not Be Moved" vs. Davis, Herman, and Irmilda singing "I Shall Not Be Moved".
I shall not Be Moved is an African-American/Negro Spiritual or slave jubilee song
We Shall Not Be Moved is the protest song based on I Shall Not Be Moved that was popularised during the Civil Rights Movement.
…
Davis and Herman had officially received word that they could start building in Maroon Lake. Davis, Herman, Irmilda, and around twelve others stood on what was mostly wooded land but there was a patch of mostly grass that seemed to be waiting for them.

“This will be our gathering place,” Davis said, “this is where we will come together, break bread, and commune with the ancestors. This is where we will sing, dance, and be joyful. This is where we will come for a blessing.”

Davis raised the tune,

“Well, Lord…”

Herman picked up the note, “I shall not be, I shall not be moved
I shall not be, I shall not be moved
Just like a tree that's growin' in the meadow”

“Down by the water,” Irmilda chimed

All together they sang, “I shall not be moved”

Davis and Herman had officially received word that they could start building in Maroon Lake. Davis, Herman, Irmilda, and around twelve others stood on what was mostly wooded land but there was a patch of mostly grass that seemed to be waiting for them.

“This will be our gathering place,” Davis said, “this is where we will come together, break bread, and commune with the ancestors. This is where we will sing, dance, and be joyful. This is where we will come for a blessing.”

Excerpt: Sophie takes the arm Ryan offers to her and they make their way to the dance floor. As they get on the floor, the orchestra begins to play “I Choose You” by Kiana Lede. Ryan can only smile at the irony of leading Sophie to the floor for this song. The two women find their way to the center of the floor, Ryan pulls Sophie into her body and gently rests her hands on the small of Sophie’s exposed back while Sophie slowly raises her arms to wrap around Ryan’s neck. The women begin to move together to the playing of the song. While moving, Ryan is savoring the feeling of having exposed skin against her hands. She revels in the feeling of how soft Sophie’s skin is. They continue to move and Ryan begins to lightly rub the skin under her thumb. This motion causes Sophie’s breath to hitch. Her skin begins to heat up and tingle with every touch that Ryan applies to her back. Sophie didn’t think that her lapse in steady breathing was that obvious, but then Ryan begins to pull Sophie into her body even tighter. With both women in heels, they are almost eye-to-eye, but for once Ryan has an inch or two on Sophie. Ryan looks at Sophie and says, “many other people have had the chance to touch you, but tell me, Miss Moore, does your body react like this to everyone?” Ryan’s comment challenging Sophie. The two women are so close that their bodies are basically connected and their faces only mere inches apart. Ryan now rearranges her hands a bit lower on Sophie’s back, interlacing her fingers. Again, Sophie's body deceives her, her breath catches again and comes out as a soft gasp. The want between the two women is palpable as the song continues.

Story: Save Batwoman Wildmoore Agenda - Where Did They All Go?
Excerpt:
“Language, language. Your mom is here.” Cluemaster said.

“Where is she?” Sophie yelled.

“Well, she’s right there.” Cluemaster said while pointing to the ceiling where Diane was tied up in a chair on the balcony rails. Her body was leaning forward and if Cluemaster cut the rope behind him that’s holding her steady then she would fall face first and most likely die.

Sophie tried to move again.

“Aht, Aht. If I cut this rope then Mommie Dearest goes bye bye bye.” Cluemaster said devilishly. “Hey, that’s a popular boy band from early 2000s. Any guesses?” Cluemaster said in his game show voice.

“What do you want?” Batwoman said.

Cluemaster made a buzzer sound with his mouth. “I’m sorry that’s wrong. The correct answer was N’Sync.”

Batwoman took a deep breath. “Once again. What do you want, Cluemaster?” Batwoman said.

“Batwoman, I just want to play a game or maybe give you some clues for you to solve.” Cluemaster said grinning. “Either way the ending results will be to die for.” He said while laughing.

Story: Wildmoore - A match made in Gotham.
Excerpt:
Half an hour later, around a quarter to 11:00, she made it back to the house where she walked in on Ryan giggling and teasing Sophie about something in the kitchen to Laura Mvula's 'Show Me Love' softly playing in the background. She could hear Sophie pleading "Yo! Can I cut my avocado in peace!? Who judges someone by the way they cut an avocado!?" from the entrance. Both of them were still in their pjs, standing by the kitchen island with Ryan's right hand resting around Sophie's waist.

Ryan was the first one to notice her walk in "Oooh okay! Good morning birthday girl!" Ryan said enthusiastically at the sight of her mom. 

Jada was wearing a simple but elegant and figure-fitting white pencil dress with a red belt matching the hue of her shiny Rouge H Porosus Crocodile Birkin bag and classic back red bottom stilettos. She sat her purse on the counter and walked toward them, bouquet in her hands "Good morning indeed beautiful people" she replied.

Excerpt:
‘We’re still in the middle of a zombie resurgence, so it would’ve been nice to have some back-up,’ Luke complained. Walking over to the desk he continued, ‘There was a report of a few of the undead congregating in an abandoned row house.’

“How many were there?” Ryan asked, placing her plate in the sink and kissing Sophie before Sophie walked out the door.

Looking out the window Luke replied, ‘In total there were 5; 2 with a weird Thriller limp and 3 wannabe track stars. I sedated and hauled them to the clinic.’ Luke took a seat and opened his laptop. ‘You sound cheerful. I guess you staying in kept Sophie pretty happy.’

Ryan grabbed her purse and lipstick and exited the apartment, “It sure did. I’m on my way.”

Excerpt:
‘Do you mind if I record this?’ Pam makes a show of placing her phone on the table between them, finger hovering over an imaginary button, though the screen is clearly locked. ‘Nay wants full details and it’s just going to be easier to play it back.’

Sophie just stops, white wine spritzer halfway to her pursed lips, glower held in place and focused intently.

‘Or you could just return a call or text – that might do it,’ Pam says with a smirk. ‘Come on, Soph; it’s been ages since you gave us anything to gossip about – you owe us.’

‘I’m not here for your entertainment.’

‘Okay, Pink.’
Sophie huffs, disguising the fact that she’s actually impressed by the swift reference, more so by the fact that she got it. She’ll have to remember to tell Ryan that her American popular culture knowledge isn’t as lacking as she mocks.

Excerpt:
Sophie stopped in the doorway to her bedroom, a smile appearing on her face as she watched Ryan with their daughter. She was lightly pacing the room as she sang to her. “You are my sunshine, my only sunshine, you make me happy when skies are grey, you’ll never know dear, how much I love you, so please don’t take my sunshine away,” Ryan lifted her arms a little higher, causing Cora to be closer to her, allowing her to lean her head down and place a soft kiss on her forehead. “Mama loves you so very much,” Ryan spoke softly. “My precious little darling,” Ryan walked over to the bassinet and gently lay Cora down. “You have a good sleep and Mama will see you for your next feed,” Ryan gently ran her hand over Cora’s forehead, Sophie smiling at the scene. Ryan looked up, seeing Sophie at the doorway. “What you looking at me like that for?”

“I just love watching you with her,” Sophie spoke quietly as she walked into the room, over to her wife. She glanced into the bassinet, Cora fast asleep. She smiled softly before she looked back up to Ryan. “It’s sweet to see.”

“Never, I was going to get started on breakfast, we didn’t exactly have dinner last night,” Sophie opened her eyes and pulled Ryan into her.

“Dinner is a relative term isn’t it,” Sophie kissed Ryan’s shoulder, and another stinging separation occurred between their lower extremities.

“Soph–,” Ryan didn’t want to say it.

“The blackberries may have been a bit much,” the two women giggled. Breakfast would become lunch as both women drifted back to sleep. 

You make it better, better, better 

Better than this and better than that

Better, better, better 

You make it better

Even though better aint the best

All of us are trying to just make it

Excerpt:
Sophie smiles against Ryan's lips, interrupting their kisses.

R: "What are you plotting now?"

S: "You didn't get a dance, tonight."

R: "We are not about to leave this room…"

S: "I agree…"

Sophie gently pushes Ryan off of her and guides her to the hotel's caramel colored leather couch, nudging her once more so she can take a seat. She pulls her phone out of her pocket, and quickly selects "Own It" by Drake. It starts slow, which lets Sophie strut around and pose a bit, smiling and being cute. The beat picks up, and she starts to dance a little more, bouncing, shaking, gradually spinning so Ryan can enjoy the views from different angles. With her back to Ryan, she widens her stance, drops lower, and twerks the way their dancer did for them.

Excerpt: The rest of the dinner was mundane with Imani sharing her plans for when she got back to Detroit and Ryan half-listening. When it came time for dessert, Ryan wasn’t on the same page as Imani. Instead, she spent the night reorganizing the plan for tomorrow’s first actual day with Sophie, her mentee. She remembered that Marquis had shared an audio recording of the woman singing lead on a choral rendition of Alicia Keys Fallin’. Ryan was stunned by what she heard. Our ears possess the secret ability to show us a person. There is something that sound transmits to the mind and heart that can only be felt. For the first time, Ryan’s protective core was cracked. She heard a talented, soulful person. She heard someone who knew her way around a musical note; she knew her way better than Ryan did. Ryan was now intimidated.

Song: Just a Closer Walk with Thee
HTMLExcerpt:
The song sheets were organized across by genre and within each genre alphabetically by artist and year. Sophie’s task was to choose songs that would fit Marquis’ vision for the choir. This vision was still vague to Sophie. She suspected this task was Ryan’s attempt to avoid any communication between them. In the 60s classic gospel section, Sophie found the song sheet for Mahalia Jackson’s version of ‘Just A Closer Walk With Thee . Sophie started humming the song to herself. Her eyes closed, tapping her foot to the melody, Sophie began to sing.

I am weak, but Thou art strong;

Jesus, keep me from all wrong;

I'll be satisfied as long

As I walk, let me walk close to Thee.

It’s Diane Moore’s favorite song. She played it every Sunday morning before church. I guess it would be the church woman’s equivalent of the song athletes play as they prepare to leave the tunnel for the championship game. It centered on Diane Moore. Seeing the title of the song brought her back to that moment when she didn’t doubt her mother’s love even though she didn’t fully understand it.
SongArtist: Just a Closer Walk with Thee by Mahalia Jackson
SASW:
Just a Closer Walk with Thee by Mahalia Jackson
Choir, Choir by WilderWriter24

Excerpt:
Sophie pulled out ‘CeCe Winans Mercy Said No’ , “This one is great but I can’t remember the melody.”

…
Ryan followed the notes on the sheet and softly hummed and then sang the first few lines. 

I was just a child when I felt the Savior leading

I was drawn to what I could not understand

By the time Ryan hit the end of the first line, her eyes were closed creating the opportunity for Sophie to see behind the irascible words she had been peppered with since they first came in contact with each other. Ryan’s face was soft, her body relaxed, her tone gentle. 

Mercy said no

I'm not going to let you go

I'm not going to let you slip away

You don't have to be afraid

Sophie almost immediately remembered the melody and jumped ahead to the chorus. Ryan opened her eyes and joined Sophie in singing the chorus. The women were facing each other, both lowering their shields for the few seconds that the chorus lasted. Their moment was interrupted by applause.

“Woo wee,” Marquis said opening the door to the choir room, “I was walking down the hallway and I heard the Lord being praised in song,” Ryan broke their gaze first, jumping like a woman caught doing something inappropriate, “if this is any indication, ‘The Healing Place’ choir is about to sit on the throne next to the King,” Marquis clapped and did a quick two-step.

Excerpt:
The three women
The three women piled into Iris’ car.

“She is lippy, huh?” Imani asked Ryan who was seated in the back of the car.

“Assured,” Ryan said defending Sophie. As Iris drove away, Ryan’s mind drifted to how she would explain what just happened to Sophie upon her return. Imani reached her hand back to hold her girlfriend’s in the backseat. Ryan, ‘Sophie’s mentor’, stared at hands, fingers interlaced with Imani’s, like a bridge over troubled waters .

Excerpt:
“I don’t know how I feel about the fact that you are choosing an actual work out over the Sophie Moore workout plan.” She joked, although she understood and she was all for helping get in some extra practice. 

 

“Stop it. I just really…I really need to be ready,” she stressed. “I know it might seem crazy, but I really feel lost not being able to just get out there and do my thing. So I don’t want to take any chances that this has to go on longer than it needs to.”

 

Sophie nodded. “I know. I know how much you love this, Ryan. She’s a runner, she’s a track star …” She teased attempting to make her smile, which she did. “But I get what this means to you, but just as passionate as you are about what you do, so I am. I promise you, Monday, you will be ready. You’ve followed my directions to a T, and I’m pretty good at what I do.” She chuckled. “You’re going to kill it,” Sophie assured her.

“Stop it. I just really…I really need to be ready,” she stressed. “I know it might seem crazy, but I really feel lost not being able to just get out there and do my thing. So I don’t want to take any chances that this has to go on longer than it needs to.”

 

Sophie nodded. “I know. I know how much you love this, Ryan. She’s a runner, she’s a track star …” She teased attempting to make her smile, which she did. “But I get what this means to you, but just as passionate as you are about what you do, so I am. I promise you, Monday, you will be ready. You’ve followed my directions to a T, and I’m pretty good at what I do.” She chuckled. “You’re going to kill it,” Sophie assured her.

Excerpt:
Her third year teaching post-graduate school had been a doozy, but she loved being able to teach and watch her students flourish throughout the school year. The end of the school year, however? They could keep that. While her principal would rather the teachers help the students 'finish strong' and continue assigning coursework through the last week of school, Ryan wholeheartedly believed that her kids deserved a break. So she and her co-teacher broke tradition and instead used the last week to meet with their students, go over the 'roses and thorns' of the school year, have an 'almost summer' party and watch movies. 

Her class had chosen Encanto for the third time that week and just as much as she was over the school year, she was over the family Madrigal (though, Surface Pressure still hit). She sat in the back and texted Imani, her co-teacher, that the students were almost done with the movie and to see if the pizza and snacks were being set up. Imani texted back in the affirmative and Ryan began quietly setting up the tables and chairs in the back of the classroom while her students were laid out on the rug.

Excerpt:
Tell me something new. Is Hocus Pocus your favorite movie? What's your favorite genre of film? Music? 

Ryan danced around the kitchen as she prepped the lentils for the bolognese she was finally getting around to making. 

It is! I love to laugh, so probably comedy. 90s R&B, hands down, is my favorite genre of music. The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill is my favorite album of all time. I almost named Win after Lauryn but that felt sacrilegious lol. 

Sophie took out her The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill vinyl and put it in the record player in the living room. Intro (Roll Call) began playing as she wrote back.

I love Lauryn, too. To Zion is my favorite track from the album. Whenever I listen to it, it makes me think about the future and what I want in my life. Makes me think I could be a mother and have a family some day.

Excerpt:
The DJ turned on Marquis’ entrance song: Joyful Noise by FLAME (instrumental). Marquis may have been progressive but one thing he couldn’t shake about being a Jet was the love of making an entrance. It benefited no one, least of all Marquis, to pretend that he didn’t enjoy the spotlight. He managed to balance this grand persona with charm and care. Marquis walked in jamming to the beats and showcasing his natural charisma. When he got to the center of the circle, he gave Iris a smile and a wink. He looked over to DJ Blessed who stopped the music. Marquis always took the time to connect with those who chose his church before leading worship.
(note the author referenced the instrumental version which is not on Spotify but can be found on youtube)
https://youtu.be/EfnbquiKk5M?si=-nyRh-XXeMmR_4cU

Excerpt: “Thank you to the good, Sis. I’m so proud to be participating in this program alongside so many others in our community. This worship room has been rejected by the ‘good Christians’”, pointing around the circle, “YOU have been rejected by the good Christians but the Parable of Wandering Sheep teaches, ‘ he is happier about that one sheep than about the ninety-nine that did not wander off. In the same way, your Father in heaven is not willing that any of these little ones should perish.’ Mary J. Blige said, ‘Just understand we’re all a work in progress.” We’re all a Work in Progress at The Healing Place; we are that one lost sheep that is how we stay connected to our purpose. Now I’m not going to tell you a story about how we’re going to save errbody cause people don’t get saved. People heal themselves and we create an environment to support that healing. Speaking of healing, I’m sure you’ve all had enough of my yapping let’s heal ourselves with some music. Ryan Wilder, this woman is like a sister to me in both loving and painful ways,” the congregation laughed, “but she has been working assiduously with a new intern here on The Healing Place Choir could be. They’re hosting auditions next week so we’re going to give DJ Blessed a little break so we can introduce you to Ryan’s singing voice. I know many of you are familiar with her sharp right hook,” Marquis chuckled, “and our choir lead Sophie Moore.”

Blige said, ‘Just understand we’re all a work in progress.” We’re all a Work in Progress at The Healing Place; we are that one lost sheep that is how we stay connected to our purpose. Now I’m not going to tell you a story about how we’re going to save errbody cause people don’t get saved. People heal themselves and we create an environment to support that healing. Speaking of healing, I’m sure you’ve all had enough of my yapping let’s heal ourselves with some music. Ryan Wilder, this woman is like a sister to me in both loving and painful ways,” the congregation laughed, “but she has been working assiduously with a new intern here on The Healing Place Choir could be. They’re hosting auditions next week so we’re going to give DJ Blessed a little break so we can introduce you to Ryan’s singing voice. I know many of you are familiar with her sharp right hook,” Marquis chuckled, “and our choir lead Sophie Moore.”
SongArtist: Work In Progress (Growing Pains) by Mary J. Blige
SASW:
Work In Progress (Growing Pains) by Mary J. Blige
Choir, Choir by WilderWriter24

Excerpt:
Ryan and Sophie sang a stripped-down version of the Jamaican Gospel Song Hold My Hands by Glacia Robinson. They delivered a soft R&B treatment to the song. Sophie was the vocal lead while Ryan harmonized with her on the chorus. 

My strength is surely failing

As trials come both left and right

And in the center, I'm now standing

Not a trace of hope in sight

And if tears were only raindrops

The universe would be flooded now

So Lord I call you today

Please don't pass me by

 

It was a deeply emotional selection veering from the upbeat nature of DJ Blessed and Marquis' song choices but Ryan wanted to showcase the range and tone of Sophie's voice. She needed a song that would let everyone hear the vocal cords that made it possible for her to finally see through the woman’s legal conviction and connect with her personal conviction. The song spoke to a yearning that each possessed— a yearning for different tellings of their own stories, their own humanity. If you can’t see the humanity in another person, it blocks the path to your own healing.

Choir, Choir by WilderWriter24

Excerpt:
The commotion settled down quickly as the chairs were filled and the meal was consumed. There was a little friendly banter shared. After the sun had set Uncle Bruce and Uncle Clarence wheeled out some speakers and old skool music flowed through the party. Sophie grabbed Ryan’s hand and pulled her onto the lawn as September by Earth, Wind, & Fire began. Most of the grown folks were up dancing to the music. It felt like they were at a family reunion/cookout. Ryan had never experienced this much joy with family. Finally, Sophie wasn’t hiding from herself and was able to just vibe with the people she loved. Unconsciously, Sophie leaned in and kissed Ryan chastely on her lips. The family again erupted into whistles and clapping. Sophie pulled back, grinning, “I love you, Ryan Wilder.” 

Ryan smirked a little, “I love you too, Sophie Moore.” Ryan could feel Sophie’s steady pulse in her neck. This was it. Sophie Moore was her “Happy Ever After” and she couldn’t ask for Moore.  

“Alright, old folks. I got something to get y’all up,” Uncle Clarence spoke into a microphone. He pressed a button and Get Down On It by Kool & The Gang floated out the speakers. 

Sophie & Ryan joined the Soul Train line that was formed by everyone. The song seemed to be irresistible to even the most fragile and frail knees and backs. Aunt Nancy scooted down the line. Shelly and Thomas hopped down the line never catching the beat. Ernestine and Ramona did their best Kid ‘n Play with Ramona almost knocking Aunt Simone over. When it came time for Sophie & Ryan to go, The Second Time Around by Shalamar was playing. Sophie did the Running Man and Ryan did The Robot. At the end of the line they questioned the other’s dance choice.  Many more songs played including Let’s Groove by Earth, Wind, & Fire, Before I Let Go by Maze featuring Frankie Beverly, as well as I’m Coming Out by Diana Ross. It wouldn’t be an authentic get-together without The Electric Slide by Marcia Griffiths. Sophie & Ryan couldn’t be happier.

“Alright, old folks. I got something to get y’all up,” Uncle Clarence spoke into a microphone. He pressed a button and Get Down On It by Kool & The Gang floated out the speakers. 

Sophie & Ryan joined the Soul Train line that was formed by everyone. The song seemed to be irresistible to even the most fragile and frail knees and backs. Aunt Nancy scooted down the line. Shelly and Thomas hopped down the line never catching the beat. Ernestine and Ramona did their best Kid ‘n Play with Ramona almost knocking Aunt Simone over. When it came time for Sophie & Ryan to go, The Second Time Around by Shalamar was playing. Sophie did the Running Man and Ryan did The Robot. At the end of the line they questioned the other’s dance choice.  Many more songs played including Let’s Groove by Earth, Wind, & Fire, Before I Let Go by Maze featuring Frankie Beverly, as well as I’m Coming Out by Diana Ross. It wouldn’t be an authentic get-together without The Electric Slide by Marcia Griffiths. Sophie & Ryan couldn’t be happier.
SongArtist: Electric Boogie by Marcia Griffiths
SASW:
Electric Boogie by Marcia Griffiths
Wildmoore Road Trip by Steffane1
Category: Family Gathering, Played, Party, Dancing, Slide Dance

Excerpt:
“How about you begin, Ray Ray?” Iris had heard enough.

Ray Ray delivered a beatbox rap that was clearly about Sophie. However, the table was not prepared for Ray Ray’s transition into an acapella version of Mario’s ‘Just A Friend. Ray Ray was always rapping and beatboxing but singing wasn’t something they did publicly. The trio at the table applauded Ray Ray.

“So Miss Sophie, think we could do a duet sometime,” Ray Ray said flirtatiously.

“I would really like that. Thanks for asking me,” Sophie replied with genuine appreciation, “but let’s duet for Jesus, okay.”

“I’ll sing to anybody as long as it’s with you.”

“Thanks, Ray Ray,” Ryan interjected.

“Damn, Miss Ryan, why you gotta be so jealous? I seen you.”

“Now Ray Ray, this is still a choir room in a place of worship,” Iris interrupted. Sophie was giggling to herself.

Excerpt:
Sophie makes her way back to her room and grabs her phone and backpack, and heads downstairs into the living room. She plops down on the couch and turns the TV on. She simultaneously flips through channels, while also mindlessly scrolling through Instagram before checking the time again.

"Jordan! Come on you have 5 minutes!" Sophie yells. In almost record time, Jordan runs downstairs with her uniform untucked, braids hanging down around her face, and her backpack on her back. Sophie chuckles at the sight of her sister as she turns the TV off. "Please get yourself together before we leave this house, I can't be driving a hooligan around." Sophie says while shaking her head with a smile.

Jordan tucks her shirt into her skirt and puts her braids into two ponytails with two braids hanging down. Sophie walks to the front door and puts on white Air Force 1's, while Jordan puts on black and yellow Jordan 1's to match her uniform. Sophie grabs her backpack and the keys to her 2020 Camry TRD off the key holder and they make their way to her car. As soon as the pair get into the car, Jordan reaches for the aux cord and Sophie puts her hand out to stop her. "If you play any of that mumble rap stuff, your aux privileges will be limited." Sophie says sternly. "Noted." Jordan smiles as she plugs her phone in. 20 Something by SZA starts blasting through the speakers as Sophie backs out of the driveway and drives out of the neighborhood.

Excerpt:
Ryan’s arm snakes around her waist, hand coming to rest on her stomach, pulling her closer. Her breath is hot against Sophie’s ear, her chest expanding against her as she licks her lips and leans in a little closer.  

‘They’re playing Christmas songs, babe. Not sure you’re going to be able to grind to Jingle Bell Rock.’ She stifles a laugh, nuzzling into Sophie’s neck.  

Sophie shrugs out of her hold, turning to face her, stroking her index finger upwards from throat to chin in a way that silences the shorter woman.  

‘Watch me.’
HTMLExcerpt:

‘They’re playing Christmas songs, babe. Not sure you’re going to be able to grind to Jingle Bell Rock.’ She stifles a laugh, nuzzling into Sophie’s neck.  

Sophie shrugs out of her hold, turning to face her, stroking her index finger upwards from throat to chin in a way that silences the shorter woman.  

‘Watch me.’
