Excerpt:
Ryan nodded. “That’s great. So, what is this new direction you will be taking when writing your book?” She asked.

Sophie shrugged. “Honestly, I don’t know. I had an idea but now I’m not sure so I’m waiting for inspiration to strike.” She said. “What about you? You take pictures but what do you know about writing?”

"Set the tone, when it's just me

And you alone, never lonely

In the room, breathin' slowly

Oh, you know me, yeah

Meditate, you can take me

To a place where we can be

All alone, I let you hold me

'Cause you know me, yeah”

Sophie was impressed. “Oh wow…that’s you?” She said.

“Nah…that’s H.E.R.” Ryan said laughing as Sophie stopped walking to shake her head. “I love her music.” She said.

“See, you play to much.” Sophie said.

Excerpt:
Sophie and Ryan arrived to Sanctuary and the band was in full swing. Luckily rain didn’t hit that side of town as of yet so everything was dry so it was a lot of people outside enjoying the music.

Sophie wasted no time as she pulled Ryan onto the makeshift dance floor and held her close. Sophie put her hand on Ryan’s waist while Ryan hands intertwined around Sophie’s neck. The band seemed to be on the break as the local DJ started playing Jazmine Sullivan’s “On It.”

I want to sit on it

So tell me why you deserve it

Come on and prove (prove)

Why I should move

Spit on it

I need more than a text message

You gon' have to pull off somethin' impressive

Curves got you drivin' reckless

Take this water and hydrate, bitch

I want to sit on it (baby, baby, baby)

But tell me why you deserve it

Come on and prove (come on and prove)

Why I should move

I, I, I'll spit on it (yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)

'Cause I heard some freaky shit 'bout you

So let me see what that mouth do

'Cause baby it's not that easy to please me

Yeah, I need it, yeah, I need more attention

With different positions (oh, oh, oh)

Sophie and Ryan moved in sync with the song as Sophie pulled Ryan closer looking down at the shorter woman. Ryan didn’t want to look into Sophie’s eyes because she knew once she did then she would be lost in her light brown eyes. Ryan opted to turn her body so that her back was touching Sophie’s front. Sophie accepted the new position as her arms held Ryan’s waist and her face was buried in neck. Ryan extended her arm behind her to reach around Sophie’s neck to pull her closer. Sophie took that as an invitation to plant light kisses on her neck which caused Ryan’s eyes to drift close to relish the feeling of being kissed. Ryan and Sophie stayed like that for awhile dancing to multiple songs before they both suggested to go home.

Excerpt:
Jada walked in the room happy to see that Sophie is doing better than before.




“Sorry I took to long, the line was long and then the drive-thru worker recognized me” Jada said, “Anyways, what’s got you two laughing?”




“I brought up Ryan’s and Soph’s upcoming wedding and then we got on the topic of Sophie’s disastrous first wedding.” Jordan laughed




“It wasn’t that bad” Sophie lied




“She’s lying. Tell me about it.” Jada smirked




“Not much to tell. It rained, the minister was late, their group of bridesmaids and groomsmen got mono, Sophie’s dress was ruined, Tyler had to wear an eyepatch…it was definitely giving Deathstroke vibes and if that wasn’t good enough signs for Sophie not to marry Tyler. She fucked up her vowels and sung a very horrible version of ‘You Mean the World to Me’.” Jordan said




Sophie groaned upon hearing the shortened version of her fist wedding.




“The Toni Braxton song?” Jada asked




“Yes,” Sophie sighed, “I awkwardly sang to Tyler. He found it cute. I was embarrassed.” 




“Well, this time around you won’t be embarrassed. I will give you and Ryan all the money and whatever you need. I’ll even share Damien.” Jada smiled
HTMLExcerpt:
Jada walked in the room happy to see that Sophie is doing better than before.

 

“Sorry I took to long, the line was long and then the drive-thru worker recognized me” Jada said, “Anyways, what’s got you two laughing?”

 

“I brought up Ryan’s and Soph’s upcoming wedding and then we got on the topic of Sophie’s disastrous first wedding.” Jordan laughed

 

“It wasn’t that bad” Sophie lied

 

“She’s lying. Tell me about it.” Jada smirked

 

“Not much to tell. It rained, the minister was late, their group of bridesmaids and groomsmen got mono, Sophie’s dress was ruined, Tyler had to wear an eyepatch…it was definitely giving Deathstroke vibes and if that wasn’t good enough signs for Sophie not to marry Tyler. She fucked up her vowels and sung a very horrible version of ‘You Mean the World to Me’.” Jordan said

 

Sophie groaned upon hearing the shortened version of her fist wedding.

 

“The Toni Braxton song?” Jada asked

 

“Yes,” Sophie sighed, “I awkwardly sang to Tyler. He found it cute. I was embarrassed.” 

 

“Well, this time around you won’t be embarrassed. I will give you and Ryan all the money and whatever you need. I’ll even share Damien.” Jada smiled
SongArtist: You Mean the World to Me by Toni Braxton
StoryWriter: Ryan Wilder, The Batwoman by FuegoCreativeFlow

You Mean the World to Me by Toni Braxton

Excerpt:
●Ed Sheeran's Perfect is played●

Ryan and Sophie emerge from opposite sides, meeting Luke in the middle. They both chuckle slightly as they take in the sight of one another. Of course their dresses are similar.

Sophie has on a fitted mermaid dress with a light champaign undertone, A slight sweetheart neckline. Lace covered Sophie's arms, the flowery patterns light and delicate. As she walked, the whole dress shimmered as light bounces off the tiny swarovski crystals all over her. The lace of her veil matches that of the train on her dress.

Ryan also opted for a fitted mermaid dress, also with a light champagne undertone. A deep V cut stops just above her belly button with lace off the shoulder sleeves. Her dress almost looks painted on the way it hugs hips. The transition into her laced train starts just above her knees, specs of crystals shimmer all over the bottom of her dress. Deeper lace in the shape of hearts dotted all around it. Her veil covers her face, also a light champagne colour with specs of glitter all of over.

They both were relieved that they opted to have their veils cover their faces until they got to Iris. Their tears threaten to do away with their make-up, knowing in just a few moments they'll be Mrs and Mrs Moore.

Ryan also opted for a fitted mermaid dress, also with a light champagne undertone. A deep V cut stops just above her belly button with lace off the shoulder sleeves. Her dress almost looks painted on the way it hugs hips. The transition into her laced train starts just above her knees, specs of crystals shimmer all over the bottom of her dress. Excerpt:
"With everything happening in Gotham lately and the clear distrust that people are voicing against law enforcement...can you believe that one of them suggested that Wayne sponsored an ad à la Kendall and Pepsi with members of the public AND The Crows holding hands and basically singing kumbaya while fawning over our latest car model?!" Ryan complained. She walked over to sit on Sophie's lap who was going through confidential documents on the couch in the lounge area of her rather large and high-ceiling office. Jada was set to leave the country soon on a last minute international trip so she was prepping the details for it. 

"That...doesn't surprise me one bit" Sophie calmly stated as Ryan paused, settling in her arms.

Excerpt:
They walked in to the sound of Stevie Wonder's 'Happy Birthday' blasting in the background accompanied by a choir of "HAPPY BIRTHDAY RYAN" screams that greeted them along with exploding confettis, vuvuzela-like sounds, with a wine-red cloud erupting from one of the smoke bombs Luke just launched.

Ryan was visibly but pleasantly startled. "Aaargh you guys! What is all this?! I thought we were just having dinner!"

Before she could process the rest of her thoughts, Mary jumped out first from the small crowd at the entrance and hugged her. Then proceeded to coronate her with a golden crown that read 'Birthday Girl' and dawn her with a black sash that read the same thing in sparkly rose gold writing. 

"There she is! There's my birthday girl!!" Mary exclaimed as she finished putting the sash on.

Ryan was visibly but pleasantly startled. "Aaargh you guys! What is all this?! I thought we were just having dinner!"

Before she could process the rest of her thoughts, Mary jumped out first from the small crowd at the entrance and hugged her. Then proceeded to coronate her with a golden crown that read 'Birthday Girl' and dawn her with a black sash that read the same thing in sparkly rose gold writing. 

"There she is! There's my birthday girl!!" Mary exclaimed as she finished putting the sash on.

Excerpt:
The night was electric. They enjoyed a dinner filled with laughter, clanking glasses, wishes made for the year to come, pictures and videos to commemorate the special moments-at the booth or with their phones, and more clanking of glasses as the red wine and champagne bottles kept flowing to the table. When Ryan heard one of her favourite Beyoncé songs 'Schoolin Life' start, she immediately got up reciting it word for word with everyone hyping her up. Then as the song transitioned to 'Party', another one of her favourite tracks from the same album, she motioned for everyone to get up and follow her to the dance floor, which they all swiftly and happily obliged. 

Sophie took her hand and started singing out loud "I may be young but I'm ready...to give you all my love..." to Ryan following with "I told my girls you can get it...don't slow it down, just let it go". Then in unison as Ryan brought them closer and wrapped Sophie around herself with her back to Sophie's chest "so in looove I'll give it all away..."

Excerpt: With their glasses all raised, Jada toasted "Here's to my beautiful baby who's now a wonderful human being forging a path of her own with no better chosen family than you all. To creating memories together that will last a lifetime. To building stronger relationships with one another with love at the center. To another year around the sun and many more. Cheers and happy birthday babygirl! I love you! We love you!" As Jada uttered the last sentence, the rest of the room joined in simultaneously in "we love you Ryan!" screams and cheers followed by a bunch of "wooo" and the chorus of Will Smith's 'Getting Jiggy Wit It' blasting through the speakers, prompting all of them to do the dance. Moments later, Luke opened another smoke bomb to everyone's excitement. He was having too much fun with these throughout the night.

Excerpt:
“This is a nice surprise. What are you doing here?”

“I can’t come and hang with my little sister?”

Jordan gave her a pointed look.

“Okay, fine. I need something to do.”

“What? No hot heiress to protect today?”

Sophie rolled her eyes.

“Come on, update! You’re living a fairytale right now. I need details!”

“Stop”

“But don’t make me close one more door,” Jordan began to dramatically clutch her heart as if she was performing on Broadway. “I don’t wanna hurt anymore. Stay in my arms if you dare. Or must I imagine you there.”

“This is not a Whitney Houston film,” Sophie cut her off.

“Come on, Soph. I know when you like someone.”

“Nope. I am simply doing my job and that is it. Nothing is going to happen between me and Ryan Jet.”

“Uh huh,” Jordan did not look convinced, but decided to go easy on her older sister.

“I can’t come and hang with my little sister?”

Jordan gave her a pointed look.

“Okay, fine. I need something to do.”

“What? No hot heiress to protect today?”

Sophie rolled her eyes.

“Come on, update! You’re living a fairytale right now. I need details!”

“Stop”

“But don’t make me close one more door,” Jordan began to dramatically clutch her heart as if she was performing on Broadway. “I don’t wanna hurt anymore. Stay in my arms if you dare. Or must I imagine you there.”

“This is not a Whitney Houston film,” Sophie cut her off.

“Come on, Soph. I know when you like someone.”

“Nope. I am simply doing my job and that is it. Nothing is going to happen between me and Ryan Jet.”

“Uh huh,” Jordan did not look convinced, but decided to go easy on her older sister.
SongArtist: I Have Nothing by Whitney Houston
SASW:
I Have Nothing by Whitney Houston
The Bodyguard by ThatScottishclown

Excerpt:
Sophie stared at the ingredients in front of her as if they were the enemy. She wasn't lying; the recipe she found seemed simple enough, but now that the ingredients were in front of her, she was feeling overwhelmed. 

"Come on, Moore. They're vegetables. How hard can it be to prepare vegetables?"

It turned out that while they were easy to prep, they were even easier to burn in the oven. She'd gotten caught up in finding an outfit for the night when she remembered that she wouldn't technically be seeing Ryan. By the time she realized that, the sweet potatoes had been in the oven too long and were burnt but edible. Luckily, the rest of the vegetables fared much better and the dish was salvaged. 

She grabbed her blanket, phone, and cooler before walking out to the dock, Win trailing behind her. She sat her phone and cooler down before spreading the blanket out for her and Win. She sat and took their dishes out - chicken and rice for Win - and then took the wine and a glass out. She shuffled her playlist and poured a glass of wine before taking her own dish out. As she ate, she imagined that she was sitting with Ryan, hopefully providing her with comfort. Soon enough, the sun was setting as Nothing Even Matters by Lauryn Hill ft. D'Angelo played. Sophie couldn't help but think it was perfect. She said a prayer for Mama Cora and Ryan before packing up her things and taking them back in the house. Win was curled up on the couch next to her as she took out her notepad and pen. 

I wish I could've really been with you tonight. You and Mama Cora were in my heart. As the sun was setting, Nothing Even Matters was playing and I wanted more than anything to be able to kiss you.

I feel…a lot for you, Ryan. Part of me feels foolish for falling for you because how could we even be together?

Ryan gasped at Sophie's note. The previous night, right as the sun began to set, Nothing Even Matters played from her cell phone. Before she passed, her mama stressed to her that nothing was more important than love and sharing one's gifts with the world. She thought that particular song playing while the sun set was a fitting tribute for her and her lessons. Reading Sophie's note made her think that it was more for them than it was for her mama. 

She'd cried while making the Buddha bowl, wishing that she could've been making it for both her and her mother rather than just for herself. It hurt her heart to think of eating her mama's favorite meal without her. But then she thought about Sophie and how she was sharing the same meal by request. How she'd asked Ryan if she could join her in honoring her mama, years apart. She again thought back to her conversation with Luke. 

My mama used to say that love knows no space or time. I'd like to think she's right.

Excerpt: Sophie linked her arm through her mother’s as the violinist and keyboardist simultaneously started to play an instrumental version of Certain Things by James Arthur. Diane squeezeed her arm, trying and failing to hide the watering of her eyes. Sophie bent and kissed her mother’s cheek before smiling ahead of her as Jordan takes her place at the altar and smiled back in her yellow bridesmaid’s dress. Not smiled. Beamed: the biggest, cheesiest grin that she’s ever seen on her sister’s face which made her shake slightly with laughter. In her other hand, she held her small bouquet of white lilies. A very simple arrangement that she’d let Ryan pick out for her, since she was not too knowledgable about flowers. Diane held her arm as she practically floated down the aisle, the train of her dress gliding along behind her. She watched as the entirety of the wedding stood together at once as she made her way toward the altar.

Excerpt:
The keyboardist started an intro to the song Ryan chose, that Sophie wasn’t privy too. As the violinist adjusted her microphone and started singing softly, Sophie turned her head to the musicians, not realizing that Ryan had chosen a song with vocals, or that the violinist could also sing. She should have known that there would be a few extra surprises. It was to be expected when your wife was also the wedding planner.

 

Your smile, your voice
Creeps inside my heart with everythin' you do
I have no choice
Lovin' you is all that I know how to do…

 

Her attention quickly turned back to the center of the rows of seating to her soon-to-be wife who had just started to walk down the aisle. She lost all sense of sound, the lyrics faded, the excitement and emotion, spread a warmth through her chest while her lips parted slightly at the vision of Ryan walking toward her, smiling that smile. The one that she reserved for Sophie and only Sophie.

Excerpt:
“Soph?” Sophie looked up to find her fiancé eyeing her curiously. “Where did you just go?”

 

“I was trying to think… about our song. Do we have a song?” She repeated the question back, searching Ryan’s eyes for answers.

 

“We have many songs; I just don’t know which one is THE song.” Ryan looks down, scrolling through her Spotify playlists.

 

“Let’s test some out.” Sophie swung her legs off the bed, laying her book down on the side table, smirking at the look of confusion on her fiancé’s face. Sophie gently pried the clipboard out of her hands and placed it on the nightstand. She grabbed Ryan’s hands and pulled her up from the bed, moving her hands around her neck. She took her phone to choose a song.

 

“Hmm…what about H.E.R.?” She clicked on the song and set Ryan’s phone down on the nightstand.

Oh, hey  

Sophie leaned in and sang softly as they swayed together.

You don't know, babe
When you hold me
And kiss me slowly
It's the sweetest thing  

Ryan scrunched her face as Sophie kissed her softly on her nose.

Excerpt:
The piano introduction started playing softly. Sophie gained her confidence as she slowly forgot about the guests that were watching to focus on her beautiful wife and the song, they had chosen together that night as they slow danced in their bedroom.  

 

Ryan reached up to clasp the back of Sophie’s neck while Sophie wrapped her hands around Ryan’s waist to settle on the small of her back. They smiled at each other and swayed in slow circles around the dance floor.

 

It's undeniable that we should be together
It's unbelievable how I used to say that I'd fall never
The places you need to know, if you don't know just how I feel
Then let me show you now that I'm for real
If all things in time, time will reveal


Ryan pulled one of her hands down from behind her wife’s head to hold up her index finger as she sang the words along with the song.

 

One, you're like a dream come true

 

She added her middle finger, continuing her serenade.


Two, just wanna be with you

 

Her newly double-ringed ring finger joined next.


Three, girl, it's plain to see

 

She poked her wife in the chest with her index finger as she laughed lightly at Ryan’s performance.


That you're the only one for me

 

Ryan held up four fingers. Still singing.


And four, repeat steps one through three

 

Sophie gently swatted her hand away and held up her own with all five fingers up and sang the next line, laughing at Ryan’s shocked, yet impressed expression.


Five, make you fall in love with me…

The piano introduction started playing softly. Sophie gained her confidence as she slowly forgot about the guests that were watching to focus on her beautiful wife and the song, they had chosen together that night as they slow danced in their bedroom.  

 

Ryan reached up to clasp the back of Sophie’s neck while Sophie wrapped her hands around Ryan’s waist to settle on the small of her back. They smiled at each other and swayed in slow circles around the dance floor.

 

It's undeniable that we should be together
It's unbelievable how I used to say that I'd fall never
The places you need to know, if you don't know just how I feel
Then let me show you now that I'm for real
If all things in time, time will reveal

Ryan pulled one of her hands down from behind her wife’s head to hold up her index finger as she sang the words along with the song.

 

One, you're like a dream come true

 

She added her middle finger, continuing her serenade.

Two, just wanna be with you

 

Her newly double-ringed ring finger joined next.


Three, girl, it's plain to see

 

She poked her wife in the chest with her index finger as she laughed lightly at Ryan’s performance.


That you're the only one for me

 

Ryan held up four fingers. Still singing.


And four, repeat steps one through three

 

Sophie gently swatted her hand away and held up her own with all five fingers up and sang the next line, laughing at Ryan’s shocked, yet impressed expression.


Five, make you fall in love with me…

 

After the first chorus, Ryan and Sophie both sang to each other, foreheads pressed together as they continued to sway slowly around the dance floor until the last chorus was almost finished. Sophie pulled back, putting only a few small steps between them and raised her arm to spin her wife under their joined hands before dipping her backward, earning a surprised gasp from Ryan. Sophie leaned over her, holding her lower back and pressed a soft kiss on her slightly parted lips. They both smile into the kiss before Sophie pulled her back up to wrap her arms around her waist again.


…Then I start back at one

 

As the song came to an end, Sophie leaned down and smiled hard into Ryan’s neck as her wife laughed and held her close for another moment before they both shyly looked around at all of their friends and family members wiping tears from their eyes and cheeks.

Excerpt:
Sophie had stepped off of the dance floor for a moment to say goodbye to one of the older couples, she had invited from her latest project, who confessed it was getting a bit late for them to be out. She hugged them each and thanked them for coming and immediately turned her attention back to the dance floor where her wife was dancing with Jordan, Mary, Luke, Diane, Kat and Cora to Love On Top by Beyonce.

 

The moment she caught her eyes, and she couldn’t help the smile on her lips when Ryan pointed to her just as Beyonce started singing:

 

Baby, baby I can hear the wind whipping past my face
As we dance the night away
And boy your lips taste like a night of champagne
As I kiss you again and again and again and again

 

Ryan rotated her arms and index fingers, beckoning her wife to come back to dance with her. Sophie couldn’t help but stare with pure adoration on her face for a second longer before slowly making her way back toward her wife. Her wife. She would never get tired of saying that, thinking it or hearing it. Satisfied that Sophie was coming back to her, Ryan had started singing to her again when she was about halfway, pointing at her again as she swayed her hips back and forth without breaking eye contact.

Excerpt:
“I now pronounce you wife and wife, you may kiss your bride.” Luke said as he officiated their wedding after becoming ordained.

Ryan and Sophie both stepped closer in their wedding gowns and kissed passionately and embraced as the crowd cheered on. They smiled at each other as they walked down the aisle hand in hand as Mrs. Wilder-Moore.

After a million pictures that the brides and the wedding party took Ryan and Sophie were ready for the reception to begin so that they could dance with family and each other.

The couple walked inside the ballroom which was turned into their reception as the DJ called out. “Everyone get out your seats and give it up for Mrs. Ryan and Sophie Wilder-Moore.” He said as the crowd cheered. The DJ then went on to play “A Couple of Forevers” by Chrisette Michele.

I see it clear, my heart is here

We got each other, let's take it from there

And if I could, I'd love you a forever at time, oh, oh

What we've been through, no one else knows

'Cause all that matters is how far this goes

And it will go until it starts again, oh

Me and you are built like armor

Nothing can't stop love from loving on us

And I'm not asking for much

Just a couple of forevers

A couple of forevers

I'm the only one, you're the only one

Together 'til never

Ryan and Sophie swayed to the song as they looked deeply into each other eyes. Sophie smiled and chuckled as her wife arched an eyebrow. “What are you laughing at?” Ryan said.

Sophie made a motion with her hand. “All of this. It’s funny that we were married six months ago and no one knew but you and me.” Sophie said.

Ryan smiled as she remembered that night on the couch six months ago.

Excerpt:
“I have a confession to make,” Sophie rushed out. She didn’t give Ryan a chance to ask anything before she was spilling. “I intentionally misled you into thinking the dinner was earlier than it was. I told you that I would pick you up at five, but the dinner isn’t actually until later.”

“Okay?” Ryan smiled, still confused. “You wanted to spend more time with me, I’m assuming?” She wasn’t mad about more time with Sophie. They talked a lot on the phone, but being alone together in person was far less common. Something about being physically in her presence, being able to touch her… it hit different.

“No. Well, yes, but there’s a part two to my confession.”

“Okay, Usher,” Ryan joked, and when Sophie cracked a smile, she considered it a win.
HTMLExcerpt:
“I have a confession to make,” Sophie rushed out. She didn’t give Ryan a chance to ask anything before she was spilling. “I intentionally misled you into thinking the dinner was earlier than it was. I told you that I would pick you up at five, but the dinner isn’t actually until later.”

“Okay?” Ryan smiled, still confused. “You wanted to spend more time with me, I’m assuming?” She wasn’t mad about more time with Sophie. They talked a lot on the phone, but being alone together in person was far less common. Something about being physically in her presence, being able to touch her… it hit different.

“No. Well, yes, but there’s a part two to my confession.”

“Okay, Usher,” Ryan joked, and when Sophie cracked a smile, she considered it a win.

Excerpt:
During the night, their positions changed and Ryan ended up holding Sophie. The bright sun shining through Ryan's sheer curtains woke her and she blinked her eyes open. She took in the unfamiliar surroundings and saw Win still asleep in her bed. She felt Ryan's legs tangled with hers and the smaller woman's hand holding tightly onto her shirt.

"Not a dream," she said softly to herself. During her wait to meet Ryan, she would dream about what it would be like to wake up with her. Reality proved much better than her dreams. She turned away from the window and sunlight to face Ryan who was still asleep. Ryan shuffled until Sophie was laying on her back and Ryan could lay on top of her, head tucked under Sophie's chin. Sophie was unsurprised to discover Ryan was a koala in disguise. She kissed her forehead before drifting off back to sleep.

She awoke again to the smell of bacon frying and Chaka Khan and Rufus playing in the kitchen. She used the restroom and brushed her teeth before grabbing a fluffy robe she found in Ryan's closet. She followed Ryan's off-key rendition of 'Aint Nobody' to the kitchen where she found her love dancing and singing to the music. Sophie looked at the spread on the counter: sweet potato pancakes, eggs, bacon, vegan sausage, and a fruit salad. Ryan had just removed the last piece of bacon from the pan when she turned around and startled at finding Sophie in the kitchen.

She took in the unfamiliar surroundings and saw Win still asleep in her bed. She felt Ryan's legs tangled with hers and the smaller woman's hand holding tightly onto her shirt.

"Not a dream," she said softly to herself. During her wait to meet Ryan, she would dream about what it would be like to wake up with her. Reality proved much better than her dreams. She turned away from the window and sunlight to face Ryan who was still asleep. Ryan shuffled until Sophie was laying on her back and Ryan could lay on top of her, head tucked under Sophie's chin. Sophie was unsurprised to discover Ryan was a koala in disguise. She kissed her forehead before drifting off back to sleep.

She awoke again to the smell of bacon frying and Chaka Khan and Rufus playing in the kitchen. She used the restroom and brushed her teeth before grabbing a fluffy robe she found in Ryan's closet. She followed Ryan's off-key rendition of 'Aint Nobody' to the kitchen where she found her love dancing and singing to the music. Sophie looked at the spread on the counter: sweet potato pancakes, eggs, bacon, vegan sausage, and a fruit salad. Ryan had just removed the last piece of bacon from the pan when she turned around and startled at finding Sophie in the kitchen.

Excerpt:
It was finally the day they all have been waiting for 




The Bachelorette Party!!




Iris and Mary were in charge of planning it and it was going to be wild. 




They knew that both Ryan and Sophie loved P-Valley and they knew both ladies met in a “creative” way to put it…nicely. 




Gotham isn’t the most normal place on the planet but they found away to make it fun. They were going to give the ladies the “Mercedes Experience” mixed in with an escape room. 




Ryan and Sophie had no idea what their friends were playing but they were excited.

...

The ladies arrived at the Gotham Get Out…a very cool exclusive escape room. It was originally designed by The Riddler but after he was taken down, Gotham thought “why not make this place an actual place of fun for people of Gotham and tourists.” 




Thanks to Mary renting out the place, the workers designed it to mimic the PYNK, the strip club from the show P-Valley. It was going to be quite the fun.




“Oh my God!” Sophie said shocked




“You guys didn’t!” Ryan screamed




“Down in the Valley…” Iris said




“Where the girls get naked” Mary finished as she and Iris high fived




“There are unlimited drinks and yes, before you ask Ry, there will be a Mercedes Experience.” Iris smiled




“I love you.” Ryan said, “I love you both.”




“Let’s get started.” Mary smiled

Excerpt:
Sophie heard the shower turn on. She stood up and paced her room. Then she went to her drawer and pulled out her clothes for sleeping in. Sometimes she liked to sleep in just her panties but she had company so she figured she’d put some more clothes on and opted for her silk shorts and top PJ set. Sophie’s mind wandered to breakfast. She didn’t have much of anything that Ryan could eat and she didn’t want her waking up hungry. Sophie’s mom taught her better than to let guests starve. Maybe she could slip out in the morning and go pick up some stuff.

R: Aint nobody love me better da da da! Makes me happy, makes me feel this way!

So, Ryan likes to sing in the shower. Sophie thought to herself and laughed fondly at hearing Ryan’s loud and off-key notes coming from the bathroom. Sophie lied back on her bed and put her hands behind her head on the pillow as she listened to more random songs that Ryan was belting out from the shower.

Excerpt:
The song ends, and Sophie feels like the DJ must have it out for her because the next song is Kehlani - Can I. Ryan turns in Sophie’s arms again with a mischievous grin on her face because she knows how Sophie feels about Kehlani and how she feels about this song. This really is a personal attack on Sophie’s self-control by the DJ. There aren’t many songs that can get Sophie to really dance in public past a sway or moving with Ryan, but this is definitely one of them.

Ryan pulls Sophie down, so their lips barely brush against each other as she sings the song word for word to Sophie. She knows exactly what she’s doing, teasing Sophie like this.

This shit’s so good, should be illegal

Need round two, I need a sequel

Hit the backboard like a free throw

You next level, you a cheat code

In so deep, you hit my seafloor

Got me singing like Alicia

Sophie’s body starts to tingle as she feels Ryan’s breath against her lips as she sings the words; she knows how this song affects her. She loves teasing Sophie and getting to dance with her. Still, most of the time, it’s her doing most of the work dancing on Sophie, but she knows with the right song, and after a few drinks, Sophie finally relaxes and will let herself dance. It isn’t that Sophie is a bad dancer, she is actually a great dancer, but she gets self-conscious easily and gets in her own head, so she doesn’t really dance much.

Excerpt:
R: I know right. That’s exactly what I said. There’s no reason to have a meeting. This ain’t the Glee club. You and I are living together, and Kate can have the loft back. I don’t get what is left to discuss.

S: I don’t know Ryan; you have a point but maybe we do need to talk about Batwoman stuff. Now that you’re both back. Establish some things, clear the air. I don’t think Kate wants to take Batwoman from you but you should hear that from her. You deciding to leave the loft happened pretty quick and Kate probably feels hurt in a way. She might not understand your motives or maybe she thinks you don’t like her.

R: Hum what would give her that impression.

Ryan muttered.

S: Huh?

R: Nothing. Ok fine. It’s whatever. Let’s go meet up with them all and clear the air.

Ryan got up from the table. She went to go grab some clean clothes, threw them onto her makeshift bed and then went into the bathroom and closed the door. A few moments later Sophie heard the shower turn on. And then Ryan started singing.

R: Hey hey you you I don’t like your girlfriend! No way no way think you need a new one!

Sophie rolled her eyes but bit down a giggle. Ryan Wilder was many things but subtle was not one of them. This meet up was going to be a hot mess.

Sophie wonders how sadness doesn't fill Ryan, she seems reminiscent, but not sad. She doesn't know how she would live without her own Mother

Excerpt:
Quickly she shoots her girl a text, starts the navigator, and puts her car in drive. As she’s driving through the familiar streets the percussion of ‘While we’re young’ by Jhené Aiko fills the atmosphere.




As she listens to the song she finds her thoughts drifting through all the people she’s ever loved. Until…




'Baby while we’re young we should just have fun. We should just do whatever we want and tell everyone that we feel in love with each other. Ooh that we found one in another.'




Suddenly her thoughts shift to her girlfriend who brings light to her life. One filled with happiness, warmth, and love. Before Ryan, her life had been pleasantly boring. She was almost always content and in control. She didn’t lash out too much. Cry too much. Smile too much. Or laugh too much. Because there was no passion in her life. Married to a man she doesn’t even love made her an easy-to-please wife. Tyler was great but he wasn’t what she wanted so she never held high expectations. And she liked being a crow… but even she wasn’t totally blind to their corrupt ways. Besides they were the ones to help shove her in the closet even deeper than before.




But then Ryan re-entered her life and now she has a job she loves. That makes her feel things even if it’s so much frustration she could cry. And she has a girlfriend and a passionate relationship that makes her feel whole. She has friends and chosen family to replace the ones she lost since coming out and her life has never been brighter. Sure she has her struggles like everyone else but Sophie isn’t just going through the phases of life anymore. She’s living them.




With these thoughts in mind she’s all that more eager to reach her girlfriend and show her just how much she appreciates her.

...

Writer's End Notes:

This had a lot of introspection (more than I originally anticipated) but I needed it to happen so yall can understand *my* idea of their dynamic.

Side note: I love Jhené so go stream her music

Writer's End Notes:

I didn't share much of my sources previously for no particular reason but for this chapter.
we have
Wade in the Water by Ramsey Lewis
Love Poem by Audre Lorde
The history around the right to marriage came from Tera W. Hunter Bound in Wedlock: Slave and Free Black Marriage in the Nineteenth Century
The tiny snippet into African marriage rights is from Male daughters, Female Husbands: Gender and Sex in an African Society by Ifi Amadiume
The herbal bath knowledge comes from my own Jamaican/ Maroon ancestry as well as researching the bath practices. "yuh need a bath" is a popular Jamaican expression and activity. Baths for healing, rejuvenation, and renewal. I'll stop yabbering on about history now.

Excerpt:
"Only if you tell us who the song is about." Julia mumbled haughtily into her microphone.

Sophie rolled her eyes, "The same person most of them are about. Why are you guys always in my business?" There was no point in denying it now, but she did wonder why she had to keep answering the same question from her bandmates over and over again.

"So we can feel the passion too. Also, you're so much more interesting." Kate said from where she was holding her head up with the palm of her hand.

"How sweet of you." Sophie said with mild sarcasm. She took her place back in front of her designated microphone and gestured with her fingers for a countdown.

Kate did just that even though she wasn't drumming for this recording, as it was focusing on vocals.

Let me swoon over you
And there's nothing I can do
So let me swoon over you

Don't you know you're just another heart breaker

"Yeah that's good. Bridge?" Sophie directed with an apprehensive bite to the inside of her lip.

And when I think I'm out of the dark
You're pulling me away from the light
Take me where you want me tonight

Excerpt:
Sophie stepped in closer. Ryan stepped closer. Stop. She placed her hand on the other woman’s stomach. Another trauma revealed it would seem almost impossible to fathom. Two women, so many stories between them— even more, broken parts to heal. Ryan danced her hands across Sophie’s face each creating equal but opposite reactions against her skin. Encircling each other, hands gliding across and around, settling, instinctively, at the womb’s wall. 

“All I knew,” in  a soft whisper, the words lifted from Sophie’s voice, “This morning when I woke Is I know something now, know something now I didn't before,” Her back turned, Ryan rested on Sophie embracing the woman singing at the waist, “ And all I've seen, since eighteen hours ago are brown eyes and freckles and your smile in the back of my mind making me feel like,” Ryan kissed Sophie’s back, her shoulder, “I just wanna know you better, know you better, know you better now, I just wanna know you better, know you better, know you better now, I just wanna know you better, know you better, know you better now, I just wanna know you, know you, know you,” 

“Cause all I know is we said, "Hello",” Sophie paused for only a moment when she heard Ryan’s voice before joining her, “And your eyes look like comin' home All I know is a simple name And everything has changed, All I know is you held the door, You'll be mine and I'll be yours, All I know since yesterday, Is everything has changed.”

The two women giggled releasing so much of the anxiety from their veins. Sophie turned around to face Ryan.

“Did not have singing Taylor Swift in the shower on my bingo card?”

“Did you have singing Taylor Swift on your bingo card?”

“Also, no” 

“Swift is a go-to for the prison glee and impromptu jam sessions in the cafeteria,” Ryan looked at Sophie in disbelief.

“Now, you’re just making things up.” 

“Of all the lies to tell. Why would I tell one as unbelievable as the women of the Freeland Correctional Facility like to get down to some Taylor Alison Swift?” 

“Okay babe, your Taylor knowledge is beginning to scare me. Are you a swiftie?” 

“Mmm… I don’t think we’re there yet,” Ryan released one of those laughs that pump through your heart and out to the world, “your laugh is something pretty magical.” There was a glint in her eyes; it drew Sophie in.
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie stepped in closer. Ryan stepped closer. Stop. She placed her hand on the other woman’s stomach. Another trauma revealed it would seem almost impossible to fathom. Two women, so many stories between them— even more, broken parts to heal. Ryan danced her hands across Sophie’s face each creating equal but opposite reactions against her skin. Encircling each other, hands gliding across and around, settling, instinctively, at the womb’s wall. 

“All I knew,” in  a soft whisper, the words lifted from Sophie’s voice, “This morning when I woke Is I know something now, know something now I didn't before,” Her back turned, Ryan rested on Sophie embracing the woman singing at the waist, “ And all I've seen, since eighteen hours ago are brown eyes and freckles and your smile in the back of my mind making me feel like,” Ryan kissed Sophie’s back, her shoulder, “I just wanna know you better, know you better, know you better now, I just wanna know you better, know you better, know you better now, I just wanna know you better, know you better, know you better now, I just wanna know you, know you, know you,” 

“Cause all I know is we said, "Hello",” Sophie paused for only a moment when she heard Ryan’s voice before joining her, “And your eyes look like comin' home All I know is a simple name And everything has changed, All I know is you held the door, You'll be mine and I'll be yours, All I know since yesterday, Is everything has changed.”

The two women giggled releasing so much of the anxiety from their veins. Sophie turned around to face Ryan.

“Did not have singing Taylor Swift in the shower on my bingo card?”

“Did you have singing Taylor Swift on your bingo card?”

“Also, no” 

“Swift is a go-to for the prison glee and impromptu jam sessions in the cafeteria,” Ryan looked at Sophie in disbelief.

“Now, you’re just making things up.” 

“Of all the lies to tell. Why would I tell one as unbelievable as the women of the Freeland Correctional Facility like to get down to some Taylor Alison Swift?” 

“Okay babe, your Taylor knowledge is beginning to scare me. Are you a swiftie?” 

“Mmm… I don’t think we’re there yet,” Ryan released one of those laughs that pump through your heart and out to the world, “your laugh is something pretty magical.” There was a glint in her eyes; it drew Sophie in.

Excerpt:
SCENE 3

INT. NATIONAL CITY CONDO- DINING TABLE-NIGHT
(Sophie sits across from Ryan. Jordan is at the apex. Our eyes move around the circular, teak dining table as the trio eats. The lighting is a pale amber indicating the somber mood at the table.) 

There were few words exchanged between the two women between the morning and the evening. Jordan, by some miracle, managed to engage her roommates in conversation at dinner. The romantic pair is careful to only respond to Jordan including the moments they were responding to each other. 

MUSIC CUE: FAMILY LINE BY CONAN GRAY

She had no answers or anything to offer. She heeded Ryan’s words. There were no solutions here for Jordan to offer. She had no place in this conversation. Though, she did feel dismissed. Jordan was there too.

“Jess, your mom said she’s making your favorite for dinner. Perhaps, you can see if she needs your help?” Jordan suggested.

 

Jordan and Sophie were familiar with the look in Diane Moore’s eyes. Jordan attempted to intervene. 

“Mom, she’s sorry,” Jordan pleaded.

 

“Did I tell either of you that you could speak?” both girls immediately went quiet, “Jordan, please get my rod,” Jordan gave her sister a look of apology. She left the room and returned with the rod, “Sophie, remove your shirt.”

 

That afternoon on the Lord’s day, while Sophie held a Bible, Diane Moore gave her daughter scars of correction. The mother forced the second daughter to watch; this was a message being delivered across a timeline of intergenerational hurt.

She was too into the attention Sophie was giving her, though, to move.

Excerpt:
“Do you need a hug first?” Ryan didn’t want to force it on her if that’s not what she needed right now, although all she wanted to do was wrap her up in her arms and let her know that everything would be okay. She nodded again and immediately sobbed into the crook of Ryan’s neck when she scooped her up off the chair and settled her on her hip. She swayed them back and forth allowing Alaia the chance to release all of the tears that she had been trying to hold back. Ryan rubbed her back and kissed her forehead, providing her all the comfort she possibly could. When she felt her exhale that deep shuddering breath, the one that let her know she was beginning to settle and relax, she started singing softly a song that Mama Cora used to sing to her when she was upset and needed to just be held.  

 

You are my sunshine

My only sunshine

You make me happy

When skies are gray

You’ll never know dear

How much I love you

Please don’t take

My sunshine away

 

When Ryan finished the first part of the song, she felt Alaia lift her head and turned to meet her glassy eyes. “What song is that is, mama?”

 

She smiled at her and wiped some lingering tears from her cheeks. “It’s called You Are My Sunshine. It’s a song Mama Cora used to sing to me when I was sad or upset. She would sing to me and rock me back and forth until I was feeling better.”
HTMLExcerpt:
“Do you need a hug first?” Ryan didn’t want to force it on her if that’s not what she needed right now, although all she wanted to do was wrap her up in her arms and let her know that everything would be okay. She nodded again and immediately sobbed into the crook of Ryan’s neck when she scooped her up off the chair and settled her on her hip. She swayed them back and forth allowing Alaia the chance to release all of the tears that she had been trying to hold back. Ryan rubbed her back and kissed her forehead, providing her all the comfort she possibly could. When she felt her exhale that deep shuddering breath, the one that let her know she was beginning to settle and relax, she started singing softly a song that Mama Cora used to sing to her when she was upset and needed to just be held.  

 

You are my sunshine

My only sunshine

You make me happy

When skies are gray

You’ll never know dear

How much I love you

Please don’t take

My sunshine away

 

When Ryan finished the first part of the song, she felt Alaia lift her head and turned to meet her glassy eyes. “What song is that is, mama?”

 

She smiled at her and wiped some lingering tears from her cheeks. “It’s called You Are My Sunshine. It’s a song Mama Cora used to sing to me when I was sad or upset. She would sing to me and rock me back and forth until I was feeling better.”

"Please don't. I didn't tell mom what happened; didn't want to hear her mouth."

"That was one-" Sophie looked at her sister, "-okay two times! And you didn't even tell mom. You're a real one, sis."

"Yeah, yeah. Less commending, more drinking," Sophie said as she took a sip of her drink and began looking around.

“So, who would be on your list?”

“Hmm?”

“Your list of dance partners. Rumour has it that I’m an excellent dancer,” Ryan grinned and held out her hand to Sophie.

“Ryan.”

“Come on, Soph. Just one dance,” Ryan led Sophie out onto the dancefloor. When they got to the centre of the floor, Sophie swapped their position so that she was leading, Ryan’s head tucked under her chin as they slowly swayed as Whitney Houston’s, I will Always Love You played in the background. Ryan closed her eyes, letting the hectic world around her fade away as Sophie kept her safe in her arms.

Excerpt:
When she finally opens the doors, she’s greeted by an austere dining room - each table covered with crisp, white cloth that she imagines are washed every night before being steamed straight the next morning. The chairs are perfectly spaced apart and there are black and white photos adorning the walls, giving an elegance and one of the only flecks of sentimentality to the room. It is the sort of place where a bout of Beethoven's piano sonata might be playing or Bach's cello suite no.1 - soft and severe in the way that classical music can be.

Out of the corner of her eye, she catches a woman walking in from a side door near the back of the expansive dining area. The woman looks confident and put together like she embodies the virtue of the room she’s just walked into. She’s carrying two rather large, cumbersome looking boxes but is handling them with ease.

Excerpt:
Ryan wants to get Sophie skating alone but knows she can't rush it, so she finds a way to compromise. 

"How about I hold your hand and skate beside you instead? It'll be cute and romantic." Ryan suggests. 

"Okay. Just don't let me go." Sophie agrees.

"I'd never let you go, Sophie. I got you forever." The two women smile at eat other as they interlock their fingers. Ryan brings their hands to her lips and kisses the back of Sophie's hand.

The pair skate around the rink for a few more songs. The DJ is playing a good mix of old-school and more recent music, and Ryan is having a good time skating beside Sophie and singing to her. She can see Sophie starting to get the hang of it and getting more confident in her movement, and she even sings along to some of the music with Ryan.

"Mo Money Mo Problems" comes on, and Ryan gets excited and accidentally lets Sophie go. Sophie panics for a moment but quickly recovers and skates along to the music without any assistance.

"Look at you go, babe! I knew you could do it!" Ryan turns and skates backward, watching and cheering Sophie on. The other woman smiles back at Ryan with more confidence as she skates through the curve and gets comfortable enough to start rapping along to the song as she skates.

Excerpt:
Before Ryan can respond, Beyoncé's "Cuff It" comes on, and Sophie stands, forcing Ryan to stand too, and she drags the shorter woman onto the skate floor. The pair of them skate around the rink weaving through the various other skaters. Sophie is in front of Ryan, and the latter keeps trying to catch up with her, but Sophie's just too quick, weaving through people for her to catch up.

It takes until the end of the song for Ryan to finally catch up, and Sophie turns around so that she's facing Ryan again.

Excerpt:
Story Title: Do That There

...

It takes until the end of the song for Ryan to finally catch up, and Sophie turns around so that she's facing Ryan again. Then, the next song comes on, and it happens to be one of her favorite songs from a duo she recently discovered while she had a Spotify playlist on shuffle. 




Slick baby hair how you do that there

Pose in the mirror how you do that there

Splits in the air how you do that there 

Girl it's not fair how you do that there 




Sophie grooves along the beat of the song, moving her hips and occasionally looking over her shoulder to make sure she's cognizant of the skaters around her. Luckily, Sophie is carving out a path for Ryan because she only has eyes for Sophie right now. In her mind, it is only her and Sophie alone in the rink as she watches her girlfriend's body effortlessly navigating between dancing and skating like a pro. 




Know your ex walking back like Mike Jack

You can bite me girl I bite back




Ryan looks at Sophie with a raised eyebrow, and Sophie laughs because they both know how true those lyrics are for both of them, especially Sophie. Ryan has the bruises and marks to prove that Sophie is 100% a biter, but she would never complain because she loves it. The bruises never really get a chance to fade without Sophie putting them back there. It's her own subtle and private way of claiming her territory, especially on Ryan's thighs. Ryan has her own bad habit of leaving bite marks on Sophie's neck herself; Sophie has to always make sure she has makeup on hand to cover up Ryan's marks. It wouldn't look good or professional for the Head of Security of Wayne Enterprises to leave the CEO's office covered in bruises. 

Sophie grabs Ryan's hands and maneuvers the two of them so that she can spin Ryan around, then position herself so that Ryan is skating in front of her, and Sophie is right behind Ryan. She isn't touching her, but they are close enough that Ryan's body might as well be nestled against Sophie's. 




Ooh the way you wearing that maxi

Them legs looking like a athlete 

Body a Marvel like Shang Chi

Running the city like a track meet

Baby that booty don't need no enhancers

Back in the day she was a dancer 

She could do the high heels or the answers




Ryan jumps when she feels Sophie grab her ass as Sophie sings about booty enhancers. She looks over her shoulder at Sophie's teasing and mischievous smile. It is no secret that one of Sophie's favorite parts of Ryan is her butt. Any time Ryan is lying in bed on her stomach, Sophie uses that opportunity to use her butt as a pillow. She has taken many naps like that or cuddled up with Ryan, her arms wrapped around her and cupping one cheek for comfort. It is a weird way to sleep, but Ryan doesn't mind it as long as she gets to be close to Sophie, and she has her own weird sleeping habits, so she can't judge.




I thinking she wanting me

She a freak and she oughta be

...

Writer's End Notes:

Song is Jake&Papa - Do That There definitely go check it out! It’s such a fun and good time!

Excerpt:
"You can kiss it better," Ryan suggests. She cracks a smile showing that she wasn't really upset and really just wanted an excuse to kiss Sophie.

Sophie happily obliges, kissing Ryan gently on the lips, making sure not to make Ryan's injury worse. Then, just as Sophie pulls back, Ryan chases her lips for another kiss for good measure. They smile as they both pull back, and Sophie stands up and holds her hand out to Ryan as "Superstar" by Usher comes on.

"Come on, Superstar." Ryan gladly takes Sophie's outstretched hand and lets herself be led onto the rink floor to skate the rest of the night away and groove with her forever skating partner.

Excerpt:
“Hey Soph” Ryan said quietly, waiting for eye contact before she continued, “You’ve got this.”

HTMLExcerpt:
Chapter Title: Week 7 - Cherry

...

“Hey Soph” Ryan said quietly, waiting for eye contact before she continued, “You’ve got this.”

Sophie laughed, remembering Ryan had provided that exact reassurance before their first dance. Even after she’d been borderline rude to her that whole first week. Knowing they had about thirty seconds before the soundtrack would kick in Sophie bent down and kissed Ryan. As they kissed Ryan put her hand on Sophie’s hip and the want of everything that could have happened that morning rushed back. The stage hand counted them in and the announcer said, “Dancing the Rumba to Cherry by Fletcher and Hayley Kiyoko, Ryan and Sophie”

It was easy enough to slip back into the starting pose of the dance, Ryan’s hand on the back of Sophie’s neck. Looking into each other’s eyes, standing only an inch apart. It was supposed to look like the viewers were interrupting something. In the opening bars of the song Ryan moved her other hand up and Sophie dipped her down, Ryan took advantage of being close to Sophie to say, “Pretend it’s just us, before we got interrupted this morning.”

And fuck if Ryan didn’t deserve the dance of Sophie’s life. After all she was doing to support her in getting over their nerves. She needed an amazing dance to keep them in the competition, she wasn’t ready for this to be over. With a renewed intensity Sophie leaned into the desire she’d felt that morning and focused on channeling that into the dance. She knew the choreography was some of her best, and they both knew the steps. All she had to do was sell the emotion and this would be the best dance for them yet.

With that as her final thought the music washed over Sophie.  She closed out everything but the way Ryan’s hands on her felt and lost herself in the lyrics as she danced. Her body flowing away from Ryan’s then pulling her back in close. Feeling Ryan’s curves as she placed her hands back on her girlfriend. The Rumba steps alternated dancing hip to hip, the closest thing you’d see in this ballroom to grinding in a club, before swaying back out. The choreography ensuring the close moments and any touches were a fleeting tease. The routine took them across the dance floor, adding spins and staccato moments where they looked into each other’s eyes. For the beats they locked eyes Sophie could see Ryan’s desire. Could feel her own escalate in response.

The dance ended with Ryan standing on tiptoe, leaning into Sophie as she pulled back so they were forehead to forehead. Sophie’s hand were splayed across the side of Ryan’s ribs, holding her up as Ryan’s hand curled across Sophie’s hip. Both of them mere inches from touching the other somewhere a little indecent for a public show.
SongArtist: Cherry by FLETCHER, Hayley Kiyoko

Excerpt:
Sophie walked back to the ballroom to find Ryan behind the DJ console and the room completely transformed into the 1980s. A few of the kids were shuffling in. She gathered that the theme was 80s pop. Ryan had also changed into what appeared to be a Janet Jackson Rhythm Nation look. 

“So, it’s like that. I don’t get to be on theme.”

“You didn’t look in the second suitcase did you?” Sophie was puzzled.

“We found what we needed in the first.”

“The second suitcase is for you,” The music was low; they could hear each other easily and the few kids in the room were either against the wall or circling the dessert table waiting for permission to pounce on some oreo cake pops.

Excerpt:
Ryan walked away with Wade to another interview.

Mid interview Ryan and Sophie locked eyes. They trade smiles before Ryan returns her attention back to the reporter.

"What was that?" Jordan asked. "What?" Sophie replied. "I swear I saw a spark fly." Jordan said. "No sparks. Ryan's just a friend."

"She got just what you need but, you say she's just a friend. But you say she just a friend." Jordan sang.

"I just got out of a relationship. I'm not going to hop into a new one especially not with Ryan Wilder."

"I think you two would be great together." Jordan said. Sophie looked back over at Ryan. "Spark." Jordan said. "I'm walking away now."

"I just got out of a relationship. I'm not going to hop into a new one especially not with Ryan Wilder."

"I think you two would be great together." Jordan said. Sophie looked back over at Ryan. "Spark." Jordan said. "I'm walking away now."

Excerpt:
As much as Sophie tried to pay attention to everything surrounding her, her mind drifted to Ryan and what she was doing and how her show turned out. She kept refreshing Instagram to see if Ryan had posted anything new but the last picture on her page was of them at the H.E.R concert. For Ryan to be a photographer she rarely posted photos of her work or anything of that nature but she kept the picture of her and Sophie on her Instagram which Sophie stared at and analyzed the entire time she was at the award show that she almost missed her name being called.

Luke lightly pushed her to get her attention. “Sophie you’re up.” He said. Sophie smiled at him and then got up from the table to accept her award.

Sophie made her way to the podium as the applause ceased when she stepped to the mic. “Wow. Thank you guys. Growing up I always wanted to be a change in this world to make an impact in some sort of way or fashion. Whoever would have thought that words would be that change. The pen between my hands as I scribbled down my feelings, my thoughts, my opinions had become my relief at times that I didn’t know I needed. Now today as I accept this award I am extremely grateful for becoming the change that you all see. I want to thank my family, the Gotham Community, the Gotham Gazette, my friends special shout-out to Luke and Tish who always stayed by my side through it all and to Ryan. Ryan, you know that I see it, I know you're a star, where you go I follow, no matter how far, if life is a movie, then you're the best part. I may have won an award for writing but there are not enough words to formulate how much you mean to me. This award has been the accumulation of what I have strived for in my life but Ryan you have been the best part. Once again than you Gotham for this award.”

With that said, Sophie left the stage with applause as she ran past her seat and a stunned Luke and Tish to out the doors of the ceremony. Sophie called for an Lyft and was thankful that one was close by as she decided to get home to pack so that she can go get her woman.

Excerpt:
John Legend’s voice started to play from the speakers. Sophie put out her hand to Ryan, palm up in question. Ryan placed her hand in Sophie's, as Sophie guided them onto the floor. They threaded their fingers as they made their way to the dance floor, carving out a place among the couples.

When that melody plays, and I see your face, the memories race right back to me.

Sophie placed Ryan’s hand on her back while she held the other in her hand to lead them both. She smiled down at Ryan as Ryan looked up at her.

Is it wrong to reminisce? Is it wrong to steal a kiss? Is someone waiting for you at home? Tonight, could be the only night. A fleeting glimpse, what could we might’ve been if we had never let go?

Ryan moved closer into Sophie. Resting her cheek against her chest. Feeling the beat of her heart. Ryan sighed as she felt as though she could finally breathe easily. Sophie leaned her head down so that it was resting on top of Ryan’s as she gently swayed them.

Oh, when that melody plays, I whisper your name, I want you to stay right next to me. And I hope you give me one last dance. Head on my shoulder, like it ain’t over. Oh, this moment gave us one more chance. Why don’t we hold it before the bar closes?

Ryan pulled back so that her face was only inches away from Sophie as they spun in a circle. Neither breaking eye contact. The rest of the patrons were just invisible figures. Nobody else existed. Sophie looked down at Ryan’s lips as Ryan pulled Sophie’s face down into a kiss. They pulled back after a moment. Both regarding the other, before they smiled and dived back into the kiss.

...

HTMLExcerpt:
John Legend’s voice started to play from the speakers. Sophie put out her hand to Ryan, palm up in question. Ryan placed her hand in Sophie's, as Sophie guided them onto the floor. They threaded their fingers as they made their way to the dance floor, carving out a place among the couples.

When that melody plays, and I see your face, the memories race right back to me.

Sophie placed Ryan’s hand on her back while she held the other in her hand to lead them both. She smiled down at Ryan as Ryan looked up at her.

Is it wrong to reminisce? Is it wrong to steal a kiss? Is someone waiting for you at home? Tonight, could be the only night. A fleeting glimpse, what could we might’ve been if we had never let go?

Ryan moved closer into Sophie. Resting her cheek against her chest. Feeling the beat of her heart. Ryan sighed as she felt as though she could finally breathe easily. Sophie leaned her head down so that it was resting on top of Ryan’s as she gently swayed them.

Oh, when that melody plays, I whisper your name, I want you to stay right next to me. And I hope you give me one last dance. Head on my shoulder, like it ain’t over. Oh, this moment gave us one more chance. Why don’t we hold it before the bar closes?

Ryan pulled back so that her face was only inches away from Sophie as they spun in a circle. Neither breaking eye contact. The rest of the patrons were just invisible figures. Nobody else existed. Sophie looked down at Ryan’s lips as Ryan pulled Sophie’s face down into a kiss. They pulled back after a moment. Both regarding the other, before they smiled and dived back into the kiss.

Excerpt:
“This is everything you’re worthy of,” she leaned over to Sophie giving her a kiss before lying down on a pillow a little bit higher up positioning herself for Sophie to snuggle into her side. She curled into Ryan’s right side, the shorter of the two women pulling the taller into her chest, wrapping her arms around her, and kissing her crown. “Star-gazing and cloud watching or nature movie as my mama called it,” Ryan pointed to a group of stars in the sky, “look. See over there, if you look at the star at the bottom and move across to the other, it almost looks like a guy standing at a microphone. Who do you think it is? What song is he singing?”

Sophie felt her eyes becoming teary. Every moment with Ryan reached a new part of her. She had never been treated this way before— the serenity wasn’t just surrounding them; it was between them and within them, “So the nature movie is telling stories about the stars in the sky.”

“Yea, and the clouds. We would come out here with enough time to stay up for the sunrise and the clouds dancing into the morning. You think it’s silly?”

Sophie sat up slightly so she could look Ryan in the eyes, “No, never that. I think it’s the most beautiful thing I have ever been a part of. I just. I have a hard time wondering if you’re real. Everything with you is just…Ryan, I feel so many of the things that I willed myself to never feel again with you.” 

Ryan listened to Sophie while playing with the mahogany-skinned woman’s hair. She wondered who left the shrapnel on her heart. Who left playing this game of ‘retreat from love’? Each time they had carved out a space where Sophie was the center she came back to this moment. 

“You’re afraid of being hurt in a way you haven’t explained to me and I am not asking you to do that now. Our feelings often run at a pace faster than our minds and sometimes I have to choose which one to listen to. I’ve been hurt too. Three first dates: a big romantic experience I came up with to protect myself from the worst possible outcome. If she ran away, at least, I know it wasn’t on the first attempt. What do you call that? Dark romance?” She breathed in, stroked the side of Sophie’s face hoping that the beauty staring back at her could stop the tears from rushing forth but they did anyway, “the last woman I held in my arms left and I don’t know why. She disappeared. A part of me could shut in but then that would mean she took me with her; I can’t let that happen.”

Sophie wiped the tears from Ryan’s face and kissed each eye before placing a gentle kiss on the tearful woman’s lips, “I think the song is Crush by Yuna and I really like this movie,” Ryan smiled back.

Excerpt: The Paso doble they were about to perform to Alien Superstar was a fun dance. They’d been lucky to get to dance to Beyoncé again this season. She’d had even managed to incorporate some nods to ball culture into the little flourishes of the choreography. It had been a fine line for Sophie to tread though, she knew Gideon would deduct points if she thought the dance was too outside genre. For Sophie it was worth the risk though. A chance to bring something from their culture into this dance and provide a little plot for the routine she’d choreographed as two dueling dancers.
HTMLExcerpt:
The Paso doble they were about to perform to Alien Superstar was a fun dance. They’d been lucky to get to dance to Beyoncé again this season. She’d had even managed to incorporate some nods to ball culture into the little flourishes of the choreography. It had been a fine line for Sophie to tread though, she knew Gideon would deduct points if she thought the dance was too outside genre. For Sophie it was worth the risk though. A chance to bring something from their culture into this dance and provide a little plot for the routine she’d choreographed as two dueling dancers. 

From start to finish the song went perfectly, Ryan’s frame was amazing. Sophie appreciated Ryan’s acting ability making the tension they needed for the Paso routine so believable. Sophie knew her acting hadn’t been awful. She didn’t even break into her I’m lovesick for you look for Ryan when they were forehead to forehead, spiraling around each other. Sophie knew she only broke her serious expression once. She couldn’t help it when heard Jordan cheer at a particularly cool stunt, where Sophie kicked out over the top of a kneeling Ryan’s head.

Sophie had done her best to add as much flair as she could with no lifts. Midway through the dance she dipped Ryan into the splits and the flashy finish was her dropping down onto her knee, lowering Ryan quickly across her lap.  As the crowd applauded Sophie looked down at Ryan, a satisfied smirk both at the performance and view right down Ryan’s low cut dress.

“Quit staring and help me up,” Ryan said playfully, laughing as Sophie pulled her up and kept their fingers entwined.

Staring directly at Sophie until the announcer introduced them, “Dancing the Salsa to Levitating by Dua Lipa, Ryan and Sophie.”
HTMLExcerpt:
Chapter Title: Week 8 - Levitating

...

For this routine they were starting on opposite sides of the stage. So Ryan stood alone as she listened to the recorded package. Footage of her and Sophie talking about the salsa, overlaid with clips of them rehearsing and of course a couple of drops played on the screen. The package had also included a couple of cute moments they’d shared in the studio. Ryan tried not so smile at how adorable they had looked as she looked across the stage at Sophie. Staring directly at Sophie until the announcer introduced them, “Dancing the Salsa to Levitating by Dua Lipa, Ryan and Sophie.”

As the music ramped up Ryan and Sophie danced across the stage, meeting in the middle with serious expressions. They touched briefly into a ballroom hold, before Ryan leaped up into Sophie’s outstretched arms and was spun around. After rotating Sophie gracefully put Ryan back on the floor, and they continued seamlessly with the dance. The routine was tight, the lifts were polished and Ryan was actually having fun with this dance.

Excerpt:
Sophie stood back watching the joy radiate from her love before walking over to join her. “It’s our first Christmas Tree.”

The tree stood about four and a half feet tall, perfect triangle shape, a really straight trunk, and a wide base. 

“What makes it perfect?” Sophie still didn’t understand why they spent so long searching for a tree. 

“It’s just the right height for me to put the star on top. I don’t need your help or a step stool,” a proud smile across her lips. 

Sophie snickered, “A Ryan-sized tree.”

“I’m in too good of a mood for your short jokes. Get to sawing, Hot Shot.” Ryan and Sophie each took an end of the saw proceeding to cut the tree down.

“O Christmas Tree, O Christmas Tree, How lovely are your branches,” the contentment settled in Sophie’s chest; joining her girlfriend in singing, “O Christmas Tree, O Christmas Tree…”

Excerpt:
Jaz was strapped into her car seat singing along to ‘Queen of Mean” while Sophie was silently fuming. She’d texted Julia a couple of times with no response. She decided to stop and get dinner on the way home from Jaz’s favorite pizzeria.




They walked into the restaurant and Sophie placed their order and went to take a seat, with Jaz in her lap. “Mama, Ms.Hamilton said I singed queen of mean real good.” 




“Oh yea? Well Ms.Hamilton is absolutely right. My cupcake has the best queen of mean rendition in the whole world.” Sophie smiled down at her daughter, eyes wide. Jaz giggled and curled into her mom.

“Ba ba dum!” A streak of blue and red rushed into the room attempting to sing the John William’s Superman theme.

“Hey, buddy,” Ryan greeted her son.

“I’m Superman,” Leon declared.

Ryan and Sophie were trying their hardest to contain their laughter as their son struck the iconic pose with his hands on his hips.

“I can see that. What made you pick him?”

“He’s the best, mama,” Leon gave her a look as though the answer was obvious. “He can shoot beams out of his eyes, and he can fly.”

“Batwoman can fly in a way too if she uses her grapple gun,” Ryan pointed out.

“But can she shoot laser beams?” Leon gave her a pointed look with his brows raised.

“Well, you’ve got me there,” Ryan rolled her eyes. Her son definitely took after his mother in the sass department and her mannerisms. Luckily, he also inherited her kindness and loving spirit too.

...

“Look mama, I’m Catwoman!” Cora twirled around to let Ryan see her costume.

“Wow. You look just like a mini version of the real one,” Ryan looked up at her wife and shared a conspiratorial smile. “Did mommy pick that outfit for you?”

“No, I asked mommy to gets this one.”

“I don’t get no respect around here,” Ryan murmured.

Sophie looped her arms around Ryan from behind and leaned her face down to nuzzle at Ryan’s neck. “You’re still my favourite superhero,” Sophie delivered kisses to her wife’s cheek.

Excerpt:
The next morning Ryan woke up after barely getting enough sleep due to worrying about picking a fight with Sophie. She reached over to apologize but noticed she was already gone. She took her time getting ready to head to the office, she just knew today was going to be a long day.

Sophie had already made her way to Wayne. There was no reason for her to be at the office this early, but she appreciated the quiet of the building when she was the only one in it. She sat in the Bat-cave, monitored the cameras, and listened to music. Today’s song of choice: Hard Place x H.E.R.

It’s one of those songs, like a torn song. You know when something isn’t good for you, or maybe it is good for you, but you don’t know what it is that you want.

Story: Just a Little Bit of Your Heart
Excerpt:
Jada was right; Sophie had fallen in love with her wife all over again. Ryan had similar sentiments as her eyes raked over Sophie.

Her wife wore a similar colored designer satin floor-length mermaid gown with a draped neckline and thin straps. The dress was tailored to fit Sophie's body perfectly and Ryan could tell that while she may have been wearing underwear, Sophie was not wearing a bra. Adding to Sophie's vintage-style look were her neutral eye makeup paired with a nude lip. Her hair was curled and pinned over one shoulder in full body waves. Jordan walked over to her sister-in-law and handed her her bouquet and gently closed her mouth which Ryan hadn't noticed had fallen open when she saw Sophie. 

Mary walked between them with one of the hotel staff members and informed them that they were ready to go. 

The group had reserved the Bellagio's Terrazza di Sogno and each wife walked to either side of the staircase so they could be escorted down to their spot in front of the fountain. 

Canon in D in the style of guitar began playing and Luke and Alice began walking down each set of stairs followed by Mary and Jordan. When it was time for Sophie and Ryan to walk down, each escorted by her mother, time appeared to slow.
HTMLExcerpt:
Jada was right; Sophie had fallen in love with her wife all over again. Ryan had similar sentiments as her eyes raked over Sophie.

Her wife wore a similar colored designer satin floor-length mermaid gown with a draped neckline and thin straps. The dress was tailored to fit Sophie's body perfectly and Ryan could tell that while she may have been wearing underwear, Sophie was not wearing a bra. Adding to Sophie's vintage-style look were her neutral eye makeup paired with a nude lip. Her hair was curled and pinned over one shoulder in full body waves. Jordan walked over to her sister-in-law and handed her her bouquet and gently closed her mouth which Ryan hadn't noticed had fallen open when she saw Sophie. 

Mary walked between them with one of the hotel staff members and informed them that they were ready to go. 

The group had reserved the Bellagio's Terrazza di Sogno and each wife walked to either side of the staircase so they could be escorted down to their spot in front of the fountain. 

Canon in D in the style of guitar began playing and Luke and Alice began walking down each set of stairs followed by Mary and Jordan. When it was time for Sophie and Ryan to walk down, each escorted by her mother, time appeared to slow.

Story: Just a Little Bit of Your Heart
Excerpt:
Sophie looked up so she could place a tender kiss on Ryan's lips. Before the kiss could get too deep, she pulled back and then picked up her phone from where she dropped it on the table. She connected her phone to the room's Bluetooth and Faith Evans' Kissing You began playing throughout the room. She stood up and held her hand out to Ryan who accepted it and stood up with her. Sophie led them to the window with a view of the fountain below and they began dancing to the music.

As the song crescendoed to the bridge, both women felt connected to the lyrics.

I can't believe it's real (can't believe it's real)

I can't believe it's true (can't believe it's true)

I can't believe that you chose me

When I was choosing you

(Can't believe when I was choosing you)

And I can't believe that you are here with me

And I am here with you

Sophie leaned down to kiss Ryan and Ryan wrapped her arms around Sophie's neck. As their kiss deepened, Sophie bent down slightly to place her hands under Ryan's thighs and lifted, Ryan wrapping her legs around Sophie's waist. As the song ended, Sophie carried Ryan into the penthouse bedroom, eager to consummate their recommitment to each other and make love to her wife, the one her heart adored. The one the universe chose for her.
