Song: We Might Even Be Falling In Love (Interlude)
Excerpt:
“See you already like my music and on the first song.” Ryan’s cocky grin widened. 







“How can you

“How can you not love Victoria Monet’s music?” Sophie quipped.







“True, true. Although this one is just the interlude.” The short song ended and transitioned into another song that Sophie didn’t know. 




“Play it again.” A demand. Ryan raised her eyebrows. “Please?” She punctuated her request with a kiss to Ryan’s hand that was still tangled in her own. 




“Wait...are you finally going to sing for me?” Ryan asked, eyes lighting up. 




Sophie sat up and picked up the small remote for the lights. She tapped the top edge and cleared her throat. 




“Is this thing on? Mic check 1, 2. Mic check 1, 2.” Sophie forced her express to remain stoic as Ryan’s laughter filled the car. 




She winked at her roommate, lying next to her with an expectant expression. “This song is dedicated to the hot groupie up front.” She pointed at her, playfully, touching her index finger to the tip of Ryan’s nose. 




Ryan laughed again at Sophie’s goofiness as she wrinkled her nose at the touch. She was ready to hear this infamous singing of hers though. She hit play on the song again and laid back, waiting. 




With her fake microphone in hand, Sophie closed her eyes and sang, making sure she was slightly louder than Victoria so her own voice could be the main focus. 




Go head act a fool in it

Freestyle with me 'til you find your groove in it

Ryan had sat up as Sophie’s voice overtook the small space, beyond impressed at the captivating cadence of her singing. She remained quiet but intent, memorizing the way she closed her eyes and seemed to lose herself in the melody while Ryan lost herself in the lyrics spilling from her roommate’s lips. 

U-haul 'cause I might let you move in it

'Cause I ain't had nobody hit it like you hit it

And it feels likeI'm gonna know you for the rest of my life

It's safe to say that we might even be falling in love

Ooh, love, love, love

Ooh, love, love, love…




Sophie’s voice was beautifully, soulful with just the perfect level of rasp, different to the original artist of the song, but no less impressive. Victoria Monet definitely had at least one thing right, they might be falling in love, or at least Ryan was, even before the singing. But the passion behind Sophie’s voice only made her fall harder in that particular moment.




“Soph…” She didn’t have the words. “Wow.” 




She smiled shyly at Ryan who still sat, practically starstruck. “Speechless huh? Maybe, I should sing more often. Midargument perhaps? That way I’ll actually get a chance to speak and make my point.”




“Very funny.” Ryan rolled her eyes. “As long as I can place my requests…?” She added, hopefully.

“True, true. Although this one is just the interlude.” The short song ended and transitioned into another song that Sophie didn’t know. 

 

“Play it again.” A demand. Ryan raised her eyebrows. “Please?” She punctuated her request with a kiss to Ryan’s hand that was still tangled in her own. 

 

“Wait...are you finally going to sing for me?” Ryan asked, eyes lighting up. 

 

Sophie sat up and picked up the small remote for the lights. She tapped the top edge and cleared her throat. 

 

“Is this thing on? Mic check 1, 2. Mic check 1, 2.” Sophie forced her express to remain stoic as Ryan’s laughter filled the car. 

 

She winked at her roommate, lying next to her with an expectant expression. “This song is dedicated to the hot groupie up front.” She pointed at her, playfully, touching her index finger to the tip of Ryan’s nose. 

 

Ryan laughed again at Sophie’s goofiness as she wrinkled her nose at the touch. She was ready to hear this infamous singing of hers though. She hit play on the song again and laid back, waiting. 

 

With her fake microphone in hand, Sophie closed her eyes and sang, making sure she was slightly louder than Victoria so her own voice could be the main focus. 

 

Go head act a fool in it

Freestyle with me 'til you find your groove in it

Ryan had sat up as Sophie’s voice overtook the small space, beyond impressed at the captivating cadence of her singing. She remained quiet but intent, memorizing the way she closed her eyes and seemed to lose herself in the melody while Ryan lost herself in the lyrics spilling from her roommate’s lips. 

U-haul 'cause I might let you move in it

'Cause I ain't had nobody hit it like you hit it

And it feels like I'm gonna know you for the rest of my life

It's safe to say that we might even be falling in love

Ooh, love, love, love

Ooh, love, love, love…

 

Sophie’s voice was beautifully, soulful with just the perfect level of rasp, different to the original artist of the song, but no less impressive. Victoria Monet definitely had at least one thing right, they might be falling in love, or at least Ryan was, even before the singing. But the passion behind Sophie’s voice only made her fall harder in that particular moment.

 

“Soph…” She didn’t have the words. “Wow.” 

 

She smiled shyly at Ryan who still sat, practically starstruck. “Speechless huh? Maybe, I should sing more often. Midargument perhaps? That way I’ll actually get a chance to speak and make my point.”

 

“Very funny.” Ryan rolled her eyes. “As long as I can place my requests…?” She added, hopefully.

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

An amalgamation of coffee shop au (light on the coffee shop) + song fic(s) au (all songs by/with H.E.R. because I apparently have to make things harder for myself all for the sake of a “theme”) + the things you said tumblr prompt (20 out of the 60) + some ideas I had that just weren’t giving me what I needed to become their own one shots. I hope it flows well because probably more than half of the scenes were written out of order.

Songs used will be in bottom notes, asterisks next to song lyrics taken wildly out of context. A lot of scenes were written before I had lyrics so some of them are kind of a stretch.

...

*when we first met

Tell your best friend (s)he can slide too

...

“It’s not that,” she said miserably. “He’s spending time with his best friend tonight. Apparently this is her last night in the city for a while.”

“Girl.” Ryan stared at her with a blank expression. “The solution is so simple.”

“What?”

“Tell him his best friend can slide too.” She said it like it was the most obvious thing in the world.

...

*at 1 AM

Just got back out this way/You already got plans for the city/Call ‘em off, can you call ‘em off for me/You’re always going on and on

...

[01:12 AM] Ryan❤️: girl anyway 😂😂 what you doing tomorrow

[01:12 AM] Ryan❤️: or later today i guess

[01:13 AM] Soph🥰: already got plans for the city

[01:13 AM] Soph🥰: ya girl been missed😂 got a few places I can slide

[01:13 AM] Ryan❤️: yeah I know bc i’m one of the people who missed you but you always going on and on🙄😒

Ryan bit her lip, wondering if what she wanted to say next was too much or not. Then she said fuck it and sent the message, ‘Mama ain’t raise no bitch’ mindset and all that.

[01:13 AM] Ryan❤️: call off your plans for me😂

Immediately after she pressed send, she put the phone face down on the bed and distracted herself with brushing her teeth. She needed to do something to calm her nerves after such a risky text. She finished up in the bathroom and turned off all the lights. When she picked up her phone, she had to do a double take.

[01:15 AM] Soph🥰: okay 

...

*under your breath

I said yes to going out tonight/Oh I ain’t did that in a minute

...

Ryan quirked an amused eyebrow at her friend’s contemplative look. It honestly wasn’t that deep. “You can ask, Mary.”

“What happened with things between you and Sophie?”

“Nothing,” Ryan groaned. “That’s the point. I’m sick of the back and forth, the ‘will we won’t we’ of it all. I think I deserve a nice night out with someone other than my friends. I ain’t did that in a minute.”

“Okay that’s fair,” Mary said softly. “But have you stopped to consider that maybe the reason she hasn’t asked you out is because you rejected her the first time?”

“Wait, did Sophie say that? Is that really how she feels?” Mary looked panicked. Being best friends for years meant that they knew how to read each other. Ryan already had her answer, but she needed verbal confirmation. But before Mary could respond, her phone started to ring. Ryan narrowed her eyes. “Don’t you dare answer that—”

Story: Stopover in a Quiet Town: Wildmoore Edition
Excerpt:
“Who the hell has a landline nowadays?” Sophie joked, still scanning the house for any signs of where they were. Ryan just shrugged and picked up the phone.




Plastic?




Ryan pushed on of the buttons. It lit up but then twinkle little star started playing. 




“What the actual fuck?” Sophie asked, as confused as Ryan was. 




“It’s, uh, it’s a toy?” Ryan answered, handing Sophie the phone. Sophie examined the item in her hands and despite its very real appearance, she reached the same conclusion. “Who would have a toy phone sitting next to the couch like it's a real one?”

HTMLExcerpt:
“I’ve been waiting all season to say this….” Julia paused, imitating the way Vesper stood silently, leaving everyone in agony as she revealed results. She was being goofy for no discernible reason that Sophie could tell since any footage of Julia was not usable footage. Channeling her mom, Sophie gave Julia her best withering hurry-up look. Finally, she finished with, “… you’re doing a contemporary dance!”

Admittedly the reveal was worth it, as an uninhibited Sophie screamed in excitement. She grabbed Ryan, pulling her in for a hug, forcing her to join her in jumping up and down.  Even as Ryan laughed at her antics, Julia smiled at them and said sarcastically, “Save the antics for when we do a take of this for the cameras! As an aside, I’m also happy that you finally get to do contemporary. I’ve got some wiggle room for the contemporary routine to have you choose your song. Your other dance this week will be an Argentine Tango to Down by Marian Hill.”

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt:
This song was a very deliberate choice. This was a very personal dance. And she was about to show it to the only person whose opinion mattered.  With her finger hovering over the phone, she second-guessed herself and added, “Remember, I just came up with this quickly. If you don’t like the dance or the song, we have plenty of time to swap it.” 

She hit the play button and quickly put her phone down as the initial bars of Angels by the xx came across the speakers. Although Sophie had a vague idea of the pattern she’d take, the actual dance steps were complete improvisation.  Her body picked up the rhythm of the music and let what she felt for Ryan show through her movements.

Chapter Title: Week 9 - Angels

...

This song was a very deliberate choice. This was a very personal dance. And she was about to show it to the only person whose opinion mattered.  With her finger hovering over the phone, she second-guessed herself and added, “Remember, I just came up with this quickly. If you don’t like the dance or the song, we have plenty of time to swap it.” 

She hit the play button and quickly put her phone down as the initial bars of Angels by the xx came across the speakers. Although Sophie had a vague idea of the pattern she’d take, the actual dance steps were complete improvisation.  Her body picked up the rhythm of the music and let what she felt for Ryan show through her movements.

Excerpt:
“We want to dance to Bruno.” Lily gave a little jump in excitement.

“Yeah, Bruno,” Maya screeched. “Alexis play don’t talk about Bruno.” Maya glanced around the room, like she was waiting for the song to play.

“It’s Alexa and we don’t have one. That’s only at your Aunt Emma’s,” Sophie reminded her daughter. “And how about we dance to something else,” Sophie said. She was all for having a little dance with her girls, but she detested the song ‘we don’t talk about Bruno’. In fact, she didn’t really like Encanto all that much either. “Anything but Bruno.”

“No,” Lily frowned. “Mommy please.” Lily batted her eyelashes at her mother.

Sophie looked down to Lily who was looking up at her, all puppy dog like. “You know I can’t say no to that little face,” Sophie pinched Lily’s cheek. She really wanted to talk to the girls about the divorce but she figured she’d let them have a little fun first. She’d much rather be doing this with Tyler present but he’d made it pretty clear to her that he wasn’t having any involvement in this conversation. “One song because then I want to talk to you, okay?”

Excerpt:
For the first hour, guests dined on cocktails and crudites that were served inside the runway garden. It created intimacy for the show, taming the flashing lets these events are known for and focusing the story being told. Sophie stood behind the backdrop peeking out at the guests milling around in the garden— all dressed in blue. There were drones capturing the evening from above. There was no doubt that the photos would be absolutely breathtaking. 

“Holy fuck, Soph. I can’t believe what I am witnessing,” Jordan walked up beside her sister, “this is the most amazing thing I have ever seen. And don’t take this the wrong but I hope never to fall in love like you two.”

“And why is that?”

“You see this? These are some high standards that I am not prepared to live up to. Like what y’all gonna do for the wedding and shit, suspend  yourself in a transparent plane on a cloud while a hologram of Whitney Houston is projected from the sun singing ‘And IIIIIIIIIIIIII…” Sophie interrupted her sister.

“Jordan, don’t sing,” Sophie laughed at her sister’s colourful personality

Excerpt:
In the studio as Ryan listened to every take of the song, performed by Ari and then sent to other artists she instinctively knew what was missing: her. 

The love sign glowed as everyone focused their attention on the silhouette of Ryan. Everyone in attendance was witnessing love bloom in real-time. Cassandra Moore sat emotionally beside her two daughters. The tears of all the love she withheld for too long; the tears of gratitude for someone coming along to do what she wouldn’t. Sophie held her sister’s hand as the first note played.

Baby, the sound of you

Better than a harmony

I want you off my mind

And on me

Holding me closer than we've ever been before

This ain't a dream

You're here with me

Girl, it don't get no better than you

For you, I wanna take my time

All night

At the sound of the word baby, the rest of the world disappeared. It was Ryan and Sophie in the garden. Rather than walking the runway. Ryan danced through the garden as she sang.

At the sound of the word baby, the rest of the world disappeared. It was Ryan and Sophie in the garden. Rather than walking the runway. Ryan danced through the garden as she sang. 

I wanna love you in every kind of way

I wanna please you, no matter how long it takes

If the world should end tomorrow and we only have today

I'm gonna love you in every kind of way

Excerpt:
Story Title: Contrasting Colors

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

I was in the mood for angst. If you've read some of the dialogue before in this? No you haven't. Songs are Contrasting Colors by Speak Low if you speak love, Dancing With Our Hands Tied by T. Swift, I Found by Amber Run, and Anyone Else by PVRIS in that order. Enjoy!

...

Fall into place like contrasting colors
You were gold, I was green to discover
Swirling like oceans apart from each other
You and I may never be lovers

She had come to know her life would change completely three nights before her eleventh birthday.

The skin above the right hip itched and stung. She could feel the name etch itself into her skin. Like it was being burned in by a laser.

It terrified her.

You weren't supposed to find out the name of your soulmate until you were eighteen years old. Unless, you're soulmate had turned eighteen before you. And sure that was moderately common. If the age gap was no more than like 2 years. But for her it was different.

Ryan knew what that had meant almost immediately. She had always been a precocious kid.

It meant that her mate was seven dang years older than her.

That couldn't be good.

She peered down and peeled the hem of her sleep shorts away from her hip. The name was upside down from her perspective but she read at a 9th grade level and that probably translated to being able to read upside down.

Sophie Diane Moore

Ryan had heard that name before. She's obsessed over that name before. She's read that name's New York Times Bestselling novel over and over again since it hit the shelves two years prior. Sophie Moore had been something of a child prodigy herself.

Ryan frowned. Then pouted. Then she cried. Not only was her soulmate seven years her senior, she was also famous.

She never stood a chance.

The mark you said would last, I'm noticing
It never did

Ryan usually watched Entertainment Tonight with her foster mother on Thursdays at 4 pm. They'd been doing that since Ryan was twelve. She's now fifteen and things haven't changed.

The name above her hip tingled slightly and she shifted.

Her mother reached to change the channel when she noticed the new hot topic being introduced. Ryan waved her off.

It had been a familial (her social worker had also been involved) decision to keep Ryan from having any contact with the author. Ryan, her mother, and her social worker had sat around the dining room table staring at each other for a full five minutes before Cora spoke up and explained their position.

Ryan was too young, Sophie was too....famous.

Ryan didn't really get a say, though, she realized any of her decisions would have been heavily biased considering she's genetically wired to be in love with the woman. And her guardians haven't failed her so far. So, she went along with it.

Even now, it was one of those times when Cora had been right. She quickly realized that preventing her mother from changing the channel was a grave mistake.

"Sh-she has a girlfriend?" Ryan whispered mainly to herself. Despite her quietness, her mother heard her anyway.

Cora pulled her trembling daughter into her side. "Do-does she not love me? Does she not want me? D-does she not-"

"Shhhhh, baby. Shhhh." Ryan does eventually quiet down, if anything to better hear the sound of her own heart cracking in two.

Ryan watched Sophie happily prance around with her new girlfriend, Kate. Sophie had girlfriends and one boyfriend before and they all pierced her heart with blunt, rusty knives, but this one hurt worse.

She's not sure why.

Would you say that you loved me if you knew I do?
Or is protecting your pride worth more than the truth?
I'm still waiting on something you outgrew

By her eighteenth birthday, Ryan Wilder was over Sophie Moore. Or at least as much as she could be. She had also figured out why it hurt more.

It hurt more because now they're engaged. But what can she do? Absolutely nothing.

She's made a name for herself. She's successful, just like Sophie.

She's the youngest in her graduating class for law school. And definitely the only queer black woman.

She's got her own office at a prestigious firm and at 21 she's well on her way to make senior partner. She's grateful.

The circumstances are funny, she likes to think.

Swirling like oceans apart from each other
You and I may never be lovers

Two years later, she can buy three beach houses right next to each other on the shore. And she does, simply because she can. One for her. One for her mom. And one just as a fucking backup.

She's never been closer to Sophie in years, and she wouldn't dare get any closer.

Because Sophie pretends her name isn't written across her left hip in bright red ink. Like she hasn't been branded for life. Because Sophie pretends Kate Kane is her soulmate. Because Sophie pretends she doesn't exist.

Ryan knows Sophie's favorite color is gold and her own is green (those colors don't fit together), she knows Sophie's afraid of thunderstorms and Ryan loves them (maybe that isn't exactly compatible), she knows that they don't fit and Sophie is happy without her.

And that's fine with Ryan, if Sophie wants to boast about how good her life is without her, then so can she.

And Ryan can boast better.

And Ryan can boast better.

Writer's Beginning Notes:

I was in the mood for angst. If you've read some of the dialogue before in this? No you haven't. Songs are Contrasting Colors by Speak Low if you speak love, Dancing With Our Hands Tied by T. Swift, I Found by Amber Run, and Anyone Else by PVRIS in that order. Enjoy!

Picture of your face in an invisible locket

The only upside to her current predicament was that Luke was with her, looking just as miserable as she felt.

Though, she knew his reason for being miserable had more to do with having to leave Mary to her work duties, than being forced to have fun by his boss.

"God, how did you deal with this growing up?" Ryan gestured to the general vicinity of the room.

Luke adjusted his black and blue mask then shrugged, "I mainly stayed by the food tables and played on my gameboy advance. Surprising fact about stuck up rich people? They don't really eat."

Ryan eyed the room with scrutiny, "That's not surprising at all."

Loud waltz music suddenly started playing, indicating a well rehearsed dance that Ryan wasn't in on.

Luke held his hand out with an exaggerated flourish, "May I have this dance, m'lady?"

Ryan stared at him blankly.

Luke huffed, "C'mon, Ryan. Dad said you need to have fun and this is the perfect opportunity."

Ryan's lip twitched, "I don't know how to waltz."

"Neither do they." Luke pointed to a couple clearly in their own world as they happily made up steps with each other. He held out his hand again.

Ryan heaved out a sigh, "Fine. But I'm leading."

Luke didn't have time to protest before Ryan was dragging him out onto the dancefloor.

Luke ended up being right. Dancing and goofing off in the otherwise stuffy atmosphere was enjoyable.

That was until she got a tap on the shoulder.

"May I cut in?" Ryan knew that voice anywhere. Suddenly, she wasn't having fun anymore.

And Luke, that bastard, offered her up with no hesitation.

And there she was, for the first time ever, face to face, or rather mask to mask with her soulmate.

Her senses were heightened. She could feel everything. Hear everything. Smell everything.

She could feel Sophie's hand and everytime it flexed nervously against her hip. She could hear the apphrensive gulp of air Sophie took before speaking. She couldn't smell anything but the Yves Saint Laurent Libre perfume Sophie wore.

It was comically how quickly all that resentment she had spent the last decade of her life building up, just crumbled away.

"Was the misses busy?" Though, she had managed to maintain the pettiness.

"Ryan..." Sophie sighed out softly.

"Oh? You know my name?"

"It's only seared into my hip."

Ryan scoffed, "Could've fooled me."

"I deserve that. But, what was I supposed to do Ryan? Wait?"

"Yes! You were supposed to wait for me."

"Seven years, Ryan. That's-"

"You think I don't know that? I did it. You were supposed to sit there and be miserable like I have for the past 16 years." Ryan poked Sophie in the shoulder.

"I'm sorry, Ryan. I really am, but would you just listen to me?" And to her credit, Sophie sounded genuinely upset and apologetic, but Ryan couldn't have even begun to listen even if she wanted to. She was just mad.

"Did she leave you? Did she finally realize you would never truly be happy with her? She did she finally grow curious about who was tattooed to her own body? Does it suck to be alone?"

"You were a kid, Ryan!" Sophie looked as though she wanted to pull her hair out. Welcome to Ryan's world.

"I'm 27, Sophie. I haven't been a kid for a while." They were no longer dancing. They hadn't been for a while. Just standing in the middle of a sea of spinning amd twirling couples like two lunatics.

"What are you saying? You won't hear me out. You won't see things from my perspective. So, what do you want me to do? Do you want me to leave you alone?"

Ryan's eyes narrowed, she didn't want any of those things in the slightest.

She wanted Sophie to do what she herself couldn't. She wanted Sophie to scream and fight for her and get it through her thick skull that despite wanting all those things it was going to take Ryan a while before she could truly forgive her.

She wanted to fall into Sophie's arms and tell her about the past twenty-seven years that she had missed. She wanted to introduce Sophie to her mom and to overhear her mom threaten Sophie if she ever put Ryan through something like waiting for her for sixteen years again.

She just wanted Sophie.

And yet, for some reason, none of that left her mouth. In its place, just a huff of air. And a insincere apology as she hightailed it out of that damn gala.

If I could dance with you again
I'd kiss you as the lights went out
Swaying as the room burned down
I'd hold you as the water rushes in

Instead of taking off a week, Lucius had added another. And hell, Ryan couldn't blame him.

She felt like she had gotten run over by a steamroller.

Seeing news of Sophie's divorce in the tabloids did nothing to make her feel better.

Luke and Mary occasionally popped over to her apartment, separately because they thought being together would throw her into a fit if hysterics.

Cora also occasionally appeared mysteriously in her apartment from time to time when she got that mother instinct thing that Ryan wasn't eating as much as she should. Slipped in her Tupperware containers were subliminal messages that suggested she get over herself and talk to Sophie.

She didn't listen.

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

I was in the mood for angst. If you've read some of the dialogue before in this? No you haven't. Songs are Contrasting Colors by Speak Low if you speak love, Dancing With Our Hands Tied by T. Swift, I Found by Amber Run, and Anyone Else by PVRIS in that order. Enjoy!

...

I'll use you as a warning sign
That if you talk enough sense then you'll lose your mind
And I'll use you as a focal point
So I don't lose sight of what I want

The knock at her door caused her to just about out of her skin. She wasn't expecting anyone. And those who were allowed to not be expected had a key.

"Ryan?" The voice called through the door. And Ryan abruptly stopped reaching for the knob to open it.

"How'd you find me?"

Sophie chuckled out something so warm that Ryan had the urge to turn on the air conditioning.

"Friends in high places."

"Figures."

"You're really not going to open the door? Fine. I didn't think actually you'd open the door. That's fine. I'll just yell through it." She chuckled to herself.

Ryan paused. She didn't move further from the door, but she didn't get any closer either.

"You were right, y'know? About Kate. At least partially. She did realize that I would never be able to truly give her my all. No matter how hard we tried to pretend. She doesn't have a soulmate, though."

Ryan remained quiet. Content to finally listen to Sophie.

"I guess we just thought it would make sense to force it. To settle down with each other because it was easier. Neither of us had to suffer that way..."

Ryan heard a small thud around where Sophie's head would be. She drew the conclusion that Sophie had placed her forehead against the door.

"But, I was miserable anyway. I still suffered. Because I knew you were out there somewhere, I couldn't bring myself to care for Kate the way I should have been caring for you."

Ryan's lip quivered. This time she did get closer to the door. Ryan rested her own forehead on it before sliding down and sitting with her back up against it. Her knees pressed into her chest.

"I got complacent. After a while, I just assumed you were better off without me."

"I wasn't." Ryan insisted.

"I wish I would have realized that sooner." Sophie's voice is right next to Ryan's ear. She must be sitting in the hallway of Ryan's apartment building with her back against the door. Their positions mirrored.

"Me too." Ryan whispered to herself.

"I am so fucking sorry, Ryan."

Another soft thud, "Do I scare you, Ryan? Because you terrify me."

Ryan stood up quickly. She opened the door with a determination she hadn't felt in years.

Sophie fell backwards into the apartment with a yelp. Her head resting at Ryan's slipper-clad feet. She smiled up with her a goofy grin.

"I thought I was going to eventually have to kick this door open or something."

"Stand up." Ryan said simply.

"God, you're bossy." Sophie said but she didn't move. Uncaring that several people had to step over her legs to get to their apartments.

"You'll get used to it. Now, stand up."

Sophie finally did as told. She leaned against the doorway waiting for the next order she just naturally knew Ryan was going to give her.

"You're sorry and you admit that making me wait for you was stupid and mean?"

"Yes to all of the above."

Ryan nodded slowly, "Okay. Then, ask me out."

Sophie smirked annoying smirk that Ryan couldn't wait to wipe off her face. Preferably, with own face.

But I missed you more than I thought I would

"Ryan Wilder, will you go out with on a date with me?"

Writer's Beginning Notes:

I was in the mood for angst. If you've read some of the dialogue before in this? No you haven't. Songs are Contrasting Colors by Speak Low if you speak love, Dancing With Our Hands Tied by T. Swift, I Found by Amber Run, and Anyone Else by PVRIS in that order. Enjoy!

...

Please don't think that I let you go
I'll never let go

"I'd love to, Sophie Moore. Thank you, for asking so politely and completely unprompted."

"Ha. Ha."

"I thought it was pretty funny. You're losing your sense of humor in your old age."

"On second thought, I don't think this will work..." Sophie moved to back into the hallway before Ryan had snagged her by the collar of her shirt.

"Come here." Ryan pulled Sophie down towards her.

"Wow. A kiss before the first date? What kind of woman do you take me for, Ryan?"

"A woman who is absolutely going to kiss me before the first date."

"You know me so well."

And Ryan did know her well, because as soon as Sophie was done wasting time by cracking jokes because she was nervous, she did kiss her.

First date be damned. They had waited long enough.

I don't belong to anyone else
I don't belong to anyone else
I know you only want me to yourself
But I don't belong to anyone else

Story: Just a Little Bit of Your Heart: Deleted Scenes
Excerpt:
"Let's dance," Sophie said as she pushed off of her stool and led Ryan towards the dance floor, hands still on her hips. Sophie walked them over to the DJ and she leaned in, giving a song request. The DJ nodded once before Sophie led Ryan again towards the dance floor. The opening melody of Kelly Rowland's Put Your Name On It played as Sophie stood behind Ryan and began dancing, hands still on her hips. Ryan began moving with her and they found themselves getting lost in the lyrics. 

And I can't even help you, babe

And I don't want you to ever stop

Stop the way that your loving me

Baby, you've got my heart

With everything that's inside of me

Give you more than just part of me

You know that you got my heart

The song choice was deliberate, for the streets and for Ryan. Sophie had been the talk of The Hold Up for long enough and the women there needed to find another topic of conversation. She belonged to Ryan. The ring on her finger, a symbol of their tether and the ultimate representation of their partnership, should've been enough to let them hoes know as Jordan would say, but as it was, she hoped their appearance together and Ryan's interaction with Cassie was enough to deter anyone else. 

Only for you

Baby, it's all yours

You can put your name on it

Only for you

What you waiting for?

You can put your name on it

Only for you

Baby, it's all yours

You can put your name on it

Only for you

Baby, you got my heart

Ryan turned towards Sophie and wrapped her arms around her neck. Sophie pulled her in close and together they rocked to the music. She was so close to Sophie that she could feel the heat radiating from her. She turned around again and Sophie held her by the waist. Ryan made eye contact with Deja and Cassie who just so happened to be dancing together. She ground her ass into Sophie's pelvis and flashed her ring as a reminder to them both of who retired Sophie's roster. 

Petty Ryan would always make a resurgence when it came to Sophie Wilder-Moore. 

Sophie caught the gesture and laughed lowly before licking the outer edge of Ryan's ear, eliciting a shiver from her wife. 

"As much as I enjoy the show we're giving them, I'd much rather star in our own," Sophie said as she bent down to kiss the side of Ryan's neck. 

Ryan leaned her head to the side to give Sophie more access and closed her eyes, no longer focused on anyone or anything beyond Sophie.

Excerpt:
An amazingly soft voice that was probably 1 or 2 notes off key is floating through Sophie’s condo as she wakes up. From recent memory she knows this voice belongs to Ryan Wilder, a petite thickish, outspoken, vegan, and smartass African-American woman. Sophie slowly rolls up to a sitting position. Ryan rounds the corner, “I want the world to know, I got to let it show, AAGH!” Ryan shouts as she sees Sophie up smirking. Her shout is followed by giggling. “Hey Soph, how’d you sleep?” 




“I slept just fine, Ms. Wilder. Do you always insist on singing oldies off key?” Sophie stood up and glanced at Ryan’s phone. 




“I was not off key, I’ll have you know,” Ryan tilted her phone up, “I was just adding a little pizazz to the song.”

An amazingly soft voice that was probably 1 or 2 notes off key is floating through Sophie’s condo as she wakes up. From recent memory she knows this voice belongs to Ryan Wilder, a petite thickish, outspoken, vegan, and smartass African-American woman. Sophie slowly rolls up to a sitting position. Ryan rounds the corner, “I want the world to know, I got to let it show, AAGH!” Ryan shouts as she sees Sophie up smirking. Her shout is followed by giggling. “Hey Soph, how’d you sleep?” 

 

“I slept just fine, Ms. Wilder. Do you always insist on singing oldies off key?” Sophie stood up and glanced at Ryan’s phone. 

 

“I was not off key, I’ll have you know,” Ryan tilted her phone up, “I was just adding a little pizazz to the song.”
SongArtist: I'm Coming Out by Diana Ross

Batwoman AU (part 2) by Steffane1

Excerpt:
The sounds of Maze featuring Frankie Beverly in concert fill the air. Ryan has begun a 2-step in Sophie’s main hallway. Sophie steps off key over to her blinds and opens them before joining Ryan in her 2-step. Both turn to face each other. 

Ryan is feeling good and allowing the music to flow through her. The stress of earlier is completely gone. She belts out the first verse. “You made me happy. This you can bet. You stood right beside me, yeah. And I won’t forget. I really love you. You should know. I wanna make sure I’m right, girl. Before I let go.” 

Sophie picks up the next verse as Ryan catches her breath and continues to dance with a full grin showing all her teeth. “Now we’ve had our good time. That’s not the same. We’re hurtin’ each other. Girl it’s a shame. I won’t be foolish, no, no. I’ve got to know. I wanna make sure I’m right, girl, oh. Before I let go.” 

Both women look up and continue singing the song together. “You know I thank God sun rises and shines on you. You know there’s nothin’, nothin’, nothin’, I would not do. Whoa, no.” 

As the guitar solo begins Sophie runs into her guest bathroom and grabs a comb and brush. She hands the brush to Ryan, who accepts her fake mic graciously. 

Ryan sings alone. “We were so close. I love you’re strong, ooh. I can’t understand it, no no. Where did we go wrong? I won’t be askin’, girl. I want to know. I wanna make sure I’m right, girl. Before I let go, ah-ha, ah-ha.” Sophie can hear Ryan accentuating the performance repeating the adverbs. It’s cute. 

As the song came to a close Ryan picked up her phone and paused the song. “I should’ve known you’d be into the old skool jams.”

Excerpt:
Sophie retrieved Ryan’s phone and started the next song. As “RUMPSHAKER” began Sophie quipped, “Okay, Ms. Wilder.” Ryan ignored Sophie as she shook her rump exaggeratedly. Seeing this Sophie just joined along shaking her bottom and waving her hands above her head or at her sides. Neither of them sang along.

The song comes to a close and Ryan answers Sophie’s unasked question. “I heard this song during a block party when I was 10 and all I knew was ‘All I wanna do is zoom-a-zoom-zoom-zoom in a boom-boom.” 

With her eyes glowing Sophie laughed, “It’s not ‘in a boom-boom’, it’s “and a poom-poom’. But when I saw girls my age dancing to this I knew too.” 

“How old were you when the song came out?” Ryan asked. 

Sophie looked thoughtful as she scrunched her nose, “Probably 5 or about to turn 5. Not in school, why?” 

Ryan sat down, “I was born the year this song came out.” Fear washed over her like a cold shower. Her eyes dimmed again and there was an overwhelming feeling of doubt. What was she doing? There was no way she could be good enough for an Army vet. Sophie was a soldier and she deserved a fighter.

Batwoman AU (part 2) by Steffane1

Excerpt:
Sophie bent down on her knees and grabbed Ryan’s hands. With her thumbs she stroked up to Ryan’s wrists. Ryan looked at her golden brown eyes. “I would like to play a song now, if I could.”

“Okay,” Ryan choked back her tears and wiped her eyes as Sophie got up and grabbed Ryan’s phone. Sophie scrolled down. As the instrumental played Sophie pulled Ryan to her feet and stared her in her eyes as she mouthed the lyrics ‘ Can’t understand. Why we treat each other in this way. Taking up time. With the silly silly games we play. We’ve got our love. And no matter how it’s said or done. We are one. No matter what we do. We are one. Love will see us through. We are one. And that’s the way it is .’ Sophie took the break and spun Ryan around. Ryan’s face was glowing when she came back around. Secretly, Ryan had always wanted to be spun while dancing, but she never had a girlfriend tall enough. When dancing with Imani, Imani was spun, but she never reciprocated. That’s just the way some people are, Ryan guessed. Ryan felt amazing in Sophie’s arms.

Sophie picks up Ryan’s phone and scrolls back up before making her selection. The soulful instrumental of “We Are One” began as Sophie sat Ryan’s phone down on the couch. Ryan stepped closer and grabbed Sophie’s left hand and placed her left hand on Sophie’s back. With her head rested on Sophie’s chest Ryan & Sophie swayed to the music. Sophie rubbed Ryan’s back as she felt Ryan’s heartbeat pick up. Jordan watched the interaction from the hallway beside the guest bathroom. Somehow music had catapulted Wildmoore into orbit way sooner then they had anticipated. Watching them was like watching a movie. The music that filled the room was the backtrack and the scene 2 African-American women finding each other through music. How could this go wrong?
SongArtist: We Are One by Maze, Frankie Beverly

We Are One by Maze, Frankie Beverly
Batwoman AU (part 2) by Steffane1

Excerpt:
The instrumental of “Ain’t No Stopping Us Now” by MacFadden & Whitehead started. Sophie pulled out her best soul train hip sway. It was all long legs and her snapping fingers. Ryan looked up at Sophie and Sophie made both hands into peace signs and drug them past her eyes. Ryan tried to hold it in, but with Sophie staring at her with her shiny eyes Ryan fell back on the couch and laughed. Sophie gradually pulled Ryan back up and bumped her with her hip. Ryan fell out again. She saw how serious Sophie was as she continued swaying from left to right. Ryan stifled her laughing and joined Sophie for a few hip bumps. 

It was insane how dancing to oldies could make Ryan feel like she was flying. The last time she danced to these kinds of songs was with Mama Cora in their apartment. Mama Cora had cassette tapes and once Ryan connected with her mama over the music she rewound those tapes back and forth. If she could stay with Mama Cora in that apartment all day, no matter what they were doing the tapes played. Mama Cora would braid her hair to this music, cook dinner, clean the apartment. Ryan also remembered greasing Mama Cora’s scalp, shucking ears of corn, snapping green beans, anything you could think of to these songs. 

As the song stopped Ryan clutched Sophie to her. “Can you just hold me for a second?” Ryan whispered. 

Sophie replied, “Sure.” She rubbed Ryan’s back and just held her. She could feel Ryan’s heart beating fast. Ryan felt Sophie’s steady heartbeat. Sophie had such strong arms, while her hands were gentle. Ryan trembled a little in the embrace. 

“Thank you for this,” Ryan whispered. “This is nice.” 

Sophie sighed, “I wouldn’t be here without you, Ryan. So, thank you.”

Mama Cora had cassette tapes and once Ryan connected with her mama over the music she rewound those tapes back and forth. If she could stay with Mama Cora in that apartment all day, no matter what they were doing the tapes played. Mama Cora would braid her hair to this music, cook dinner, clean the apartment. Ryan also remembered greasing Mama Cora’s scalp, shucking ears of corn, snapping green beans, anything you could think of to these songs. 

As the song stopped Ryan clutched Sophie to her. “Can you just hold me for a second?” Ryan whispered. 

Sophie replied, “Sure.” She rubbed Ryan’s back and just held her. She could feel Ryan’s heart beating fast. Ryan felt Sophie’s steady heartbeat. Sophie had such strong arms, while her hands were gentle. Ryan trembled a little in the embrace. 

“Thank you for this,” Ryan whispered. “This is nice.” 

Sophie sighed, “I wouldn’t be here without you, Ryan. So, thank you.”

Batwoman AU (part 2) by Steffane1

Excerpt:
“Will you start the next song?” Sophie asked. Ryan got up and grabbed her phone. As soon as the beat began Sophie stood up and grabbed Ryan by the hand. “When Jordan and I used to listen to this we always danced.” 

“Okay,” Ryan smiled as Sophie drug her over to the carpet. Sophie began kicking her leg out and spinning like she was Jody Watley. Ryan watched for a few seconds and got into step. They were having so much fun they didn’t hear the front door open and close. Jordan watched with a grin on her face. She sat the bags in her hands in the kitchen and burst in singing “The Second Time Around” loud and off key. She yanked Sophie to the right and took her rightful place at the center. Sophie slowly placed her hands on her hips and watched as Jordan took her place. 

“Good evening, ladies. I brought dinner,” Jordan smiled and said when the song ended.

Batwoman AU (part 2) by Steffane1

Excerpt:
Sophie deflated. "I'm sorry. You must think I'm selfish with the way that I'm talking."

Ryan looked back at Sophie. "I don't, actually. That's your truth; who am I to judge you for it?"

"Still, considering the alternative, my problems seem pretty mundane."

"This isn't the oppression olympics, Soph; You can be upset with your family, it's kind of par for the course. Mo money, mo problems, right?"

Sophie laughed out loud at the Biggie reference and Ryan smiled. Sophie's laugh was easily becoming her favorite sound.

Ryan looked back at Sophie. "I don't, actually. That's your truth; who am I to judge you for it?"

"Still, considering the alternative, my problems seem pretty mundane."

"This isn't the oppression olympics, Soph; You can be upset with your family, it's kind of par for the course. Mo money, mo problems, right?"

Sophie laughed out loud at the Biggie reference and Ryan smiled. Sophie's laugh was easily becoming her favorite sound.

Excerpt:
Ryan and Sophie looked at each other as they realized that Skylar was wise beyond her years.

“So, what were you an Aunt Diane doing?” Sophie asked.

“We watched Bluey.” She said with excitement.

“Is that what you want to watch?” Ryan asked.

“Yes please.” Skylar said as Ryan reached for the remote to try to find the show. When the show wasn’t available live she went to her Disney plus app and was able to find it there.

Skylar jumped up and sang along with the theme song as Ryan looked on with a huge smile on her face. Sophie looked at her and didn’t recognize the smile she had. They had been dating for two years now and they had discussed children but it was never decided if they would actually have kids or not.

Excerpt:
Sophie was busy grabbing a bottle of tequila from her liquor cabinet when her front door opened.

"Down in the valley where the girls get naked, if you throwin’ bands, then you know she gon’ shake it! 1, 2 break ’em, 3, 4 rake ’em!" Jordan twerked her way inside of Sophie's house. She closed and locked the door behind her and set her purse down on the kitchen island where she found her sister.

"I'm restricting your key privileges," Sophie deadpanned as she set the tequila bottle on the island. 

"Sis, let's not make false statements," Jordan said as she sat down on one of the barstools. 

"You finally finished season 2?" Sophie poured her sister some tequila in a glass and handed it to her before cutting up limes for margaritas.

"Yes! I need a Mercedes Experience in my life. Or a pole class. Ooh! Does your girl have pole classes at her gym?" Jordan said, taking a sip of her tequila.
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie was busy grabbing a bottle of tequila from her liquor cabinet when her front door opened.

"Down in the valley where the girls get naked, if you throwin’ bands, then you know she gon’ shake it! 1, 2 break ’em, 3, 4 rake ’em!" Jordan twerked her way inside of Sophie's house. She closed and locked the door behind her and set her purse down on the kitchen island where she found her sister.

"I'm restricting your key privileges," Sophie deadpanned as she set the tequila bottle on the island. 

"Sis, let's not make false statements," Jordan said as she sat down on one of the barstools. 

"You finally finished season 2?" Sophie poured her sister some tequila in a glass and handed it to her before cutting up limes for margaritas.

"Yes! I need a Mercedes Experience in my life. Or a pole class. Ooh! Does your girl have pole classes at her gym?" Jordan said, taking a sip of her tequila.

Excerpt:
"Stay Alive buddies," Sophie stated. 

"Yes, the name sucks, but roll with it."

Sophie chuckled and pulled out her phone. "What's your number, buddy?"

Ryan gave it to her and Sophie called it so Ryan had her number. 

"Please don't save my name under 'Stay Alive Buddy,'' Sophie asked as Ryan saved Sophie's number. 

Ryan gasped. "If ringtones were still a thing, you better believe Stayin' Alive would've been your ringtone."

Sophie laughed out loud as her car was brought around. The valet left her car running and the driver's side door open for her. Before she got into her vehicle, she turned to Ryan.

"Thank you, again. I fully expected to hate tonight but I didn't and that's thanks to you."

Ryan smiled. "You're welcome, buddy. Get home safely."

Excerpt:
“ What does love feel like to you?” a masculine voice questioned from the background. 

 Ryan looked down, about the surroundings of her environment, and then the camera. “ It used to feel fleeting. ” Head cocked, she chewed a lip and seemed to think before expounding, “ Now it’s overwhelming?” 

“ Overwhelming ?” they probed. 

“ I learned to not look for it, because so much of it has been stolen in my lifetime. I drew in and chose to be almost detached .” 

“ Someone changed that for you? ” 

 Her expression softened, became younger. A light smile played around her mouth. “ Someones ,” she stressed. “ but for the sake of transparency, I will tell Gotham, Twitter, and most of the horny gays on Tumblr that I do, in fact, have a woman who plays in my hair and tells me I’m pretty over oatmeal açaí berry bowls in the morning .” She sighed audibly. “ I wasn’t being my authentic self when I said otherwise .” Staring directly into the lens, she explained, “ I was afraid. As mentioned, there’s safety in solitude .” Her shoulders jerked. “ But unless I can believe the life I have is deserved, that good things are for me, I can’t know joy. ” Ryan grew solemn. “ She brings me joy. An insane amount. ” Her mouth trembled slightly. “ So baby, if you’re hearing this at all—and I’ll have them run it as many times as they need to—fear doesn’t get to determine the extent of which I live life publicly anymore.“ 

 It darkened as ecstatic whistles and calls rent the air. Following, a slow velvety melody of Evergreen began, showing various video clips and photos from LGBTQ+ couples of all orientations and ethnicities. Just before it stopped, a minute clip of Ryan cut back in, dressed for laser tag game night. It was obviously selfie footage from the way she held a moving camera before her and spun to show the background where an unaware Sophie sat with Luke and Mary drinking slushies post-game. 

 “ Dear diary ,” she hummed with a wide smile. “ I think that lady might be the most unhinged laser tagger I’ve ever seen. She literally yelled, ‘die, die, die,’  while shooting. I’m concerned.” 

 Laughter startled out of her and others as her face went hot in surprised delight. 

“ But she real cute tho’. And I like her or whatever.” 

The screen went black and the Sophie couldn’t hear past the ringing in her ears, feel past the elated numbness in her toes. 

“I want to encourage everyone here,” Ryan was saying on stage, “to remember that their perspective of a life in lonely, hopeless solitude because of who you find consenting passion with is not a truth with any foundation.

“ What does love feel like to you?” a masculine voice questioned from the background.

 

 Ryan looked down, about the surroundings of her environment, and then the camera. “ It used to feel fleeting. ” Head cocked, she chewed a lip and seemed to think before expounding, “ Now it’s overwhelming?”

 

“ Overwhelming ?” they probed.

 

“ I learned to not look for it, because so much of it has been stolen in my lifetime. I drew in and chose to be almost detached .”

 

“ Someone changed that for you? ”

 

 Her expression softened, became younger. A light smile played around her mouth. “ Someones ,” she stressed. “ but for the sake of transparency, I will tell Gotham, Twitter, and most of the horny gays on Tumblr that I do, in fact, have a woman who plays in my hair and tells me I’m pretty over oatmeal açaí berry bowls in the morning .” She sighed audibly. “ I wasn’t being my authentic self when I said otherwise .” Staring directly into the lens, she explained, “ I was afraid. As mentioned, there’s safety in solitude .” Her shoulders jerked. “ But unless I can believe the life I have is deserved, that good things are for me, I can’t know joy. ” Ryan grew solemn. “ She brings me joy. An insane amount. ” Her mouth trembled slightly. “ So baby, if you’re hearing this at all—and I’ll have them run it as many times as they need to—fear doesn’t get to determine the extent of which I live life publicly anymore.“

 

 It darkened as ecstatic whistles and calls rent the air. Following, a slow velvety melody of Evergreen began, showing various video clips and photos from LGBTQ+ couples of all orientations and ethnicities. Just before it stopped, a minute clip of Ryan cut back in, dressed for laser tag game night. It was obviously selfie footage from the way she held a moving camera before her and spun to show the background where an unaware Sophie sat with Luke and Mary drinking slushies post-game.

 

 “ Dear diary ,” she hummed with a wide smile. “ I think that lady might be the most unhinged laser tagger I’ve ever seen. She literally yelled, ‘die, die, die,’  while shooting. I’m concerned.”

 

 Laughter startled out of her and others as her face went hot in surprised delight.

 

“ But she real cute tho’. And I like her or whatever.”

 

The screen went black and the Sophie couldn’t hear past the ringing in her ears, feel past the elated numbness in her toes.

 

“I want to encourage everyone here,” Ryan was saying on stage, “to remember that their perspective of a life in lonely, hopeless solitude because of who you find consenting passion with is not a truth with any foundation.

Excerpt:
With her second load of darks in the washer and Sophie placing her work shirts on hangers she started playing her own old skool playlist. Her playlist began with “September” by Earth, Wind & Fire. As the melody flowed through the condo a sleeping Ryan’s ears registered the familiarity. She blinked her eyes open and sat up in a yellow t-shirt and blue shorts. Sleeping in a bed had Ryan’s body feeling refreshed. She wasn’t bombarded by the cold and she slept soundly not worrying if she heard someone jiggling the door handle on her van. Ryan opened her door to find a tray with a mug of hot water with the option of the 3 different teabags, a sliced apple, and a bowl of grapes. After registering that her breakfast had been prepared Ryan’s head continued rocking to the rhythm. It was Saturday and she couldn’t expect Sophie to leave just to appease her. Ryan picked up the tray and closed her door. She slunk out to take care of her hygiene, but returned quickly to her quarters. 

Ryan ate her fruit and drank her black tea with honey and continued swaying to Sophie’s playlist. She had quite the selection. The playlist rolls through Michael Jackson’s “Rock With You”, Patrice Rushen’s “Forget Me Nots”, and Rick James’ “Super Freak” almost gets Ryan dancing out of her room. She didn’t know why this track was missing from her playlist. Next was Evelyn Champagne King’s “Love Come Down”. This song was on Ryan’s playlist as well.

Ryan picked up the tray and closed her door. She slunk out to take care of her hygiene, but returned quickly to her quarters. 

Ryan ate her fruit and drank her black tea with honey and continued swaying to Sophie’s playlist. She had quite the selection. The playlist rolls through Michael Jackson’s “Rock With You”, Patrice Rushen’s “Forget Me Nots”, and Rick James’ “Super Freak” almost gets Ryan dancing out of her room. She didn’t know why this track was missing from her playlist. Next was Evelyn Champagne King’s “Love Come Down”. This song was on Ryan’s playlist as well.

Artist: Waka Flocka Flame, Roscoe Dash, Wale
Excerpt:
The group arrives to the party and the house is already packed with people. The lights are dim, music is blasting, and there's more than enough teenage hormone's to go around.

"Okay guys I'm gonna go mingle, but text if you need anything." Mary says as she weaves through the crowd.

Imani, Beth, Ryan, and Sophie make their way over to the kitchen and get drinks from the from the giant cooler.

"So what are you guys trying to do?" Imani asks.

"I don't know about ya'll, but I have my eyes on something tall and handsome." Beth says eyeing the boy standing across the room. "I'll text if I need you guys."

"And then there were 3." Ryan chuckles.

'No Hands' by Waka Flocka Flame comes on and Ryan's face lights up. "I love this song!" she exclaims. Ryan speed walks to the crowd while Sophie and Imani follow her. Ryan starts rapping the first verse along with the song, to Sophie's surpise. Imani starts throwing it back and Ryan goes behind her to catch her. Sophie's jaw drops and her heart starts racing. She can feel her mouth getting dry and she starts to panic.

I need to get out of here.Sophie casually slips away from the crowd and makes her way upstairs. She finds an empty room and closes the door behind her. Sophie walks into the en-suite bathroom and looks at herself in the mirror. Her makeup is still intact, but her mind is frazzled.

Downstairs, Imani and Ryan are sitting on the couch, enjoying the party scene around them.

"Girl, you're literally so much fun. You should've transferred to Gotham Academy sooner." Imani chuckles.

"Thanks." Ryan smiles.
HTMLExcerpt:
The group arrives to the party and the house is already packed with people. The lights are dim, music is blasting, and there's more than enough teenage hormone's to go around.

"Okay guys I'm gonna go mingle, but text if you need anything." Mary says as she weaves through the crowd.

Imani, Beth, Ryan, and Sophie make their way over to the kitchen and get drinks from the from the giant cooler.

"So what are you guys trying to do?" Imani asks.

"I don't know about ya'll, but I have my eyes on something tall and handsome." Beth says eyeing the boy standing across the room. "I'll text if I need you guys."

"And then there were 3." Ryan chuckles.

'No Hands' by Waka Flocka Flame comes on and Ryan's face lights up. "I love this song!" she exclaims. Ryan speed walks to the crowd while Sophie and Imani follow her. Ryan starts rapping the first verse along with the song, to Sophie's surpise. Imani starts throwing it back and Ryan goes behind her to catch her. Sophie's jaw drops and her heart starts racing. She can feel her mouth getting dry and she starts to panic.

I need to get out of here.Sophie casually slips away from the crowd and makes her way upstairs. She finds an empty room and closes the door behind her. Sophie walks into the en-suite bathroom and looks at herself in the mirror. Her makeup is still intact, but her mind is frazzled.

Downstairs, Imani and Ryan are sitting on the couch, enjoying the party scene around them.

"Girl, you're literally so much fun. You should've transferred to Gotham Academy sooner." Imani chuckles.

"Thanks." Ryan smiles.

Excerpt:
Sophie couldn't believe what she just did , she tried to make a stranger jealous and almost kissed Ryan ? what has got into her .. she wiped her sweaty palms on the sides of her dress as she marched to the bar to get herself a drink.. her heart was beating so fast it felt like it would explode right out of her chest . Is Ryan even gay ? Who is the woman I just insulted ? Ryan wasn't even into that kiss was she  , did I freak her out ? I'm such an idiot , who goes around kissing people without their consent ?

''Hey , what can I get you?..'' her train of thoughts was interrupted by the bartender with a kind smile ..

''Some water would be great thanks..'' I definitely need to sober up . Ryan was driving her insane , she barely slept last night thinking about her ..and today , she spent most of it following her around the court with her eyes , she looked like she was in her element taking those photos —it made Sophie crush even harder .. Crazy stunt she pulled out there though, now she'll never know what Ryan really thinks of her .. Or even if she'll come find her at the bar .. ''You know what vodka and Sprite will do ..'' she said while Beyoncé's CUFF IT played on the background .. Yep , she was definitely getting fucked up tonight ...

“That’s why you won the TikTok dance off because you already know how to dance.” Reign said surprised.

Story: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees)
Excerpt: For Sophie, the essential thing when choreographing had been to make their last dance fun. They danced to Make Me Feel by Janelle Monae for the final routine. The song had a lot of versatility and could easily be used to fuse various dance styles. She had made the routine a narrative, with Ryan in a version of her Bat Team costume and Sophie in a sexy villain outfit. The dance told the story of a villain trying to carry out a heist of the mirrorball trophy by seducing the hero to sneak by. The hero suspected it was a trick, and they fought until they realized they were actually in love with the villain. The big ending was the in-love couple committing the heist together. Sophie knew it was a little camp, but so were both the Bat Team show and Dancing with the Stars, to be honest. So it would work.
HTMLExcerpt:
Chapter Title: Week 10: Make Me Feel

...

For Sophie, the essential thing when choreographing had been to make their last dance fun. They danced to Make Me Feel by Janelle Monae for the final routine. The song had a lot of versatility and could easily be used to fuse various dance styles. She had made the routine a narrative, with Ryan in a version of her Bat Team costume and Sophie in a sexy villain outfit. The dance told the story of a villain trying to carry out a heist of the mirrorball trophy by seducing the hero to sneak by. The hero suspected it was a trick, and they fought until they realized they were actually in love with the villain. The big ending was the in-love couple committing the heist together. Sophie knew it was a little camp, but so were both the Bat Team show and Dancing with the Stars, to be honest. So it would work.

The opening part of the song was slow and bass-heavy, perfect for a rumba that told the seduction part of the story. Sophie loved the exaggeration she could put in, including all the sexiest dips and grinds in her arsenal to lay on the villain persona. Ryan was acting so well, and Sophie loved watching how expressive she was. It really helped sell this whole narrative-style dance.
SongArtist: Make Me Feel by Janelle Monáe
StoryWriter: and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees) by jump_the_gunn
SASW:
Make Me Feel by Janelle Monáe
and everyday I’m learning about you (the things that no one else sees) by jump_the_gunn

Excerpt:
Mary and Jordan both shrugged and Jordan replied, “Blame Soph. She basically threatened us.” Both climbed in followed by Ryan. She sat in the seat she’d taken on the trip to talk to Precious. Mary and Jordan opted for the third row seats. 

“Where are we off to first, ladies?” Amy looked into the rearview mirror. 

“We’re going to Gotham Mall, Amy,” Mary replied. 

Jordan leaned forward and smiled, “Please start the special playlist.”

Ryan looked out the window and didn’t realize until 3 songs in that the special playlist was just the songs Ryan had shared with Sophie. She looked back at Jordan. “So, Sophie told you about my playlist.” 

Jordan shook her head, “She only told me to ask to start it after you got in.” 

Ryan nodded her head to DJ Kool as “Let Me Clear My Throat” played. She’d be bringing this up to Sophie later tonight. As the truck cruised Ryan began wondering what Sophie’s angle was. They were obviously going to be doing some shopping, but that couldn’t be all.

“Where are we off to first, ladies?” Amy looked into the rearview mirror. 

“We’re going to Gotham Mall, Amy,” Mary replied. 

Jordan leaned forward and smiled, “Please start the special playlist.”

Ryan looked out the window and didn’t realize until 3 songs in that the special playlist was just the songs Ryan had shared with Sophie. She looked back at Jordan. “So, Sophie told you about my playlist.” 

Jordan shook her head, “She only told me to ask to start it after you got in.” 

Ryan nodded her head to DJ Kool as “Let Me Clear My Throat” played. She’d be bringing this up to Sophie later tonight. As the truck cruised Ryan began wondering what Sophie’s angle was. They were obviously going to be doing some shopping, but that couldn’t be all.

Excerpt:
“Our lives are so crazy right now and I just want you to know--” 




Then there was a knock at the door. Sophie exhaled and said “Wait right here.” She picked up her phone and walked to the door. Snatching the door open, Sophie glared at Diane. “Hi, Mom.”      




“Hey sweetie, a friend from the church said they saw you earlier with the CEO from Wayne . Why didn’t you tell me you got the job?” Diane asked with a puzzled look. She was dressed in a cream-colored dress Sophie had seen a thousand times. 




Sophie took a deep breath turning her speakers all the way up before starting “Easy” by the Commodores, “Do you remember this song, Mom?” Diane nodded. “I didn’t tell you because,” Sophie began singing, “Know it sounds funny. But I just can’t stand the pain. Girl, I’m leaving you tomorrow. Seems to me, girl. You know I’ve done all I can. You see I begged, stole, and I borrowed, yeah, ooh.” 




“Sophie, will you just talk to me?” Diane cried out. 

Ryan had been hovering at the corner of the living room listening. Sophie saw her and extended her hand to Ryan. “Mom, I was done with you when you called Ryan a heathen and walked out of my hospital room. Now.” Sophie started the song again ‘That’s why I’m easy. I’m easy like Sunday morning. That’s why I’m easy. Easy like Sunday morning.’ Sophie paused the song as Diane looked as if she was about to speak. “Mom, save it because there’s nothing you can say that will change anything. Tonight I’m going to ask Ryan to be my girlfriend and you’re interrupting that.” With a flick of her wrist the door slammed in Diane’s face.

Song: Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas
Story: Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas Miracle
Excerpt:
"Have you been here long?"

"About 45 minutes or so. I've been mingling pretty much the entire time."

"Hmmm. And how has that played into your holiday party meet cute idea?" 

"It hasn't really. I'm pretty sure my person isn't my colleague and no one else has piqued my interest. Until now."

"Step one accomplished. Step two?"

"I ask her if she'd like to dance," Sophie held her hand out. 

"I technically haven't been asked."

Sophie kissed her teeth then smiled to show that she wasn't really annoyed. "Ryan, would you like to dance?"

Ryan accepted the hand Sophie held out and allowed her to lead them to the dance floor, away from the crowd. Luther Vandross' Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas was the soundtrack to their first dance and as Ryan swayed to the music with her arms around Sophie's neck and Sophie's hands wrapped around her waist, Ryan couldn't help but praise her mama's Christmas miracles. 

"So what else happens in this meet cute of yours?"

"Since this is the holiday party edition, our couple would find themselves under a mistletoe where they'd look into each other's eyes and slowly come together for their first kiss."

Ryan looked around and saw not a sprig of mistletoe in sight. 

"Looks like there's a hiccup in your meet cute plan."

Sophie pulled out a sprig of mistletoe from her pocket. "Sometimes meet cutes need a little help."

"Pretty risky to keep mistletoe in your pocket considering you didn't know if I was going to show."

"You're worth the risk."

Ryan took the mistletoe from Sophie and held it up above their heads with one hand and took Sophie's chin with the other, bringing their lips together.

She pulled back to see Sophie's eyes opening and a smile graced her face, the twinkling lights behind her giving her a soft glow.

"Definitely worth the risk," Ryan leaned in to kiss Sophie again, Luther crooning in the background.
HTMLExcerpt:
Story Title: Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas Miracle

...

"Have you been here long?"

"About 45 minutes or so. I've been mingling pretty much the entire time."

"Hmmm. And how has that played into your holiday party meet cute idea?" 

"It hasn't really. I'm pretty sure my person isn't my colleague and no one else has piqued my interest. Until now."

"Step one accomplished. Step two?"

"I ask her if she'd like to dance," Sophie held her hand out. 

"I technically haven't been asked."

Sophie kissed her teeth then smiled to show that she wasn't really annoyed. "Ryan, would you like to dance?"

Ryan accepted the hand Sophie held out and allowed her to lead them to the dance floor, away from the crowd. Luther Vandross' Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas was the soundtrack to their first dance and as Ryan swayed to the music with her arms around Sophie's neck and Sophie's hands wrapped around her waist, Ryan couldn't help but praise her mama's Christmas miracles. 

"So what else happens in this meet cute of yours?"

"Since this is the holiday party edition, our couple would find themselves under a mistletoe where they'd look into each other's eyes and slowly come together for their first kiss."

Ryan looked around and saw not a sprig of mistletoe in sight. 

"Looks like there's a hiccup in your meet cute plan."

Sophie pulled out a sprig of mistletoe from her pocket. "Sometimes meet cutes need a little help."

"Pretty risky to keep mistletoe in your pocket considering you didn't know if I was going to show."

"You're worth the risk."

Ryan took the mistletoe from Sophie and held it up above their heads with one hand and took Sophie's chin with the other, bringing their lips together.

She pulled back to see Sophie's eyes opening and a smile graced her face, the twinkling lights behind her giving her a soft glow.

"Definitely worth the risk," Ryan leaned in to kiss Sophie again, Luther crooning in the background.
SongArtist: Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas by Luther Vandross
StoryWriter: Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas Miracle by EndlessDreamer1024
SASW:
Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas by Luther Vandross
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas Miracle by EndlessDreamer1024

Story: A Batfamily, A Baby, and Gotham: Son of A Bih-
Excerpt:
On Sunday mornings, Alani would come over to her moms house so they wouldn’t have to drive over to her loft to drop Cory off. As they slept, she would fix Cory a bottle as they went down her version of “black history.” They would start the morning watching That’s So Raven or The Proud Family, then afterwards she always made sure to play Beyoncé for her baby brother (his favorite song seems to be MOVE), after the Beyhive lessons, Alani would tell him about important black figures and then her versions of important black figures (Beyoncé, Serena Williams, The Obamas). After that she would tell Cory about Batwoman or Black Lightning stories. 




Ryan and Sophie would get up and watch front their room. They enjoyed seeing Cory absorb all of the information from his sister, even though they are pretty sure a four month old baby doesn’t understand her. But one thing they mostly love, when Alani talks about the family. It does seem at that time he can truly understand the words that come out of Alani’s mouth.

Christmas Eve will find me

Where the love light gleams

I'll be home for Christmas

If only in my dreams…

S: I love it too.

Excerpt:
Ryan changed the subject and pulled out a few ornaments from the box. There was a brown felt gingerbread man and brown felt reindeer with glitter on it and some paper snowflakes. Ryan got up and put them on the tree. I think Mary has a box of Christmas ornaments too in the cabinet. Sophie went to find the ornaments. When Sophie came back with the box of Mary’s ornaments she set it down. Then she pulled her phone out and started up the Christmas music once more as it had been paused.

I really can’t stay…

R: Baby it’s cold outside…

S: I’ve got to go ‘way…

R: Baby it’s cold outside…

S: The evening has been

R: Hoping that you’d drop in…

S: So very nice…

R: I’ll hold your hands, they’re just like ice…

Ryan and Sophie snag along to the music as they continued decorating the tree and looking through Ryan’s memories of her Mama Cora.

S: My mother will start to worry…

R: Beautiful what’s your hurry…

S: My father will be pacing the floor…

R: Listen to that fire place roar…

S: So really I’d better scurry…

R: Beautiful please don’t hurry…

S: Well maybe just a half a drink more…

R: Put some music on while I pour…

Ryan and Sophie had stopped putting decorations on the trees and looking at photos and now they were singing right to each other, seemingly suspended in time and space.

S: The neighbors might think…

R: Baby it’s bad out there…

S: Say, what’s in this drink…

R: No cabs to be had out there…

S: I wish I knew how…

R: Your eyes are like starlight now…

S: To break this spell…

R: I’ll take your hat, your hair looks swell…

Ryan smiled because Sophie’s hair did look swell, and her eyes did look like starlight and she felt for a moment like they weren’t singing along to some silly Christmas song, but that maybe this was all too real.

S: Hey, you missed your part.

Sophie joked.

R: Did you ever realize how this song is kinda giving Law and Order Special Victims Unit? She said it’s cold bruh. She tryna leave.

S: Oh my gosh Ryan, way to ruin the moment. And this song.

Sophie shook her head. Whatever spell that was brewing between them was broken.

R: Soph I’m serious! “Say, what’s in this drink?” What the hell does that mean? And he clearly can’t take no for an answer.

Ryan was indignant about getting Sophie to see how bad this song was.

S: Now you sound like Jordan. You don’t think the lady in the song was playing hard to get? It seemed like she wanted to stay, she just wanted him to beg her to stay. I’m not gonna let you ruin that song for me.

Sophie tossed some tinsel at Ryan.

R: Hey! It’s not my fault that song is creepy. There are much better ones than that.

S: Ok Simon Cowell, I’ll put on a different one. Any specific requests?

“Mmm…ten more minutes Soph…it’s Christmas.” Ryan said yawning.

Sophie jumped hearing Ryan’s voice for the first time in years. Then the door opened and a six year old girl, Raya in a Doctor McStuffins pajama set walked into the room carrying an eighteen month old boy singing loudly.

“Oh, Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way, all the way. Oh what fun we use to have in a white open sleigh, hey.” Raya sang wrongly.

Raya placed Sebastian on the bed and then jumped on the bed between Sophie and Ryan.

Raya patted the bed. “You too, King.”

The dog jumped on the tiny bed leaving very little room for Ryan, Sophie, Sebastian, and Raya.

“Rise and shine, mommies.”

Story: A Perfect Verse Over A Tight Beat
Excerpt:
“We already got the song we want to record to it.” Ten complained.

Ryan exhaled. “Oh yeah, what’s that?” Ryan hated to ask.

“The Boy Is Mine it’s a remake.” Ten stated.

“By Brandy and Monica?” Ryan asked.

Ren and Ten looked at each other in the booth. “Yeah, something like that.”
“It’s more of a retelling of the original.”

“Oh goody.” Ryan said sarcastically. “Play the track so I can hear it.”

“It’s more of a retelling of the original.”

“Oh goody.” Ryan said sarcastically. “Play the track so I can hear it.”

Excerpt:
Sophie nodded. “Okay, so you choose dare?”

Ryan nodded as she felt this was more safer than telling Sophie her life.

“I dare you to dance for me.”

“What?”

“I want you to give me a show and dance for me. I want you to grind on me.” Sophie answered.

Ryan nodded. The ask wasn’t bad so she stood up walked away from to her phone that sat on the desk. Ryan grabbed her phone to go to the music app and selected Teyana Taylor/Kehlani “Morning.”

Ryan walked slowly back over to Sophie and stood in front of her. She lifted Sophie’s face so they were staring at each other.

♪ I ain't here to play no games ♪
♪ I'm gonna give it to you ♪
♪ Just how you want it ♪

Excerpt:
The music changed as Ryan came around to stand in front of her. Then came the touch Sophie had been waiting for.  Just as the beginning notes of Beyoncé's ‘Rocket’ began to play, Ryan turned away from Sophie presenting her with another view of her spectacular ass.  She swayed back and forth in a hypnotizing cadence.  It took all of Sophie’s will power to keep from reaching out.  Then Ryan slowly lowered herself into her lap.

 

‘Let me sit this ass… on you

Show you how, I feel

Let me take this off

While you watch me… watch me’

 

The swell of Ryan’s ass fit perfectly in Sophie’s pelvis.  The throbbing between Sophie’s thighs matched the beating of her heart.  She bit her lips so hard, she was sure she’d drawn blood.   Unable to help herself, her hands instinctively moved to Ryan’s waist.  Before she could correct her mistake, Ryan turned and gave her a piercing look.  Sophie immediately removed her hands at the silent rebuke and placed them back on the arms of the chair.  Ryan winked then went back to performing, grinding into Sophie’s lap, using her body to please and tease.  Sophie shivered and moaned with each deliberate movement.  It took every bit of restraint to keep from wrapping Ryan in her arms and having her way with her then and there.

The lyrics to Beyoncé's ‘Rocket’ is used in this chapter. The song referenced in the next few chapters will be ‘The Way’ by Jill Scott. No copyright infringement intended.

For those who are not familiar with Jill Scott, to fully understand the hints that Ryan (and other characters) will be dropping to Sophie, you should read the lyrics to the song or watch one of her performances on YouTube because she’s amazing! Excerpt:
The kiss quickly grew into something more passionate and curious hands began to wander.  Ryan was kissing her way down perfectly defined abs heading for the paradise between her thighs when the sudden sound of NWA’s “Fuck Tha Police” rang out in the room. 

Sophie couldn’t help it.  She laughed out loud.  Ryan grumbled in frustration and lay her head on her stomach.     

“Babe, I can’t believe you made this your alarm sound.  How do you wake up to that?” Sophie said leaning over to silence Ryan’s phone.

Ryan made her way back up to the bed and straddled Sophie.  Sophie placed her hands on Ryan’s thighs.

“You know I’ve never been a fan of the police; you were an exception because you’re so pretty.” Ryan said staring down at her with a playful smirk.

Sophie rolled her eyes.  “You are such a brat.”

“I’m your brat.”

“Yes, you are.” Sophie pulled Ryan back down and snuggled into her neck.

Excerpt:
One of Sophie’s favorite Jill Scott songs was ‘The Way’.  Ryan thought it would be cute to drop little snippets of the song to Sophie throughout the day as a hint to her ultimate surprise.  That meant certain items had to be on the menu this morning.

“You know what Sophie likes, Paul.  She loves all types of breakfast food, so whatever you whip up she’ll love.  But I need you to include some kind of toast, a version of scrambled eggs, and grits.”  Ryan said wondering if she should have mentioned this to him beforehand.

“Don’t worry, Ms. Wilder.  I will make her a breakfast fit for royalty.” Paul said in his thick French accent.  

“Perfect.” Ryan said relieved.
