Excerpt:
Just as Sophie was about to respond, her cell rang.  She smiled when she saw her sisters face appear on the screen.  She answered the FaceTime call.  “Hey Jordan.”

“Hey birthday girl!”  She screamed before belting out one of the most off-key versions of the birthday song Sophie and Ryan had ever heard.  Ryan was dying laughing while Sophie was trying to cover her ears. 

“Wow, J that was really, really… bad.  Let’s not quit that day job just yet, okay?”  Sophie said.

“What?  You didn’t like it?  I thought I was giving old school Whitney.” At Sophie’s blank stare, Jordan laughed and continued.  “Well, that’s okay.  Maybe this will work.  And IIIIII……. will always love yoooouuu!!!” She belted, sounding like a drowned cat in heat. 

“Girl, Whitney Houston is up there in the upper room pissed all the way off at you for that one.”  Ryan said laughing.
HTMLExcerpt:
Just as Sophie was about to respond, her cell rang.  She smiled when she saw her sisters face appear on the screen.  She answered the FaceTime call.  “Hey Jordan.”

“Hey birthday girl!”  She screamed before belting out one of the most off-key versions of the birthday song Sophie and Ryan had ever heard.  Ryan was dying laughing while Sophie was trying to cover her ears. 

“Wow, J that was really, really… bad.  Let’s not quit that day job just yet, okay?”  Sophie said.

“What?  You didn’t like it?  I thought I was giving old school Whitney.” At Sophie’s blank stare, Jordan laughed and continued.  “Well, that’s okay.  Maybe this will work.  And IIIIII……. will always love yoooouuu!!!” She belted, sounding like a drowned cat in heat. 

“Girl, Whitney Houston is up there in the upper room pissed all the way off at you for that one.”  Ryan said laughing.

Excerpt:
The couple had the entire diner to themselves that night.  Maggie had set them up with their food, desserts, and anything else they would need before handing Sophie the keys for her to lock up.

After eating, Sophie went behind the counter and found the Bluetooth speaker she’d asked Maggie for.  She pulled out her phone and went to her playlist.  Ryan smiled when she heard ‘Best Part’ by Daniel Caesar and H.E.R.

Sophie walked back to the booth and held out her hand.  “May I have this dance?”

Ryan took her hand and moved into Sophie’s arms.  She lay her head on her chest and they swayed to the music.  They danced and talked for hours at Maggie’s that night.  Ryan was lying back in Sophie’s arms as they watched golden rays trickle through the blinds as the sun began its accession into a new day.
HTMLExcerpt:
The couple had the entire diner to themselves that night.  Maggie had set them up with their food, desserts, and anything else they would need before handing Sophie the keys for her to lock up.

After eating, Sophie went behind the counter and found the Bluetooth speaker she’d asked Maggie for.  She pulled out her phone and went to her playlist.  Ryan smiled when she heard ‘Best Part’ by Daniel Caesar and H.E.R.

Sophie walked back to the booth and held out her hand.  “May I have this dance?”

Ryan took her hand and moved into Sophie’s arms.  She lay her head on her chest and they swayed to the music.  They danced and talked for hours at Maggie’s that night.  Ryan was lying back in Sophie’s arms as they watched golden rays trickle through the blinds as the sun began its accession into a new day.

Excerpt:
Sophie continues to write and produce songs with the band. If asked she would deny it but, this “fake” marriage, living with Ryan and caring for her, it's all become her muse, her motivation for writing the songs she does. And she kinda loves it. 




She performs a recent song for a record label who’s considering her and the band for signing




I hate the way you say my name 

I hate your picture-perfect lips

On mine 

If I could I’d cut the breaks 




Ryan places her hands on the two bars in front of her, using her upper body to stand. She winces in pain as her therapist stands behind her for support. She takes a step, and another. She stops for a breath 




Month Two 

I hate that I can't help but stay 

Oh my 

And I hate the way 

I say words that i laughed at before 




Ryan stands by the same walking aid bars, hands on either side. She’s taking steps easier but the pain after a few is still excruciating. Her therapist encourages her to push through it. Jada’s always close. 




My thoughts are not mine now they’re yours

Look what you’ve created 

Something borderline sacred 

I call it overrated 

Go on and call me jaded 

Cause I hate the way 

I say words that I laughed at before

Song: He Loves Me (Lyzel in E Flat)
Excerpt:
“Miss Sophie, I would like to personally wish you a happy birthday, beautiful.  I heard it’s your favorite.  It is an honor for me to perform it for you.” 

The band began playing the intro to ‘He Loves Me’ and Sophie’s heart melted.  

Ryan took Sophie’s hand and brought it to her lips once again.  She placed a gentle kiss on her knuckles before standing.  Sophie looked up at her.

“May I have this dance?”  Ryan asked quietly. 

Without hesitation, Sophie allowed the younger woman to guide her to the dancefloor.  Ryan slipped her arms around Sophie’s waist and pulled her close.  Sophie wrapped her arms around Ryan and rested their foreheads together as the sounds of the band rose.

 

You love me especially different every time

You keep me on my feet happily excited

By your cologne, your hands, your smile, your intelligence

You woo me, you court me, you tease me, you please me

You school me, give me some things to think about

Invite me, you ignite me, you co-write me, you love me, you like me

You incite me to chorus, ooh

Ohh…

 

When the song reached the spoken word section, Sophie was surprised to hear Ryan’s voice rather than the singer’s.  The band was now playing the song very softly as Jill quietly vocalized a smooth melody in the background.

“Sophie… You’re different and special.  You’re different and special in every way imaginable.”

Sophie looked around and saw everyone’s eyes on them.  Jordan, Jada, Naomi, and several others all had their phones out recording.  They all had tears in their eyes.  She swallowed hard as the realization of what was happening started to dawn on her.  She tried to focus as Ryan continued reciting Jill’s words.

“You love me from my hair follicles to my toenails.  You got me feeling like the breeze, easy and free and lovely and me.”  Ryan paused and switched from Jill’s lyrics to her own words.  “Sophie…you make me feel like I can do anything.  Your love makes me feel like I’m ten feet tall, even though you constantly insist on reminding me how vertically challenged I am.”

A few chuckles could be heard from around the room.  Sophie smiled.  Leave it to Ryan to throw a joke in to relieve the tension.  Sophie tried to blink away the tears pooling in her eyes.

Ryan took a calming breath and held Sophie’s hands between them.  She met Sophie’s eyes with determination.  “Seriously though, all of this started when I began to think about how you love me… and how I love all the ways you love me.  Before I met you, I didn’t believe in things like true love and soul mates.  The kind of love everybody told stories about and sang about in love songs didn’t seem real to me.  Those things were for other people, not for someone like me… someone always on the move.  See, growing up in the system and being on my own, I never had the time or felt safe enough to just stop and… take a breath, to just be present.  There was always another home to move to, another job to do, or another obstacle to overcome.  Then you just… showed up in my life.  And as everyone here knows, we did not start off in a very good place.  We had to work and fight to get to where we are, and I wouldn’t trade our journey for anything.  Because for the first time in my life, I can breathe, Soph.”  Ryan’s voice cracked and Sophie reached out to catch the tear that had escaped her eye.  Ryan kissed her hand and continued.  “With you, I breathe every day. You are the love of my life, Sophie.  You are my soul mate.  You are my love song.   And I want to spend my whole damn life, my every breath loving you.”

Ryan took a deep breath and took the ring box out from behind her back. Tears already freely flowing, Sophie froze.  The music and singing lowered even more.  Sophie gasped and covered her mouth as Ryan dropped to one knee.  There wasn’t a dry eye in the room at this point.

Ryan opened the ring box and looked up at Sophie.  “Sophia Rose Moore… will do me the honor of spending forever with me?  Will you marry me?”

Too emotional to speak, Sophie just nodded her head up and down before pulling Ryan to her feet into a deep kiss.  The sounds of whistling and clapping could be heard in the background as the music rose and Jill’s voice resumed the song.  Sophie cradled Ryan’s face in her hand as she placed kiss after kiss to her lips. Ryan, in tears herself by now, let out a relieved laugh.
HTMLExcerpt:
“Miss Sophie, I would like to personally wish you a happy birthday, beautiful.  I heard it’s your favorite.  It is an honor for me to perform it for you.” 

The band began playing the intro to ‘He Loves Me’ and Sophie’s heart melted.  

Ryan took Sophie’s hand and brought it to her lips once again.  She placed a gentle kiss on her knuckles before standing.  Sophie looked up at her.

“May I have this dance?”  Ryan asked quietly. 

Without hesitation, Sophie allowed the younger woman to guide her to the dancefloor.  Ryan slipped her arms around Sophie’s waist and pulled her close.  Sophie wrapped her arms around Ryan and rested their foreheads together as the sounds of the band rose.

 

You love me especially different every time

You keep me on my feet happily excited

By your cologne, your hands, your smile, your intelligence

You woo me, you court me, you tease me, you please me

You school me, give me some things to think about

Invite me, you ignite me, you co-write me, you love me, you like me

You incite me to chorus, ooh

Ohh…

 

When the song reached the spoken word section, Sophie was surprised to hear Ryan’s voice rather than the singer’s.  The band was now playing the song very softly as Jill quietly vocalized a smooth melody in the background.

“Sophie… You’re different and special.  You’re different and special in every way imaginable.”

Sophie looked around and saw everyone’s eyes on them.  Jordan, Jada, Naomi, and several others all had their phones out recording.  They all had tears in their eyes.  She swallowed hard as the realization of what was happening started to dawn on her.  She tried to focus as Ryan continued reciting Jill’s words.

“You love me from my hair follicles to my toenails.  You got me feeling like the breeze, easy and free and lovely and me.”  Ryan paused and switched from Jill’s lyrics to her own words.  “Sophie…you make me feel like I can do anything.  Your love makes me feel like I’m ten feet tall, even though you constantly insist on reminding me how vertically challenged I am.”

A few chuckles could be heard from around the room.  Sophie smiled.  Leave it to Ryan to throw a joke in to relieve the tension.  Sophie tried to blink away the tears pooling in her eyes.

Ryan took a calming breath and held Sophie’s hands between them.  She met Sophie’s eyes with determination.  “Seriously though, all of this started when I began to think about how you love me… and how I love all the ways you love me.  Before I met you, I didn’t believe in things like true love and soul mates.  The kind of love everybody told stories about and sang about in love songs didn’t seem real to me.  Those things were for other people, not for someone like me… someone always on the move.  See, growing up in the system and being on my own, I never had the time or felt safe enough to just stop and… take a breath, to just be present.  There was always another home to move to, another job to do, or another obstacle to overcome.  Then you just… showed up in my life.  And as everyone here knows, we did not start off in a very good place.  We had to work and fight to get to where we are, and I wouldn’t trade our journey for anything.  Because for the first time in my life, I can breathe, Soph.”  Ryan’s voice cracked and Sophie reached out to catch the tear that had escaped her eye.  Ryan kissed her hand and continued.  “With you, I breathe every day. You are the love of my life, Sophie.  You are my soul mate.  You are my love song.   And I want to spend my whole damn life, my every breath loving you.”

Ryan took a deep breath and took the ring box out from behind her back. Tears already freely flowing, Sophie froze.  The music and singing lowered even more.  Sophie gasped and covered her mouth as Ryan dropped to one knee.  There wasn’t a dry eye in the room at this point.

Ryan opened the ring box and looked up at Sophie.  “Sophia Rose Moore… will do me the honor of spending forever with me?  Will you marry me?”

Too emotional to speak, Sophie just nodded her head up and down before pulling Ryan to her feet into a deep kiss.  The sounds of whistling and clapping could be heard in the background as the music rose and Jill’s voice resumed the song.  Sophie cradled Ryan’s face in her hand as she placed kiss after kiss to her lips. Ryan, in tears herself by now, let out a relieved laugh.

“I love you so much.  I can’t wait to spend the rest of my life with you.” Sophie said reverently as she placed a kiss on Ryan’s lips.

“Hell yeah!  Ya’ll hear that?  She’s mine now!” Ryan turned and let out an excited yell.  The entire room erupted in a huge roar of laughter and applause.

“Let’s help the happy couple celebrate, shall we?  Everybody on the dancefloor!”  Jill said before beginning her song Golden.  Everyone stood and joined the newly engaged couple, exchanging hugs and well wishes as they danced and sang along.

If the world should end tomorrow and we only have today

“ Picnic.” Sophie turns the card around . “ I’ll play you in a game of one on one for what ? Your heart.” Sophie puts her hand on her chest. “You already have it, love but I’ll still kick your ass on the court.” she smirks at Ryan who laughs “ Don’t write a check your ass can’t cash and don’t let my height fool you.” Sophie laughs “ You mean lack thereof .” “ Awww babe you know Love and Basketball is my guilty pleasure. This is so sweet.” “Well finish picking so I can ask my question ?” Ryan holds out 2 more cards.

I'm gonna love you in every kind of way
I wanna love you in every kind of way
I wanna please you, no matter how long it takes

“Painting? Sophie questions but Ryan just points to the back of the card. “Life is a canvas and I want to finish painting mine with you.”

“ You are it for me Soph , You are what I want and need.” Ryan has a huge grin on her face as she wipes the tear that has escaped off of Sophie’s cheek. “ Don’t get soft on me now, Crowphie, you have more cards to pick.” She holds out 2 more cards.

If the world should end tomorrow and we only have today
I'm gonna love you in every kind of way

“Dinner.” She turns the card around . “ I want to feed your soul and nourish your heart.” Ryan holds out 2 more cards. “ Watch the stars. “ she turns the card around. “ To me you are the stars. You outshine all of the darkness that tries to cloud my days.” Ryan holds out 2 more cards.

I wanna love you
I gotta love you
I wanna love you
I gotta love you

“Good morning kiss.” Before Sophie turns the card around she grabs Ryan’s hand and pulls her into her. Ryan wraps her arms around Sophie’s waist. Sophie grabs Ryan’s face with her free hand and kisses her deeply. “ I have been wanting to do that for a while.” Sophie pulls back and looks into Ryan’s chocolate brown eyes. “ Read the back baby.” Ryan stares back into Sophie’s honey ones. Sophie removes her hand and turns the card around. “ Kiss me when you finally wake up from being left breathless and satisfied.” Ryan takes the cards from Sophie and puts them down on her desk. She grabs Sophie and turns her around revealing the sign and the tealights. While still holding Sophie in her arms Ryan whispers in her ear . “ Will you be my Valentine ?” Sophie turns around in Ryan’s arms and kisses her again. She nibbles at her bottom lip to ask for more and Ryan abides allowing Sophie to explore her mouth with her tongue. They both pull away from the air. “ Yes .” Sophie takes a breath. They both have huge smiles on their faces.

“Well you just planned our Valentine's Day date babe .” Ryan kisses Sophie again.

HTMLExcerpt:
Ryan rolled her eyes but knew Sophie was right. “I can’t find the right beat to match her powerful voice. I don’t want to overpower it but I want to be able to give it more life.”

Sophie smiled that Ryan finally opened up. “Yeah, I seen her videos she mostly sings acappella.”

Ryan nodded. “Yeah, I seen that too. I feel like her songs are good and they are written beautifully so I want to put like a boom-boom-tsk-tsk beat like Aaliyah’s Four Page Letter.”

Story: A Perfect Verse Over A Tight Beat
Excerpt:
“Whew, that beat was fire. So, since this is a sample why don’t we use an old school song from the late 90s and early 2000s. It can give us the nostalgia and a perfect background for her song.”

Ryan nodded. “Yeah, that would be dope. What songs are you thinking?”

“Well, you already said Aaliyah’s ‘Four Page Letter’ which is in the 2000s, what about Jodeci ‘Come Talk to Me’ which is a sample from EPMD or Mario Winans ‘I Don’t Wanna Know which comes from The Fugees ‘Ready or Not or Ashanti’s ‘Foolish’ which you know came from Biggie’s ‘One More Chance’ who took a sample from DeBarge.”

Ryan looked at Sophie smiling.

“What?” Sophie asked.

“I know you know music but you really know music.”
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie smiled that Ryan finally opened up. “Yeah, I seen her videos she mostly sings acappella.”

Ryan nodded. “Yeah, I seen that too. I feel like her songs are good and they are written beautifully so I want to put like a boom-boom-tsk-tsk beat like Aaliyah’s Four Page Letter.”

“Whew, that beat was fire. So, since this is a sample why don’t we use an old school song from the late 90s and early 2000s. It can give us the nostalgia and a perfect background for her song.”

Ryan nodded. “Yeah, that would be dope. What songs are you thinking?”

“Well, you already said Aaliyah’s ‘Four Page Letter’ which is in the 2000s, what about Jodeci ‘Come Talk to Me’ which is a sample from EPMD or Mario Winans ‘I Don’t Wanna Know which comes from The Fugees ‘Ready or Not or Ashanti’s ‘Foolish’ which you know came from Biggie’s ‘One More Chance’ who took a sample from DeBarge.”

Ryan looked at Sophie smiling.

“What?” Sophie asked.

“I know you know music but you really know music.”

Excerpt:
The crowd cheers as Sophie sits and begins to play the chords of her song on the piano. 




I was fine before 

You walked right through that door 

And now i'm something more 

Than i ever imagined 




I was so sure

I knew exactly who you were 

But you were something more

Than I ever imagined 




In your arms i'm safe and sound 




Ryan lays on top of Sophie, kissing her softly as the sun rises




You turned my world right upside down 

But all the hell we've been through 

Had a purpose 




Jordan’s watching from the crowd, hoping her sister will realise what she needs to do before it’s too late. 




Together we are chaos and it's perfect 

I didn’t, i didn't know 

What love could, what love could be 

Until you, until you 

Loved my everything 




Sophie throws her head back in boisterous laughter as Ryan tickles her in their bed




The good, the bad 

The in-between 




I didn't…know

You were something i could need 

Until you, until you 

Loved my everything 




The good, the bad 

The in-between, all of me 




Their room is lit by the moonlight. Sophie runs her fingers through Ryan’s loose curls, gently bringing her forehead to her lips. Ryan closes her eyes and basks in Sophie’s touch 




Sophie continues her song. Jordan watches in hope. Sophie remembers how she feels being held by Ryan. The safety, the love. She truly didn't know, until now. 





They run through their set and as soon as they finish Sophie’s out the door. She tries to ring Ryan but there’s no answer.




Jordan: What are you waiting for Sis? GO GET HER DUMMY!!!! 




Sophie smiles and gets into the car, “I LOVE YOU SIS”

Excerpt:
Suddenly, the music changed, and the wedding singer began to sing ‘For You’ by Kenny Latimore.  That was Ryan’s cue to enter.   First Luke appeared at the top of the stairs then Ryan stepped into view as everyone turned.  Sophie was sure her heart stopped beating in that moment.  She couldn’t take her eyes off her bride.

Luke took his time guiding Ryan down the stairs from the main house until they reached the garden area.  Ryan looked stunning walking through the myriad of flowers in the garden. 

Jordan and Mary both looked at Sophie’s stunned expression and giggled.  Jordan touched Sophie’s back.  “Breathe sis, breathe.  We can’t have you passing out before she even makes it up the aisle.”

“My god, J.  Do you see her?”

“Yeah Soph.  She’s beautiful.  You both are.”
HTMLExcerpt:
Suddenly, the music changed, and the wedding singer began to sing ‘For You’ by Kenny Latimore.  That was Ryan’s cue to enter.   First Luke appeared at the top of the stairs then Ryan stepped into view as everyone turned.  Sophie was sure her heart stopped beating in that moment.  She couldn’t take her eyes off her bride.

Luke took his time guiding Ryan down the stairs from the main house until they reached the garden area.  Ryan looked stunning walking through the myriad of flowers in the garden. 

Jordan and Mary both looked at Sophie’s stunned expression and giggled.  Jordan touched Sophie’s back.  “Breathe sis, breathe.  We can’t have you passing out before she even makes it up the aisle.”

“My god, J.  Do you see her?”

“Yeah Soph.  She’s beautiful.  You both are.”

Excerpt:
Luke: I’m going to die

Luke unknowingly spoke out loud. All the eyes in the room landed on Batwing— no armour within sight.

Luke was the only one still focused on Mary. He quickly covered his mouth and pointed back at the newly minted doctor who was frantically…swimming? Her hands moved in the form of a freestyle stroke while her body postured like a scene from Michael Jackson's Thriller. Ryan jumped; Sophie caught her to stop the sudden smack of her legs on the floor. She was surprised and held her composure, signaling to Sophie that she could put her down without alerting the hangry mob.

Luke was the only one still focused on Mary. He quickly covered his mouth and pointed back at the newly minted doctor who was frantically…swimming? Story: A Gift (or 14) of Me to You
Excerpt:
The twelfth gift was an honest to God burned CD that Sophie had to pull out an old laptop and wait an hour for it to fully charge in order to listen to. 

The note accompanying it was the album cover which read, You're my favorite song .

Sophie sat back on her couch and listened to the opening notes of H.E.R.'s Comfortable . The next song, Everything by Mary J. Blige took her back to her youth and how she hoped to have that special someone like Mary sang about. Song three, More of You by Victoria Monet, solidified for her that Ryan was her secret admirer. It was their song. During one of their dates, Ryan played the song and they danced together in the loft after Ryan cooked dinner for them. They made love well into the night and Sophie felt Ryan's flame dance over her. It was the night she realized she was falling in love with Ryan Wilder and she was powerless to stop it.  

The next songs, Two Occasions by Babyface, You're Always on my Mind by SWV, and You Bring Me Joy by Anita Baker, all told the story of how Ryan felt about Sophie but it was Ready or Not by After 7 that gave her pause. Did Ryan really love her? Sophie hoped she did, but it seemed with each passing day, prior to the start of her receiving gifts and thinking that it could possibly be Ryan, that Ryan didn't feel the same. But according to the song choice, she loved Sophie, too. 

Smile by V. Bozeman, Real Thing by Pink Sweat$ ft. Tori Kelly, Excuse Me by Jazmine Sullivan, and Can't Take My Eyes Off of You by Lauryn Hill followed. The final song, Soon As I Get Home by Faith Evans, took her by surprise. Unlike the previous songs, Soon As I Get Home was an apology, a promise that Ryan would make up for her previous behavior and would make things right between them, given the chance. Ryan didn't want to lose her and wanted to make it up to her and Sophie wanted nothing more. 

Part of her wanted to go to the loft and talk to Ryan right then but a greater part of her needed to know how things would naturally play out. She'd done her part and asked Ryan for what she wanted. It was time for Ryan to do the same.

The twelfth gift was an honest to God burned CD that Sophie had to pull out an old laptop and wait an hour for it to fully charge in order to listen to. 

The note accompanying it was the album cover which read, You're my favorite song .

Sophie sat back on her couch and listened to the opening notes of H.E.R.'s Comfortable . The next song, Everything by Mary J. Blige took her back to her youth and how she hoped to have that special someone like Mary sang about. Song three, More of You by Victoria Monet, solidified for her that Ryan was her secret admirer. It was their song. During one of their dates, Ryan played the song and they danced together in the loft after Ryan cooked dinner for them. They made love well into the night and Sophie felt Ryan's flame dance over her. It was the night she realized she was falling in love with Ryan Wilder and she was powerless to stop it.  

The next songs, Two Occasions by Babyface, You're Always on my Mind by SWV, and You Bring Me Joy by Anita Baker, all told the story of how Ryan felt about Sophie but it was Ready or Not by After 7 that gave her pause. Did Ryan really love her? Sophie hoped she did, but it seemed with each passing day, prior to the start of her receiving gifts and thinking that it could possibly be Ryan, that Ryan didn't feel the same. But according to the song choice, she loved Sophie, too. 

Smile by V. Bozeman, Real Thing by Pink Sweat$ ft. Tori Kelly, Excuse Me by Jazmine Sullivan, and Can't Take My Eyes Off of You by Lauryn Hill followed. The final song, Soon As I Get Home by Faith Evans, took her by surprise. Unlike the previous songs, Soon As I Get Home was an apology, a promise that Ryan would make up for her previous behavior and would make things right between them, given the chance. Ryan didn't want to lose her and wanted to make it up to her and Sophie wanted nothing more. 

Part of her wanted to go to the loft and talk to Ryan right then but a greater part of her needed to know how things would naturally play out. She'd done her part and asked Ryan for what she wanted. It was time for Ryan to do the same.

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

I mentioned before, this story idea came to me after hearing a song, so I’ve put some of the lyrics in this chapter. They really have been the total inspiration behind it all.

I hope you enjoy, and I promise, Wildmoore is always endgame.

Song – Fall Again by Glenn Lewis

...

As they stood there, they heard the DJ. “Hey everyone, thanks for coming out tonight to support the Sheldon Park Community Center. We appreciate all of your generous donations. Now, I see a lot of couples out there, so I’m gonna slow things down just a little, and give you lovebirds something to dance to.”




The song began playing, and Ryan looked up at Sophie. “Dance with me?”




Sophie nodded. “I’d love to,” she said, pulling Ryan close.







Feels like fire burns in my heart

Every single moment that we spend apart

 

All this time away is killing me inside

I need your love in my life

 

I want to spend time till it ends

I want to fall with you again

Like we did when we first met

I want to fall with you again

 

 

Ryan laid her head against Sophie’s chest. They silently swayed back and forth, just enjoying being together. Enjoying the feeling they’d gone without for far too long.




“I’ve missed you so much, Sophie. I don’t even have the words to describe how much. Sometimes, I could hardly breathe. I was lost. I just didn’t know what…”




“I’m so sorry, Ryan. If I wasn’t so stubborn, I would have come back to you right away, but I just got so caught up in...”




“I know. So did I.”







Fought in a battle that nobody won

Now we face a mountain to be overcome

 

You can’t turn away a pass a second love

I need us to carry on

 

I want to spend time till it ends

I want to fall with you again

Like we did when we first met

I want to fall with you again

Excerpt:
"Is this a lesbian club?" She asked as she noticed there were only women present, at least where the staff was concerned.

"Yeah. It's woman-owned and women-only."

"Nice…" Ryan said as she looked around some more. Her perusal was interrupted by another waitress bringing their wine and informed them that their meals would be out shortly. Ryan noticed that there was a large, tall box in front of their booth along with curtains behind their booth. Before Ryan could address it, their food was brought out and they began eating. While they ate they talked and Ryan attempted to coax some answers from Sophie about the rest of her plans. Sophie didn't give her any answers, telling her to be patient and that the wait would be well worth it. 

When they finished their dinner, their plates and glasses were removed and the lights above their table dimmed considerably. The curtain that was around their booth was on an electric timer and began moving until their booth and the box were enclosed. A light came on in the box and a woman appeared, dressed in a silk robe with large rollers in her hair and sitting at a vanity. Her back was turned towards them and the opening notes to Beyoncé's Rocket sounded.
HTMLExcerpt:
"Is this a lesbian club?" She asked as she noticed there were only women present, at least where the staff was concerned.

"Yeah. It's woman-owned and women-only."

"Nice…" Ryan said as she looked around some more. Her perusal was interrupted by another waitress bringing their wine and informed them that their meals would be out shortly. Ryan noticed that there was a large, tall box in front of their booth along with curtains behind their booth. Before Ryan could address it, their food was brought out and they began eating. While they ate they talked and Ryan attempted to coax some answers from Sophie about the rest of her plans. Sophie didn't give her any answers, telling her to be patient and that the wait would be well worth it. 

When they finished their dinner, their plates and glasses were removed and the lights above their table dimmed considerably. The curtain that was around their booth was on an electric timer and began moving until their booth and the box were enclosed. A light came on in the box and a woman appeared, dressed in a silk robe with large rollers in her hair and sitting at a vanity. Her back was turned towards them and the opening notes to Beyoncé's Rocket sounded.
SongArtist: Rocket by Beyoncé

Excerpt:
Sophie arrives home early, deciding she’d rather spend an extra hour with her kids and then plough through her mountain of paperwork on the sofa with a glass of red than sit at her desk a moment longer. Though she’d tried to put on a positive face for the children this morning, particularly Mason who seemed quieter and in his own head more than usual on the way to school, the heavy mood Tyler had cast on them all had followed her through her day, leeching her energy and twisting a knot between her shoulders. She hasn’t heard from him, and experience tells her she probably won’t see him until the early hours when she can pretend his stumbling hasn’t woken her and just wait for him to pass out on the other side of the bed.  

She hears singing as soon as she opens the front door – a very enthusiastic rendition of Under The Sea that has both her children giggling more than joining in – and she’s grateful that the noise covers her entrance, allows her to pad quietly down the hall towards the kitchen and watch unnoticed from the doorway. Mason and Arielle sit at the small table they use unless they have guests over, finishing off what looks like spaghetti and meatballs as Ryan chops vegetables at the central island, all the while giving her best Sebastian the crab and wiggle-walking side to side.  

Ari has always been a giggler – similarly to a tantrum, it really doesn’t take much to make her laugh – but Mason is a tougher audience, usually stopping at a smile or amused huff. But as Ryan lifts two spoons in her left hand and starts clapping them like maracas and dancing across the kitchen, Mason laughs so hard he spits spaghetti sauce onto the table, and Sophie feels like she’s about to cry for the second time today. The events of the morning do not seem to have tainted her children’s day – in fact, they appear untouched, unaffected. Protected somehow.  

Sophie finds the how when their new Nanny spins to an abrupt stop, eyes meeting hers, a slightly embarrassed smile curling up one side of her mouth.  

‘Hi,’ she says, lowering her spoons as the kids turn to see what has her attention.

Sophie arrives home early, deciding she’d rather spend an extra hour with her kids and then plough through her mountain of paperwork on the sofa with a glass of red than sit at her desk a moment longer. Though she’d tried to put on a positive face for the children this morning, particularly Mason who seemed quieter and in his own head more than usual on the way to school, the heavy mood Tyler had cast on them all had followed her through her day, leeching her energy and twisting a knot between her shoulders. She hasn’t heard from him, and experience tells her she probably won’t see him until the early hours when she can pretend his stumbling hasn’t woken her and just wait for him to pass out on the other side of the bed.  

She hears singing as soon as she opens the front door – a very enthusiastic rendition of Under The Sea that has both her children giggling more than joining in – and she’s grateful that the noise covers her entrance, allows her to pad quietly down the hall towards the kitchen and watch unnoticed from the doorway. Mason and Arielle sit at the small table they use unless they have guests over, finishing off what looks like spaghetti and meatballs as Ryan chops vegetables at the central island, all the while giving her best Sebastian the crab and wiggle-walking side to side.  

Ari has always been a giggler – similarly to a tantrum, it really doesn’t take much to make her laugh – but Mason is a tougher audience, usually stopping at a smile or amused huff. But as Ryan lifts two spoons in her left hand and starts clapping them like maracas and dancing across the kitchen, Mason laughs so hard he spits spaghetti sauce onto the table, and Sophie feels like she’s about to cry for the second time today. The events of the morning do not seem to have tainted her children’s day – in fact, they appear untouched, unaffected. Protected somehow.  

Sophie finds the how when their new Nanny spins to an abrupt stop, eyes meeting hers, a slightly embarrassed smile curling up one side of her mouth.  

‘Hi,’ she says, lowering her spoons as the kids turn to see what has her attention.

HTMLExcerpt:
"If we're on a break why are we doing Spotify Sessions?" Kate whined and complained into the microphone in front of her.

"Because we're not on break yet."

Kate groaned so dramatically that it forced Jordan to throw her Croc at her.

"Shut up!"

Kate's mouth formed into a pout. Everyone let it.

For her part, Sophie briefly glanced down at her phone.

She had been doing that a lot lately. For reasons only she was privy too. She hadn't been to keen on sharing her recent personal life developments to anyone but her sister.

"We'll start playback on my count, girls." Their producer said abruptly.

Sophie stuffed her phone back into her pocket. She ignored the curious eyes boring into the back of her skull.

"I'm just arranging stuff for the Grammys performance, guys." She never really thought of herself as a liar, but apparently she is one. Pathological even.

"Right. Anyway." Julia mumbled under her breath. Sorta.

"Feels for first run through, then I Wanna Dance With Somebody. 3...2...1...."

Sophie would tell then eventually. When she really had no choice.

...

The songs referenced are Feels (Fifth Harmony Cover) and I wanna dance with Somebody (fall out boy cover)

Excerpt:
“Fine, Queen of skepticism, everyone pick a card, look at it and put it face down the table on front of you.” Ryan skillfully shuffled the deck of cards, fanned them and placed the cards in front of each person. They each selected one from their pile and followed her instructions. 

“Okay. What next?” Mary asked, her excitement growing hard to contain. 

Ryan dramatically looked up at the ceiling then back at the table. “I’m going to recite the magic words.”

“Which are?” Sophie asked. 

“Ease on. Ease on. Ease on down the road.” 

“Seriously?” Luke asked. 

“Yes. The mom at one of my foster homes loved watching the Wiz.  Don’t judge me.”

He put his hands up in surrender.

Excerpt:
Story Title: Ginger Me Slowly

...

Ryan gasped loudly. “Ryan Wilder, I knew then what I absolutely know now,” the tears couldn’t be held back any longer as Ryan looked at the oil painting of the moment they celebrated officially becoming a thing. Ryan and Sophie went to The Hold Up. After a few drinks and a lot of dancing, Sophie stepped away to the sound booth and whispered, “does the DJ take requests?” The moment the song played was unexpectedly captured and posted on The Hold Up’s Instagram page. It was Ryan leaning into Sophie’s chest, her eyes closed, her smile peaceful, Sophie kissing the crown of her head as Somi’s Ginger Me Slowly stitched their beginning together. The canvas painted was draped with replicas of Poison Ivy's vines and pepper lights. It was propped up by a stand that was modeled in the fashion of the cabin: the backdrop of their first kiss. The realisation of the synergy of all these moments led to a small chuckle, “so you like it?”

“Sophie Moore is that even a question? You can ask me but you already know my answer,” Sophie took that as the moment to queue Judah into action. As she turned to look at him, he sensed something and went running at the fence.

She called out to him, “Judah, back boy, back!” He ran to the furthest end of the fence and was ferociously growling and digging. Sophie and Ryan ran over to see what was wrong as Judah let out a whimper it happened. The family of three was collectively skunked. Sophie was deflated. 

“Judah, you had one job,” Ryan looked at Judah’s collar. His name tag had been replaced with a ring. Sitting there smelling like rotting onions and burned plastic Ryan chuckled as she reached across to wipe the tear from her lover’s despondent face.

“Given our history, this is smelly perfection.”

“Is it?” Sophie huffed.

“You plotted each moment to the minute. The to-do lists that keep you grounded. I love your to-do list and the way life always reminds you that moments can’t be planned. I love your instant disappointment when things shift just a millimeter left of your plan. You told me the story of us. So, I hate to break it to your stinky face, but you do have the words. So, can you ask me now because I am really looking forward to my part?” Judah started rubbing his face on Sophie’s jogger pants. 




The woman hung her head, covering her face with her palm. They were all sitting on the grass, the culprit was long gone. Ryan gently opened Sophie’s hands, “I’m waiting.” 




The former Crow took a conciliatory breath, “Ryan, will you–,” She cut her off.




“Yes. Every day, yes,” she took Sophie’s into hers, snarled at their stinky ringbearer, “Alexa play ginger me slowly.” Sophie collapsed into Ryan as they affirmed their smelly family of three.

Excerpt:
‘You didn’t know this was a gay bar, did you? Oh poor, stick-up-the-ass Crowphie,’ she smirked, mocking her surprise. ‘Don’t worry, the big bad lesbians won’t bother you if you don’t make eye contact. Or better still, just leave.’  

‘I...’ She’d driven there so really probably shouldn’t have, but she necked the second drink in one, hoping to buy herself some time and physical cover to conceal the flustered reaction.  

Ryan was too close to miss it though, and she kept unwavering eyes on her as she collected the empty glass.  

‘Are you -’  

‘Your girl,’ Sophie interrupted clumsily, darkening her already blushed cheeks as she rushed to clarify. ‘Angelique.’  

Ryan bristled at the mention, recrossing her arms.  

‘My fiancée,’ she corrected, her tone already carrying a warning.  

‘Has she started coming around here more? Bringing her crew?’  

‘Does the woman I’m going to marry occasionally come to my place of work – a lesbian bar – with our friends?’ Ryan scoffed, incredulous. ‘Honestly, Crowphie, whatever suppressed sexuality shit you’ve got going on, leave us out of it. Go figure your shit out somewhere else.’  

‘Angelique is using you, Ryan,’ Sophie spat back, a little too harshly. Too blatantly defensive. ‘She’s using you and this place to push her drugs and make a name for herself, and I think part of you already knows that but for whatever reason you can’t admit it. That black mark, in place of a ring, just shows how little she really values you. Your worth to her is based on what you can give, not who you are.’  

‘Real love, a real relationship, real people cannot be bought and do not need to be.’ Ryan’s voice was a razor, her blazing eyes cutting to Sophie’s left hand then back to her face as she rose up and leant heavily across the bar, right into her space. ‘You want to talk about admitting things?’ She stroked the length of Sophie’s finger with two of her own, the tip of her tongue peeking between full lips and slowly curling back in. ‘How wet are you right now?’  

She didn’t wait for a response. Walked out from behind the bar and across the small dancefloor to the DJ booth near the frosted bay windows. Sophie’s body turned on her stool like it was on a pully, attached and without choice. Ryan continued to watch her as she spoke into the DJ’s ear. Smirking as the track began to change and the blue-haired woman at the controls unmuted her mic.  

‘This guilty pleasure is for those still harbouring their own. Don’t worry, this is a safe space. We’ve all kissed a girl and liked it.’  

Sophie was out the door before the first line was sung.

The whole fucking world stops turning, and Sophie is at its centre, all eyes on her for an explanation.  

‘Of course not,’ Diane Moore scoffs, trying to lighten it with an empty laugh. ‘Ladies don’t kiss ladies, sweetheart.’  

Ryan and Jordan have honed in on the conversation, completely still just a few feet away. Mason has moved to take his aunt’s hand; the other kids looking around confused.  

‘That’s not true, Mom,’ Sophie says, as levelly as her quivering throat will allow, keeping her eyes on her daughter. ‘People can love and kiss whoever they want when they grow up.’ She looks to Hallie with a reassuring smile. ‘And if they don’t want to kiss people that’s absolutely fine too. Everyone should do what makes their heart happy.’ Her eyes wander instinctively over the small girl to Ryan, holding there, holding them all in a dawning silence.  

‘Is your heart happy, Mommy?’ Ari asks with a yawn.  

‘It’s trying to be, baby.’  

Without a word, Tyler stands up and walks out of the room. And because the universe is a sadistic little shit, the only sound left is that of The Little Mermaid soundtrack.  

And you don’t know why  

But you’re dying to try  

You wanna kiss the girl.  | also mentioned in chapter 10

Excerpt:
Jordan lowers herself onto the couch in her office, relieved that she opted for something soft and cosy. As she sinks deeper into the couch, she feels a little weight being lifted off her shoulders, just a little. Sophie’s warmth was always her safe space, she's been managing on hard days but today is weighing heavier than any other hard day she's had and she wishes she could feel the warmth of her sisters embrace again. 




She feels the sting of her tears threatening to fall. The sudden warmth she feels encircling her uncovers the deep cracks in the dam she's built to keep herself going. The dam breaks and she sobs into her palms, the more she cried the more the warmth engulfed her, a cycle. 




Jordan’s voice breaks as she speaks through her tears, “Soph I miss you so much” 




“I miss you too baby sis” 




Jordans not sure if her heart breaks or swells at the sound of her sister’s voice. A bit of both? Her sobs grow louder. “I wish I could just hug you foreal” 




“Im right here Jord”,  she hugs Jordan a little tighter. Her sister crumbles a little more in her embrace




“Call on me I will be there”




Jordan hears Sophie’s voice. Their song. When Jordan was younger it was the only thing that would calm her, that song and her sister singing it, nobody else. As she got older the song took on its own meaning, it was a promise, a pact between them both. Wherever they were, whatever they were doing, they’d always be there for each other. It was a call and response. It was her turn 




Jordan sings through her sobs,  “don't be afraid”




“Please believe me when I say”




Jordan: Count on me




Jordan feels a familiar squeeze to her hand, it does nothing to calm her. Only spurs her tears even more. Sophie sits with her for a little while, knowing her sister can feel her presence, even if she can’t physically be there. This will have to be enough for now.

As she sinks deeper into the couch, she feels a little weight being lifted off her shoulders, just a little. Sophie’s warmth was always her safe space, she's been managing on hard days but today is weighing heavier than any other hard day she's had and she wishes she could feel the warmth of her sisters embrace again. 

 

She feels the sting of her tears threatening to fall. The sudden warmth she feels encircling her uncovers the deep cracks in the dam she's built to keep herself going. The dam breaks and she sobs into her palms, the more she cried the more the warmth engulfed her, a cycle. 

 

Jordan’s voice breaks as she speaks through her tears, “Soph I miss you so much” 

 

“I miss you too baby sis” 

 

Jordans not sure if her heart breaks or swells at the sound of her sister’s voice. A bit of both? Her sobs grow louder. “I wish I could just hug you foreal” 

 

“Im right here Jord”,  she hugs Jordan a little tighter. Her sister crumbles a little more in her embrace

 

“Call on me I will be there”

 

Jordan hears Sophie’s voice. Their song. When Jordan was younger it was the only thing that would calm her, that song and her sister singing it, nobody else. As she got older the song took on its own meaning, it was a promise, a pact between them both. Wherever they were, whatever they were doing, they’d always be there for each other. It was a call and response. It was her turn 

 

Jordan sings through her sobs,  “don't be afraid”

 

“Please believe me when I say”

 

Jordan: Count on me

 

Jordan feels a familiar squeeze to her hand, it does nothing to calm her. Only spurs her tears even more. Sophie sits with her for a little while, knowing her sister can feel her presence, even if she can’t physically be there. This will have to be enough for now.
SongArtist: Count On Me by Whitney Houston, CeCe Winans
SASW:
Count On Me by Whitney Houston, CeCe Winans
The In-between by WritersNook

Excerpt:
Story Title: Replay

...

AirPods shoved into her ears. Nikes laced and ready to pound the pavement. Replaying the events of a dream. She didn’t dream often. Or if she did she didn’t usually remember. 




On the rare occasion she did remember, she’d head straight to Google for an interpretation. All dreams had to have a deeper meaning right? Her subconscious layering metaphors about hidden or unknown feelings deep within her that she had yet to discover. 




This one however was vivid, so detailed it was blurring her ability to separate it from reality. And she didn’t need google to interpret its meaning. What she did need was to clear it from her mind. Erase it from existence. Because if she didn’t, there was zero percent chance of her being able to look Ryan in the eye without giving herself and her subconscious and now blatantly conscious desires away. 




She hit shuffle on her liked songs on Spotify and blew out a laugh as the randomly chosen song filled her ears. 




Make it stop

Sounds so good, I just can't take no more

Turn it down, turn it up, I don't know

I don't know




Of course. She wants the replaying to stop but her playlist suggests otherwise. She walked out of her condo and jogged down the stairs. As soon as her sneakers touched the pavement, she took off, turning the music up and deciding that she’d let the song play out. 




But don't stop (oh)

Don't move (oh), just keep it there (right there)

Keep it right there (ooh)

Keep it right there




She tried to focus on her breathing, her steps, the scenery passing by. But the images that were passing through her mind were preventing her body from calming. Hands and legs intertwined. Soft, intentional touches. Torturously slow exploration. Her heart rate was rising and it had nothing to do with running. 




I wanna put you on repeat

Play you everywhere I go

Everywhere I go

Play you everywhere I go




She rounded the corner into the park taking off in a full out sprint. The pace of her heartbeat and her demeanor matching the speed of jolting of consciousness at which she woke up this morning, sweating and gasping.




Don't stop (stop)

Turn it on, turn it up, make it louder (yeah)

I don't wanna miss a single thing

I wanna hear every melody (yeah)

Beating (beating, beating)

Beating so loud you can feel it (see it, see it)

Beating (beating, beating)

Beating for you




Her heartbeat was in her ears as she replayed the scene again from the beginning. Hands gripping hands and skin and hair. Lips grazing, teasing, whispering words of passion and adoration. 




Feel it all (feel it)

Feel it all crashing down (down, down, down)

I'm so lost (I'm so)

I'm so lost in (lost in) your sound (sound)




She leaned over hands on her knees as she gasped for air, willing her pulse and heartbeat to slow. 




The rest of the song faded into the background as she stood up and tilted her head up toward the sky. Hands on her hips, continuing to slow her breathing. 




“Hey Soph.” That voice. The one that she’d been hearing all morning in hushed whispers. An echo of her own mind combined with the voice she knew well. Her breath caught without even looking at her. “Fancy seeing you here.” 




Sophie found her eyes, gulped the nervousness, desperately trying to hide residual feelings and emotions still simmering beneath her skin. 




“You okay?” She tensed at the familiar touch of fingers to her wrist. Familiar in reality and now her fantasies. 




She shrugged off Ryan’s grip and shook herself. “Yeah. I just needed to clear my mind.” She glanced down at her Nikes. 




Ryan pulled back her hand, confused by Sophie’s reaction. “I get that. I’m doing the same, but walking. Not in the mood to be sweaty.” She shrugged, oblivious to the effect of her words on the taller woman standing rigidly in front of her, clenching her teeth and fists. 




“Oh.” She needed to get away from her. The urge to step closer battled with the panic to run and keep running until she couldn’t run anymore. “I’m gonna…” She gestured past Ryan and went to take a step, stumbling and dropping her phone. She steadied herself while Ryan bent to pick up her phone, glancing at her song choice. 




“Replay, huh?” Ryan handed the phone back. “Throwback Thursday?” 




“Something like that.” Sophie accepted her phone back trying not to touch her fingers. 




“I hit replay for you.” She smiled wiggling her eyebrows playfully. 




“Thanks.” Sophie’s cheeks and neck warmed. 




“Oh, that reminds me. Mary wants us to meet her at The Hold Up later for their Throwback Thursday themed DJ. Maybe we can request this song.” She put her own AirPods back into her ears and started to walk past her, gracing Sophie with her scent. “See ya later, Soph. Good luck with clearing your mind.” She called over her shoulder leaving Sophie standing in the middle of the pavement, Replay still playing in her ears. 




Wanna put this song on replay

We can start all over again

And again

Yeah

Wanna put this song on re-




“Fuck it.” She tapped the replay button and took off running again. She was fucked.

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

I can't believe I haven't posted smut for this fandom yet. I'm like 10 months in. Who even am I?! lol funnily enough, I actually started this before Bet It Up but when I finished it a few days ago I noticed that it could connect. Some minor edits later, here we are. A prequel.

For those who noticed/cared/wondered why the I C O N I C song, Comfortable by H.E.R., wasn't in the things you said au, well. This is why. Even though literally no one asked.

...

Her tone sounded very much like ‘go on’ so Sophie did. “And we’re comfortable with each other, right?”

“Yeah, one hundred percent,” Ryan agreed without even really thinking about it. If she weren’t too busy comprehending and was instead going for her usual levels of head ass-ery (which was the maximum amount in Sophie’s opinion), she would have told Alexa to play Comfortable by H.E.R.

“Good,” Sophie smiled to herself. “Already a solid foundation for trying something new.”

“True…” That was a solid reason. Or maybe it just sounded like one because Ryan was halfway sold already. Hell, she started considering it the second she realized that it was a legitimate offer.

“I’m comfortable with you too. And I mean, I doubt we’d let something like that ruin our friendship if it ends up being too weird so it’s not like I would regret it.” Sophie paused. “Also, you’re very aesthetically pleasing. I mean attractive. I mean, seriously, damn woman—“

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together

...

“They got up here rather speedily don’t you think,” Luke was genuinely confused. Imani had broken through the door. They could hear the zombies on the other side but the door, well… not much had taken place since, “it could be possible that they exerted too much energy to get to the loft, inside, and finally to this door.”

“So, they’re tired?”

“Or refueling,” Luke proceeded to open a search engine on his phone, “it’s a bit concerning to consider the dead as either tired or refueling. They are, you know… dead.”

“Thanks, Captain Obvious,” Ryan released her fighting stance and turned to Mary. Sophie remained in place. 

“What are you doing? Now isn’t the time to let our guard down,” Sophie remained in position, eyes focused on the door.

Then you come around again and say

"Baby, I miss you and I swear I'm gonna change, trust me"

Remember how that lasted for a day?

I say, "I hate you," we break up, you call me, "I love you"

“Or we could focus on getting out of here?” she gently turns the taller woman’s face towards her. The impact of the touch rattles her. The moments flash before her eyes. The possibility of Sophie (all of them) but mostly Sophie. Ryan wasn’t one to sacrifice a life but the woman who grated each nerve and always had a witty comeback wasn’t about to die on her watch, “Mary, how long for the jet?”




I'm really gonna miss you picking fights

And me falling for it, screaming that I'm right

And you would hide away and find your peace of mind

With some indie record that's much cooler than mine

“Ryan, I know it feels like time is moving slowly but nothing could be further from the truth,” in Mary’s defense Ryan had repeatedly put this question forward… and by repeatedly, every 5-15 seconds. It was an anxious spiral.

“You’re going first!” It was an affirmative squarely directed at the taller woman.

“What? Ryan, now is NOT the time!” Mary knew what was happening.

“Why would we put our military marksman on the getaway aircraft first?” Luke was flabbergasted by Ryan’s suggestion.

“You bozos are so naive,” the words were both arrogant and slimey, “it’s painfully obvious.”

“What? To who?” perplexed. The brain of the operation was always perplexed by basic human behaviour…like feelings. 

Mary gasped, “Ryan… RYan… RYAN RYAN RYAN”

“Why are you shouting?”

“You have feelings!”




Ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh

You called me up again tonight, but

Ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh

This time, I'm telling you, I'm telling you




“What?” Sophie, stumped by the statement.

The door hinges had begun to creak, “Oh god, oh god,” Luke imagined the misfire of timing, the fumbling decisions about to derail their rescue operation.

“Ryan, she has feelings,” Mary pointed nonchalantly between the two women. Ryan still hadn’t turned her attention away from the military marksperson. Her body wasn’t frozen; she was experiencing an avalanche of thoughts, “feelings for you.”

Sophie let out a maniacal giggle, “I know we are all mentally writing our life resignation speeches but…. Ryan is many things, but delusional isn’t one.”

Luke was spiraling in the corner, audibly counting the seconds until the jet’s arrival, “507, 506, 505, 504. 503, the universe, anybody don’t give up on me, 502, 501, 500, 499, 498.” 

“The coroner’s report will read: death by lesbian,” Alice pointed her words at the two Black women currently too distracted to realise that the door was mere moments from being completely broken down. 

“Soph…” she hesitated. What was she supposed to do now? She had been made by everyone in the room “I-”

“Ryan,” there was a sense of urgency.

“Soph”

“RYAN”

“Stop interrupting me!” She kissed her. Irrationally, hard then soft. She is on her toes; the shorter woman dragged her downwards. Sophie pushes her off.

“Ryan!” 

“I’m trying to tell you something!”

Sophie slapped her!

“What was that for?”.... “you don’t like me”

“Wrong time to ask that question?”

“We could die! This feels perfect if you ask me!”




We (We) are never, ever, ever getting back together

We are never, ever, ever getting back together

You go talk to your friends, talk to my friends, talk to me (Talk to me)

But we are never, ever, ever, ever getting back together




“Are you going to kill Angelique?”

“What?”

The door crashes to the floor. Zombies come charging forward. Jada Jet’s plane is moving ever close. 

“Angelique! Shoot her!”

“Kate!”

“What?”

“Luke, remember what we practiced?” Ryan looked at their exes, hooks ups, and hangouts walking towards them. She wasn’t the best at relationships but she didn’t want to add the zombie apocalypse to the list of reasons she was single, “Luke, snap out of it!”

Sophie softened, “Kate, I know you’re in there.”




“I used to think that we were forever, ever

And I used to say, "Never say never"

Ugh, so he calls me up and he's like, "I still love you"

And I'm like, "I just, I mean, this is exhausting, you know?

Like, we are never getting back together, like, ever"




Ryan lunges forward.

“RYAANNNNN”

“DIEEEEEEEEEEEEE!”

Excerpt:
Story Title: So Into You

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Wildmoore and Thundergrace link up and Ryan makes a very special request

Song: So Into You by Tamia (https://youtu.be/yFTYzJYTHQA)

...

“What’s up Freeland?!” they heard the DJ over the speakers say. “I got a song request from a special guest here tonight. Miss CEO herself, Ryan Wilder from Gotham City is in the building. Make some noise!” the crowd screamed and cheered in response and Ryan couldn’t help but smile. She was more known than she thought. 

“Ry. Babe. What’s going on?”

“Just wait.”

“This goes out to Miss Wilder’s special lady and it’s a throwback slow jam so grab your special one and cuddle up on the dance floor.”

As the music began to play, Ryan stood up and offered her hand to Sophie. 

“May I have this dance?”

Still a little confused by what was happening but willing to go along it; Sophie nodded, took Ryan’s hand, and let Ryan pull her up. She pulled Sophie close, arms wrapping around her waist while Sophie rested her arms around Ryan’s neck. 

With every passing moment

Thoughts of you run through my head

Every time that I'm near you

I realize that you're heaven sent, baby

I think you're truly something special

Just what my dreams are really made of

Let's stay together you and me boy

There's no one like you around, oh, baby

With the life they both led, they didn’t get many moments like this one.

Is was nice.

As they swayed to the music, Ryan began softly singing along. 

“I really like what you've done to me. I can't really explain it, I'm so into you. I really like what you've done to me. I can't really explain it, I'm so into you.”

Sophie rested her head on the side of Ryan’s, vibing and listening while her girlfriend serenaded her. 

I really like

What I feel when I'm with you

You're a dream come true

Don't you ever leave my side

'Cause it feels so right

Oh, I really like what you've done to me

Oh, I can't really explain it, I'm so into you, baby

I really like what you've done to me

I can't really explain it, I'm so into you

As the song coasted to the end, the DJ was saying something but all Ryan could hear was her own pulse in her ears and feel Sophie’s heartbeat against her own chest. 

“Sophie?”  

“Mmm?” 

“I’m so into you.”

Sophie chuckled.

“I’m so into you too.”

Ryan took a deep breath.

“No. Um. Not just that. I’m so into you that I’m in love with you.”

Sophie stopped their swaying and leaned back to look at Ryan. And the look on her face was hard to read.

The longer the pause, the more Ryan wanted to sprint out of the club and catch the first available flight to the moon. Then Sophie slowly smiled.

“Fucking finally.” She said and Ryan couldn’t believe her ears.

“Wait. Finally?”

Story Title: So Into You

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

Wildmoore and Thundergrace link up and Ryan makes a very special request

Song: So Into You by Tamia (https://youtu.be/yFTYzJYTHQA)

...

“What’s up Freeland?!” they heard the DJ over the speakers say. “I got a song request from a special guest here tonight. Miss CEO herself, Ryan Wilder from Gotham City is in the building. Make some noise!” the crowd screamed and cheered in response and Ryan couldn’t help but smile. She was more known than she thought. 

“Ry. Babe. What’s going on?”

“Just wait.”

“This goes out to Miss Wilder’s special lady and it’s a throwback slow jam so grab your special one and cuddle up on the dance floor.”

As the music began to play, Ryan stood up and offered her hand to Sophie. 

“May I have this dance?”

Still a little confused by what was happening but willing to go along it; Sophie nodded, took Ryan’s hand, and let Ryan pull her up. She pulled Sophie close, arms wrapping around her waist while Sophie rested her arms around Ryan’s neck. 

With every passing moment

Thoughts of you run through my head

Every time that I'm near you

I realize that you're heaven sent, baby

I think you're truly something special

Just what my dreams are really made of

Let's stay together you and me boy

There's no one like you around, oh, baby

With the life they both led, they didn’t get many moments like this one.

Is was nice.

As they swayed to the music, Ryan began softly singing along. 

“I really like what you've done to me. I can't really explain it, I'm so into you. I really like what you've done to me. I can't really explain it, I'm so into you.”

Sophie rested her head on the side of Ryan’s, vibing and listening while her girlfriend serenaded her. 

I really like

What I feel when I'm with you

You're a dream come true

Don't you ever leave my side

'Cause it feels so right

Oh, I really like what you've done to me

Oh, I can't really explain it, I'm so into you, baby

I really like what you've done to me

I can't really explain it, I'm so into you

As the song coasted to the end, the DJ was saying something but all Ryan could hear was her own pulse in her ears and feel Sophie’s heartbeat against her own chest. 

“Sophie?”  

“Mmm?” 

“I’m so into you.”

Sophie chuckled.

“I’m so into you too.”

Ryan took a deep breath.

“No. Um. Not just that. I’m so into you that I’m in love with you.”

Sophie stopped their swaying and leaned back to look at Ryan. And the look on her face was hard to read.

The longer the pause, the more Ryan wanted to sprint out of the club and catch the first available flight to the moon. Then Sophie slowly smiled.

“Fucking finally.” She said and Ryan couldn’t believe her ears.

“Wait. Finally?” 

“Ryan. I’ve wanting to say it for a few months now, but I didn’t want you feel like I was rushing things and then I’d scare you off. Again.”

Excerpt:
“I attached a new weapon to your belt.” Luke spoke into the comms. 

 

Sophie furrowed her eye and scanned her utility belt. “What is it?” 

 

“It’s a whip.” He started. “It’s made from-”

 

“I am not Rihanna. Chains and whips do not excite me.” She paused for a second to reconsider depending on the circumstances and the person and… focus Moore . “I wouldn’t even know how the hell to use it.”

 

Luke sighed heavily. “Just as you would imagine a whip would be used.” 

 

“Okay…but shouldn’t I be trained or something?” She held the whip in her hand and cracked it in the air with a simple wrist flick. The sound was strangely satisfying. “Maybe Rihanna was on to something…” 

 

“Sophie!” His voice came through already exasperated and Sophie hadn’t even left the rooftop of her building yet. “Focus.” 

 

Luke settled himself in front of the hospital’s security monitors in his office. He expanded the surveillance to external cameras surrounding the hospital and programmed two drones to release simultaneously above the warehouse.
HTMLExcerpt:
“I attached a new weapon to your belt.” Luke spoke into the comms. 

 

Sophie furrowed her eye and scanned her utility belt. “What is it?” 

 

“It’s a whip.” He started. “It’s made from-”

 

“I am not Rihanna. Chains and whips do not excite me.” She paused for a second to reconsider depending on the circumstances and the person and… focus Moore . “I wouldn’t even know how the hell to use it.”

 

Luke sighed heavily. “Just as you would imagine a whip would be used.” 

 

“Okay…but shouldn’t I be trained or something?” She held the whip in her hand and cracked it in the air with a simple wrist flick. The sound was strangely satisfying. “Maybe Rihanna was on to something…” 

 

“Sophie!” His voice came through already exasperated and Sophie hadn’t even left the rooftop of her building yet. “Focus.” 

 

Luke settled himself in front of the hospital’s security monitors in his office. He expanded the surveillance to external cameras surrounding the hospital and programmed two drones to release simultaneously above the warehouse.

Excerpt:
Sophie stepped closer to Ryan, softly breaking the distance between them. They each had their wounds, each found themselves floating above their sense of self and safety. As the space between felt heavier and heavier as it became smaller and smaller, “is this, okay?”

“I was thinking… maybe we could snuggle until the sunrises,” Sophie offered her a hand. Together, they returned to Ryan’s bed. 

Ryan cocooned herself into Sophie’s body, “mmm… snug-a-bug” 

There are these ways we have been conditioned to believe that without the physical consummation of a relationship, it means nothing. We rush or time or fear that moment because of all the expectations it places on a person’s heart. Rarely, do we stop to think- is it possible that a heart can be made for a heart, a body for a body without touch is the key? Sophie and Ryan navigated the spectrum of intimacy and gravity differently. We define the presence of love and romance, of togetherness and, “you are my person” by things that can be performed— acted upon, replicated, and mimicked. So, when love shows up, we desperately want to float back into the atmosphere because a relationship is the vulnerability of learning a person.

“Soph?”

“Mmhmm”

“Are you humming the song gravity?”

Sophie smiles, “sleep, my love.”

Excerpt:
Sophie placed a finger over Ryan’s lips.  “Hey, you have nothing to apologize for.  You get to feel however you need to feel about this. As far as we are concerned, we take care of each other.  That’s our rule.  That’s how we work.  Always have, always will.”

Ryan nodded and rested against Sophie’s chest.  “How did I ever get so lucky?”

The sound of Eli singing the Paw Patrol theme song floated into the kitchen. 

Sophie smiled. “I’m the lucky one. You gave me a life I never even dreamed possible.”

“A life of Paw Patrol and PJ Masks mornings?” Ryan asked with a raised brow.

“Nothing better in the world.” Sophie said before leaning in for another kiss.  She pulled back and glanced at their son still sitting on the sofa.
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie placed a finger over Ryan’s lips.  “Hey, you have nothing to apologize for.  You get to feel however you need to feel about this. As far as we are concerned, we take care of each other.  That’s our rule.  That’s how we work.  Always have, always will.”

Ryan nodded and rested against Sophie’s chest.  “How did I ever get so lucky?”

The sound of Eli singing the Paw Patrol theme song floated into the kitchen. 

Sophie smiled. “I’m the lucky one. You gave me a life I never even dreamed possible.”

“A life of Paw Patrol and PJ Masks mornings?” Ryan asked with a raised brow.

“Nothing better in the world.” Sophie said before leaning in for another kiss.  She pulled back and glanced at their son still sitting on the sofa.

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: This Little Light of Mine

...

The music gets louder as they get closer. Sounds like an old school church hymn. As they got closer, they realized that the music was a ruse. Blight and his minions have the church people tied up around the altar. She instantly spotted Sophie’s mom, recognizing her from Sophie’s pictures. Ryan and Luke hid behind the choir stand.




“I thought you said that lady made a tip to GCPD that she saw me.” Blight said to one of his minions




“She did sir.”




“Then where is Batwoman? We can’t do what we want without Batwoman around.” 




Ryan and Luke look at each other. 




“This was all a ploy to get to you.” Luke whispered




“Well, since Batwoman hasn’t got the news. Why don’t we start with giving something to see in the morning” Blight smiled




Ryan got up to move when Luke stopped her 




“If you go, you will be in his trap.”




“If I don’t show myself, I risk Sophie’s mom's life, and no one should lose their mother.” Ryan said




Ryan got up from behind the choir stand.




“When the old saints said ‘this little light of mine, I’m gonna let it shine’ I don’t think that meant a radioactive one.” Batwoman said




“Batwoman, it’s good to see you. Glad you got my message.” Blight responded with a glowing smile




“Let these people go” Batwoman said




“Sorry Moses but I need an audience.” Blight responded
HTMLExcerpt:
Chapter Title: This Little Light of Mine

...

The music gets louder as they get closer. Sounds like an old school church hymn. As they got closer, they realized that the music was a ruse. Blight and his minions have the church people tied up around the altar. She instantly spotted Sophie’s mom, recognizing her from Sophie’s pictures. Ryan and Luke hid behind the choir stand.

 

“I thought you said that lady made a tip to GCPD that she saw me.” Blight said to one of his minions

 

“She did sir.”

 

“Then where is Batwoman? We can’t do what we want without Batwoman around.” 

 

Ryan and Luke look at each other. 

 

“This was all a ploy to get to you.” Luke whispered

 

“Well, since Batwoman hasn’t got the news. Why don’t we start with giving something to see in the morning” Blight smiled

 

Ryan got up to move when Luke stopped her 

 

“If you go, you will be in his trap.”

 

“If I don’t show myself, I risk Sophie’s mom's life, and no one should lose their mother.” Ryan said

 

Ryan got up from behind the choir stand.

 

“When the old saints said ‘this little light of mine, I’m gonna let it shine’ I don’t think that meant a radioactive one.” Batwoman said

 

“Batwoman, it’s good to see you. Glad you got my message.” Blight responded with a glowing smile

 

“Let these people go” Batwoman said

 

“Sorry Moses but I need an audience.” Blight responded

Excerpt:
Ryan paused. A tear quickly made its way down her cheek as pain clenched in her chest.  Sophie was about to go to her when Ryan cleared her throat and carried on. 

“I’m glad he shared that moment with me. Because of him, I can see there is still beauty in this world. One of his favorite quotes was by Richard Russo. It said ‘Lives are like rivers, eventually they go where they must. Not where we want them to go.’ None of us were ready for Marquis’ departure, but just like a river his life had a purpose, and he will live on in the hearts of those who loved him forever.”

When Ryan returned to her seat, Sophie wrapped a protective arm around her and held her close. The remainder of the service went by quickly. Luke read one of Marquis’ favorite poems followed by the priest reading a scripture of comfort before beginning the benediction.  

“We therefore commit this body to the ground, earth to earth, ashes to ashes, dust to dust; in sure and certain hope of the Resurrection to eternal life.”

Jordan sang a simple rendition of ‘Amazing Grace’ as the casket was lowered.

Not where we want them to go.’ None of us were ready for Marquis’ departure, but just like a river his life had a purpose, and he will live on in the hearts of those who loved him forever.”

When Ryan returned to her seat, Sophie wrapped a protective arm around her and held her close. The remainder of the service went by quickly. Luke read one of Marquis’ favorite poems followed by the priest reading a scripture of comfort before beginning the benediction.  

“We therefore commit this body to the ground, earth to earth, ashes to ashes, dust to dust; in sure and certain hope of the Resurrection to eternal life.”

Excerpt:
“You matter to someone,” Sophie’s face held a mellow and contented glow, “I hope you know that’s more than a recipe,” Sophie gives Danvers a curious look, “I can tell you don’t cook. You’ve been nervous this entire time which tells me you have not prepared a meal of any kind for anyone but yourself. The notes… “trust yourself” beside the adding of the chili powder. The timing and pacing along with the songs, press play after all the ingredients are prepped and ready, and the curl of the exclamation mark at the end. It’s a smile. A gentle message.” 

My Love,




Wooden spoon in your firefighting hand, pot on the stove. Let’s do this. 




Turn the fire on to medium. Press play




Add the oil at the end of the piano intro. Something always brings me back to you




You still feel me here til the moment I’m gone. Add the sausage and the ground beef




Use your spoon to gently break the sausage and ground beef up as it cooks. 




But you touch me for a little while and all my fragile strength is gone. Add the poblano pepper, onion, and celery.




Stir in the veggies.You’re everything I need here on the ground




Sway to the sound of the notes and the sizzle. Add chili powder, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and molasses, and mix well. Lift from the bottom of the pot. Use those muscles.




You’re on to me, on to me, and all over, something always brings me back to you




Timer: 15 minutes.




It never takes too long




Add the non-alcoholic stout, beef stock, garlic, Worcestershire, and vinegar




Me say mi love yuh like mango




Stir the spoon and swivel the sips




A better you gimme some loving 

See how far we can guh




Imagine it’d be nice and something 




Let the fire do what it do for 90 minutes




If you put your head my sleeve

Do you sing you asleep?

I wouldn’t tell a soul what you dream

I think you’d want me to know it’s like ivory




Add beans and cook and another 30 minutes. 




Bet you you'll see far

Bet you you'll see stars

Bet you you'll elevate

Bet you you'll meet God

'Cause I feel like fallin' in love

I'm in the mood to fuck somethin' up

'Cause we gon' fuck up the night





Stir




…




If you got the notion

I second that emotion

Said, if you feel like giving me a lifetime of devotion

I second that emotion




Stir




…




Wild, wild, wild

Wild, wild, wild thoughts

Wild, wild, wild

When I'm with you, all I get is wild thoughts

Wild, wild, wild

When I'm with you, all I get is wild thoughts




Stir




…




Well, now, it takes more than a robin to make the winter go

And it takes two lips of fire to melt away the snow

Well it takes two hearts a-cookin to make a fire grow

And baby, you’ve got what it takes




Stir




….

I was lost in transit

You, you found me stranded

I, I just can't stand it

You, you hit me just like

                                                      (Sophie repeats the song)

Stir




…

And the chemistry, the chemistry

It hit me like that, that, that

And the serotonin flutterin'

It hit me so bad




Like a sucker punch straight to my heart




Stir




…




Stir




…




You hold me without touch

You keep me without chains

I never wanted anything so much than to drown in your love




…




Stir 




…

Breathe.  Turn off the flame. You did it. 

...
