Stir in the veggies. You’re everything I need here on the ground

 

Sway to the sound of the notes and the sizzle. Add chili powder, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and molasses, and mix well. Lift from the bottom of the pot. Use those muscles.

 

You’re on to me, on to me, and all over, something always brings me back to you

 

Timer: 15 minutes.

 

It never takes too long

 

Add the non-alcoholic stout, beef stock, garlic, Worcestershire, and vinegar

 

Me say mi love yuh like mango

 

Stir the spoon and swivel the sips

 

A better you gimme some loving 

See how far we can guh

 

Imagine it’d be nice and something 

 

Let the fire do what it do for 90 minutes

 

If you put your head my sleeve

Do you sing you asleep?

I wouldn’t tell a soul what you dream

I think you’d want me to know it’s like ivory

 

Add beans and cook and another 30 minutes. 

 

Bet you you'll see far

Bet you you'll see stars

Bet you you'll elevate

Bet you you'll meet God

'Cause I feel like fallin' in love

I'm in the mood to fuck somethin' up

'Cause we gon' fuck up the night



Stir

 

…

 

If you got the notion

I second that emotion

Said, if you feel like giving me a lifetime of devotion

I second that emotion

 

Stir

 

…

 

Wild, wild, wild

Wild, wild, wild thoughts

Wild, wild, wild

When I'm with you, all I get is wild thoughts

Wild, wild, wild

When I'm with you, all I get is wild thoughts

 

Stir

 

…

 

Well, now, it takes more than a robin to make the winter go

And it takes two lips of fire to melt away the snow

Well it takes two hearts a-cookin to make a fire grow

And baby, you’ve got what it takes

 

Stir

 

….

I was lost in transit

You, you found me stranded

I, I just can't stand it

You, you hit me just like

                                                      (Sophie repeats the song)

Stir

 

…

And the chemistry, the chemistry

It hit me like that, that, that

And the serotonin flutterin'

It hit me so bad

 

Like a sucker punch straight to my heart

 

Stir

 

…

 

Stir

 

…

 

You hold me without touch

You keep me without chains

I never wanted anything so much than to drown in your love

 

…

 

Stir 

 

…

Breathe.  Turn off the flame. You did it.

Excerpt:
"I love you," Sophie whispered against Ryan's lips. 

"I love you, too," Ryan returned, kissing Sophie once more before sitting up and standing from the bed. She held her hand out for Sophie to grab and Sophie stood from the bed with Ryan's assistance, their hands remaining linked as they left the bedroom to find their girls and their aunt. They found them in the living room, dancing to Christmas music, Donny Hathaway's This Christmas blasting from Sophie's Bluetooth. Even Rayven was up and dancing and filming them all together on her phone.

Excerpt:
It was quiet for a while, save for Ryan’s slow, quiet breathing. And the occasional snore.

Then out of nowhere, Sophie heard humming. It took a minute to catch it the tune and figure out what Ryan was humming.

“Here I thought you were sleep. Yet you’re humming Ne-Yo?”

“I was trying to get to sleep but the song got in my head and I couldn’t shake it.” Sophie heard Ryan say from behind her.

“‘Cause she walk like a boss. Talk like a boss. Manicured nails to set the pedicure off. She’s fly effortlessly.” Ryan sang softly, nuzzling the side of Sophie’s neck. 

“That I am.” Sophie agreed. 

“But I still got the most money now so, Let me be, I wants to be, gots to be, your suga mama.”

Sophie giggled.

When did she become a giggler?

“I can’t with you.”

But Sophie couldn't deny that she liked the idea of someone wanting to care of and carry her. 

“Mm mmm.”

Sophie felt Ryan relax into her back and slowly her breathing evened out.

She stayed up for a bit longer, searching hotels and Airbnb’s for the perfect getaway spot with Ryan’s breathing as the soundtrack for her search.

...

Writer's End Notes:

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: Hot in Here

Ryan stumbled into the apartment. She dropped her keys on the floor. The result of inebriation, poor balance, and terrible aim. She hadn’t been out in weeks as Gotham was experiencing a crime wave— Arkham had a few escaped residents. 

“Sophie!” She stumbled into the living space. She belched loudly, catching herself off guard. She sniffed, “oh yea. Crispy Joe’s wontons. Those were tasty.” She felt uncomfortable, “right, shoes.” She took her heels off and threw them towards the door. One of her black pumps hit the apartment door causing a loud thud. She slithered out of her skin-tight dress as she sang to herself.

“I was like good gracious ass is bodacious, uh flirtatious, trying to show faces,” Ryan was dancing, wobbly but still sultry enough for Sophie to stop in the doorway and enjoy the show before announcing that she was indeed awoken by her drunk lover, “looking for the right time to shoot my steam, you know, looking for the right time to flash them keys,” she stepped out of her dressed. She was running her hands through her hair as she danced. Sophie leaned against the wall in the apartment hallway, “then um, I’m leaving, please believing, oh me and the rest of my heathens,” Sophie was catching the beat and proceeded to join Ryan as she removed her push-up bra.

“Check it, got it locked at the top of the Four Seasons,” Sophie was wearing a yellow waffle knit cami bralette top with matching shorts. It was cute cozy and perfect for a sudden late-night dance-party-sing-a-long, “penthouse, rooftop, birds I feeding, no deceiving, nothing up my sleeve no teasing,” she ran her index finger down Ryan’s chest as they rapped and moved their bodies in sync, “I need you to get up up on the dance floor give that man what he asking for because I feel like cutting loose and I feel like touching you,” the two women’s eyes were locked and focused on each other, “uh uh and can’t nobody stop the juice so baby tell me what’s the use.”

Sophie lifted Ryan off the ground, and a heated kiss followed. Ryan pulled back, biting her lips, “it’s getting hot in here so take off all your clothes. I am getting so hot–”

“I want to take my clothes off.” 

Sophie carried Ryan to their bedroom, tossing her on the bed— a move that proved to have disastrous consequences. It shifted Ryan’s stomach. Sophie removed her pyjama top as Ryan barely made it to their en suite toilet in time. Sophie could hear the painful hurl escape Ryan’s body.

Sophie quietly put her top back on and climbed into bed. Ryan brushed her teeth and drank some water. She came dancing back into the bedroom, “it’s getting hot in herree.” 

“Nope.” 

“Babbbeeee… I brushed my teeth tho.”

“Nope.”

Ryan climbed into the bed trying other methods to reengage Sophie in their pre-interruption activities, “can you resist this?” Ryan took Sophie’s earlobe between her teeth, running her hand along Sophie’s inner thigh.

“Yes,” as she removed Ryan’s hand, “I absolutely can; I can absolutely can.”

“But…” Ryan huffed and slunk into bed. 

“I brushed my teeth,” she mumbled under her breath.

It wasn’t long before Ryan was asleep and snoring. Sophie turned around to spoon the woman sure to be nursing a hangover in the morning. 

She kissed her cheek, “I love you, puke face.”

Excerpt:
Getting up again, Sophie looked at her watch. 1:35pm Ryan had already left and gone to the community center to meet with a potential Muay Thai instructor. She probably wouldn’t be in the most receptive mood. As her girlfriend, Sophie had to try.  She printed the article about Jada’s surgery, the death certificate of Nia A. Wilder, the obituary for Ryan Wilder, and Ryan’s birth certificate. 

Sophie was inside her 2021 Subaru Outback Onyx Edition XT . She was riding smoothly to Ryan’s playlist. “We Are One” is flowing through the speakers as she drives past the community center. Sophie sees her destination, but drives on.

Excerpt:
Especially, not when more lights were turned onto the choir behind her as they joined her for the chorus.

Let's talk about it, let′s talk about it
The way it hurts
The way it hides behind our words
When we don′t want to say what's wrong
Can we talk about it before the love′s gone?

Ryan turned to Iris with a raised eyebrow. She didn't want to say what she was thinking outloud, lest she look like a self-centered psychopath, but luckily Iris turned to her with the same expression.

"Is this fucking song about me?"

Iris patted her velvet-clad knee, "Baby, all her songs are about you."

Ryan felt like that might have been a stretch but she was increasingly glad she planned on speaking with Sophie later on in the night.
HTMLExcerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

And the song sophie sings is Talk About It by Jake Issac and Yuna

...

She was onstage before the lights came up as was standard. Less standard was the fact that she had to sing a full verse before a singular yellow spotlight shown down on her.

Don′t walk away 'cause if you go, I might not stay
No, don′t you leave
You had enough and I can see
That our talk has turned to madness
It's become so cold and quietly

It often helped that she couldn't see anything when performing on stage. The bright lights did not really make for any viewing pleasure.

Especially, not when more lights were turned onto the choir behind her as they joined her for the chorus.

Let's talk about it, let′s talk about it
The way it hurts
The way it hides behind our words
When we don′t want to say what's wrong
Can we talk about it before the love′s gone?

Ryan turned to Iris with a raised eyebrow. She didn't want to say what she was thinking outloud, lest she look like a self-centered psychopath, but luckily Iris turned to her with the same expression.

"Is this fucking song about me?"

Iris patted her velvet-clad knee, "Baby, all her songs are about you."

Ryan felt like that might have been a stretch but she was increasingly glad she planned on speaking with Sophie later on in the night.

Let's talk about it (let′s talk about it)
Let's talk about it (let's talk about it)
The scar it made
The pain it caused, the way it never healed
Because we never wanna talk
Can we talk about it?
′Cause it hurt when we don′t

For the final lyrics of the shortened for time version of the song, the choir would leave Sophie alone.

Don't walk away
′Cause if you go, I might not stay
No, don't you leave
You had enough and I can see
Our talk has turned to madness
It's become so cold and quietly

Sophie left the stage, still tunneled in. The audience clapped and upon her return backstage she thanked and congratulated the choir.
SongArtist: Talk About It by Jake Isaac, Yuna

Song: Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)
Excerpt:
Sophie chuckled.  “Interesting first date, huh?”

Ryan smiled at the familiar words.  She turned and titled her head up. She ran her fingers along Sophie’s jaw.  “Definitely memorable.  You were very memorable in that orange dress and my eyes will forever thank you for wearing that push-up bra. The girls were out to play that night and I was here for it.”   

Sophie leaned in and captured Ryan’s lips with her own. “I’m yours Ryan… every single part of me for as long as you’ll have me.”

Ryan swallowed the emotion welling within her. Sophie always had a way with words. “I thought we already settled this.  In the words of the great Beyonce’ Knowles-Carter, I liked it so I put a ring on it.  You’re mine until we’re both old and dusty.”

Sophie snorted.  “You better speak for yourself. I’m not going to be dusty. I have good genes.” She said gesturing to herself. 

Ryan stepped back and looked at her from head to toe.  She had to admit that Sophie did look good.  She was wearing a simple pair of white linen pants with a matching white button down.  Her hair was hanging freely over her shoulders, blowing in the gentle breeze.  She looked breathtaking.

“I plan to age gracefully.  And if your mother is any indicator of how you’ll age, you won’t have anything to worry about either.”

Ryan looked up at her and frowned.  “Did you just admit that my mother is attractive in a roundabout way?”

Sophie thought about it.  “Nope.  Not even gonna answer that.”

Ryan shook her head and snuggled back into Sophie’s arms.  They both kept their eyes on the waves and the sun setting into the sea.
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie chuckled.  “Interesting first date, huh?”

Ryan smiled at the familiar words.  She turned and titled her head up. She ran her fingers along Sophie’s jaw.  “Definitely memorable.  You were very memorable in that orange dress and my eyes will forever thank you for wearing that push-up bra. The girls were out to play that night and I was here for it.”   

Sophie leaned in and captured Ryan’s lips with her own. “I’m yours Ryan… every single part of me for as long as you’ll have me.”

Ryan swallowed the emotion welling within her. Sophie always had a way with words. “I thought we already settled this.  In the words of the great Beyonce’ Knowles-Carter, I liked it so I put a ring on it.  You’re mine until we’re both old and dusty.”

Sophie snorted.  “You better speak for yourself. I’m not going to be dusty. I have good genes.” She said gesturing to herself. 

Ryan stepped back and looked at her from head to toe.  She had to admit that Sophie did look good.  She was wearing a simple pair of white linen pants with a matching white button down.  Her hair was hanging freely over her shoulders, blowing in the gentle breeze.  She looked breathtaking.

“I plan to age gracefully.  And if your mother is any indicator of how you’ll age, you won’t have anything to worry about either.”

Ryan looked up at her and frowned.  “Did you just admit that my mother is attractive in a roundabout way?”

Sophie thought about it.  “Nope.  Not even gonna answer that.”

Ryan shook her head and snuggled back into Sophie’s arms.  They both kept their eyes on the waves and the sun setting into the sea.

"I-uh-I wrote this song for you, I'm not gonna release it unless that's what you want. I wrote it for you, it's yours. So, you can tell me what to do with it. I'm not going to sing it for you right now. Just gonna play it from my laptop. I've never really understood the idea of serenading someone. What are they supposed to do while you sing? And what if I choke or something? That'd be so awkward-"

"You're starting to sound like me. Just play it, Sophie."

At risk of sounding like Ryan even more, and ecstatic for the interruption, Sophie did just that.

The intial words were staticky and tinny as they sounded from the small speakers, but that was quickly overshadowed by the lyrics and Ryan's affinity for Sophie's voice.

I need you to fill the void
I wonder how I got by this week
I only touched you once
Lately I can't find a beat
I used to feel the rush

Excerpt:
Ryan finally gave up and joined her.  Jada laughed and brushed snow out of Ryan’s hair.  “You look a mess… and extremely happy, baby girl.”

“I am deliriously happy.” Ryan said wistfully as she watched her family and friends play in the snow.  Her eyes found Sophie and Charlie behind a tree.  Charlie was stockpiling snowballs as Sophie pelted Jordan and Marquis in the face.  Luke tripped over his own feet and landed face first in the snow.  Mary was laughing too hard to help him up.  Ryan and Jada laughed out loud.

“They make quite the team, don’t they?”

“They do.  Did you hear her call Sophie mommy?”

“I did.  I didn’t think there was anyone other than you that could wrap that woman around their finger.  I think your baby girl is going to give you a run for your money, dear.”

Ryan thought for a moment.  She liked the sound of that.  Charlie was their baby girl just like she was Jada’s.

“We got them, Mommy!  We won!” Charlies high pitched voice rang out into the starry night.

Ryan watched as Sophie lifted Charlie onto her shoulders as they trotted around celebrating their victory in song.  “We are the champions! We are the champions! No time for losers cause we are the champions... of the world!”

“So, how does it feel to finally have the family you always wanted?” Jada asked quietly.

Ryan looked at her mother for a moment before draping an arm around her shoulder.  Jada wrapped an arm around Ryan’s waist. 

“It feels like… a Christmas wish come true.

Ryan finally gave up and joined her.  Jada laughed and brushed snow out of Ryan’s hair.  “You look a mess… and extremely happy, baby girl.”

“I am deliriously happy.” Ryan said wistfully as she watched her family and friends play in the snow.  Her eyes found Sophie and Charlie behind a tree.  Charlie was stockpiling snowballs as Sophie pelted Jordan and Marquis in the face.  Luke tripped over his own feet and landed face first in the snow.  Mary was laughing too hard to help him up.  Ryan and Jada laughed out loud.

“They make quite the team, don’t they?”

“They do.  Did you hear her call Sophie mommy?”

“I did.  I didn’t think there was anyone other than you that could wrap that woman around their finger.  I think your baby girl is going to give you a run for your money, dear.”

Ryan thought for a moment.  She liked the sound of that.  Charlie was their baby girl just like she was Jada’s.

“We got them, Mommy!  We won!” Charlies high pitched voice rang out into the starry night.

Ryan watched as Sophie lifted Charlie onto her shoulders as they trotted around celebrating their victory in song.  “We are the champions! We are the champions! No time for losers cause we are the champions... of the world!”

“So, how does it feel to finally have the family you always wanted?” Jada asked quietly.

Ryan looked at her mother for a moment before draping an arm around her shoulder.  Jada wrapped an arm around Ryan’s waist. 

“It feels like… a Christmas wish come true.

Excerpt:
“Dance with me…” Sophie stood up and held out her hand to Ryan. ICU by CoCo Jones was playing, and she just wanted to get lost in a moment with her love. There wasn’t anyone else dancing, but she didn’t care.

Ryan didn’t hesitate to indulge her. She took Sophie’s hand and joined her. Sophie pulled her close, holding her by her waist while Ryan hugged her around her shoulders. They shared a sweet, tender kiss, before Sophie kissed her shoulder and then the side of her face.

As they swayed to the music, their friends watched them, commenting about how happy Sophie seemed and how she just glowed. Ryan leaned in close to Sophie, whispering sweet nothings in her ear, and Sophie responded with a loving smile. Their connection was undeniable and radiated throughout the room.

Jordan couldn't help herself, she was unable to resist, teasing her sister and Ryan. "You two are so damn cute, it's almost sickening!" she joked, but the warmth in her voice made it clear that she was genuinely happy for them. The rest of the team chimed in agreeing with her.
HTMLExcerpt:
“Dance with me…” Sophie stood up and held out her hand to Ryan. ICU by CoCo Jones was playing, and she just wanted to get lost in a moment with her love. There wasn’t anyone else dancing, but she didn’t care.

Ryan didn’t hesitate to indulge her. She took Sophie’s hand and joined her. Sophie pulled her close, holding her by her waist while Ryan hugged her around her shoulders. They shared a sweet, tender kiss, before Sophie kissed her shoulder and then the side of her face.

As they swayed to the music, their friends watched them, commenting about how happy Sophie seemed and how she just glowed. Ryan leaned in close to Sophie, whispering sweet nothings in her ear, and Sophie responded with a loving smile. Their connection was undeniable and radiated throughout the room.

Jordan couldn't help herself, she was unable to resist, teasing her sister and Ryan. "You two are so damn cute, it's almost sickening!" she joked, but the warmth in her voice made it clear that she was genuinely happy for them. The rest of the team chimed in agreeing with her.

Ryan whispered to Sophie. "You're so beautiful," which made her blush. Sophie kissed her in response, because she didn’t have the words to describe how she was feeling. The way Ryan was looking at her filled her with so many emotions that she felt overwhelmed.

“Why don’t you get us another round?” Ryan asked her.

“Are you trying to get me drunk so you can have your way with me?” Sophie teased.

“Of course.” Ryan grinned.

Sophie chuckled, softly, and gave Ryan another quick kiss before she went over to the bar. Jordan noticed all of a sudden Ryan seemed to get nervous. She took a deep breath, and reached into the pocket of the flannel shirt she wore. At first, she couldn’t tell what was in her hand until Ryan adjusted what she was holding.

“Oh my god,” Jordan gasped and eagerly nudged Mary next to her, who squealed.

Sophie could hear the gasp and whispers behind her, which made her turn around. Immediately she was caught off guard when she saw Ryan standing there holding a ring.

“I wasn’t sure when, or how I was going to do this. I was waiting for the perfect moment, but there is no such thing,” Ryan began, her voice trembling with emotion. The look in Sophie’s eyes made her feel even more emotional. "Sophie, from the moment we met, I knew there was something special between us. Through everything, even in my darkest moments, the one thing I could never get away from was how much I love you, and I can't imagine my life without you in it. I want to spend the rest of my life showing you how much you mean to me. Life is so unpredictable, we don’t know how much time we have, and we're reminded of it every day. I want to make every single moment with you count. So, Sophie, will you do me the honor of becoming my wife?"

Tears welled up in Sophie's eyes, her heart swelling with so many overjoyed emotions. Words that described what she was feeling escaped her, so she simply nodded vigorously until she managed to choke out a heartfelt, "Yes, Ryan, yes! I will marry you baby!"

The room erupted in cheers and applause from their friends, and strangers onlooking who were overjoyed for them. Ryan slipped the ring onto Sophie's finger, and they shared a passionate and emotional kiss that seemed to last forever.
SongArtist: ICU by Coco Jones
SASW:
ICU by Coco Jones
Fire and Desire by BWildmoore

Story: It All Began With Ryan's Bad Day
Excerpt:
“Focus.” Sophie rolled her eyes catching Ryan’s look.  “Anyway, I think her little friends were impressed and some… maybe a little scared.  When one of the boys asked who I was, Charlie gives him this smug look at tells him ‘That’s my Sophie, what’s it to ya?’”

Ryan laughed.  “Aww… that is too cute!”

“I know! Jordan said she’s overheard her saying it while at the center a few times too.  I think she’s finally warming up to me.  It appears that I’ve been claimed.” Sophie said beaming.

“Just remember who claimed you first.”  Ryan smiled watching the transformation.  Sophie’s eyes were bright and her dimples on full display.  This was Sophie at her happiest.  Ryan ran her fingers along Sophie’s face.  “You’re serious about this, aren’t you?”

Sophie glanced across the room and watched Charlie dance around in her seat as her head bobbed.  Her little voice was singing ‘My Girl’ off key.  “I am.  I’m in this if you are.”

Ryan let out a long sigh.  “You already know I’m in.”

“Focus.” Sophie rolled her eyes catching Ryan’s look.  “Anyway, I think her little friends were impressed and some… maybe a little scared.  When one of the boys asked who I was, Charlie gives him this smug look at tells him ‘That’s my Sophie, what’s it to ya?’”

Ryan laughed.  “Aww… that is too cute!”

“I know! Jordan said she’s overheard her saying it while at the center a few times too.  I think she’s finally warming up to me.  It appears that I’ve been claimed.” Sophie said beaming.

“Just remember who claimed you first.”  Ryan smiled watching the transformation.  Sophie’s eyes were bright and her dimples on full display.  This was Sophie at her happiest.  Ryan ran her fingers along Sophie’s face.  “You’re serious about this, aren’t you?”

Sophie glanced across the room and watched Charlie dance around in her seat as her head bobbed.  Her little voice was singing ‘My Girl’ off key.  “I am.  I’m in this if you are.”

By the end of the week, they had been all over the Maldives. It was the last night and they agreed to go to a late night concert. The performer was Janet Jackson and they were all freaking out, especially Sophie and Alani. 




As they were enjoying the show (Sophie and Alani doing the full Rhythm Nation choreo), a very handsome man, one that favored Method Man, began hitting on Jada. Jada was somewhat interested but was also being guarded. Ryan stepped in and got his number for Jada. 




After the show, they all headed back to the beach house. Jada had been quieter than usual. The rest of the family went to the movie room while Ryan joined Jada in the kitchen as she nursed a glass of wine.

Excerpt:
“Thank you Ni No, you’re the best sister I have ever had” Cory said as he hugged her. Alani got a little choked up. Her late brother Alvin, God rest his soul, used to joke and say Alani was his best sister.




“I love you Ni Ni.” He said as he pulled back




“I love you too, little man,” Alani said. Cory hopped in the car and checked out the gadgets. It could light up and it had a little radio to play all of Cory’s favorite songs. He recently discovered the Descendants franchise and “Chillin Like a Villain” has been his anthem.




“You did good Ni” Ryan whispered




“Thanks” Alani said, her eyes still teary

“Thank you Ni No, you’re the best sister I have ever had” Cory said as he hugged her. Alani got a little choked up. Her late brother Alvin, God rest his soul, used to joke and say Alani was his best sister.

 

“I love you Ni Ni.” He said as he pulled back

 

“I love you too, little man,” Alani said. Cory hopped in the car and checked out the gadgets. It could light up and it had a little radio to play all of Cory’s favorite songs. He recently discovered the Descendants franchise and “Chillin Like a Villain” has been his anthem.

 

“You did good Ni” Ryan whispered

Chapter Title: Love from NGC 7318 (T)

...

Chapter Summary:

I wanna tell you how I feel tonight
I keep trying, but the words ain't right
Nothing's fitting for a kind like you
I'm never speechless when the earth's my view

-Love from NGC 7318, Tanerélle

...

Ryan swallowed thickly and opened the ring box she held. "Sophia Diana Moore…will you marry me?"

The word yes felt stuck in Sophie's throat, and she couldn't seem to get the word out no matter how hard she tried, so she did the only thing she could think of, which was to kneel in front of Ryan and kiss her. She felt her tears falling and mixing with Ryan's as she poured a thousand 'yeses' into her kiss. When they parted, Sophie was still crying, but was able to nod, the closest she could get to forming the word she so desperately wanted to say but could not, for the life of her, get to come out.

Ryan's hand trembled as she held up the ring, a 5 carat sunburst halo round diamond, perfect for the woman she would love for the rest of her natural life and beyond, and placed it on Sophie's finger. 

It was a perfect fit. 

Ryan intertwined their fingers and kissed both of Sophie's hands before Sophie held Ryan's face and kissed her again. 

Tanerélle's Love From NGC 7318 played softly as the newly engaged couple knelt amongst the stars.

I've never met a girl like you

Never met a girl like you

...

Writer's End Notes:

I kinda cheated at the end and added another lyric, but it felt right.

- Come Over, Aaliyah

...

It's a quarter after 2 am when Sophie's phone rings, disturbing her precious sleep. Her mouth is poised to cuss whoever it is the fuck out, but then her eyes recognize the number and she's pressing the green button before her mind can register that Ryan is calling her in the middle of the night. 

"Hello?" She answered groggily.

"Hey…you busy?"  

"Is that a trick question? I was asleep."

"Alone?"

"Ryan…"

"Is that a no?"

"Who else is going to be in my bed?"

" You tell me? I don't know who you're sleeping with ."

Sophie sat up, her sleep waning the longer she spoke with Ryan. "You sound jealous, Ms. Jet-Wilder."

Ryan kissed her teeth and Sophie could imagine she was rolling her eyes as well. 

"My flight just touched down…"

"...how long until you get here?" 

"20 minutes."

"Hurry up, I'm sleepy."

Ryan chuckled lowly and the sound went straight between Sophie's legs. 

"We'll see about that."
SongArtist: Come Over by Aaliyah, Tank
StoryWriter: Life is A Song by EndlessDreamer1024

Come Over by Aaliyah, Tank

Excerpt:
The shorter woman just grins, happy that they aren’t on the subject of compliments anymore, and eager to see Sophie’s reaction to her song choice. A series of catchy minor notes start playing. And Sophie gives Ryan a now all too common side-eye as she recognizes the tune even before the words start: Birthday Sex by Jeremih.

“You are ridiculous.” Sophie laughs as the first lyrics join in. And Ryan just gives her a mega-watt smile before animatedly starting to sing along.

It's your birthday, so I know you want to ride out

Even if we only go to my house

Sip mo-eezy as we sit upon my couch

Ryan makes a show of dancing along with the music, picking up her and Sophie’s empty plates as she does. She rolls her body all the way to the sink before putting the kitchen ware there., ignoring the big feelings rolling around in her chest.

Sophie can’t help but laugh at the site of this short goofy-ass goddess.

Excerpt:
The weather was nice so together they began strolling the almost empty roads. Somehow ended up with linked arms. Sophie had just told Ryan about that time she had to ask Alex out in order to bait Kelly out, who was hopelessly in-love with the other woman.

 

“And it worked?”

 

“Of course it did, I was serenading her with my flute to Elvis Presley’s ‘I can’t help falling in love with you’” she grins and Ryan gasped laughed.

 

“On the subway?” Ryan questions in shock, her whole face lit up in amusement

 

“Full of people” Sophie adds with a nod

 

“Oh my god!” Ryan bust out in laughter making Sophie smile in return

 

“Hey, it got the job done. I mean Alex definitely said no but they’re married now so…” she shrugs with a smile

 

“Sophie Moore, I had no idea you had such side to you”
HTMLExcerpt:
The weather was nice so together they began strolling the almost empty roads. Somehow ended up with linked arms. Sophie had just told Ryan about that time she had to ask Alex out in order to bait Kelly out, who was hopelessly in-love with the other woman.

 

“And it worked?”

 

“Of course it did, I was serenading her with my flute to Elvis Presley’s ‘I can’t help falling in love with you’” she grins and Ryan gasped laughed.

 

“On the subway?” Ryan questions in shock, her whole face lit up in amusement

 

“Full of people” Sophie adds with a nod

 

“Oh my god!” Ryan bust out in laughter making Sophie smile in return

 

“Hey, it got the job done. I mean Alex definitely said no but they’re married now so…” she shrugs with a smile

 

“Sophie Moore, I had no idea you had such side to you”

HTMLExcerpt:
"Alright, y'all, this next cut goes out to the spinning beauty with the amber eyes. You know who you are…or maybe you don't. Either way, this one's for you."

The opening notes of Jazmine Sullivan's Excuse Me started playing and Luke muted their mics. 

"For the umpteenth time, why don't you, I don't know, tell her that you like her like a normal person?"

"And why would I do that?" Ryan said as she took notes for the next show. 

"Because that's what normal people do. They have actual conversations instead of simping via the radio."

"So you told the director from Sheldon Park how you feel about her?" Ryan raised her brow and Luke sucked his teeth. 

"That's different-"

"How?!"

"Because I've actually had a conversation with her. You've been making eyes with this woman at the gym for months and haven't said a word-"

"Okay, but-"

"And then , instead of talking to her, like a-"

"If you say 'normal' one more time-"

" Regular person, you anonymously dedicate songs to her. You don't even know if she's a listener!"

"Maybe not, but-" Luke pointed at her, informing her that her mic was live. 

"That was Philly's own Jazmine Sullivan. Before we sign off, I want to remind you all that Sheldon Park will be having a clothing drive this weekend. Please drop off new and/or gently used clothing items at the community center in the drop boxes located near the entrance. Also, the dirty birds have been out heavy lately, so stay vigilant. Remember, if they stop you, hands up and no sudden movements. If possible, film them or have someone else film. This is Radio Free Gotham. Stay safe and stay free."

Ryan signed off and removed her headphones. 

"Seriously, you should talk to her," Luke said as he removed his own headphones.
SongArtist: Excuse Me by Jazmine Sullivan
StoryWriter: Life is A Song by EndlessDreamer1024

Excerpt:
Jada relaxed and looked around trying to wake herself up.  A few moments later, Sophie returned from the kitchen with a bottle of water.  She handed it to Jada then joined her on the sofa.

“Thank you.  We must have fallen asleep on the last movie.”  Jada said stretching. 

“How many times did she make you watch The Princess and the Frog?” Sophie asked.

Jada chuckled.  “Only twice this time and the second time was just for the songs.”

“Yeah, she knows every word of those songs.  I’ve heard them so many times, I find myself singing them to myself at the oddest times.  I was in a security briefing last week when one of my guys said I was mumbling the words to Almost There.”

Jada laughed. “I heard about that.  Apparently, you have quite the voice.  They were calling you the singing commander around the office.”

Sophie flushed at the compliment. “I can hold a note, nothing like the actor in that movie though.”

Excerpt:
“First of all, Imani… come on. She’s great and all, but no chemistry.” Sophie said, giving her a bored face.  “Secondly…” There was a long pause.  “She just… She never deserved you, Ryan.”

Ryan raised a brow.  “And you think you do?”

“Oh, I can only pray and hope.” Sophie said so sincerely, it took Ryan’s breath away.

Conversation flowed easily between them as dinner was consumed.  They talked about everything; nothing was off limits.  Following dessert, Sophie stood and held out her hand.  “Usually, a date includes dancing.  May I?”

“Mmhmm… I’m not a player. I just crush a lot.” Ryan mumbled the song lyric.

Sophie just shook her head as Ran stepped into her taller frame and looped her arms around her neck.  Sophie’s hands slid around her waist and pulled her close.  Sophie lowered her head, touching their foreheads together.  They both sighed, feeling at home. 

“We’re not moving.” Ryan whispered after a while.

“We’re not?  It feels like we’re floating.”

 Ryan’s eyes drifted to Sophie’s plump lips.  She bit her own lip and groaned.  “If you want to dance, you’d better start moving otherwise, I’m about to kiss you and this museum is going to hold special meaning to me for a whole different reason.”

Sophie looked like she was ready to risk it all but held back.  They had plenty of time for that.  This night was about giving Ryan a first date that she would remember years from now.  The mere fact that she was thinking about the future made Sophie even more certain that this thing with Ryan was more than just attraction.  She knew she wanted to have a million firsts with Ryan.

She started swaying them to the music, just enjoying the feel of Ryan in her arms.  They danced for what felt like forever then walked the museum halls, listening and taking in Ryan’s enthusiasm as she talked about different pieces.  By the end of the night, Ryan was practically bubbling.  She was still talking about one of the modern paintings and its meaning.  Sophie found it adorable and sexy that Ryan was a secret Art and History geek.

Excerpt:
Ryan faced Sophie as they continued to dance. Holding each other and smiling. The DJ slowed it down and played Trey Songz' newest hit, “Save It,” so that the ladies could get a little sexier with one another. And it worked. Mary and Jordan went to sit, but Ryan and Sophie stayed on the dancefloor. Sophie pulled Ryan close, and Ryan slung her arms over the taller woman’s shoulders while Sophie held her by the waist. They stared into each other’s eyes, both blushing and content in each other’s arms.




Why are we fighting our connection? We belong together. Sophie couldn’t keep her thoughts at bay. She held Ryan tighter. “Are you okay?” Ryan asked. She had seen Sophie’s lip do that little twitch thing it did when she was getting emotional. “I’m great, Ry.”

Excerpt:
Jordan got up and requested a song. “Well, my loves, looks like we got a song request. This song is dedicated to the boss lady and our very own personal security. We love you, ladies.” Mariah Carey’s “We Belong Together” blasted through the speakers, and Ryan was thankful that her dark skin hid how much she was blushing. There was no hiding how red Sophie’s face was, though. “You wanna take a break?” Ryan asked, but she prayed that Sophie wanted to keep dancing with her. “No. Clearly, this is our song.”




We definitely belong together, Soph. Ryan thought. They danced until the song was over. Then they went back to their table, where Jordan gave them a sheepish grin. “Why are you even like this?” Sophie asked her sister.




“I’m just trying to give you two a push in the right direction. Everyone in here thinks that y’all are a couple. Just give the people what they want.”

There was no hiding how red Sophie’s face was, though. “You wanna take a break?” Ryan asked, but she prayed that Sophie wanted to keep dancing with her. “No. Clearly, this is our song.”

 

We definitely belong together, Soph. Ryan thought. They danced until the song was over. Then they went back to their table, where Jordan gave them a sheepish grin. “Why are you even like this?” Sophie asked her sister.

Excerpt:
"But that’s my point. I know Sophie isn’t a pushover. The woman gets what she wants. So, why waste so much time? My assistant thought you two were already married." 





"Ryan is a runner. You push too hard, and she’ll turn into a track star. If I couldn’t have her completely, I wasn’t going to risk what she was already giving me." Sophie said truthfully.





Everyone started looking at Ryan. "Like I told Sophie last night, I never had anything like this. Her. You guys. Other than Mama Cora, all I had was Angelique, and having her was nothing like having all of you. I didn’t even think I deserved Sophie’s friendship, let alone something more. Even when she was Crowphie, I knew she was too good for me. And once we became closer, I was content with that being enough. I felt like if I got too greedy, I would lose her completely."





"You’ll never lose me, Ry. That’s a promise. I love you."

The warm, sunlit restaurant hummed with the harmonious rhythm of Bob Marley's "Could You Be Loved", mingling seamlessly with the gentle symphony of crashing waves. The aroma of coconut and grilled seafood wafted in the air, creating a delightful aura.

Spotting Mary nestled comfortably at a table by the window, a mimosa sparkling like liquid sunshine next to her, Ryan sauntered over with an easy grin. Mary looked up, a playful smirk dancing on her lips.

"What? Did you forget we had brunch plans?" Mary quipped, arching a brow at Ryan.

Ryan, her eyes twinkling with mirth, shot back, "I didn't forget. I just had...other important matters to tend to. Sophie-related matters, if you catch my drift."

Mary dramatically gagged, feigning disgust. "Please, Ryan! It's too early for your TMI."

HTMLExcerpt:
Just then, the gentle strumming of a guitar flowed from the suite, soon followed by Sade's sultry voice crooning, "You think I'd leave your side baby? You know me better than that..." The lyrics filled the night, wrapping around Ryan like a soft blanket.

Behind her, she felt Sophie's arms gently encircle her waist, pulling her closer. Soft kisses trailed up her neck, making her close her eyes in bliss. The combination of Sophie's tender affection and the soulful music created a soothing rhythm that reverberated through her entire being.

"Dance with me," Sophie's voice was barely a whisper, but it echoed clearly in the silence of the night. She guided Ryan around to face her, their bodies swaying slowly to the music. Sophie was taller, and Ryan had to tilt her head up to maintain eye contact. Their height difference made the moment even more intimate, their eyes locked onto each other's, each gaze holding a depth of love that words could never express.

As the final notes of the song died down, Ryan, her voice soft yet full of conviction, stated, "I think we've just found our wedding song." Sophie simply nodded, resting her head against Ryan's.
SongArtist: By Your Side by Sade
SASW:
By Your Side by Sade
Turbulence by BWildmoore, Selinakvle

Excerpt:
Sophie squinted her eyes. “Did you just name all the women from Danity Kane?”

“Yes, because that’s how many women you go through a week.”

“I’m a show- show stopper.” Sophie sang.

Jordan chuckled as her sister slow wind in her seat as she sung Danity Kane’s hit song “Showstopper.”
HTMLExcerpt:
“Special delivery for Sophie Moore.” Her sister Jordan called as she walked over to her desk with flowers. Most people would say it was favoritism that Sophie and Jordan worked at the same company but she didn’t care. Her sister had just graduated college and was in need of a job and Sophie had enough pull to get her on. Neither one knew that Jordan would go from being a copy editor to having her own column in a magazine talking about the latest society and community events. Jordan went everywhere and when she went to an event everyone knew that it was the place to be.

“Which woman is this one now.” Jordan drawled as she sat the flowers down. “Dawn, Aubrey, Aundrea, Shannon or D. Woods?”

Sophie squinted her eyes. “Did you just name all the women from Danity Kane?”

“Yes, because that’s how many women you go through a week.”

“I’m a show- show stopper.” Sophie sang.

Jordan chuckled as her sister slow wind in her seat as she sung Danity Kane’s hit song “Showstopper.”

StoryWriter: How to Lose a Girl in 10 Days by RyanWilderSuit

Excerpt: Before walking any further, she looked around. At the front of the bar, there was a DJ table and a nice sized dancefloor. Currently packed full of women dancing to Lipstick Lover by Janelle Monάe. There were tables all around and plenty of stools at the bar.
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie was amazed at how big it was and how many women were there. All colors, shapes, and sizes. Everyone just relaxed and having a good time.

With this being her first time in a lesbian bar, Sophie felt self-conscious. Like all eyes were on her as soon as she walked in. She knew she was attractive. She’d never been told anything else. But she still couldn’t help feeling like she somehow didn’t fit in.

Before walking any further, she looked around. At the front of the bar, there was a DJ table and a nice sized dancefloor. Currently packed full of women dancing to Lipstick Lover by Janelle Monάe. There were tables all around and plenty of stools at the bar.

Finally, she made her way over to the bar, sitting on the side towards the back. After the way the women looked at her when she walked in, like she was the shiny new toy in the toybox, she wanted to hide the best she could.

Excerpt:
Joey was sitting in her wheelchair with Ryan’s iPad in front of her facing Ryan. The two of them were playing Head’s Up and Ryan was trying her best but failing to give Joey clues she knew. At the sight Sophie’s stomach swirled. She got instant butterflies.

“She accidentally showed her breast on stage at the Super Bowl!” Ryan yelled and Joey furrowed her eyebrows in confusion.

“Ou ou! Her brother is the biggest pop star to ever live! Ryan squealed. “Come on Joey!”

“Erykah Badu!” Joey yelled.

“You’re killing me!” Ryan laughed. “Ou I got it! Her brothers were a famous singing group!” Ryan was bouncing up and down.

“Justin Bieber!” Joey yelled.

“Girl what!” Ryan laughed out loud. “She was one of the biggest pop artists! She was..” Ryan yelled as the clock timed out.

Joey turned the screen toward her to check on what she missed. “Seriously Ryan, Janet Jackson? You do remember how old I am right?” Joey shook her head in disappointment.

“Also, we’ve been through this for like the fifth time, you can choose to pass to the next clue. You’re so bad at this.” Joey laughed as Ryan pouted.

For someone who loves music, why don’t you know these things about Janet Jackson?

“Maybe you should have called some of the songs she sings. All you had to say was Rhythm Nation.” Joey rolled her eyes.

Ryan’s eyes widened in realizatdion. “Oh yeah that’s true.” She laughed while Joey looked on in disbelief.

Excerpt:
The atmosphere of the parade was exhilarating. From the colorfully designed floats to the stunning dance troupes to the meticulously designed costumes, the parade showcased the artistic prowess of the LGBTQ community. There was art that absolutely dazzled their eyes, but the highlight of their day was the beautiful and talented Janelle Monáe.




The ladies were all in awe. Janelle Monáe was in Gotham City and was putting on an incredible performance right in front of them. Ryan swayed her hips to Lipstick Lover, a bit surprised when Sophie ended up pressed against her back, but she didn’t stop her movements. Sophie actually fell into rhythm with her. Ryan looked over her shoulder and smiled at the taller woman. They were having the time of their lives. The vibes between the two of them were definitely heightened; their chemistry was undeniable.




Ryan took a minute to just watch her friends. They were all letting loose; the liquor was flowing; everyone was dancing and mingling with new people. She was a lucky woman to have been guided on her journey to cross paths with this group of amazing women.

Excerpt:
Ryan turned and caught Sophie watching them. Her smile grew even bigger.  Sophie walked over and swept Ryan into her arms, twirling her around the room.  Charlie cheered as she watched Sophie dip Ryan then pull her up.

“I don’t need no money, fortune, or fame.  I got all the riches baby one man can claim!” Sophie sang along as she held Ryan close.  She turned and held out a hand to Charlie.  “I guess you’d say what can make me feel this way.  My girl. Talking bout my girls!”
HTMLExcerpt:
Ryan turned and caught Sophie watching them. Her smile grew even bigger.  Sophie walked over and swept Ryan into her arms, twirling her around the room.  Charlie cheered as she watched Sophie dip Ryan then pull her up.

“I don’t need no money, fortune, or fame.  I got all the riches baby one man can claim!” Sophie sang along as she held Ryan close.  She turned and held out a hand to Charlie.  “I guess you’d say what can make me feel this way.  My girl. Talking bout my girls!”

They sang until the song ended then Ryan switched off the player.

“Welcome home.” Ryan said, accepting Sophie’s kiss on the cheek.

“Hi. I didn’t know dinner would include entertainment tonight.  Motown, huh?”

“Charlie and I thought we could use a little music while we made dinner.  I realized I have failed to teach her about Motown, so I had to teach her my favorite song.  Every girl should know My Girl by The Temptations.  It’s a Motown classic.”

“Mama taught me the words.  ‘My girl. Talking bout my girl’.”  Charlie sang a little off key.

Sophie broke away from Ryan and lifted the girl into her arms and kissed her cheek.  She mentally noted that Charlie was getting bigger.  Even though she was small for her age, it wouldn’t be much longer before she wouldn’t be able to hold her Chuck in her arms like this.  The thought made her a little sad.  Her Chuck was growing up.

“I heard you singing.  You got a nice set of pipes on you, Chuck.”

Charlie sighed and shook her head in exasperation.  “I don’t have pipes, Mommy.  I’m a girl. We talked about this.”

Sophie laughed.  “I know that, you little bug.  When someone says that it just means you have a nice voice.  The pipes are your vocal cords.” She tickled the girl under her chin.

“Oh! My bad.” Charlie laughed.  “Thank you.”

“You’re welcome.”
SongArtist: My Girl by The Temptations
SASW:
My Girl by The Temptations
The Email by alphagirl007 (kayandkimsmom1)

HTMLExcerpt:
Aaliyah’s “At Your Best (You Are Love)” started playing through the speaker.

“Will you dance with me?” Sophie asked.

Ryan smiled, placing her hand inside of Sophie’s outstretched hand.

Sophie pulled Ryan closer as she wrapped her arms around her. Sophie hands ran through her hair and then moved down Ryan’s back as they moved to the music.

“I love your hair down.”

Ryan looked up at her. “You do?”

“Yes.” Sophie said playing in Ryan’s hair. “Just everything about you I want to touch.” Sophie rubbed her back then she put her arms around Ryan holding her tight.

Ryan inhaled her scent and then sighed. Sophie smelled of sweet vanilla and she loved the scent.

Sophie looked down at her and chuckled. “Did you just smell me?”

Ryan’s eyes popped open. “Not in a weird way but in a you smell good way.”

“Yeah, cause smelling someone is never weird.”

Ryan laughed. “This is nice. This is…” Perfect. Ryan wanted to say it was and in a perfect world it would be but they weren’t in a perfect world. She was on a reality bachelorette show trying to win the woman who now held her affections.

Sophie stopped swaying to look down at her. “I know this isn’t ideal but this moment right here is perfect.”

Ryan smiled as Sophie leaned down to kiss her.

Ryan pulled back. “You need to stop kissing me like that.”

“Like what?” Sophie feigned innocence. She leaned down again to capture Ryan’s lips. “Like this?” She whispered against Ryan’s lips.

Ryan looked up at Sophie’s beautiful brown eyes and almost came to pieces. She couldn’t believe how lucky she was to be in the arms of the most beautiful woman she has ever seen.

Sophie must of felt the same way because her eyes bore into Ryan like she was lucky to be in her arms too.
SongArtist: At Your Best (You Are Love) by Aaliyah
SASW:
At Your Best (You Are Love) by Aaliyah
The Reluctant Bachelorette by I_Write_4_Fun

HTMLExcerpt:
The amazing whirlwind of joy that had been happening in their lives over the past few months had Ryan almost floating around their kitchen while she made breakfast for her and Sophie. The breakfast consisted of fluffy sweet potato pancakes with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg, crispy bacon cooked to perfection for Sophie, accompanied by scrambled eggs seasoned with a touch of fresh herbs. For herself, Ryan prepared avocado toast topped with thinly sliced radishes and sprouts, along with a vegan egg substitute. To complete the meal, that was going to be a surprise for Sophie, was an assortment of fresh fruit, including strawberries, blueberries, and Sophie’s favorite, sweet, succulent pineapples. The aroma of the food carried through the apartment, creating a hungry invitation that caused Sophie to stir in their bedroom. While Ryan cooked, she couldn't help but hum to herself.

I don't know what it is that you've done to me

But it's caused me to act in such a crazy way

Whatever it is that you do when you do what you're doing

It's a feeling that I want to stay

'Cause my heart starts beating triple time

With thoughts of loving you on my mind

I can't figure out just what to do

When the cause and cure is you

 

Ryan was caught off guard by the feeling of Sophie’s hands gliding around her waist, but her smile widened the length of a football field as she leaned back into Sophie, who caressed her neck with her lips before joining in her sing along.

 

I get so weak in the knees

I can hardly speak (I do)

I lose all control (control)

And something takes over me (takes over me)

In a daze, your love's so amazing (amaze)

It's not a phase I want you to stay with me (stay with me)

By my side, I swallow my pride (my pride)

Your love is so sweet

It knocks me right off of my feet

Can't explain why your love, it makes me weak

They hummed the song together, sharing a sweet moment before Ryan turned around and wrapped her arms around Sophie’s neck. 

“Good Morning,” she greeted, before lifting slightly to kiss her lips. 

"Good morning," Sophie responded, her smile bright and warm. "SWV definitely is a vibe for us.

Story Title: Signs

...

"I guess I've never really been into astrology to know that. The only reason I even know zodiac sign names is because of Beyoncé," Sophie said, thinking of the song “Signs” from her debut album.

"Now that song was a bop," Ryan nodded. "But you mean to tell me that you've never once looked up personality traits that your sign is known for?"

"Nope"

"Oh, this is gonna be fun."

Excerpt:
"You may kiss your bride." Before the words were fully out, Ryan and Sophie were already kissing passionately. Jordan and Mary had to clear their throats in order for the two women to pull away from one another. The couple felt euphoric after their first kiss as newlyweds.


The ceremony went by quickly, and the reception was definitely something they would always remember. It was incredibly lavish, with extravagant decorations and delicious cuisine. It was probably fancier than the wedding itself. Jada and Diane had to get their way at some point, but the brides loved it.




Jordan caught the bouquet, which she was sure her sister and sister-in-law threw directly at her. Ryan and Sophie had their first dance to John Legend’s song So High. It had been on both their lists. They even danced with their mothers, and half way through the song, they switched and danced with their mother-in-laws.

Song: We Might Even Be Falling In Love (Interlude)
Story: A Perfect Verse Over A Tight Beat
Excerpt:
Victoria looked at the screen and saw all the songs except for one song that she didn’t record. Victoria played the song and the instrumental came on. Victoria heard guitar chords along with a 1970s beat. She was bobbing her head to the beat when Ryan stopped the song playing.

“Sorry, that’s not supposed to be there.”

“No, I love the beat. What is this?” Victoria asked excitedly.

“It’s just something I was playing around with.”

“A song that you’re playing around with called ‘We Might Even be Falling In Love’.” Victoria asked.

Ryan didn’t say anything.

“Are there lyrics to go with this song?”

“I’m not a writer.” Ryan stated.

“Yet, you have a song aptly titled ‘We Might Even be Falling In Love’.” Victoria countered. “If you named the song then there are lyrics to follow.”

Ryan stared at her before reaching for her phone to go to the Notes app to pull up the lyrics. She gave Victoria her phone as she silently read the lyrics. After she finished she looked up at Ryan and smiled.

“This is for her.” Victoria probed.

“For who? I just had these lyrics on my mind and had to write it down.” Ryan lied.

“Okay.” Victoria said unconvinced. “You should let me record it.”

“Why?” Ryan asked.

“Because this beat and those lyrics are meant to be heard even if it’s just you and me.”

Ryan shook her head. “I don’t know about that.”

“Let’s just see how it sounds. If you don’t like it then no harm no foul but I think you may have something special there, Ryan.”

“Oh you’re good.” Ryan said smiling.

“What did I do?” Victoria asked innocently.

“You know what you’re doing. You’re trying to stroke my ego.”

Victoria smiled. “Is it working?”

Ryan rolled her eyes. “Ugh, yes. Go get in the booth before I change my mind.”

“Yes.” Victoria said excitedly as she ran into the studio. “Send the lyrics to my phone.”

Ryan texted her the lyrics. As she set up the soundboard Victoria was in the booth trying to find the melody for the lyrics. After about ten minutes she was done.

“Are you ready?” Ryan asked.

“Are you?” Victoria countered as she put on the headphones.

Ryan smiled as she started the song.

Victoria closed her eyes and got lost into the beat of the song. Twelve seconds in Victoria started singing over the beat.

“Go 'head, act a fool in it
Freestyle with me 'til you find your groove in it
U-Haul 'cause I might let you move in it
Cause I ain't had nobody hit it like you hit it
And it feels like
I'm gonna know you for the rest of my life
It's safe to say that we might even be falling in love
Ooh, love, love, love
Ooh, love, love, love”

Ryan was in awe as Victoria sung the lyrics to her song. She knew the lyrics were good but Victoria just made them better and did it in one take.

“What did you think? Do you want me to go again?” Victoria asked.

“No, that was incredible.” Ryan marveled.

Victoria jumped up and left the booth to come back into the studio. After tinkering around with the song. Ryan played the song throughout the studio and they both screamed in excitement.

...

Writer's End Notes:

The song used in this chapter is Victoria Monet’s “We Might Even be Falling In Love.” If you haven’t heard it…check it out.
HTMLExcerpt:
Victoria looked at the screen and saw all the songs except for one song that she didn’t record. Victoria played the song and the instrumental came on. Victoria heard guitar chords along with a 1970s beat. She was bobbing her head to the beat when Ryan stopped the song playing.

“Sorry, that’s not supposed to be there.”

“No, I love the beat. What is this?” Victoria asked excitedly.

“It’s just something I was playing around with.”

“A song that you’re playing around with called ‘We Might Even be Falling In Love’.” Victoria asked.

Ryan didn’t say anything.

“Are there lyrics to go with this song?”

“I’m not a writer.” Ryan stated.

“Yet, you have a song aptly titled ‘We Might Even be Falling In Love’.” Victoria countered. “If you named the song then there are lyrics to follow.”

Ryan stared at her before reaching for her phone to go to the Notes app to pull up the lyrics. She gave Victoria her phone as she silently read the lyrics. After she finished she looked up at Ryan and smiled.

“This is for her.” Victoria probed.

“For who? I just had these lyrics on my mind and had to write it down.” Ryan lied.

“Okay.” Victoria said unconvinced. “You should let me record it.”

“Why?” Ryan asked.

“Because this beat and those lyrics are meant to be heard even if it’s just you and me.”

Ryan shook her head. “I don’t know about that.”

“Let’s just see how it sounds. If you don’t like it then no harm no foul but I think you may have something special there, Ryan.”

“Oh you’re good.” Ryan said smiling.

“What did I do?” Victoria asked innocently.

“You know what you’re doing. You’re trying to stroke my ego.”

Victoria smiled. “Is it working?”

Ryan rolled her eyes. “Ugh, yes. Go get in the booth before I change my mind.”

“Yes.” Victoria said excitedly as she ran into the studio. “Send the lyrics to my phone.”

Ryan texted her the lyrics. As she set up the soundboard Victoria was in the booth trying to find the melody for the lyrics. After about ten minutes she was done.

“Are you ready?” Ryan asked.

“Are you?” Victoria countered as she put on the headphones.

Ryan smiled as she started the song.

Victoria closed her eyes and got lost into the beat of the song. Twelve seconds in Victoria started singing over the beat.

“Go 'head, act a fool in it
Freestyle with me 'til you find your groove in it
U-Haul 'cause I might let you move in it
Cause I ain't had nobody hit it like you hit it
And it feels like
I'm gonna know you for the rest of my life
It's safe to say that we might even be falling in love
Ooh, love, love, love
Ooh, love, love, love”

Ryan was in awe as Victoria sung the lyrics to her song. She knew the lyrics were good but Victoria just made them better and did it in one take.

“What did you think? Do you want me to go again?” Victoria asked.

“No, that was incredible.” Ryan marveled.

Victoria jumped up and left the booth to come back into the studio. After tinkering around with the song. Ryan played the song throughout the studio and they both screamed in excitement.

Excerpt:
Move-in day arrived sooner than later. Ryan stood in the middle of her airy new loft, music blasting. She danced around as she unpacked, basking in the possibilities of the space.

 

Caught up in the moment, she belted out the lyrics to Rihanna’s “Rude Boy” at the top of her lungs. As she executed a dramatic spin, her phone began buzzing with an incoming FaceTime call.

 

Still giddy, Ryan grabbed her phone. Sophie's face filled the screen. Ryan’s heart leapt at the sight of her warm brown eyes and signature smile.

 

Before she could say hello, Sophie’s amused voice came through the speakers, “Well don’t stop the show on my account!”
HTMLExcerpt:
Move-in day arrived sooner than later. Ryan stood in the middle of her airy new loft, music blasting. She danced around as she unpacked, basking in the possibilities of the space.

 

Caught up in the moment, she belted out the lyrics to Rihanna’s “Rude Boy” at the top of her lungs. As she executed a dramatic spin, her phone began buzzing with an incoming FaceTime call.

 

Still giddy, Ryan grabbed her phone. Sophie's face filled the screen. Ryan’s heart leapt at the sight of her warm brown eyes and signature smile.

 

Before she could say hello, Sophie’s amused voice came through the speakers, “Well don’t stop the show on my account!”

Ryan glanced over at Sophie in the driver's seat. Streetlights glided by, illuminating her flawless features in a warm glow. Sensing Ryan's gaze, Sophie turned to her with a subtle smile. "This was nice tonight," Sophie said, her voice low. Ryan nodded, pulse quickening. "It really was."

...
As she scrolled aimlessly on social media, trying to ground herself in reality, Ryan came across a new post from Sophie. It was a video of her and Jordan at the Beyoncé concert, belting out "Virgo's Groove" with delight. Ryan couldn't help but smile, admiring the sisters' infectious joy. But a jolt went through her as she realized - it was the very song that had soundtracked her dream.

“No way, we should go!” Sophie said excitedly.

“You weren’t the only one with a surprise up your sleeve, you two really are perfect for each other,” Jordan clued her sister in. “This is Ryan and Mom's gift to you.”

Excerpt:
Sophie laughed and stole a quick kiss from her wife’s pouty lips.  “It’s the circle of life, babe.”

“The circle of life!... And it moves us all!!”

Both women winced at the loud, slightly out of key voice singing loudly.

“In the circle… circle of life!” Izzie continued to sing.  “Ooh! Mama, can we watch The Lion King?”

“Sure nugget.  We can watch whatever you want, but you need to get up to bed to rest for a little bit first.”

“Aww man.  You no fun, Mama!”

Sophie swooped in and gently lifted the girl from the booster seat and into her arms.  She was careful not to brush up against the girl’s cast in the sling. 

“Don’t be mean to Mama.  Mama is the best.  She just wants you to feel better.”

“I know.  I’m sorry, Mama.  You’re the bestest Mama in the whoooole wide world!” Izzie said, trying to make a circle with her good arm.  She didn’t succeed. 

Ryan could only laugh.  God, she loved this kid.
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie laughed and stole a quick kiss from her wife’s pouty lips.  “It’s the circle of life, babe.”

“The circle of life!... And it moves us all!!”

Both women winced at the loud, slightly out of key voice singing loudly.

“In the circle… circle of life!” Izzie continued to sing.  “Ooh! Mama, can we watch The Lion King?”

“Sure nugget.  We can watch whatever you want, but you need to get up to bed to rest for a little bit first.”

“Aww man.  You no fun, Mama!”

Sophie swooped in and gently lifted the girl from the booster seat and into her arms.  She was careful not to brush up against the girl’s cast in the sling. 

“Don’t be mean to Mama.  Mama is the best.  She just wants you to feel better.”

“I know.  I’m sorry, Mama.  You’re the bestest Mama in the whoooole wide world!” Izzie said, trying to make a circle with her good arm.  She didn’t succeed. 

Ryan could only laugh.  God, she loved this kid.

"Nine times out of ten, I'm in my feelings

But ten times out of nine, I'm only human

She was jolted from her brooding thoughts by a sudden knock on the driver's side window. She looked up to see Sophie standing in the rain, looking tired after a long day wrangling energetic kids.

Excerpt:
"Perfect," Ryan said, selecting "Moment" by Victoria Monét and connecting it to her Bluetooth home speakers. She set the phone down and extended a hand to Sophie. "Dance with me?”

 

Sophie took Ryan's hand, unsure of the song that was playing. "What's this?"

 

"It's your motherfuckin' moment," Ryan said with a grin, quoting the lyrics.

 

Sophie pulled back, raising an eyebrow. “It’s my what now?”

 

"Shh, baby, just listen to it," Ryan urged as the song's melodic beat filled the room.

 

She wrapped her arms around Sophie's neck as Sophie's hands encircled her waist. They swayed together slowly as the lyrics swelled:

 

“I got a feeling that you brought me to you

Yeah, you did, babe

Look what your mind's imagination can do

Making shit true

Yeah, you do, babe.”

 

Ryan smiled up at Sophie, mouthing along to the metaphoric words. Sophie pulled Ryan even closer, their bodies ideally in sync as she paid attention to the lyrics.

 

“So let me take away your pain

Give me all of your emotions

Land it like a plane on my back if you can't hold it.”

 

Sophie repeated the line back curiously. "Land it like a plane on my back if you can't hold it? What does that mean?"

 

Ryan chuckled. “It’s a double entendre."

Sophie took Ryan's hand, unsure of the song that was playing. "What's this?"

 

"It's your motherfuckin' moment," Ryan said with a grin, quoting the lyrics.

 

Sophie pulled back, raising an eyebrow. “It’s my what now?”

 

"Shh, baby, just listen to it," Ryan urged as the song's melodic beat filled the room.

 

She wrapped her arms around Sophie's neck as Sophie's hands encircled her waist. They swayed together slowly as the lyrics swelled:

 

“I got a feeling that you brought me to you

Yeah, you did, babe

Look what your mind's imagination can do

Making shit true

Yeah, you do, babe.”

 

Ryan smiled up at Sophie, mouthing along to the metaphoric words. Sophie pulled Ryan even closer, their bodies ideally in sync as she paid attention to the lyrics.

 

“So let me take away your pain

Give me all of your emotions

Land it like a plane on my back if you can't hold it.”

 

Sophie repeated the line back curiously. "Land it like a plane on my back if you can't hold it? What does that mean?"

 

Ryan chuckled. “It’s a double entendre."

Excerpt:
Feeling a thirst coming on, Sophie headed to the kitchen where Ryan was. But on second thought, she grabbed Ryan's hands instead and urged "Dance with me." Naya let out a suggestive whistle at Sophie's forwardness. Ryan just smirked at her nosey friend before letting herself get led away.

 

"I'm So Into You" by SWV comes on from the playlist. Sophie started doing a goofy two-step dance in front of Ryan, who laughed hysterically at her antics. Deciding to join in on the silliness, Ryan busted out her own hip twirling, body winding move. Before long, everyone else joined them in the living room. They all sang along loudly as the space turned into a dance floor, everyone showing off their most ridiculous moves in the spirit of unworried fun.

 

As the song continues going, Sophie pulled Ryan's back flush against her front and began whisper-singing the lyrics in her ear. Ryan leaned back, craning her neck to look at Sophie with a smirk. "You're so into me huh?"

 

"Just a little bit," Sophie teased, matching her smirk.

 

"Only a little bit?" Ryan challenged playfully.

 

Sophie pretended to think hard before declaring "Maybe...a lotta bit" and placing a soft kiss behind Ryan's ear. "Thank you again for this."

 

Ryan turned around, facing Sophie with a soft, adoring expression on her face. "Anytime."
HTMLExcerpt:
Feeling a thirst coming on, Sophie headed to the kitchen where Ryan was. But on second thought, she grabbed Ryan's hands instead and urged "Dance with me." Naya let out a suggestive whistle at Sophie's forwardness. Ryan just smirked at her nosey friend before letting herself get led away.

 

"I'm So Into You" by SWV comes on from the playlist. Sophie started doing a goofy two-step dance in front of Ryan, who laughed hysterically at her antics. Deciding to join in on the silliness, Ryan busted out her own hip twirling, body winding move. Before long, everyone else joined them in the living room. They all sang along loudly as the space turned into a dance floor, everyone showing off their most ridiculous moves in the spirit of unworried fun.

 

As the song continues going, Sophie pulled Ryan's back flush against her front and began whisper-singing the lyrics in her ear. Ryan leaned back, craning her neck to look at Sophie with a smirk. "You're so into me huh?"

 

"Just a little bit," Sophie teased, matching her smirk.

 

"Only a little bit?" Ryan challenged playfully.

 

Sophie pretended to think hard before declaring "Maybe...a lotta bit" and placing a soft kiss behind Ryan's ear. "Thank you again for this."

 

Ryan turned around, facing Sophie with a soft, adoring expression on her face. "Anytime."

Excerpt:
Tonight is much like any other Friday night for Kate Kane. Always chasing the high, nevermind the fact that she burns off alcohol quicker than the average person does, she Sips on her glass of old fashioned, seeking the lasting burn from the beverage that never comes.

 

The bar she's sitting in is fairly empty so she slips the vial of fluorescent blue liquid from her leather jacket pocket, tipping The contents  into her drink, to add a little….razzle dazzle. The next few sip of her glass sends all her senses into a heightened frenzy. This, this is the high she's been searching for. She gulps down the rest of her glass and stumbles through the exit of the bar, heading down the road. The streets aren't empty on a Friday night, everyone's out, looking to start their weekend on a high note. 

 

“Sweet Carroolliieeeeee” Kate sings, her emptied glass in hand and her words slurred. 

 

She sings at the top of her lungs, as off key as her body is off balance. She takes a few tumbles to the ground before she finally finds her footing, albeit clumsily. 

 

The hairs along her arms stand at attention, her blood bubbles with excitement, her ears hone in on almost every sounds she could possibly hear, she smells the greasy food being prepared in all the fast food restaurants in close proximity, she hears every laughter, every smashed glass, alcoholic drinks being mixed in shakers. This is what she's been craving and her body loves it, the constant rush of adrenaline. She heads into one of the clubs on Gotham highstreet, she'll need to blow off some steam after this, where better to look than The Hold Up?

Excerpt:
As they drove, Jordan let out a groan. "Why do you always insist on riding in silence?"
 
"Because I like to think without distractions," Sophie replied, keeping her eyes on the road.
 
 Jordan rolled her eyes and smacked her lips. "Girl, think about this!" She reached for the infotainment system controls. Sophie smacked her hand away, and the two engaged in a brief, playful scuffle before Jordan relented.
 
Ryan chuckled at their sibling antics from the backseat. The sound drew Sophie's eyes back to the mirror. She caught Ryan's and smirked. "What do you want to listen to?" Sophie asked.
 
 Ryan blinked, not expecting to be given the choice. "Oh, ummm...whatever you normally play is fine," she replied.
 
 Sophie's smirk deepened as she chose a mellow song from her latest playlist.
 
"And this is what you pick, Sophie?"
 
Ryan chuckled. "I actually like this song."
 
 Jordan laughed and shook her head. "Not you too, Ryan!"
 
Ryan just shrugged and smiled in response.
 
In the mirror, Sophie's found Ryan's eyes once more. "What do you know about this?" she asked, nodding towards the music as the hazy vocals of "Serenade of Water" filled the car.
 
 "I know a little something," Ryan said with small smile.
 
 Sophie raised an eyebrow but focused back on the rainy road ahead.

Excerpt:
Sophie just nodded silently and watched as Ryan got out and hurried through the rain up to her front door. After unlocking it, Ryan gave a small wave before disappearing inside. Sophie waited until the lights came on, signaling Ryan was safely home, before shifting the car into drive and pulling slowly away into the night.

Jordan looked over at her sister and smirked. "What?" Sophie asked, glancing between Jordan and the road. "She's taken, you know."

Sophie feigned ignorance. "Who?"

"Don't play dumb," Jordan said, giving her sister a knowing look. "You've been here a month already and haven't found someone yet."

"I'm not interested in anyone nor am I looking ," Sophie replied dismissively.

"Mhmm, tell that to someone who'll listen. I know how Sophie Moore operates."

Sophie rolled her eyes but stayed focused on driving.

Jordan nudged her playfully. "Just don't bring any skanks back to my place."

 "C'mon Jor, I would never."

"I know, I'm just playing." After a brief pause, she added, "What happened with that girl you were dating in Central City? Kim something?"

 Sophie just shrugged noncommittally and continued driving them to Jordan's apartment. She was crashing on her sister's couch for the time being, ever since moving back a few weeks ago. Her return was far from ideal, but she had no other options and Jordan was the only family she had left. Living in Gotham again definitely hadn't been part of the plan, but plans have a way of getting derailed - or blowing up in your face, as was the case for her.

Sophie adjusted in her seat and navigated through the familiar streets as the melancholy melodies of "Melt Away" by Alicks filled the silence.

Sophie just nodded silently and watched as Ryan got out and hurried through the rain up to her front door. After unlocking it, Ryan gave a small wave before disappearing inside. Sophie waited until the lights came on, signaling Ryan was safely home, before shifting the car into drive and pulling slowly away into the night.

 

Jordan looked over at her sister and smirked. "What?" Sophie asked, glancing between Jordan and the road. "She's taken, you know."

 

Sophie feigned ignorance. "Who?"

 

"Don't play dumb," Jordan said, giving her sister a knowing look. "You've been here a month already and haven't found someone yet."

 

"I'm not interested in anyone nor am I looking ," Sophie replied dismissively.

 

"Mhmm, tell that to someone who'll listen. I know how Sophie Moore operates."

 

Sophie rolled her eyes but stayed focused on driving.

 

Jordan nudged her playfully. "Just don't bring any skanks back to my place."

 

 "C'mon Jor, I would never."

 

"I know, I'm just playing." After a brief pause, she added, "What happened with that girl you were dating in Central City? Kim something?"

 

 Sophie just shrugged noncommittally and continued driving them to Jordan's apartment. She was crashing on her sister's couch for the time being, ever since moving back a few weeks ago. Her return was far from ideal, but she had no other options and Jordan was the only family she had left. Living in Gotham again definitely hadn't been part of the plan, but plans have a way of getting derailed - or blowing up in your face, as was the case for her.

 

Sophie adjusted in her seat and navigated through the familiar streets as the melancholy melodies of "Melt Away" by Alicks filled the silence.

The two couples piled into a spacious SUV and headed to Dolby Live. Once they settled into their seats, the show quickly got underway.




Naya was utterly mesmerized, singing along to every word. Chelsea tried to play it cool but couldn't help but get into it, too, when Usher busted out, "You don't have to call."

Excerpt:
Sophie and Ryan were lost in the music, singing and dancing together all night. When Usher launched into "Can U Handle It," they shared a knowing glance. That had been their song the first night they met and danced at the club.




As the familiar beat dropped, Sophie came up behind Ryan and pulled her close. She began rocking side to side, singing the lyrics softly into her ear. Ryan leaned back into her and sighed contently. She turned to look at Sophie, "I'm so glad you're here with me, baby." She was so grateful to be sharing this night with the love of her life.




Sophie smiled and kissed her ear, whole holding onto her hips. "There's nowhere else I'd rather be. Though I kinda wish our song was something like 'There Goes My Baby' instead. That would be more appropriate for our wedding one day."




Ryan whipped around and gave Sophie a perplexed look. Sophie didn't even realize she had casually mentioned them getting married.




"What?" Sophie asked, noticing Ryan's look.




Ryan just smiled, shook her head and pulled Sophie in for a light kiss. "Nothing, babe...just hold me a little tighter." Sophie happily obliged, wrapping her arms snugly around Ryan's waist. They moved as one, caught up in the music and each other.

"What?" Sophie asked, noticing Ryan's look.
