Excerpt:
Everything in the entrepreneur longed to reach out, grab Ryan’s wrist and stop her. To make her see she was serious about wanting to be better for her, for them. But the larger part of her couldn’t. Even if she hadn’t stayed because Sophie wanted her to, the fact remained that her wife was still in their home. And with that, it presented the Ryan chances to see Sophie meant what she said. That she longed to correct, comfort and replace the hurt caused by what she had wrought to their relationship.





With her decision made, she pulled her phone once again from her pocket. Scrolling through her contacts she hit YGAFRIM. Her call was answered on the second ring.




“Well if it isn’t my partner in crime…”




“I need a favor.” Her tone came out rushed hinting at the seriousness of the situation as she stared after her vanished spouse.




“Name it.” Gone away was Kate’s joking tone and gentle prodding as she took in the CEO’s mood. “Is everything ok?”




At the question her thoughts fled back to Ryan. Her harrowing, coffee colored eyes still lingered in the forefront of her mind. Replaying her announcement that she couldn’t love Sophie.

 

“Sophie,” Kate called, using her name to pull her from her mental hell she was reliving currently as she shook her head. Giving a final glance toward Ryan’s wing before retreating back to the couch. As she exhaled deeply.




“I guess that answer would depend on your definition.”

 

...

Writer's End Notes:

I'm hoping to update at least once a month on a random Friday. I don't want to rush out chapters. I want a good story that you can revisit if you choose. So again thank you for the love, support and patience. And I hope you enjoyed the update.

*Bonus points if you understood Kate's Contact name and what YGAFRIM stands for*

Love you all!

RedToxicity ♥️♥️♥️

Excerpt:
She listened in, enjoying the music while responding to emails. She looked at her phone, answering emails and making plans for their next step. She looked out of the picturesque windows, noticing how dark it had become, she didn't realize that it was after 10pm. She didn't realize she was humming along until she recognized the song that Ryan was playing. She shook her head, going back to work when another song she recognized was coming from the piano, but this time Ryan was singing along. She saved her work and locked all of her devices before going around the couch to the studio, not realizing that at some point the door had opened.  

“Hey.” She said popping her head into the room.  

Ryan looked up at her and kept playing and singing.  

“Are you okay?”  

Ryan nodded, her eyes a little unfocused, but still singing.  

Ryan got to the chorus, and she sang louder. Realization hitting Sophie like a Mack truck. She looked down at her outfit, saw the glassy look in Ryan's eyes and realized what she was doing. She couldn’t do this again (even though it was a good song, and she was singing it better than Ginuwine).  

“Are you drunk right now?!”  

Ryan just kept playing and singing. “ Can I have what’s in those jeans.”  

Ryan hit the bridge of the song and Sophie stormed downstairs. Shaking her head as she went. She grabbed her purse and keys and was at the door in seconds. Ryan hot on her heels.  

“Wait. Please don’t go, I was just having some fun,” she pleaded.  

“Get you shit together Ryan. I’ll be back for my equipment in the morning.”

Excerpt:
Sophie drops Ryan’s hand and Ryan notices the loss immediately. “Well if you ever change your mind about checking out the class first hand feel free to view the schedule online or in the lobby and join us one day. It’s a pretty great workout if I do say so myself.”

“Yeah, sure thing.” Ryan’s not entirely sure why she even agreed. She’s never stepped foot in a spin class much preferring Yoga and even that she does in the comfort of her own home and not in a room full of others. Although her therapist has been encouraging her to get out of her comfort zone more but hey she just moved to a completely new city so she thinks that qualifies.

“Well, I better get going.” Sophie gestures towards the class which looks almost completely filled by now.

“See ya around,” Ryan responds as Sophie turns to enter the room.

Ryan begins to make her way down the hall when she hears the muffled bass line of Victoria Monet’s Alright blasting from the room. Whoever is in charge of the playlist has excellent taste. Maybe it wouldn’t hurt to take a peek at the schedule and sign up for a class especially if that means she gets to see Sophie again.

Excerpt:
“The Hold Up. Have you heard of it?”

Sophie winces slightly. “Yeah, I’m familiar. It’s my ex’s bar, unfortunately.”

“I’m guessing things didn’t end well judging by that look on your face.”

“That’s an understatement. Safe to say I haven’t been there in a few months. Just thought it best to avoid it though I hear she’s skipped town now.”

“Yeah, she did mention something about leaving to find herself after we wrapped up everything.”

Sophie rolls her eyes. “She can be so dramatic sometimes but yeah it’s definitely for the best.”

Ryan knows a bit about messy breakups considering how her last relationship ended. She’s about to tell Sophie that she understands when suddenly the lights dim and a woman, who Ryan guesses is the instructor, hops onto the bike at the front of the room facing the class. Sophie shoots Ryan a sideways smile as the opening of Usher’s Omg begins. What has Ryan gotten herself into?

Excerpt:
Ryan scrunches up her face at the thought of possibly trying that celery, cucumber, and ginger concoction that Sophie always orders, but she quickly brushes the worry aside. She’s pretty sure that she can top the leaderboard while getting her best score to date. The Power Meter, as Sophie explained to her during their first class, measures how much work the rider is putting into the bike (resistance) and the rate at which that work is being done (cadence). While the leaderboard is there to help keep people motivated with a goal to work towards it also serves as a little friendly competition between the participants. Ryan’s been tracking her score the past few weeks and she’s come a long way from her spot near the bottom half of class when she first started spinning. Lately, she’s been in 3rd or 4th place, still behind Sophie in the standings, but she’s positive she can take the top spot today, especially with the added incentive.

Ryan’s so busy psyching herself up to win that she barely notices Sophie has left her side and is walking towards the front of the room straight to the instructor's bike.

Sophie hops on and after some quick adjustments places a headset mic on. “Hey everyone! I’m filling in for our usual instructor Allison. Unfortunately, she had a last-minute thing pop up so you guys get me today. Hopefully, you don’t mind,” she finishes as she puts on her most charming megawatt smile.

Sophie’s announcement is met with smiles and nods from the class but Ryan is stuck in place. What in the entire fuck? She was expecting Sophie to be on the bike next to her not leading class. How is she supposed to concentrate now with Sophie directly in her sightline, giving instructions, muscles flexing, sweat glistening? It’s as if Sophie can read her mind as she chooses that exact moment to look directly at Ryan to shoot her a knowing smirk. It’s going to take all of Ryan’s resolve to reach the top of the rankings with this new wrinkle thrown in, but she refuses to back down now. She gives Sophie a thumbs up before the lights dim and the opening of Ciara’s Level Up begins. Appropriate song choice Ryan thinks as she puts her game face on - it’s go time.

Excerpt:
“Nah, I hear you sis. I was just trying to lighten the mood before I say this. It’s reminding you of Kate and that damn guitar and the situation before.” She softened her tone. “But this person isnt Kate, and with Kate it was different, you were married to Tyler. Also, your public profile doesnt show you as out. So maybe she was just trying to have fun..? Maybe just try talking to her. Tell her about your past clients that put you in an uncomfortable position. I still wish i knew who she was to give you better advice, but communication always works.”  

Sophie softened, her shoulder relaxed. Her little sister always knew what to say. “You’re right. I’ll just tell her why I was uncomfortable. I left so quickly all my equipment is over there and i need to grab it.”  

“Look at you finally listening to me for once. At least she didn’t play daddy’s home by Usher...”   

Sophie could hear her sisters smile through the phone. “Shut up. But thank you J. I’ll head back over in a few hours. Love you J.”  

“Always Giant One.”

Excerpt:
Ryan appeared after another 15 minutes, bright eyed and smiling. Sophie nodded to her before grabbing her bags and leading them out the door and down to the parking garage to her car. Ryan made herself comfortable in the passenger seat while she waited for Sophie to finish loading her bags.  

Sophie turned the car over, turning on the radio before pulling out of the garage and driving to the destination. Sophie didn’t object when Ryan took control of the entertainment system, turning the volume up when a certain song came on. She didn’t even object to Ryan’s loud ‘skeeyee’ when the Sexxy Red song came on and Ryan turned the volume up even higher. Sophie couldn’t stand the song, but Ryan rapping along made her smile. She made sure to suck her teeth audibly before subtly nodding her head to the beat. Ryan was so lost in the radio that she didn’t notice the car parked.

...

"I'm still getting the hang of this thing. But you mentioned you don't listen to music when you drive, which is just crazy to me." Ryan fiddled with the high-tech infotainment system and scrolling through screens. She glanced over at Sophie. "So as long as you are in my car, I'm requiring we listen to something right now. Go ahead and pick a song."




Sophie scoffed. "Wow, not only am I being held hostage, but I must also be your DJ against my will? Is this what our friendship is going to be? Do I get no say?"




"Girl, just pick a song," Ryan laughed.




Sophie mumbled under her breath, "So damn bossy," as she scrolled through the Spotify app integrated into the car. After some contemplation, she chose "Smoking in the Park" by Tone Smith.




Ryan bopped her head approvingly and increased the volume slightly as they cruised, following the curving highway lined with bright streetlights. "What you know about Tone?"




"Not much, honestly. He stopped by the shop about a week ago while touring through Gotham. Said he heard about my skills from folks around town and needed some work done on his tour bus."




Ryan's eyebrows raised, impressed that an artist with fame and status had sought out Sophie specifically. "Well, clearly, your talent precedes you if celebrities come calling for your expertise."




"I just try to provide quality work for whoever comes by the shop." But internally, she did feel a sense of pride that her dedicated grinding has earned her a respected reputation in the industry. Ryan could sense Sophie's humility about her skills, which she found even more attractive.




As the sweet melodies continued to play out, the mood in the car shifted, becoming more relaxed and intimate.

Sophie scoffed. "Wow, not only am I being held hostage, but I must also be your DJ against my will? Is this what our friendship is going to be? Do I get no say?"

 

"Girl, just pick a song," Ryan laughed.

 

Sophie mumbled under her breath, "So damn bossy," as she scrolled through the Spotify app integrated into the car. After some contemplation, she chose "Smoking in the Park" by Tone Smith.

 

Ryan bopped her head approvingly and increased the volume slightly as they cruised, following the curving highway lined with bright streetlights. "What you know about Tone?"

 

"Not much, honestly. He stopped by the shop about a week ago while touring through Gotham. Said he heard about my skills from folks around town and needed some work done on his tour bus."

 

Ryan's eyebrows raised, impressed that an artist with fame and status had sought out Sophie specifically. "Well, clearly, your talent precedes you if celebrities come calling for your expertise."

 

"I just try to provide quality work for whoever comes by the shop." But internally, she did feel a sense of pride that her dedicated grinding has earned her a respected reputation in the industry. Ryan could sense Sophie's humility about her skills, which she found even more attractive.

 

As the sweet melodies continued to play out, the mood in the car shifted, becoming more relaxed and intimate.

Back in the car, Sophie pulled back her injured hand from Ryan's smack. She wonders if the little one knew how strong she was. 

 

"No one turns off Mary J.," Ryan continued, sliding the music volume back up. "Her vibes are perfect for this long-ass drive."

 

"Fine, you win. I'll just sit here and be a passenger princess like you clearly want."

 

Ryan couldn't help but to absorb the lyrics. The words seemed to echo her own feelings for Sophie, resonating deep within her heart. Sophie, too, seemed to latch on to the song's verses. The joy they brought to each other made them feel like they were in their own little world of happiness.

 

"To be with you would be like paradise
Everything would be so nice, so right
The joy you bring to me makes me feel so
Good inside
It's so right, so high
Just thinkin' about you
And my feelings I just can't hide"

Excerpt:
The night continued with laughter, shared stories, and a few more drinks. With R&B music playing softly in the background, Ryan and Sophie moved closer as they sipped their drinks.

Soon the energy in the room would change as the soulful melody of "My First Love" by Avant and Keke Wyatt filled the room, Sophie couldn't resist the magnetic pull of the music. With an impromptu smile, Sophie allowed herself to be transported back to moments that resonated with the lyrics of the song.

Sophie's movements began with a gentle sway, her body moving to the rhythm of the music. Sophie closed her eyes briefly as Ryan watched her and was enchanting by her beauty. Sophie spinned around on the floor by herself before turning to Ryan extending her hand out to dance with her. The room seemed to hold its breath for a moment as their eyes met. Ryan eyed her curiously.

"You’re going to leave me hanging?" Sophie asked.

Ryan melted into a warm smile as she accepted Sophie's outstretched hand. Sophie pulled Ryan close as the electricity pulsed between them.

“This song reminds me of the first girl I fell in love with, Taylor Strickland.”

Ryan looked at Sophie. “What happened?”

“She wanted me to come out and I wasn’t ready until college. Then she found herself in college and wanted to explore her sexuality more. I understand now but eighteen year old Sophie wasn’t trying to hear that.”

Ryan chuckled. “I understand. Angelique Devereaux was mine. When I say everything toxic and wrong for one person packaged in a 5'5 stature it was all her.”

“Why did you stay with her when you knew she was not good for you?” Sophie asked as they continued to sway.

“You know how something is wrong for you but you still go for it because the rush excites you.”

Sophie nodded.

“That’s how it felt with her.”

“What about right now? What do you feel?” Sophie asked as she leaned in close to Ryan.

Their eyes locked, communicating a shared understanding that went beyond words. Sophie's hand gently cupped Ryan's cheek, her thumb tracing the outline of her face. Sophie gently pulled Ryan to her as their lips drew closer, the world outside faded away.

The kiss started slow as their lips brushed against each other as they explored each other's mouths. They didn’t know how long they were kissing as they pulled away, a shared breath lingering between them. The chemistry between Sophie and Ryan was strong that both were terrified of the emotions they were feeling. This was stronger than what either of them has felt for anyone.

As the song ended, Ryan and Sophie backed up slowly from each other to retreat to opposite corners. The kiss threw them both for a loop and they did not know how to react afterwards. What does this mean for them going forward? They kissed before without knowing each other but now that they know more about each other their feelings were stronger. Were they willing to take a risk that could eventually affect the lives of their daughters? Ryan and Sophie must have had the same thought as they took one look at each other and walked back to embrace once more as their lips connected again. Why try to fight something you can’t resist?

“You know how something is wrong for you but you still go for it because the rush excites you.”

Sophie nodded.

“That’s how it felt with her.”

“What about right now? What do you feel?” Sophie asked as she leaned in close to Ryan.

Excerpt:
Sophie watched Ryan making her way around the party. Today was Charlie’s thirteenth birthday and the party had been a complete success.  Ryan had been the perfect host, making sure all the guests had what they needed.  Sophie smiled at how good she looked. It seemed like she got more beautiful by the day. The glow from her pregnancy only enhanced it.  Keeping her eyes on the woman, Sophie waited until it was the right moment and grabbed her by the hand.

“What are you doing?” Ryan asked, as Sophie guided her to the other side of the dance floor.

“Stealing the gorgeous host for a dance.” 

Sophie led them to the far edge of the floor.  Ryan shook her head but placed her arms around Sophie’s shoulders and allowed the woman to begin moving them to a slow rhythm.

“This DJ doesn’t seem that fond of slow music so I’m taking advantage of the moment.  Didn’t you notice?  He’s playing our song.”

Ryan listened and smiled. The DJ was playing The Point of it All by Anthony Hamilton. They swayed together as Sophie sung the lyrics in her ear.

“Have I told you how beautiful you look this evening, Mrs. Wilder-Moore?” 

Ryan pretended to think.  “Once or twice maybe.”  

Sophie leaned down and pressed a soft kiss next to Ryan’s ear.  “You’re still the baddest chick in the place.”

Ryan shivered a little.  “Thank you, baby.”
HTMLExcerpt:
Sophie watched Ryan making her way around the party. Today was Charlie’s thirteenth birthday and the party had been a complete success.  Ryan had been the perfect host, making sure all the guests had what they needed.  Sophie smiled at how good she looked. It seemed like she got more beautiful by the day. The glow from her pregnancy only enhanced it.  Keeping her eyes on the woman, Sophie waited until it was the right moment and grabbed her by the hand.

“What are you doing?” Ryan asked, as Sophie guided her to the other side of the dance floor.

“Stealing the gorgeous host for a dance.” 

Sophie led them to the far edge of the floor.  Ryan shook her head but placed her arms around Sophie’s shoulders and allowed the woman to begin moving them to a slow rhythm.

“This DJ doesn’t seem that fond of slow music so I’m taking advantage of the moment.  Didn’t you notice?  He’s playing our song.”

Ryan listened and smiled. The DJ was playing The Point of it All by Anthony Hamilton. They swayed together as Sophie sung the lyrics in her ear.

“Have I told you how beautiful you look this evening, Mrs. Wilder-Moore?” 

Ryan pretended to think.  “Once or twice maybe.”  

Sophie leaned down and pressed a soft kiss next to Ryan’s ear.  “You’re still the baddest chick in the place.”

Ryan shivered a little.  “Thank you, baby.”
SongArtist: The Point Of It All by Anthony Hamilton

Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

Chapter Soundtrack:

1. Footsteps in the Dark
2. Rain on Me
3. I Got 5 On It
4. Quiet Storm

...

"My mind drifts now and then

Lookin' down dark corridors and wonders what might have been."




Sophie was lying on her couch, staring blankly at her laptop screen, losing track of how long she had been sitting motionless.




The crackle of a vinyl record playing in the background filled the room. It's one of the many records Ryan had borrowed (read: stole) from Jada's house during their visit the other week. Sophie had needed something—anything—that felt like a part of her girlfriend to be close to her right now. The night they first played this record was unforgettable.

...

The soft vinyl remained their soundtrack as they rocked into each other.




"Honey, now let's stop walkin' around

When there's love lost to be found

Oh, and you know I still care, I still care

What's the sense of goin' elsewhere?"




Looking into Ryan's eyes, Sophie pulled her closer, their bodies dissolving into each other as their hips found a slow but deep tempo. "I love you...damn...I love you so much." She watched her girlfriend's face, obsessed with being able to make her feel like this.
HTMLExcerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

Chapter Soundtrack:

1. Footsteps in the Dark
2. Rain on Me
3. I Got 5 On It
4. Quiet Storm

...

"My mind drifts now and then

Lookin' down dark corridors and wonders what might have been."

 

Sophie was lying on her couch, staring blankly at her laptop screen, losing track of how long she had been sitting motionless.

 

The crackle of a vinyl record playing in the background filled the room. It's one of the many records Ryan had borrowed (read: stole) from Jada's house during their visit the other week. Sophie had needed something—anything—that felt like a part of her girlfriend to be close to her right now. The night they first played this record was unforgettable.

...

The soft vinyl remained their soundtrack as they rocked into each other.

 

"Honey, now let's stop walkin' around

When there's love lost to be found

Oh, and you know I still care, I still care

What's the sense of goin' elsewhere?"

 

Looking into Ryan's eyes, Sophie pulled her closer, their bodies dissolving into each other as their hips found a slow but deep tempo. "I love you...damn...I love you so much." She watched her girlfriend's face, obsessed with being able to make her feel like this.

Story Title: (I love the way) you wear that dress

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

sooo it's day 12, and i'm here with my first ever Wildmoore fic <3

quick note: the day 12 prompt on the list I have been using was 'karma'. which ik people have raised concerns about the widespread misappropriation and casual use of, so I didn't want to potentially contribute to that by writing about its 'informal' meaning, and I don't feel I know enough about its proper meaning to do it justice!! hence why i'm using this list for today, since i said i might mix it up a little anyways :))

anyways! no content warnings for this fic afaik, it's pure fluff.

title is from 'Dress' by Charlotte Sands bc it was the first thing i thought of!

Song: Heaven Must Be Missing An Angel
Story: heaven must be missing an angel (…’cause you’re here with me right now)
Excerpt:
Story Title: heaven must be missing an angel (…’cause you’re here with me right now)

...

Writer's Beginning Notes:

🎧: Title lyrics from: Heaven Must Be Missing an Angel by Tavares

...

Ryan gets more excited about the idea than Sophie thought she would. They make it to the indoor roller rink, hit with a comforting combination of colorful lights, wood floors and carpet-like fabric lining the rink walls that only a place called ‘Skate King’ could get away with.

And maybe they are having a little too much fun. There’s a moment where Ryan reaches out to grab Sophie’s hand so she can tug her into the rink, and then they just don’t let go for a while. Not until they get a couple of giant soft pretzels from the concession stand.

As they’re eating, the song, Heaven Must Be Missing An Angel plays over the rink radio and then immediately after, the beginning guitar chords of Monica’s Angel of Mine start. Both women can barely contain their laughter at the heavenly coincidence.

They talk and laugh, and there is a spattering of cute innocent touches, and maybe something more that neither of them comment on. By the end Ryan is in a much better mood.

“Why can’t all my dates be this much fun?” She voices.

It sparks something akin to tenderness all through Sophie and she wants so badly to grab Ryan’s hand again. But she doesn’t. Because she shouldn’t.

Excerpt:
As their laughter died down, Diane pulled Sophie into her chest.  She held her close, just as she had as a child.  She rocked her gently and started singing a familiar melody.  Sophie immediately remembered and allowed the song to take her back to her childhood when everything was simple.

“Jesus loves me, oh yes, he does.  Jesus loves me, oh yes… he does… for the Bible tells me so.”

Sophie closed her eyes and allowed herself to relax into her mother’s protective embrace.  She felt like a little girl again.  She let go of all her worries, if only for a few moments.

“Everything is going to be fine, Sophia.  You’re doing everything right.  I know I haven’t said it, but I’m… I’m so very proud of the wife and mother you are.  I know I’m still learning, but I know who I raised you to be, and you have exceeded my expectations.”

Sophie hugged her mother tighter as more tears came.  

“Your father would be so proud of you, just as I am.”

As their laughter died down, Diane pulled Sophie into her chest.  She held her close, just as she had as a child.  She rocked her gently and started singing a familiar melody.  Sophie immediately remembered and allowed the song to take her back to her childhood when everything was simple.

“Jesus loves me, oh yes, he does.  Jesus loves me, oh yes… he does… for the Bible tells me so.”

Sophie closed her eyes and allowed herself to relax into her mother’s protective embrace.  She felt like a little girl again.  She let go of all her worries, if only for a few moments.

“Everything is going to be fine, Sophia.  You’re doing everything right.  I know I haven’t said it, but I’m… I’m so very proud of the wife and mother you are.  I know I’m still learning, but I know who I raised you to be, and you have exceeded my expectations.”

Sophie hugged her mother tighter as more tears came.  

“Your father would be so proud of you, just as I am.”

Excerpt:
He licked his dry lips, eyes darting towards the producer's booth as if seeking an escape. Sophie leaned forward, delivering what felt like the final blow. "Regarding transparency, let's talk about the sizable donations from the Police Union. How can voters be assured these won't sway your policy decisions?" 




"I... look, Sophie, the intricacies of campaign financing are... complex," Mitchell stumbled, his discomfort unmistakable. 




With a nod, Sophie concluded the segment. "Thank you, Mr. Mitchell, for trying to shed light on these issues. We'll pause for a music break and then hear from our listeners. Stay with us. This is Sophie Moore, and you're listening to The Moore You Know."




As the bassline of "This is America" filled the studio, Mitchell huffed out of his seat, face reddened. 




"I'm firing whoever the hell set this sham up!" he snarled at his sweating assistant. They rushed clumsily out of the room.




Sophie grinned, leaning back casually as Luke sidled next to her booth, barely containing his laughter. 




"Damn Soph, I didn't know you were bringing the heat like that!" He checked the monitor as Gambino’s chorus played. "Still two minutes before we're live again."

He licked his dry lips, eyes darting towards the producer's booth as if seeking an escape. Sophie leaned forward, delivering what felt like the final blow. "Regarding transparency, let's talk about the sizable donations from the Police Union. How can voters be assured these won't sway your policy decisions?" 

 

"I... look, Sophie, the intricacies of campaign financing are... complex," Mitchell stumbled, his discomfort unmistakable. 

 

With a nod, Sophie concluded the segment. "Thank you, Mr. Mitchell, for trying to shed light on these issues. We'll pause for a music break and then hear from our listeners. Stay with us. This is Sophie Moore, and you're listening to The Moore You Know."

 

As the bassline of "This is America" filled the studio, Mitchell huffed out of his seat, face reddened. 

 

"I'm firing whoever the hell set this sham up!" he snarled at his sweating assistant. They rushed clumsily out of the room.

 

Sophie grinned, leaning back casually as Luke sidled next to her booth, barely containing his laughter. 

 

"Damn Soph, I didn't know you were bringing the heat like that!" He checked the monitor as Gambino’s chorus played. "Still two minutes before we're live again."

Excerpt:
"Shoot, I gotta go. Apparently, these kids think Christopher Columbus discovered America, so I have to go reset their brains," Jordan joked, eyeing the clock.




"I was taught the only Christopher we acknowledge is Wallace."




Jordan snorted and pointed a playful finger at her. "Okay, Jay-Z."




They shared a laugh before Jordan had to dash to her next class. After the door swung shut, Ryan sank back into her chair with a smile. Though they only really talked at school, she always liked Jordan's vibes.
HTMLExcerpt:
"Shoot, I gotta go. Apparently, these kids think Christopher Columbus discovered America, so I have to go reset their brains," Jordan joked, eyeing the clock.

 

"I was taught the only Christopher we acknowledge is Wallace."

 

Jordan snorted and pointed a playful finger at her. "Okay, Jay-Z."

 

They shared a laugh before Jordan had to dash to her next class. After the door swung shut, Ryan sank back into her chair with a smile. Though they only really talked at school, she always liked Jordan's vibes.

Song: Saving All My Love for You
Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

🎵 Tune into 98.7FM Radio Station Here. New music will be added with every new chapter. 🎵

...

Luke’s fingers froze mid-typing. “Uhhh...lemme check TikTok real quick. You know that's my new Google.” He scanned several videos and then glanced back, unsure if he really wanted to share. “I’m pretty sure it means you have charisma.”




“Then why not just say that?”




“Maybe she was low-key flirting. Especially after you played that Whitney Houston song.” Luke chuckled with a shrug. 




“Yeah, well, I’ll take the compliment, I guess. Even if her word choice was...odd.” Sophie dismissed the implication with an eye roll. 




They clacked away in sync, the room atmosphere casual yet focused. After a few moments, Luke peeked sideways, “But hey...can’t blame her for shooting her shot if she was.”




Sophie halted mid-sentence, casting him a confused look. “Can’t blame who for what now?”




Luke chuckled, turning his eyes back to his laptop. “Nothing."

Song: Inner City Blues (Make Me Wanna Holler)
Excerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

🎵 Tune into 98.7FM Radio Station Here. New music will be added with every new chapter. 🎵

...

Nearby, a small yet inviting balcony offered breathing space with its hanging plants and seating arrangement, promised solace with every sunrise




After a quick shower, she slipped on a silk robe, cueing up a Marvin Gaye vinyl. She sank into her leather couch, gazing out floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the skyscrapers. 




Eyelids growing heavy, she drained her glass and leaned back, thoughts drifting to later in the week. Just as visions of a certain activist began invading her mind, shrilling sirens shattered the calm. 




"Jesus!" Sophie gasped, heart pounding as red and blue flashes streaked across her windows. Shaken, she turned off the music, closed the windows, and stumbled off to bed, burrowing under cool sheets.

Excerpt:
“It’s okay. That’s the point of The Pleasure Zone: you shouldn’t be afraid of what you desire.”

Sophie agreed.

“Are you ready for the next room?” Ryan asked as she held her hand out for Sophie to take.

They walked down the hall to a room with a red door. Ryan turned the knob and when the door opened Sophie heard music playing.

“I know you love fuckin’ me,
I can tell by the way you in love with me,
You can’t get enough of me, yeah,
Well, I guess it’s lookin’ like you stuck with me,
‘Cause I got you sprung off in the spring time,
Fuck all your free time,
You don’t need no me time,
That’s you and me time”
HTMLExcerpt:
“It’s okay. That’s the point of The Pleasure Zone: you shouldn’t be afraid of what you desire.”

Sophie agreed.

“Are you ready for the next room?” Ryan asked as she held her hand out for Sophie to take.

They walked down the hall to a room with a red door. Ryan turned the knob and when the door opened Sophie heard music playing.

“I know you love fuckin’ me,
I can tell by the way you in love with me,
You can’t get enough of me, yeah,
Well, I guess it’s lookin’ like you stuck with me,
‘Cause I got you sprung off in the spring time,
Fuck all your free time,
You don’t need no me time,
That’s you and me time”

Excerpt:
"Are you ready to talk to the city tonight?"




"Absolutely," Ryan adjusted her headphones. She thought internally they were a bit too small for her hairstyle.




"Before we learn about Ryan, I want to kick us off with some tunes," Sophie told the audience. "What are you in the mood to listen to today, Ryan? As our guest, you get to pick the song."




Ryan paused, mildly surprised by being put on the spot. She thought for a second before suggesting, "How about a little Earth, Wind and Fire, 'Can't Hide Love' is one of my favorite songs."




"You got it," Sophie eyed her music producer, who nodded as he queued up the track. "Gotham, don't you change the station - we'll be back in about 4 minutes with Ryan Wilder."




They went off the air, and Sophie turned to Ryan, "Okay, we're easing into it. You feeling okay?" she asked, checking in on her guest.




Ryan nodded, exhaling slowly. "Yeah, I'm good. Nice start."




Luke gave them the cue to put their headphones back on as the time ticked by quickly. Sophie offered Ryan one last encouraging smile before welcoming Gotham City listeners back to what was sure to be a lively show.

"Absolutely," Ryan adjusted her headphones. She thought internally they were a bit too small for her hairstyle.

 

"Before we learn about Ryan, I want to kick us off with some tunes," Sophie told the audience. "What are you in the mood to listen to today, Ryan? As our guest, you get to pick the song."

Writer's Beginning Notes:

🎵 Tune into 98.7FM Radio Station Here. New songs were added starting at Track 20. 🎵

...

"Alright, ladies, let everyone take a breather," he said calmly over their headphones. 




"How about we pause here and dive into some music for a bit? I got the new track by Destin Conrad that you all have been requesting every day. Stay tuned, and we'll be back."




Ryan crossed her arms, still simmering from the discussion. She knew Sophie made some fair points, but the aloofness with which she discussed policies that impacted real lives grated on her nerves. Glancing over at Sophie, she caught the host leaning back in her chair, eyes closed as she took some deep breaths of her own. She felt guilty seeing the stress on her face.




"Hey…I know we disagree, but I shouldn't have gotten so worked up like that. My bad."




Sophie opened her eyes, regarding the younger woman mindfully. "I may have been a bit dismissive as well," she admitted. "Perhaps we can find a middle ground."




"I'd like that."

Excerpt:
Sophie and Ryan greeted their listeners to start the show as usual. "I have this song. I want to jump in first with you, Soph, and the audience. I heard it the other day, and it had me thinking."




"Uh oh."




Ryan snickered, "No, for real, let's take a listen with Gotham, and we'll come back to discuss it." The engineer cued up the song, and the opening notes of "Next Lifetime" by Erykah Badu began to play.




"Uhhh, Ryan? Didn't this song come out over twenty-five years ago?"




"Yes, Sophie…just listen, and we'll be right back," Ryan said into the mic.




They went off the air as everyone in the studio listened to the track.




"Your energy feels so damn good to me

It picks me up don't wanna come down

You got me spinning all around (oh), yeah

You need to know I've got somebody

But, you're beautiful, shh

But still, it ain't that type of party now"




Ryan's mind zeroed into the woman sitting next to her. Lately, thoughts of her co-host crept in unprompted. Though they often butted heads, she's felt her heart do somersaults sometimes when Sophie was near.




Every time their eyes met, Ryan's pulse felt like it was going to shoot out of her skin. She noticed new details - the way she nibbled her pen when lost in thought or how she twitched her lip when she was feeling vulnerable. Ryan found it impossible to ignore the growing presence between them.




Yet she stalled to confront the meanings behind it all and decided instead to keep her cards close, though she wanted to play the song in an attempt to make sense of her muddled feelings.




Sophie noticed Ryan's pensive expression as they returned on-air. "So, what made you choose that particular song for our listeners tonight?" she asked.




"Well, I wanted to spark a discussion about relationships. That song makes me think about connections that feel...inexplicable. Like maybe some people are just meant to be together, destined by the universe." She turned to Sophie. "What do you think? Do you believe in soulmates, or do you think you have to be 100% compatible with your partner?"

Excerpt:
Before getting started, Ryan grabbed her phone and turned on her ‘old skool’ playlist. A soft medley began playing as they each remained at their separate areas of the kitchen, both retreating into their heads. 

Smooth R&B was their background noise as they silently worked together, yet separately. Soft saxophone played as the Queen of Soul crooned.

Ain't no way for me to love you

If you won't let me

It ain't no way for me to give you all ya need

If you won't let me give all of me

The song was so fitting to their situation, Sophie actually stopped chopping as she listened to Aretha sing everything she was feeling.

Oh, but how can I, how can I, how can I

Give you all the things I can

If you're tying both of my hands?

Just the night before, Ryan had told Sophie that she was enough, but Sophie didn't know if she could trust her words when her actions stated differently. It seemed that every time they made headway in making their way back to one other, another obstacle appeared, knocking them off course. It hurt and Sophie didn't know how long she could continue on the roller coaster before needing to get off, permanently. 

And if you need me to love you

Say, say yeah you do

Oh then please, please, please

Don't you know that I need you?

Sophie had gone through the single most damaging experience of her life and she needed Ryan, but Ryan wasn't there, and she hadn't been there. Sophie felt so alone and all she wanted was her girlfriend’s support, but her girlfriend couldn't do that because of everything Sophie represented. And yes, Ryan had come to the Valley to see her, but was it too little too late? Were they too far gone to get what they had back? 

It ain't no way for me to love you

If you won't let me

All Sophie wanted to do was love Ryan. She'd wanted to believe that love was enough to guide them through the hard times, but if anything, this latest fiasco had shown her that love wasn't enough. 

“Soph?” 

Sophie looked up and over at Ryan as the song faded out. 

“Are you okay?” 

Sophie shook her head and was surprised when a tear fell down her cheek. She turned away from Ryan and quickly wiped it away. 

“Wait, Sophie…don't hide from me. Please.”

Excerpt:
Ryan watched the performers on stage with amusement and secondhand embarrassment. Some were genuinely talented, others, well, they were certainly enthusiastic, even if their pitch was a bit off. She popped a fried pickle into her mouth as she thought to herself, 'There's no way in hell I'd ever be caught dead doing this.'

That thought lasted .8 seconds when suddenly, Anissa grabbed Ryan's hand, pulling her up from her seat. "Come on, let's show 'em how it's done!" she shouted, dragging Ryan towards the stage.

"What? No!"

"Come on - let's just have some fun, I put our names down earlier."

Ryan's heart sank as she reluctantly followed, her feet heavy with each step. As they reached the stage, the opening notes of "Knockin' Da Boots" came through the speakers, "This!!?" Of all the songs Anissa could have picked, she chose this one?

Anissa grabbed the microphone and began belting out the provocative lyrics while Ryan stood awkwardly beside her, trying to blend into the background. But the other woman wasn't having it. She kept making eye contact, her gaze suggestive as she gyrated her hips in Ryan's direction.

Good lovin', body rockin' all night long, yeah

Makin' love until we tire to the break of dawn

But oh, come on, come on and turn the lights down,

and let me get on it, yeah'

Cause when I do, just me and you, it'll be so right

Ryan squirmed and glanced out at the audience, hoping for a sympathetic face. Instead, she was met with a sea of shocked expressions, mouths were wide open as they watched Anissa's performance. Yet, despite their surprise, they clapped along to the beat, some even whistling and cheering. Traitors.

Excerpt:
Her eyes then darted to the edge of the stage, calculating her escape. She took a step towards the stairs, ready to make a break for it. But just as she thought she was free, the music started up again with a new song. Anissa pulled her back, "We're doing two songs tonight."

"Two?!" The people in the front of the stage broke out in laughter at her reaction, their amusement only adding to her growing irritation.

"Yeah, but I'll sing this one for you. Just stand right there."

As the lyrics poured from Anissa's lips, Ryan felt like the song was a not-so-subtle message directed straight at her. The words spoke of desire, longing, and a yearning for something more—a sentiment that made her skin itch. It was clear that Anissa was trying to communicate her intentions, and Ryan wasn't sure how to respond to them.

Then I kissed your lips and you tuned on my fire, baby

And you burned me up within your flame

Took me a little higher

Made me live again, you turned on my fire, baby

Then you showed me what a love could do

Fire and desire, baby

Glancing out at the audience, Ryan's heart sank as she noticed the amount of camera phones pointed in their direction and she was pretty sure that several people were live-streaming the performance on Instagram. She frowned, realizing that this moment would be immortalized on social media, potentially reaching a far wider audience than she had anticipated.

The idea of her personal life being plastered all over the internet made her feel sick. She had always been careful to keep her private life separate from her public persona, but now it seemed that the two were colliding in the most uncomfortable way possible.

When the final notes of the song faded away, Ryan braced herself for the inevitable applause and the looks from the audience. She knew that this moment would be the talk of the town, and she dreaded the thought of facing the fallout. But for now, all she could do was put on a smile and hope that the night wouldn't get any worse.

Excerpt:
It was quiet at first as they continued to eat their meals. Then, the restaurant's music shifted to a song by Silk Sonic.

"I love this song," Ryan said small smile, her head bobbing to the rhythm.

"Girl, me too!" Iris was unable to resist mouthing along to the lyrics as the vocals kicked in.

They found themselves subtly singing the words, glancing up at each other with grins as they realized they were in sync. A shared chuckle broke the brief lyrical moment.

"Actually, I'm going to see them live. Silk Sonic is coming here on the 31st."

"Oh, are they? That's so dope!"

Excerpt:
Before she could say anything, the DJ took the stage to introduce Destin. As the album began to play, the crowd started making their way to the dance floor.

Luke leaned over as the first track played, "This is a dope song. You should play it next Thursday to see what Ryan thinks."

From the eye, we're not similar,

We make love anyway

Mesh well like colorway

Mm, when I'm down

Love me anyway

We take well to each other, like colorway

Listening to the lyrics, she was in thought, contemplating the unusual bond she now shared with Ryan—their differences and how they meshed—like a colorway.

Quickly, she pushed the thought aside, focusing instead on the music and the crowd's energy. She was here to work, to evaluate Destin's album for potential airplay. Anything else was a distraction, one she couldn't afford to entertain.

The night went on, she was deep in conversations with other industry professionals about Destin's new sound and its potential impact on the music scene. This was her playground, her passion for her work was evident in every word.

Excerpt:
Chapter Title: Blackbird

...

“Why you wanna fly Blackbird, you ain’t ever gonna fly…”

Ryan Wilder sang quietly, shifting on the bench she was secured to in order to adjust the soft head in front of her. 

“…Why you wanna fly Blackbird…”

The song was theirs alone, one once chorused loudly in the humble apartment they called home in the inner-city Gotham neighbourhood of Brightcave Gardens.  

“… You ain’t ever gonna flyyy …”

Ryan thought of how at first, she resisted moving away from the war zone of the Wayside Heights projects she’d grown up in; and how she hated the little first-floor apartment, along with the woman who rented it. The home was too colourful, too clean, too calm; and the woman; too patient, too warm, too giving – everything Ryan hadn’t known she needed.

“… No place big enough for holding…”

Now, what she wouldn’t do to see the bright yellow walls and eccentric mismatched furniture and her adoptive mother singing badly as she cleaned all four rooms like a great palace. It hadn’t been much, nor had it been for long – just four short years – but Mama Cora made it a home for them to belong, and for a moment, Ryan had been still.

“…all the tears you're gonna cry...” 

Biting her lip, she quietened, expecting Cora to continue like she always did. However, no off-key notes came, only the reverberating siren of the ambulance they were in.

The only indication she was still alive was the tickling of jagged breaths over Ryan’s bare skin, and for that, she carried on.  

“…Cause your mama’s name was ‘Lonely’ –”

Yet, as she sang Cora’s part, something like a sob distorted the tune, and the woman that had become her mother in every sense of the word looked up with heartbreak etched across her swollen face.

The expression of worry was clearly for her and not Cora herself, and it reinforced every prior action that proved her love transcended the ties of blood. Ryan wanted to weep for it but sang instead.

“… And your daddy’s name was ‘Pain’…”

Wiping at the blood which intermittently dribbled out the corners of her normally smiling mouth; Ryan grew concerned that, like always, she was going to lose this beautiful thing because fairytale endings didn’t belong to orphans like her. Bellowing louder, she tried to quell such truths.

“…And they called you little sorrow ‘cause you'll never love again…”

Since they’d been jumped, the older woman had barely been able to follow conversation, panicking for the paralysis of her broken bones, and it was only when Ryan sang, did she calm into the half-way lucid state before her.

Despite the blaring siren and hectic speed of the ambulance, in the patient compartment, the atmosphere was tranquil, and a sinking feeling settled in the pit of her stomach. She wondered if the stillness she clung to for protection was the calm before the storm. 

It bewildered her to see her larger-than-life mother so small and fragile – words she’d never before associated with the boisterous nursing assistant.

“…So, why you wanna fly Blackbird –”

Seconds, minutes and hours seemed to have blurred into each other, and with Ryan’s head still ringing from the kicks she’d taken to the face, she wasn’t sure of how long it had been since she crawled to Cora’s bleeding side and pressed crimson fingers to 9-1-1.

Excerpt:
The apartment smelled fabulous when I got back home and Adele was crooning soulfully through the surround sound speakers about chasing pavements. I looked across the open floor plan into the kitchen and saw Anissa swaying to the music while stirring something on the range. There was an open bottle of wine on the counter and two goblets, one of which was half-filled with red wine.


“Hey,” I called out as I got closer. “Whatcha cooking? And do I have time for a shower first?”


She poured wine into the other goblet and slid it across the breakfast bar to me, her movements practiced and elegant.

“I’m over that game!” I laughed and warmth spread through me to hear him laughing, too. “I’ll call you in a few days. Be good.”

“That’s my line.”

We hung up. Sitting in silence, I savored the fleeting sense that everything was in harmony in my world, though I knew such moments never endured. I brooded on that for a minute, until Anissa blasted Alien Superstar on her bedroom stereo and that kicked my butt into gear. I hurried to my room to get ready for a night with Sophie.

Excerpt:
“Fine. Six months ago, we took a break to get some distance and see if the relationship was worth fighting for, you know? Then time kept going and neither of us really missed the relationship that much. Forty—” she cut herself off at Ryan’s pointed look. “I mean about six, maybe seven weeks ago, Kate called it off for real.”

Ryan stared at her as she waited for the shoe to drop. “You know I’m aware of this information, right? You’ve literally talked to me about it before, except those times didn’t lead to fake dating, which, by the way, is the most important part yet somehow still the only part without an explanation.”

She still vividly remembered herself and Sophie singing “Burn” by Usher that night. Repeatedly until Alice came home, took one look at them, said “no” and made them shut up and get drunk instead before promptly locking herself in her room to study. It was a pretty fun night.

You’ve literally talked to me about it before, except those times didn’t lead to fake dating, which, by the way, is the most important part yet somehow still the only part without an explanation.”

She still vividly remembered herself and Sophie singing “Burn” by Usher that night. Repeatedly until Alice came home, took one look at them, said “no” and made them shut up and get drunk instead before promptly locking herself in her room to study. It was a pretty fun night.

Excerpt:
Sophie instantly smiled at the view in front of her. Ryan was dancing and singing to “Naughty Girl” by Beyoncé while she was cooking. Her voice was surprisingly not bad and her dancing was kinda hot. Sophie walked over to Ryan, wrapped her arms around Ryan and gave her a kiss on the neck. Ryan jumped but soon melted into the embrace.




“Good morning beautiful”




“Good morning naughty girl” Sophie smirked into her neck. “This smells great, I’m shocked it’s real food.”




“Ha ha,” Ryan faked a laugh, she turned the stove off and turned into Sophie’s arm. “I do have real food , Mary loves bacon, my sisters love dairy, and Marquis eats very unhealthily.”




“Well, thank them for me” Sophie says as she kisses Ryan and then pulls back. “Also, thank you for these clothes.”

“Good morning beautiful”

 

“Good morning naughty girl” Sophie smirked into her neck. “This smells great, I’m shocked it’s real food.”

 

“Ha ha,” Ryan faked a laugh, she turned the stove off and turned into Sophie’s arm. “I do have real food , Mary loves bacon, my sisters love dairy, and Marquis eats very unhealthily.”

 

“Well, thank them for me” Sophie says as she kisses Ryan and then pulls back. “Also, thank you for these clothes.”

Her gaze burned into me. “Ryan, you have no idea.”

Nearly giddy with anticipation and a lovely surge of power, I got on my treadmill and started at a brisk walk. Sometimes I wished just running fast could get me away from whatever was troubling me.

Ryan thought for a moment.  “Michael or Prince?”

“Oh, come on!  You can’t ask that?  That’s like out of bounds.”

Ryan just gave her a patient look.  Sophie huffed.  “Michael.”

Ryan nodded her head as if she agreed.  

“My turn.  Tupac or Biggie?”

“Pac all day.” Ryan said easily.

“You like Hip-Hop huh?”

“Used to drive my parents crazy.” Ryan laughed.  “Best Dis record?”

“ No Vaseline .  You?”

“Good one, but it's Hit Em Up for me.”

“Nice.”

Song: I've Got You Under My Skin
Excerpt:
The live band began playing “I’ve Got You Under My Skin” and Anissa appeared beside me as if by magic.

“Time to make me look good, Ginger.”

“I’ll try my best, Fred.” I smiled at Jordan. “Excuse me a minute.”

“Three minutes, forty seconds,” she corrected, displaying some of her family’s expertise in music.

Anissa led me onto the empty dance floor and pulled me into a swift foxtrot. It took me a minute to get into it, because I’d been stiff and tight with misery for days. Then the synergy of longtime partners kicked in and we glided across the floor with sweeping steps.

When the singer’s voice faded with the music, we stopped, breathless. We were pleasantly surprised by applause. Anissa gave an elegant bow and I held on to her hand for stability as I dipped into a curtsy.

When I lifted my head and straightened, I found Sophie standing in front of me. Startled, I stumbled back a step. She was seriously underdressed in jeans and an untucked white dress shirt that was open at the collar and rolled up at the sleeves, but she was so damn fine she still put every other woman in attendance to shame.
HTMLExcerpt:
The live band began playing “I’ve Got You Under My Skin” and Anissa appeared beside me as if by magic.

“Time to make me look good, Ginger.”

“I’ll try my best, Fred.” I smiled at Jordan. “Excuse me a minute.”

“Three minutes, forty seconds,” she corrected, displaying some of her family’s expertise in music.

Anissa led me onto the empty dance floor and pulled me into a swift foxtrot. It took me a minute to get into it, because I’d been stiff and tight with misery for days. Then the synergy of longtime partners kicked in and we glided across the floor with sweeping steps.

When the singer’s voice faded with the music, we stopped, breathless. We were pleasantly surprised by applause. Anissa gave an elegant bow and I held on to her hand for stability as I dipped into a curtsy.

When I lifted my head and straightened, I found Sophie standing in front of me. Startled, I stumbled back a step. She was seriously underdressed in jeans and an untucked white dress shirt that was open at the collar and rolled up at the sleeves, but she was so damn fine she still put every other woman in attendance to shame.
SongArtist: I've Got You Under My Skin by Frank Sinatra

Excerpt:
She grabbed her essentials before making her way to the bathroom. Half an hour later, Ryan stepped out of the shower freshly cleansed and feeling good. She smirked to herself in the mirror as she dried off before leaving the bathroom to go back to her room. She knew exactly how thin the walls were, and she hoped Kate enjoyed her concert, starting with Nunya by Kehlani featuring Dom Kennedy but without the Dom. Right after, she sang No One by Alicia Keys. She knew that combo had to get under Kate’s skin. She wondered how Kate felt about her rendition of My Girl by The Temptations as well as her bar for bar reciting of Shortie Like Mine by Bow Wow (the only song she didn’t skip parts of). Did that kind of song get under her skin more than the shots? Ryan sincerely hoped so because she couldn’t think of a lot of songs to throw shade so her concert included mostly whatever lovesick song came to mind first back to back, but she also threw in a hidden gem, a song called Late Night Drive by Yo Trane.

Ryan snickered quietly to herself at the memory of that reaction. She heard the front door loudly slam during the final chorus, and it took everything in her not to cackle during the rest of the song. She simply continued singing then moved on to the next and final love song until she was done. It would have been suspicious if she had stopped singing after Kate left, and she didn’t want Mary to be irritated at her pettiness.

Then again, Mary knew that Ryan didn’t normally sing love songs in the shower, so she was probably already on to her.

Excerpt:
“Sounds reasonable. What happens when we get to five months though?” She emphasized the when, confident enough in their friendship to make it work.

“Uh, we break up I guess. Not in an explosive way though,” she quickly added, seeing the worrying excitement in Ryan’s eyes. “I don’t want our friend group to be fractured because of my terrible relationship… again.”

“First of all, fake or not, our relationship will not be terrible. I will be the best you ever had—“

“—Okay, John Legend—“

Artist: Fugees, Ms. Lauryn Hill, Wyclef Jean
HTMLExcerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

I curated a dope playlist for each chapter, designed to elevate your reading experience. The tracks will have you feeling the story on a whole other level, making the journey of this adventure even more raw and unforgettable. Take a listen on Spotify as you read.

 

...

In her basement, aka her haven, a place to get lost in the soothing flow of programming and escape the outside world's troubles, Ryan was lost in her element. Earbuds played the Fugees to keep her focused, and an energy drink sat dangerously close to her keyboard.

 

On her four monitor screens, she was remotely hacking into a corporate server—just some light illegal work to blow off steam before her big mission. Old habits die hard.

 

Her phone buzzed, pulling her attention away.

 

It was a text from her ex: "Drinks tonight? For old times' sake? I'm in town for a few days."
SongArtist: Ready or Not by Fugees, Ms. Lauryn Hill, Wyclef Jean

Writer's Beginning Notes:

...

The heavy bag shook under Sophie's unrelenting strike, each powerful kick and punch fueled by the frustrations boiling beneath her skin. Sweat glistened on lean arms, and damp spots began to form on her sports bra.

 

At this late hour, the gym in her apartment building was empty, save for her and the Bluetooth headphones in her ear, which were bumping Jay-Z. The beats of her music were in sync with the thud of her strikes, and her breathy exhale. It was a routine scene, Sophie working out her stress in solitude.

Artist: Kizomba da Boa, Soarito, Mark Exodus
HTMLExcerpt:
Writer's Beginning Notes:

I curated a dope playlist for each chapter, designed to elevate your reading experience. The tracks will have you feeling the story on a whole other level, making the journey of this adventure even more raw and unforgettable. Take a listen on Spotify as you read.

 

...

Drawn by an invisible force, she began to move towards her. The woman turned, and their eyes locked in a strong stare. Their bodies naturally moved in sync as if they had been dancing together for years when the sexy song 'Denovo' came on. Up close, she was even more stunning with her hair makeup, perfectly done hair, and her eyes blazing with a fire that made Sophie's breath catch in her throat and goosebumps race up her arms.

 

She leaned in, her lips barely grazing the shell of the other's ear. "You're a hard woman to find," she whispered, her voice merely audible over the music.

 

"Maybe I didn’t want to be found," the woman said with a teasing smile as she snaked her arms around Sophie's neck, erasing the distance between them.

 

Sophie's hands found her waist, fingers splaying over the curves and brown skin. The rhythmic swing of her hips and the brush of her thighs—all of it a heady mix of attraction and danger—made her head spin, clouding her judgment with every beat of the sensual bachata song.

 

They moved as one, spinning and twirling, their bodies molding together like two halves of a whole. The sexy woman rolled her ass against Sophie's, trailing her fingers down her arms.

 

Sophie responded in kind, her hands roaming, mapping the outline of her back, dipping dangerously low. She spun her out, only to tug her back in, their faces just inches apart. Ryan's breath ghosted over her lips, a temptation begging to be tasted.
SongArtist: Denovo by Kizomba da Boa, Soarito, Mark Exodus
SASW:
Denovo by Kizomba da Boa, Soarito, Mark Exodus
Mrs. & Mrs. Wilder by AdultishGambino

Excerpt:
“Drink your champagne,” she said. “And let’s dance.”

The wine was still bubbling nicely through my system when we moved onto the dance floor to the sound of Billie Holliday singing “Summertime.”

“So,” she began, “are you working?”

As we danced, I told her about my job and I asked what she was up to. I wasn’t surprised to hear she was working for Franklin’s investment firm and doing well.

“I’d love to come uptown and take you out to lunch sometime,” she said.

“That would be great.” I stepped back as the music ended and bumped into someone behind me. Hands went to my waist to steady me and I looked over my shoulder to find Sophie at my back.
HTMLExcerpt:
“Drink your champagne,” she said. “And let’s dance.”

The wine was still bubbling nicely through my system when we moved onto the dance floor to the sound of Billie Holliday singing “Summertime.”

“So,” she began, “are you working?”

As we danced, I told her about my job and I asked what she was up to. I wasn’t surprised to hear she was working for Franklin’s investment firm and doing well.

“I’d love to come uptown and take you out to lunch sometime,” she said.

“That would be great.” I stepped back as the music ended and bumped into someone behind me. Hands went to my waist to steady me and I looked over my shoulder to find Sophie at my back.
SongArtist: Summertime by Billie Holiday
SASW:
Summertime by Billie Holiday
Tethered To You by RyanAndSophieLoveChild

Excerpt:
Freddie was hailed by someone she knew and she leaned forward to kiss my cheek. “I’ll call you about lunch. Next week maybe?”

“Great.” I was highly conscious of Sophie vibrating with energy beside me, although when I glanced at her, her face was calm and impassive.

She pulled me into a dance, with Louis Armstrong singing “What a Wonderful World.” “Not sure I like her,” she muttered.

“Freddie’s cool.”

“Just so long as she knows you’re mine.” She pressed her cheek to my temple and placed her hand within the cutout back of my dress, skin to skin. There was no way to doubt that I belonged to her when she was holding me like that.

I relished the opportunity to be so close to her scrumptious body in public. Breathing her in, I relaxed into her expert hold. “I like this.”

Nuzzling against me, she murmured, “That’s the idea.”

Bliss. It lasted as long as the dance did.
HTMLExcerpt:
Freddie was hailed by someone she knew and she leaned forward to kiss my cheek. “I’ll call you about lunch. Next week maybe?”

“Great.” I was highly conscious of Sophie vibrating with energy beside me, although when I glanced at her, her face was calm and impassive.

She pulled me into a dance, with Louis Armstrong singing “What a Wonderful World.” “Not sure I like her,” she muttered.

“Freddie’s cool.”

“Just so long as she knows you’re mine.” She pressed her cheek to my temple and placed her hand within the cutout back of my dress, skin to skin. There was no way to doubt that I belonged to her when she was holding me like that.

I relished the opportunity to be so close to her scrumptious body in public. Breathing her in, I relaxed into her expert hold. “I like this.”

Nuzzling against me, she murmured, “That’s the idea.”

Bliss. It lasted as long as the dance did.
SongArtist: What A Wonderful World by Louis Armstrong
SASW:
What A Wonderful World by Louis Armstrong
Tethered To You by RyanAndSophieLoveChild

"Newlyweds!" Alice clapped her hands together and saw their matching wedding bands. "Oh, how delightful! I do love a good romance." She then turned to Ryan, scanning her from head to toe. "And you, my dear...what's your secret to getting the tall one here to, as the 2008 pop culture phenomenon that changed the world says, 'put a ring on it?'"

 

 "Oh, you know…" Ryan forced an uncomfortable laugh, "It's my natural charm and good looks."

Excerpt:
This time, Sophie wouldn’t dare break their contact now that she’d gotten it back. There was just so much safety here. She wondered vaguely how long they could really stay like this in Ryan’s office, rubbing the back of Ryan’s hand, their bodies so close together. 




But of course it’s ruined. Nothing good lasts forever. 




Sophie’s phone rings in her pocket, a call from Jordan, confirmed by her chosen ringtone of BedRock by Young Money, one of their favorite songs growing up, one they bonded over listening to when their mother wasn’t around, who often swore off ‘inappropriate music’ in the Moore household. 




The chorus rings out, kind of shocking them at first. Sophie looks at Ryan as if to say sorry for ending their moment in favor of reaching for her phone, but Ryan only giggles when she recognizes the song as it moves into the first words of Nicki’s verse. The laughter is quick and soft, but Sophie has to concentrate on answering the phone, trying to push away the butterflies in her stomach the sound forces out.

The laughter is quick and soft, but Sophie has to concentrate on answering the phone, trying to push away the butterflies in her stomach the sound forces out.

authenticity guaranteed by CyborgSamurai

HTMLExcerpt:
...

Instantly, a familiar beat came through the radio speakers. Sophie's head bobbed ever so slightly, lips mouthing the lyrics.

 

"Hov, huh? Still trips me out that you listen to this," Ryan ribbed playfully.

 

"Oh yeah? Why's that?"

 

"I dunno... I pegged you for more of a classical, baroque kind of girl."

 

"Ugh, no way. I need beats that get me hyped, not put me to sleep."

 

Ryan's mind wandered briefly, thinking of other scenarios where she could put Sophie to sleep. Shaking her head to chase away the inappropriate thoughts, she cleared her throat. "Alright, alright. So, what's your favorite Jay-Z track then?"

 

"Too many to name." Sophie blew out a breath. "Definitely this joint right here. Then maybe 'U Don't Know'… 'Imaginary Player'…Oh, and 'What more can I say,' no doubt. It got me through some rough times back in the day."

 

"Yeah? How's that?"

 

"When I first enlisted, I felt so alone, like I was drowning in a sea of testosterone and ego. But that song... it was like Jay was speaking right to me, telling me to stay strong, to believe in myself." She shook her head, a small smile on her lips. "Sounds silly, I know. But those lyrics, they gave me the courage to keep pushing, to prove I belonged."

 

"Doesn't sound silly one bit. Music has a way of hitting you right where you need it most." Ryan reached over, gently resting her hand on Sophie's that was on the middle console.

 

Sophie met Ryan's eyes, and the music faded into the background. This had become a common occurrence between them recently—long instants of staring, studying each other, followed by more staring. Sophie constantly fought the urge to lean in for a kiss. Ever since the one they had shared a few weeks ago in Iris's presence, it had been stuck in her mind, playing on repeat.
SongArtist: Feelin' It by JAY-Z, Mecca
SASW:
Feelin' It by JAY-Z, Mecca
Mrs. & Mrs. Wilder by AdultishGambino

HTMLExcerpt:
...

"Soph, it's okay to admit it." Ocean chimed in. "We've seen the way you look at each other. That's not something you can fake."

 

Turning around and peeping over the crowd, Sophie searched for Ryan on the dance floor, but then some noise and hollering from the back made her eye that direction.

 

Craning her head, she found Ryan mounted on the mechanical bull that was in the back of the bar, her body swaying seductively to the rhythm of the machine. Ryan's eyes were locked on hers, full of carnal hunger that was impossible to ignore.

 

"She's a tyrant every time I ride it,

every time I ride it

Make it look so good,

try to justify it

you know they're lookin' for me,

how we gonna hide it?

Ride it like hydraulics,

I am such a tyrant"

 

Seeing her own that machine, rocking those hypnotic hips with a blend of finesse, sex appeal, and raw strength, made Sophie imagine what it would be like to have Ryan on top, riding her while her fingers were —.

 

Clearing her throat,  Sophie turned around to finish her drink. She needed to cool the hell off.
SongArtist: TYRANT by Beyoncé, Dolly Parton

TYRANT by Beyoncé, Dolly Parton

HTMLExcerpt:
...

Ryan's free hand roamed down the flat stomach in front of her, drawing a gasp as her fingers found her target soaked. She started to massage her, matching the tempo of the R&B beat playing in her head, and Sophie's hips rocked in sync with her tempo.

 

Pulling back and staring into the eyes she was falling for, Ryan lifted her hand to her lips, tasting the sweet remnants of Sophie on her skin. When she pressed her fingertips against her tongue, her eyes rolled back in pleasure.

Excerpt:
Diane smiled and gently wiped Sophie's tears away.  She pulled her into her chest and rocked back and forth. Diane sang ‘Jesus Loves Me’ just as she had for both of her daughters before bed each night.

Jordan discreetly slipped away to the bathroom to wipe her tears.  She returned with a box of tissues, handing them to Sophie. Sophie didn’t meet her sister’s eyes.  Jordan sat next to her and bumped her shoulder. 

“You and me against the world, right?”

Sophie nodded.  “Right.”

Sophie nodded.  “Right.”

HTMLExcerpt:
...

Jordan stopped and saw the large fish tank in the living room, "Is that Oscar?"

 

"Yep, that's my boy. He's gotten so big since the last time you saw him."

 

"Does she still talk to him like he's her child?" Jordan asked, looking towards Ryan.

 

"Oh, absolutely. I've caught her singing Snoop Dogg lyrics to him when she thinks no one's listening."

 

"But babe, I thought you loved when I sang to our son."

 

Ryan threw Jordan a look that screamed, 'Help me,' which set them both off on another giggle-fit. Sophie wasn't even going to try to argue with these two clowns that she adored anymore. She just waved the white flag and kept it moving.

Excerpt:
Jordan handed the balloons and flowers back to Donna before joining the other students.  

The ceremony was fairly short and simple.  The principal spoke briefly about the students and gave a few words of wisdom.  A cute and uplifting slide show from the entire year was shown over a large screen as I Believe I Can Fly played through the speakers.  Shortly after, each student received a certificate and awards for high honors were presented.

Sophie and Ryan cheered loudly and whistled as Jordan’s name was called for the Principal’s Award.  The award was given to one student each year that showed not only academic progress, but character and perseverance as well. Sophie was bursting with pride as she recorded the moment.

Excerpt:
It was such a long pause that Ryan kind of forgot her previous statement and therefore couldn’t decipher what was being asked of her. “Do I what?”

“Want to be… friends?” Uncharacteristically, she chickened out and went the safe route, hoping Ryan could spontaneously acquire the ability to read minds and understand what she wasn’t saying. That she wanted to know if Ryan felt the same as she, craving another chance.

Ryan did not spontaneously acquire the ability to read minds and therefore answered accordingly.

“We are friends, Soph. No matter whatever else happens, doesn’t happen, or has happened in the past, I’m someone you can count on. Always.”

Sophie lost whatever courage was trying to grow and decided to not rock the boat further. “Of course. You can count on me too.”

“Like 1,2,3.”

“…Did you just Bruno Mars me?”

“It just flowed. Smooth wasn’t it?” Sophie hummed noncommittally in polite disagreement, causing Ryan to laugh.
HTMLExcerpt:
It was such a long pause that Ryan kind of forgot her previous statement and therefore couldn’t decipher what was being asked of her. “Do I what?”

“Want to be… friends?” Uncharacteristically, she chickened out and went the safe route, hoping Ryan could spontaneously acquire the ability to read minds and understand what she wasn’t saying. That she wanted to know if Ryan felt the same as she, craving another chance.

Ryan did not spontaneously acquire the ability to read minds and therefore answered accordingly.

“We are friends, Soph. No matter whatever else happens, doesn’t happen, or has happened in the past, I’m someone you can count on. Always.”

Sophie lost whatever courage was trying to grow and decided to not rock the boat further. “Of course. You can count on me too.”

“Like 1,2,3.”

“…Did you just Bruno Mars me?”

“It just flowed. Smooth wasn’t it?” Sophie hummed noncommittally in polite disagreement, causing Ryan to laugh.

Story: Charlie's Big Day: A Glimpse into the Future
Excerpt:
“With the help of a guiding staff and loving family, we grew from those timid freshmen to the graduates of today.  As I look out over this sea of friends and family, I am reminded of an old film I used to adore as a child.  It was about a young woman working towards her dream of owning her own restaurant.  She works endlessly and she’s always… almost there.”

She paused and looked up into the stands until she found Ryan and Sophie.  

“In the original theme song, the protagonist sings,  ‘There’s been trials and tribulations, you know I’ve had my share.  But I’ve climbed the mountain.  I’ve crossed the river and I’m almost there.’  To my fellow graduates, you’ve worked hard, you’ve passed all the tests, you’ve completed all the courses, but our journey into adulthood is just beginning.  We’re almost there.”
HTMLExcerpt:
“With the help of a guiding staff and loving family, we grew from those timid freshmen to the graduates of today.  As I look out over this sea of friends and family, I am reminded of an old film I used to adore as a child.  It was about a young woman working towards her dream of owning her own restaurant.  She works endlessly and she’s always… almost there.”

She paused and looked up into the stands until she found Ryan and Sophie.  

“In the original theme song, the protagonist sings,  ‘There’s been trials and tribulations, you know I’ve had my share.  But I’ve climbed the mountain.  I’ve crossed the river and I’m almost there.’  To my fellow graduates, you’ve worked hard, you’ve passed all the tests, you’ve completed all the courses, but our journey into adulthood is just beginning.  We’re almost there.”
SongArtist: Almost There by Anika Noni Rose
StoryWriter: Charlie's Big Day: A Glimpse into the Future by alphagirl007 (kayandkimsmom1)
SASW:
Almost There by Anika Noni Rose
Charlie's Big Day: A Glimpse into the Future by alphagirl007 (kayandkimsmom1)

Excerpt:
Sophie gives Ryan a tour of her apartment. She was nervous at first after realizing this was Ryan’s first time seeing her place. The nerves went away after Ryan complimented her place. She let Ryan decide on the movie while she ordered pizza. 




“So what movie did you decide on Miss Wilder?” 




“Don’t judge me but I decided on The Cheetah Girls 2” Ryan smiles bashfully




“I would never judge you, The Cheetah Girls is my shit, especially number 2” 




“I knew I liked you for a reason” 




“My favorite song from the movie is Amigas Cheetahs. What’s your favorite song from the movie?”




“Strut fasho. One summer, my mom took us to Barcelona. Iris and I convinced her to let us reenact the whole scene from the movie. I was Galleria and Iris was Chanel.” Ryan laughed




“Oh my God, that’s hilarious. Fun fact, Jordan and I listen to Step Up before every game.”




“Aww that’s so cute”




Before Sophie could respond with more cheetahlicious stories, there was a knock at the door. Pizza arrived.

“Aww that’s so cute”

 

Before Sophie could respond with more cheetahlicious stories, there was a knock at the door. Pizza arrived.

Story: Charlie's Big Day: A Glimpse into the Future
Excerpt:
The music paused then changed and the artist Teek stepped up to the mic and began to sing ‘First Time’ as the musicians played in the background.  

There was an audible gasp that swept over the entire courtyard as Charlotte Wilder-Moore stepped into view.  The dry ice smoke dissipated and there she stood at the top of the back stairs under a giant arch of flowers looking like a dream.  

There were no words for how beautiful Charlie looked. Her dress was off the shoulders and fitted until it fanned out at the waist into layers of soft silk and lace with a train that seemed to go on forever.  She truly did look like a princess.  It was obvious that Mason approved.  His eyes were glued to her as he became overcome with emotions. His best man passed him a handkerchief to wipe his eyes.  By the time Teek sang the words ‘I prayed for you. I cried for you’ there wasn’t a dry eye among them.  Everyone who knew their story understood.  Ryan felt it was finally okay to let go.  She felt Jada wipe her tears, always the mother.

Sophie slowly guided their baby girl down the stairs and up to the altar where she placed Charlie’s hand into Mason’s.  It took her a moment to let go.  Charlie looked at her tenderly as she gave Mason a meaningful look.  She stared directly into his eyes, letting him know that she was handing over her most precious possession. Mason understood.  He squeezed her hand and gave her a solemn nod, letting her know he would honor and care for her.

Mason understood.  He squeezed her hand and gave her a solemn nod, letting her know he would honor and care for her.

Story: Charlie's Big Day: A Glimpse into the Future
Excerpt:
“Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome for the first time Mr. and Mrs. Mason and Charlotte Robinson.”

Everyone applauded and whistled as the new couple made their way to the dance floor where they shared their first dance to Kenny Latimore’s ‘For You’ . They looked so in love and beaming with happiness.  As the slow dance ended, they broke out with a routine to ‘Blow the Whistle’ that had everyone on their feet cheering.  

There was no father-daughter dance of course.  The bride and groom shared dances with both of their mothers instead to Boyz II Men’s ‘Mama’ .
